title: CTO Founder Associate - internship
description:
YOU. BETTER. WITH ALAN.

Alan is building a vertically integrated health partner that unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one seamless system. Our vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all.

Our mission: Help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

By connecting all aspects of care (private, public, and direct to consumer) we create the most member-centric healthcare experience, reducing claims costs while generating new monetization opportunities.

We partner with tens of thousands of companies across France üá´üá∑, Spain üá™üá∏, Belgium üáßüá™, and Canada üá®üá¶, serving over a million members.


HOW WE WORK: OUR LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES

 - Mission is the Boss ‚Äî We think long-term and are methodical optimists who take risks, seeking our mission's success above all else.

 - Distributed Ownership ‚Äî Accountable enlightened despots: everyone owns their decisions and results.

 - Radical Transparency ‚Äî All information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously.

 - Always Growing ‚Äî Direct, positive, and caring feedback, combined with self-growth ownership.


‚≠ê CTO FOUNDER ASSOCIATE INTERNSHIP ‚≠ê

The position is open for an immediate starting date, for a six-month internship.

CTO Founder Associates support the CTO and Senior Alaners on top business priorities, such as unlocking new growth, driving alignment on strategy and building new processes/standards internally and externally. It is a unique chance to work on many tasks in a different and non traditional environment.


You will be highly involved in key challenges for Alan, and will be asked to support high added value tasks for Alan.


¬†
‚≠ê DETAILED MISSIONS ‚≠ê

As such, you can‚Äôt be exhaustive on the missions you will perform as a CTO FA, as you can be asked to help on almost any subject.¬†
Possible projects include:

 - Tech: Exploring new technologies and their applications for Alan

 - Artificial Intelligence: Implementing internal solutions that leverage AI to optimize processes

 - Strategy: Contributing to company vision, market analysis, and growth modelling

 - Product: Identifying and exploring strategic opportunities

 - Corporate & Governance: Supporting board packs, legal research, and public affairs

 - Brand & Communication: Developing corporate presence at events and on social media

 - Growth: Coordinating RFPs, supporting marketing and partnerships

 - Recurring tasks: Coordinating the weekly internal communication, supporting the CTO with his weekly social posts, organizing the monthly event gathering all the Alaners, recruiting the next batch of FAs.

 - And many more...


‚≠ê KEY OUTCOMES ‚≠ê

By the end of the internship period, the intern will have:

 - Created new processes and resources, and contributed innovative ideas to improve Founders Associates team efficiency and autonomy

 - Gained skills to start your own company as a CTO

 - Met incredibly talented and smart people

 - Collaborated with the CTO and other Senior Alaners

 - Interacted with most of Alan‚Äôs communities (Engineers, Product, Strategy, Sales, Marketing, Talent)

 - Gained a 360 view of Alan

 - Contributed to at least one strategic company project (new product launch, AI model implementation, etc.).


‚≠ê PROFILE & COMPETENCIES ‚≠ê

 - Analytical sense and critical thinking: FAs possess strong abilities to frame the right questions, objectively analyze problems, and simulate possible outcomes.

 - Business and product sense: FAs need excellent understanding to think at the company level, assess cross-cutting impacts, and make sound decisions in ambiguous situations.

 - Execution and collaboration: The ability to orchestrate and direct people towards objectives is key, given the scope and timeline of work.

 - Versatility and education: given the scope of work, FAs should be able to jump from one topic to another with similar impact.

 - Organization, time management and autonomy: FAs must excel in managing projects precisely and reliably with minimal external assistance.

 - Effective communication: FAs interact with numerous Alaners daily, and therefore need to clearly express their needs, and inspire action in others.

 - Always looking for the extra mile: FAs are expected to deliver tasks quickly and well while proactively proposing new initiatives and anticipating future needs.

 - Growth mindset: you know how to ask for and receive feedback in order to grow as an FA in your early professional life.

 - Fluency in spoken and written English. All our communications are written and in English.


üôå ¬† PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/about/life-at-alan/a/perks


At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.¬†
Therefore, we offer:

 - Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you‚Äôre the happiest.

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your¬†time as you wish.

 - Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential.¬†Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

üîñ Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

title: CEO Founder Associate - Internship
description:
YOU. BETTER. WITH ALAN.

Alan is building a vertically integrated health partner that unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one seamless system. Our vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all.

Our mission: Help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

By connecting all aspects of care (private, public, and direct to consumer) we create the most member-centric healthcare experience, reducing claims costs while generating new monetization opportunities.

We partner with tens of thousands of companies across France üá´üá∑, Spain üá™üá∏, Belgium üáßüá™, and Canada üá®üá¶, serving over a million members.


HOW WE WORK: OUR LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES

 - Mission is the Boss ‚Äî We think long-term and are methodical optimists who take risks, seeking our mission's success above all else.

 - Distributed Ownership ‚Äî Accountable enlightened despots: everyone owns their decisions and results.

 - Radical Transparency ‚Äî All information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously.

 - Always Growing ‚Äî Direct, positive, and caring feedback, combined with self-growth ownership.

‚≠ê CEO Founder Associate Internship ‚≠ê

The position is open for gap year or end-of-study interns starting from June 2026, for a six-month internship. It is not open to MBA students.

CEO Founder Associates support the CEO and Senior Alaners on top business priorities, such as unlocking new growth, driving alignment on strategy, building new processes internally and externally and building new products. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on a diverse range of strategic projects in a dynamic, innovative environment, gaining invaluable experience across multiple facets of the business.¬†

You will be highly involved in key challenges for Alan, and will be asked to support high added value tasks for Alan.




¬†‚≠ê DETAILED MISSIONS ‚≠ê

As such, you can‚Äôt be exhaustive on the missions you will perform as a FA, as you can be asked to help on almost any subject.¬†



POSSIBLE PROJECTS INCLUDE:

 - Strategy - Contribute to the strategic vision of the company, market analysis and competition, identify strategic business opportunities, perform business analyses and growth modelling

 - Product & Design - Contribute to the product vision by identifying and exploring strategic product opportunities, support the continuous improvement of Alan‚Äôs core offering, conduct user research, assist in design & prototyping¬†

 - Growth - Coordinating RFP for big prospects, supporting marketing initiatives, partnerships.

 - Corporate & Governance - Support the constitution of our board packs, public affairs work, legal research, fundraisings, key Alaners meetings.

 - Brand & Communication - Develop the corporate presence at major events, via social networks; organise internal and external events to build the Alan network and leverage connections globally.

 - Talent - Sourcing and recruiting the next batch of FA‚Äôs

In this position, you will get a great overview of the key strategic topics at Alan and you will have the chance to work with senior Alaners on topics that are instrumental to our success. You will grow exponentially with the guidance of senior Alaners. It is a unique chance to work on so many tasks in a different and non traditional environment. ¬†

Examples of recent projects:

 - Strategy - Develop market entry strategies for international expansion, contribute RFP coordination for major prospects in the public sector, create go-to-market plans for new segments.

 - Product - Assist in the development of core products in Alan‚Äôs offering (ex: Alan Walk), exploring opportunities to streamline the user experience market research to evaluate the opportunity to build new services within Alan

 - Finance - Taking part and coordinating Series F fundraising: preparation of Pitch Deck, financial analysis to assess valuation, coordination of fundraising with investors¬†

 - Sales - Being project manager on the biggest tender in Alan's history: involvement throughout the whole process, coordination of Sales and Product teams to make the best offer possible

 - Logistics - Organizing the annual Alaner reunion event: managing a budget of ‚Ç¨300k to bring Alaners together over 2 days and create a sense of belonging

 - Engineering - Collaborating with technical teams to develop Alan‚Äôs insurance pricing engine, supporting the integration of AI across various products to enhance both product offering and internal efficiency.

 - Recurring tasks - Coordinating the weekly internal communication, supporting the CEO with meeting preparations, organising the internal events, recruiting the next batch of FAs- And many more...
   


‚≠ê PROFILE & COMPETENCIES ‚≠ê





SKILLS

 - Analytical sense and critical thinking: FAs have a lot of research and analysis to produce. This requires the ability to frame the right questions, objectively analyse and evaluate a problem, and problem-solve including simulating possible outcomes.¬†

 - Business‚Äô and product sense: FAs often have to think at the company level, assessing what would be best for the business, and working on topics that have cross-cutting impacts. The ability to understand what can make a business great (product wise, commercially, in terms of image, etc.), and make correct decisions, even in the presence of ambiguity, is paramount.

 - Execution and collaboration: given the scope, volume and timeline of work, the ability to direct people‚Äîincluding oneself‚Äîtowards a particular objective that may require active orchestration is key.

 - Versatility: given the scope of work, FAs should be able to jump from one topic to another with similar impact

 - Organization, time management and autonomy: you are well-versed in missions requiring precision and reliability. You are able to manage a project from start to finish with minimal external assistance.¬†

 - Communicate effectively: given the number of Alaners that FAs interact with on a daily basis, the ability to communicate your specific needs (deadlines etc) and to inspire action in others is essential.¬†

 - Always looking for the extra-mile: as a FA, you will be expected to be able to deliver quickly and well on the tasks assigned to you, but also to be proactive in proposing new initiatives, going beyond the task assigned to you if you think it is necessary, as well as anticipating future needs to propose potential solutions?

 - Growth mindset: you know how to ask for and receive feedback in order to grow as an FA in your early professional life.¬†

 - Fluency in spoken and written English. All our communications are written and in English.

 - Technical aptitude: Familiarity and appetite for basic programming,¬† experience with data analysis and/or product creation tools is a plus.




We welcome applications from candidates with diverse educational backgrounds, including but not limited to:

 - Business schools (HEC, ESSEC, ESCP, LSE ‚Ä¶)

 - Engineering schools (Polytechnique, Mines Paris, Ecole des Ponts, CentraleSupelec, Imperial ‚Ä¶ )

 - Data science or mathematics programs

 - Other relevant fields or schools (Bocconi, Politecnico, TU Delft, UCL, Oxford, Cambridge)

Diplomas matter to an extent but if you don‚Äôt have one and have built a project or a company, we‚Äôd love to hear from you so please send your application!¬†



üôå ¬† PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/about/life-at-alan/a/perks


At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.


THEREFORE, WE OFFER:

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Air, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

 - Transport. Generous transit benefit

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential.¬†Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.
   


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

üîñ Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

title: Software Engineer Internship (6 months)
description:
YOU. BETTER. WITH ALAN.

Alan is building a vertically integrated health partner that unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one seamless system. Our vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all.

Our mission: Help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

By connecting all aspects of care (private, public, and direct to consumer) we create the most member-centric healthcare experience, reducing claims costs while generating new monetization opportunities.

We partner with tens of thousands of companies across France üá´üá∑, Spain üá™üá∏, Belgium üáßüá™, and Canada üá®üá¶, serving over a million members.


HOW WE WORK: OUR LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES

 - Mission is the Boss ‚Äî We think long-term and are methodical optimists who take risks, seeking our mission's success above all else.

 - Distributed Ownership ‚Äî Accountable enlightened despots: everyone owns their decisions and results.

 - Radical Transparency ‚Äî All information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously.

 - Always Growing ‚Äî Direct, positive, and caring feedback, combined with self-growth ownership.


‚≠êÔ∏è THE ENGINEERING TEAM ‚≠êÔ∏è

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is Python/Flask, React, React Native, PostgreSQL.

Want to know more? Read this article https://blog.alan.com/tech-et-produit/engineering-organisation-at-alan if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article https://medium.com/alan/engineering-career-path-at-alan-e5de5c2e740c on our Engineering career path.





‚≠êÔ∏è IS IT YOU WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR? ‚≠êÔ∏è

Please note that for this internship, you need to be based in Paris, France, and currently enrolled in your last year of a Master's degree in a university.


You would be a great fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

 - You are looking for your 6-month end-of-studies internship and want to start in H1 2026

 - You have prior internship or side-projects coding experience, and have already deployed frontend and backend code to production for real users

 - You are willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don't need to have experience with those 2 languages!)

 - You are passionate about building products

 - You are self-starting and humble

 - You are collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork and learning

 - Fluent in English (no need to speak French!)
   

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.

If you want to learn how engineers can grow at Alan, take a look at our Engineering career path https://medium.com/alan/engineering-career-path-at-alan-e5de5c2e740c.

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

title: Sales Graduate Program üá´üá∑
description:
YOU. BETTER. WITH ALAN.

Alan is building a vertically integrated health partner that unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one seamless system. Our vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all.

Our mission: Help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

By connecting all aspects of care (private, public, and direct to consumer) we create the most member-centric healthcare experience, reducing claims costs while generating new monetization opportunities.

We partner with tens of thousands of companies across France üá´üá∑, Spain üá™üá∏, Belgium üáßüá™, and Canada üá®üá¶, serving over a million members.


HOW WE WORK: OUR LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES

 - Mission is the Boss ‚Äî We think long-term and are methodical optimists who take risks, seeking our mission's success above all else.

 - Distributed Ownership ‚Äî Accountable enlightened despots: everyone owns their decisions and results.

 - Radical Transparency ‚Äî All information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously.

 - Always Growing ‚Äî Direct, positive, and caring feedback, combined with self-growth ownership.


‚≠êÔ∏è THE BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE - GRADUATE PROGRAM ‚≠êÔ∏è

We‚Äôre excited to open a new opportunity to join Alan's Business Development Representative (BDR) - Graduate Program, offering a remarkable start to a Sales career!

The concept? Over a period of 18-24 months, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to gain essential Sales skills, that will prepare you for more senior positions within the Sales community.

You will work as a Business Development Representative (BDR), where you will learn the fundamentals of Sales:

 - Develop an effective prospecting strategy;

 - Understand the specifics of a market;

 - Spark the interest of a prospect via various channels (email, social networks and cold calls);

 - Book qualitative discovery meetings with C-Levels.

After 12 months in a market such as Tech, Manufacturing, Retail, or Hospitality, you will change segments to discover new prospecting methods and collaborate with another team.

In your second year, you will continue as a BDR. You will have the opportunity to apply for the BDR Enterprise position, targeting large accounts (companies with more than 300 employees) or take on the added challenge of conducting discovery meetings and product demonstrations for small businesses.

These experiences will prepare you for an internal mobility as an Account Executive, for example (watch Victoire https://youtu.be/3FN7IPfC_Yo?feature=shared).

If you want to know more about the Business Development Representative (BDR) - Graduate Program, listen to Matthieu https://youtu.be/6tOXX8q6leY?feature=shared a team member, check this blogpost https://alan.com/fr-fr/blog/tout-alan/a/propulsez-votre-debut-de-carriere-rejoignez-alan as well as this one https://blog.alan.eu/nos-commerciaux-ne-vendent-pas about our unique approach to Sales.


‚≠êÔ∏è IS IT WHAT YOU ARE LOOKING FOR? ‚≠êÔ∏è

At Alan, our motto is "we hire people, not roles": we value interpersonal skills over technical ones. We believe your potential is what truly counts.

You will be a good fit to join the Sales team at Alan if:

 - You hold a Master's degree from a business school, with up to two years of professional experience;

 - You are enthusiastic, driven by our mission, and eager to share our ambition;

 - You are a team player, organized, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously;

 - You are eager to learn and grow in new roles;

 - You are based in (or willing to relocate to) either Paris or Bordeaux

Ready to join our Business Development Representative - Graduate Program?

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the A2-B1 level range https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity.


üôå¬† ¬†PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.¬†

Therefore, we offer:

 - Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary.

 - Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ in Paris or sponsored co-working hub in Bordeaux.

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your¬†time as you wish.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance:¬†Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

 - Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly¬† flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential.¬†Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.

 - Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

üîñ Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

title: Junior AP Accountant
description:
ABOUT AMBOSS

AMBOSS is the copilot for medical professionals, empowering them to provide the best possible care through our learning and clinical decision support tool. Our team brings together care, innovative thinking, and cutting-edge AI medical technology. Our founders launched AMBOSS in 2012 with the goal of creating a tool they wished they had during medical school and clinical practice. Since then, we've grown to over 600 employees and are active in over 180 countries - primarily in Germany and the US. Our offices are located in Berlin, Cologne, New York, Cagliari and Cape Town.

Want to learn more about our culture? Watch our video https://youtu.be/gTPDn5XpeJgto explore what makes us unique.


WHY CAN THIS POSITION BE EXCITING FOR YOU?

As an AP Junior Accountant, you'll contribute directly to the financial health and operational efficiency of AMBOSS. Your main focus will be on processing vendor invoices and travel expenses, verifying transactions, and supporting accurate and timely accounting practices.

In this role, you'll play a key part in maintaining financial accuracy and ensuring compliance with internal policies. You‚Äôll have the chance to develop your technical skills, collaborate with a diverse and motivated team, and see the real impact of your work as AMBOSS continues to scale. If you're excited to dive into financial operations, contribute your analytical mindset, and learn in a dynamic, mission-driven environment - this could be the perfect next step in your journey.

Even if you don‚Äôt meet every single requirement, we encourage you to apply if you believe your experience and motivation align with the role.


YOU WILL:

 - Full-Cycle Invoice Management: Manage the end-to-end AP process, including verification, tax coding (VAT), and posting, while ensuring strict adherence to internal controls and approval workflows.

 - Vendor & Payment Coordination: Act as the primary liaison for vendors, reconcile accounts, and collaborate with Treasury to ensure accurate, timely payment runs.

 - T&E Policy Compliance: Oversee employee travel and expense processing, ensuring all claims are accurately documented, tax-compliant, and aligned with company policy.

 - Month-End & Reporting: Support month-end closing activities and provide accurate AP data to the wider Finance team.

 - Process Innovation: Drive efficiency by identifying opportunities for automation and contributing to optimization projects within the AP and T&E functions.

 - Cross-Functional Support: Partner with internal stakeholders to resolve inquiries and assist with ad hoc accounting projects as needed


YOU BRING:

 - A completed degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field (or a comparable commercial qualification)

 - 1‚Äì2 years of professional experience in Accounts Payable or a similar accounting role

 - Solid understanding of invoice processing and basic VAT principles (knowledge of German VAT regulations is a strong plus)

 - Experience working with an ERP system (e.g., SAP, NetSuite, Workday, or similar)

 - Familiarity with DATEV is nice to have

 - Proficiency in MS Office or Google Workspace, particularly Excel/Sheets

 - Strong attention to detail and the ability to identify and analyze discrepancies in financial data


YOU ENJOY:

 - Solving discrepancies with an analytical and solution-oriented mindset

 - Working closely with colleagues across departments and valuing strong collaboration

 - Taking ownership of your responsibilities and seeing the tangible impact of your work

 - Communicating clearly and transparently with stakeholders, vendors, and teammates

 - Contributing to a diverse, mission-driven company

 - Being part of a professional, friendly, and supportive team

 - Deepening your understanding of accounting processes and developing long-term expertise in accounting


BENEFITS:

AMBOSSians tell us that innovative work keeps them energized and employee benefits help them to feel appreciated and empowered. We invest in every AMBOSSian with our employee benefits package, crafted to support financial, physical, and mental health, and work-life harmony.




üå¥ Rest & Time Off (30 paid vacation days, AMBOSS holiday, personal purpose day and more)

ü•ôFood & Office Comfort (Daily healthy breakfast & lunch by in-house chef in Berlin HQ, AMBOSS daycare, work remotely from other office spaces in Cologne, Sardinia, Cape Town)

üèÉ Health, Fitness & Mobility (Urban Sports Club -M plan- , Fitbit Versa 3, Deutschland Ticket‚Ä¶)

Check out the full list of benefits below:

https://go.amboss.com/the-amboss-prescription-de

We believe that diversity is a powerful driver of innovation and progress. That‚Äôs why we are committed to fostering an inclusive, respectful, and supportive environment where everyone‚Äîregardless of gender, age, ethnic or cultural background, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity‚Äîis valued and given equal opportunity to thrive. We warmly welcome people of all backgrounds to help us fulfil our mission: empowering all medical professionals to provide the best possible care ü©∫

title: Junior CRM Marketing Manager DACH
description:
Hi, we‚Äôre AMBOSS and seeking a curious Junior CRM Marketing Manager for our DACH Campus Team!

About AMBOSS

AMBOSS is a learning and clinical decision support tool striving to empower physicians across the globe to provide the best possible care. Our founders set out in 2011 to create a tool that they would have hoped to have as medical students and doctors. Since then we have grown to currently operate in 180 countries and have gained immense traction in Germany and the US. Currently, we are pursuing this mission with more than 500+ employees in our offices in Berlin, Cologne, New York, and Cagliari.


WHY CAN THIS POSITION BE EXCITING FOR YOU?

At AMBOSS, we support medical students across the DACH region throughout their studies. To engage students at the right time with the right message, we rely on strong CRM foundations. CRM helps us understand student needs, personalize communication, and build long-term relationships beyond one-off campaigns.

As the CRM Marketing Manager for the DACH Campus Team, you will shape how we connect with students at scale and ensure our campus initiatives are relevant, timely, and impactful.


YOU WILL:

 - Focus on the implementation and optimization of multichannel campaigns and automations via Braze - our CRM system.

 - Support the execution of AMBOSS' promotional campaigns.

 - Work very closely with different teams to advise and support them in the development and implementation of campaigns.

 - Support delivery of all CRM activity in our key markets, including optimisation and reporting, performance metrics and ROI.

 - Support development, testing, and deployment of new CRM channels for AMBOSS, such as Push.

 - Leverage data and customer insight to constantly improve the engagement of our campaigns and channel ROI.


YOU BRING:

 - Strong German communication skills to work effectively with customers in the DACH region, and good English skills.

 - At least 1-2 years of experience in the multichannel CRM environment (mobile/email/web).

 - A growth mindset to create campaigns that can move the needle and increase our market share

 - You are familiar and very curious about new technologies

 - Knowledge of marketing automation software (e.g. Braze, Hubspot) and experience with data visualization tools such as Looker

 - Experience with HTML, CSS and javascript-type languages like AMPscript


YOU ENJOY:

 - Enjoy connecting with people and building relationships

 - You see challenges as opportunities and approach them with a proactive, solution oriented mindset

 - You like working in a dynamic environment, stay on top of deadlines and ensuring structure in projects


BENEFITS

AMBOSSians tell us that innovative work keeps them energized and employee benefits help them to feel appreciated and empowered. We invest in every AMBOSSians with our employee benefits package, crafted to support financial, physical, and mental health, and work-life harmony.

Check out all of our employee benefits below:

http://go.amboss.com/the-amboss-prescription-de

Welcome http://go.amboss.com/the-amboss-prescription-deÔøºÔøºÔøºWelcome to AMBOSS

We believe that diversity is a powerful driver of innovation and progress. That‚Äôs why we are committed to fostering an inclusive, respectful, and supportive environment where everyone‚Äîregardless of gender, age, ethnic or cultural background, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, identity ‚Äîis valued and given equal opportunity to thrive üíô

We warmly welcome people of all backgrounds to help us fulfill our mission: empowering all medical professionals to provide the best possible care ü©∫.

Even if you don‚Äôt meet every single point in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: (Junior) Clinical Engagement Representative DACH (MD, Medical Doctor)
description:
Hallo, wir von AMBOSS sind aktuell auf der Suche nach √§rztlicher Unterst√ºtzung in Vollzeit f√ºr unser B2B-Sales-Team.

Hast du mit AMBOSS studiert? Dann wei√üt du schon, wie viel Zeit unsere L√∂sung sparen kann und welchen Unterschied sie macht. Wenn du dein Medizinstudium abgeschlossen hast und Lust hast, aktiv beim Aufbau langfristiger Partnerschaften mit Krankenh√§usern mitzuwirken, k√∂nnte das hier genau der richtige Job f√ºr dich sein! Dein Ziel w√§re es, das Wachstum von AMBOSS zu f√∂rdern und das klinische Personal bestm√∂glich zu unterst√ºtzen ‚Äì f√ºr eine noch bessere Patientenversorgung.


DEINE AUFGABEN

 - Zun√§chst planst du mit deinem Team, welche potenziellen Krankenhauspartner in der DACH-Region ihren Mitarbeitern:innen noch keine Kliniklizenz anbieten.

 - Im Anschluss nimmst du Kontakt mit aktiven User:innen und relevanten Entscheidungstr√§gern auf und gehst in den konkreten Aufbau starker Beziehungen.

 - Je nach Zielgruppe f√ºhrst du Bedarfsanalysen durch oder erstellst effektive Pr√§sentationen, die auf die Bed√ºrfnisse und Anforderungen der jeweiligen Klinikpartner abgestimmt sind.

 - Du bist Schnittstelle zwischen √Ñrzt:innen und Pflegedienstleitungen und den verschiedenen Teams innerhalb von AMBOSS wie Customer Success, Sales Operations und Marketing

 - Aufgrund deiner N√§he zu den Klinikmitarbeitenden kannst du eigeninitiativ Projekte und Events im Namen von AMBOSS planen und an die Krankenh√§user bringen - M√∂glichkeiten, dich weiter einzubringen und eigene Ideen umzusetzen, gibt es immer!

 - Du stellst sicher, dass sich Krankenh√§user mit dir gut aufgehoben f√ºhlen ‚Äì von der ersten Ansprache bis hin zur erfolgreichen Implementierung.

 - Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Data Team und Sales Operations zusammen, um Nutzungsdaten zu analysieren und auszuwerten.

 - Du repr√§sentierst AMBOSS auf Veranstaltungen und √ºbernimmst aktives Networking zur Steigerung der Markenbekanntheit.


DAS SOLLTEST DU MITBRINGEN

 - Medizinischer Hintergrund: Ein abgeschlossenes Medizinstudium, idealerweise erg√§nzt durch klinische Erfahrung, um ein tiefes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr die Herausforderungen im Gesundheitswesen zu gew√§hrleisten.

 - Kommunikationsst√§rke: Hervorragende Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch (hohes Niveau) und flie√üendes Englisch. Die F√§higkeit, in verschiedenen Umgebungen souver√§n zu interagieren.

 - Neugierig und offen f√ºr Neues: F√§higkeit, Kundenbed√ºrfnisse zu verstehen und √ºber den aktuellen Stand im Medizin- und EdTech-Sektor informiert zu bleiben, um L√∂sungen in die eigene Arbeit zu integrieren.

 - Begeisterung f√ºr Digitalisierung: Starkes Interesse an digitalen L√∂sungen und deren positiven Einfluss auf die medizinische Ausbildung und den Klinikalltag.

 - Sales & Networking: Erfahrung oder starkes Interesse am Beziehungsaufbau im Gesundheitswesen.

 - Reisebereitschaft: Spa√ü am Reisen und Freude daran, verschiedene medizinische Einrichtungen und Fachleute in der DACH-Region kennenzulernen.

 - Projektmanagement-F√§higkeiten: Effizientes Management mehrerer paralleler Projekte, insbesondere in einem dynamischen Umfeld wie dem Gesundheitswesen.

 - Selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise: F√§higkeit, eigenverantwortlich und strukturiert zu arbeiten, inklusive exzellenter Organisations- und Zeitmanagementf√§higkeiten.


WARUM AMBOSS?

Wenn du dich bis hierhin angesprochen f√ºhlst, m√ºssen wir dir wohl eher nicht erkl√§ren, was AMBOSS ist und wie es funktioniert. Was du aber vielleicht noch nicht wusstest: AMBOSS ist seit einiger Zeit auch in den USA und international eines der meistgenutzten Tools f√ºr Medizinstudierende und √Ñrzt:innen. Ein Team aus √ºber 500 Mitarbeiter:innen arbeitet t√§glich daran, dass AMBOSS als zuverl√§ssiger Co-Pilot Studierende und √Ñrzt:innen weltweit zur bestm√∂glichen Patientenversorgung bef√§higt. Du kannst dich also auf ein gro√ües internationales Team mit viel Erfahrung verlassen und die Zukunft von AMBOSS aktiv mitgestalten.


BENEFITS

Wir legen sehr viel Wert darauf, dass sich unsere Mitarbeiter:innen (AMBOSSians) bei uns wohlf√ºhlen, und bieten daher eine Reihe von Benefits an, zwischen denen du w√§hlen kannst (z.B. kostenlose Urban-Sports-Club-Mitgliedschaft). http://go.amboss.com/the-amboss-prescription-de

Wir sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass Vielfalt ein starker Motor f√ºr Innovation und Fortschritt ist. Deshalb engagieren wir uns f√ºr ein inklusives, respektvolles und unterst√ºtzendes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem alle Menschen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, ethnischer oder kultureller Herkunft, Religion, Behinderung, sexueller Orientierung oder geschlechtlicher Identit√§t ‚Äì wertgesch√§tzt werden und die gleichen Chancen erhalten, ihr Potenzial zu entfalten.

Wir hei√üen Menschen mit den unterschiedlichsten Hintergr√ºnden herzlich willkommen, uns bei unserer Mission zu unterst√ºtzen: medizinisches Fachpersonal dabei zu st√§rken und die bestm√∂gliche Versorgung zu gew√§hrleisten. ü©∫

Auch wenn du nicht alle Anforderungen der Stellenbeschreibung erf√ºllst, ermutigen wir dich, dich zu bewerben. Wir freuen uns darauf, von dir zu h√∂ren!

title: Motion Design Intern/ Junior
description:
We are hiring a Motion Design Junior or intern to join our team and help us grow Bump by raising our creative bar and strengthening the brand through high production value short-form video.

You will work directly with the Creative / Content team to design, execute, and scale a premium content output for Instagram, from Reels to Stories to paid social, with an emphasis on craft, clarity, and visual impact.

This position provides the opportunity to gain experience within a fast-growing, venture-backed startup that‚Äôs building at the frontier of the social category. You will get to learn from an experienced and international team, gaining insight into how global consumer brands are built through content.

This role is open to individuals who can join us in-person, Mon-Fri. We are based in the Op√©ra district of Paris.




AS A MOTION DESIGN JUNIOR, YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WILL INCLUDE:


High Production Value Content

Your core mission will be to help produce premium short-form videos that reinforce the Bump brand. This includes building strong motion systems (typography, transitions, compositing), elevating pacing and storytelling, and ensuring every deliverable feels intentional and polished.

We move fast, but the priority is quality: taste, craft, and consistency. Creating work that can set a standard and compound over time.

Studio Foundations (Creative Systems & Workflow)

Alongside day-to-day production, you‚Äôll help create the foundations of a more structured creative output: templates, reusable motion components, asset libraries, and workflows that make high quality repeatable.

Content Iteration & Performance-Driven Variations

Great content is iterative. You‚Äôll help develop variations (hooks, pacing, layouts, edits) to test and learn what performs, without compromising production value.

AI-Assisted Creative Production

You‚Äôll be expected to be comfortable using AI tools to move faster and explore more: generating visual directions, producing/cleaning assets, upscaling, rapid mockups, and accelerating iterations. The goal is better output, faster, while keeping a premium finish.




YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

 - Strong fundamentals in motion design (timing, typography, composition, readability).

 - Comfortable with After Effects and Premiere. Being able to produce 3D assets is a plus.

 - High bar for quality and attention to detail.

 - Able to move quickly while keeping craft and polish.

 - Social media native, with a strong field of reference for up-and-coming creators and evolving short-form formats.

 - Comfortable adopting AI creative workflows and learning new tools fast.

 - Previous experience in a startup environment or creative role is a bonus, but not essential (portfolio matters most).





LIFE AT AMO:

To ensure that everyone is set up for success within our way of working, we work together onsite 5 days a week.

To make coming to the office as comfortable as possible, we offer the following:

 - A location in central Paris, near Op√©ra (Metro lines 3, 8, 9 and RER A).

 - Work from a beautiful Parisian-style office with high ceilings, balconies, and huge windows. So a lot of natural light!

 - We reimburse 50% of your commuting expenses.

This is a junior/ graduate position on an internship contract and will require you to be onsite 5 days a week. Compensation depends on level.

title: Junior Solutions Architect
description:
Blockstream https://blockstream.com/ was founded in 2014 by Dr. Adam Back https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_Back and a group of fellow cryptographers and engineers who are passionate about Bitcoin and its potential to change the world. Today, Blockstream is the leading Bitcoin company, providing cutting-edge infrastructure solutions for enterprises, institutions, and individual Bitcoin users. We develop industry-leading Bitcoin self-custody solutions, Bitcoin-based financial products, second-layer scaling technologies, and enterprise-grade blockchain infrastructure.

We are seeking a Junior Solutions Architect with strong technical aptitude and an eagerness to learn, who will support the team in designing and building secure, scalable blockchain and digital asset solutions for enterprise and institutional clients. This role supports the end-to-end architecture process, from assisting with initial design through documentation and deployment, ensuring solutions adhere to technical best practices for distributed systems, cryptography, and financial services integration.

Within the Service & Enterprise Solutions organization, the Junior Solutions Architect works closely with Solutions Architects, Delivery, Engineering, Product, and Client teams. This role will assist in translating business requirements into robust technical architectures and will gain hands-on experience in ensuring that blockchain solutions are secure, scalable, and operationally sound for banking and institutional environments.

What You'll Be Doing (Responsibilities):

 - 3-5 years architecture experience, technical aptitude, eager to learn

 - Design and deliver end-to-end blockchain and digital asset solutions for banking, custody, payments, and treasury management use cases

 - Architect secure, scalable platforms that integrate blockchain infrastructure with core banking and financial systems

 - Define technical architecture including API design, data flows, event-driven systems, and integration patterns

 - Make platform-level design decisions on deployment models (cloud, hybrid, on-premise), consensus mechanisms, and security protocols

 - Evaluate and select appropriate blockchain platforms, protocols, and tools based on client requirements and technical feasibility

 - Ensure solutions adhere to cryptographic security standards, regulatory compliance requirements, and industry best practices

 - Collaborate with delivery teams, developers, and DevOps engineers to ensure architectures are buildable, testable, and operable

 - Create and maintain technical documentation including architecture diagrams, system specifications, and integration guides

 - Identify and escalate architectural risks, technical dependencies, and performance bottlenecks

 - Mentor junior architects and developers on architectural patterns, blockchain best practices, and secure coding principles
   

What We Look for In You (Required Qualifications):

 - 5-10 years of experience in solution architecture, platform engineering, or enterprise system implementation

 - Strong understanding of blockchain technology, distributed systems, and cryptographic principles

 - Experience designing multi-system platforms in regulated financial services environments

 - Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and modern deployment practices

 - Deep expertise in API-based architectures, microservices, and event-driven systems

 - Strong knowledge of security protocols, encryption, authentication, and authorization mechanisms

 - Understanding of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure-as-code

 - Excellent communication skills with ability to present complex technical concepts to both technical and business stakeholders

 - Self-starter with proven ability to work collaboratively across multiple teams and geographies, demonstrating high-quality and high-touch customer engagement throughout all phases of delivery

 - Languages: Swiss German, German, and English required; French and/or Italian a plus

 - Location: Switzerland, with focus on Zurich, Zug, Lugano
   

Nice To Haves (Preferred Qualifications):

 - Hands-on experience with blockchain platforms (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Hyperledger, or similar)

 - Knowledge of smart contract development and decentralized application (DApp) architecture

 - Experience with digital asset custody, tokenization, or crypto payment systems

 - Understanding of DeFi protocols, stablecoins, and Layer-2 scaling solutions

 - Familiarity with regulatory frameworks for digital assets (MiCA, AML/KYC, securities regulations)

 - Experience integrating blockchain with core banking systems, payments platforms, or treasury management systems

 - Programming proficiency in languages like Python, Go, Rust, Java, or Solidity

 - Blockchain certifications (Certified Blockchain Architect, Hyperledger, or similar)

 - Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and container orchestration

 - Interest in progressing into Principal Architect or technical leadership roles

Blockstream https://blockstream.com/ was founded in 2014 by Dr. Adam Back https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_Back and a group of fellow cryptographers and engineers who are passionate about Bitcoin and its potential to change the world. Today, Blockstream is the leading Bitcoin company, providing cutting-edge infrastructure solutions for enterprises, institutions, and individual Bitcoin users. We develop industry-leading Bitcoin self-custody solutions, Bitcoin-based financial products, second-layer scaling technologies, and enterprise-grade blockchain infrastructure.

title: Junior SDR - Germany
description:
Join blp ‚Äì The #1 Solution for ERP Automation

blp is a high-performance ETH and HSG spin-off redefining ERP automation with AI. We solve real enterprise problems with cutting-edge tech and a strong sense of ownership. Our solution is in production across 40+ countries, used by 20'000+ daily active users, automating 70'000+ processes every day.

Our AI-driven ERP automation is transforming finance, procurement, logistics, sales, and more. As one of Switzerland's fastest-growing SaaS scale-ups, we are proudly self-financed and fully employee-owned.

Our success stems from deep expertise in technology and business processes, delivering a superior product with an outstanding product-to-market fit, proven by our growing customer base, including Fortune 500 companies.

Our rapid growth and career opportunities have been recognised with the LinkedIn Top Startup Award, and we‚Äôre just getting started. Our HQ? Z√ºrich‚Äôs iconic Bahnhofstrasse, a fitting home for a company redefining how businesses operate.

Ready to build the future? Join blp today.

As a Sales Development Representative, you‚Äôll be at the front line of our growth‚Äîconnecting with decision-makers at leading industrial companies and creating new opportunities. You‚Äôll work closely with our Sales Team to build relationships, uncover needs, and proactively drive the sales process forward‚Äîconverting leads into customers to reach your sales targets. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing scale-up with 80+ employees, combining startup agility with the structure and ambition of a scaling business

How We Work

 - AI-First & Data-Driven: We leverage smart automation to optimize leads, so you can focus on meaningful customer engagement.

 - In control. As a self-financed startup, we make decisions, not investors

 - Engineering and product led. We successfully sold our AI first product over 300 times, beating incumbents

 - Ownership: We own our work, our wins, and our mistakes. It‚Äôs how we grow and improve.

 - Excellence: We don't settle for ‚Äúgood enough.‚Äù Exceptional is our standard, in everything we do.

 - Transparency: What you see is what you get. Open communication, honest processes, and no surprises

 - Candour: Bold, honest conversations that inspire new ideas and solve problems.

What You'll Do

 - Take ownership of targeted outreach to potential clients through cold calls and personalized messages.

 - Take ownership of discovery meetings and process analysis with key stakeholders to ensure a strong handover of qualified demo opportunities.

 - Craft tailored value propositions by understanding the unique pain points of industrial stakeholders across Finance, Procurement, and Sales.

 - Independent and continuous improvement in outbound sales tactics.

 - Stay ahead of the market by continuously updating your commercial knowledge, analysing P2P and O2C processes, and tracking industry trends.

 - Prioritise complex tasks with clients and identify potential bottlenecks to push deals moving forward.

We‚Äôre Excited About You Because

 - Bachelor's or Master's degree in STEM, Psychology, Business or similar

 - You are confident picking up the phone, following scripts and asking open-ended questions

 - Your attention to detail is shown by accurately tracking information in our CRM (HubSpot)

 - You‚Äôre a structured thinker & organised; it is a must to keep up with your day to day

 - You handle rejection with resilience and keep your momentum through long sales cycles

 - You‚Äôre a team player with a sense of ownership and accountability

 - You enjoy problem-solving and have a natural curiosity that drives you to find creative solutions

You‚Äôll Get

 - Training and development. Enjoy a 3-month onboarding process with ongoing support to set you up for success

 - Fair lead allocation. We make sure the playing field is level for everyone. AI algorithms decide, not managers

 - Automatic promotions. Your success is our success, and you‚Äôll be measured on revenue contribution

 - High Earning Potential. Uncapped commission and expected 6-figure package, and opportunity to participate in common share equity program

 - Equal OTEs. As we share the same incentives, you‚Äôll be comped as the Account Executives

 - Remote-friendly & flexible: Work the way that suits you

 - Opportunities to grow. You‚Äôre controlling your personal development and career trajectory in a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup

 - Exceptional colleagues. You‚Äôll be growing alongside individuals from exceptional academic backgrounds and careers

title: Research Internship (Spring 2026)
description:
Who are we?

Our mission is to scale intelligence to serve humanity. We‚Äôre training and deploying frontier models for developers and enterprises who are building AI systems to power magical experiences like content generation, semantic search, RAG, and agents. We believe that our work is instrumental to the widespread adoption of AI.

We obsess over what we build. Each one of us is responsible for contributing to increasing the capabilities of our models and the value they drive for our customers. We like to work hard and move fast to do what‚Äôs best for our customers.

Cohere is a team of researchers, engineers, designers, and more, who are passionate about their craft. Each person is one of the best in the world at what they do. We believe that a diverse range of perspectives is a requirement for building great products.

Join us on our mission and shape the future!

Why this role?

To have the opportunity to collaborate with Cohere researchers and tools on designing and implementing novel research ideas and shipping state-of-the-art models to production. We have openings in teams covering base model training, retrieval augmented generation, data and evaluation, safety, and finetuning, to name a few; and we are open to receiving intern applications in any research area relating to LLMs to broaden your research connections while obtaining deep experience in a growing AI startup.¬†
Please Note: To be eligible for a Research Internship, you must be currently pursuing a PhD in Machine Learning, NLP, or a related discipline. You need to be available for a full-time internship that lasts for 4-6 months.

As a Cohere Research Intern, you will:

 - Conduct cutting-edge machine learning research, building and training large language models.¬†

 - Focus on research projects aimed at expanding the frontier of knowledge in language modelling and associate areas such as evaluation, multimodal models, optimisation etc.

 - Disseminate your research results through the production of publications, datasets, and code.

 - Contribute to research initiatives that have practical applications in Cohere‚Äôs product development.¬†

You may be a good fit if you:

 - Are currently pursuing, or in the process of obtaining, a PhD in Machine Learning, NLP, Artificial Intelligence, or a related discipline. We will also consider exceptional non-PhD candidates.

 - Are eligible for work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization throughout the internship period.¬†

 - Have experience using large-scale distributed training strategies, data annotation and evaluation pipelines, or implementing state of the art ML models.

 - Are familiar with autoregressive sequence models, such as Transformers.

 - Have strong communication and problem-solving skills with the ability to convey complex research findings clearly and succinctly.¬†

 - Have knowledge, or are knowledgeable, of programming languages such as Python, C, C++, Lua, or related languages.

 - Have knowledge of related ML frameworks such as JAX, Pytorch and Tensorflow.

 - Have previous experience in building systems based on machine learning and deep learning techniques.¬†

 - Demonstrate passion for applied NLP models and products.

Preferred Qualifications:

 - Demonstrated expertise through publications in top tier venues in fields such as machine learning, NLP, artificial intelligence, computer vision, optimization, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, or data science.¬†

 - Proven ability to tackle analytical problems using quantitative methodologies.¬†

 - Proficiency in handling and analysing complex, high-dimensional data from various sources.

 - Experience in applying theoretical and empirical research to real-world problem-solving.

If some of the above doesn‚Äôt line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply!

We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to providing equal opportunities. Should you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please submit an Accommodations Request Form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/12a6IrLdF3kI2nonKSr4tiFuz18rLQbaeYV-JM9L4o9Q/edit, and we will work together to meet your needs.

Full-Time Employees at Cohere enjoy these Perks:

ü§ù An open and inclusive culture and work environment¬†

üßë‚Äçüíª Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research¬†

üçΩ Weekly lunch stipend, in-office lunches & snacks

ü¶∑ Full health and dental benefits, including a separate budget to take care of your mental health¬†

üê£ 100% Parental Leave top-up for up to 6 months

üé® Personal enrichment benefits towards arts and culture, fitness and well-being, quality time, and workspace improvement

üèô Remote-flexible, offices in Toronto, New York, San Francisco, London and Paris, as well as a co-working stipend

‚úàÔ∏è 6 weeks of vacation (30 working days!)

description:
Who are we?

Our mission is to scale intelligence to serve humanity. We‚Äôre training and deploying frontier models for developers and enterprises who are building AI systems to power magical experiences like content generation, semantic search, RAG, and agents. Join us on our mission and shape the future!

Why this role?

This role is for students who are excited about building the next generation of machine learning models and NLP products. Our SWE roles can cover creating datasets for machine learning, scaling the pods to serve our API, or even building out new security features on our platform. We don't distinguish much between interns and full-time employees, and you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to push code to production. You'll have full autonomy and ownership over high-impact work, and will be backed by the support of an incredible team or leaders & mentors.

Join us at a pivotal moment, shape what we build, and wear multiple hats!
We're currently hiring for multiple teams and roles, including Frontend, Backend, Full-stack, and Infrastructure roles. We'll take your interests & experience into account throughout the application process.
Our recruitment process will begin in the upcoming weeks, and we will be carefully reviewing applications and assessing potential candidates for our internships. Should we find a suitable match with your qualifications and our requirements, we will be in touch to discuss the opportunity further and to advance your application to the next stage.


Please Note: To be eligible for this position, you should be currently enrolled in a post-secondary program and available for a full-time 3-6 month internship, co-op, or research work term.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:

 - Ship delightful experiences for our user-facing products, meticulously crafting code for browsers or server code.

 - Build features for the API platform that directly impact users.

 - Design and implement robust data pipelines (crawlers, storage, filters).

 - Design and implement scalable services or infrastructure for machine learning development.

 - Build internal tooling (CI/CD, dev utilities) to move faster together.

 - Build tech writing skills through maintaining and contributing to technical documentation, both internal and external facing.

 - Keep up with the cutting edge and adopt new technologies to improve performance and reliability across Cohere.

If some of the above doesn‚Äôt line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply!

title: Software Engineer Intern 12 month FTC
description:
We‚Äôre not just building better tech. We‚Äôre rewriting how data moves and what the world can do with it. With Confluent, data doesn‚Äôt sit still. Our platform puts information in motion, streaming in near real-time so companies can react faster, build smarter, and deliver experiences as dynamic as the world around them.

It takes a certain kind of person to join this team. Those who ask hard questions, give honest feedback, and show up for each other. No egos, no solo acts. Just smart, curious humans pushing toward something bigger, together.

One Confluent. One Team. One Data Streaming Platform.


ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are a team of passionate engineers who love solving complex distributed systems and infrastructure problems. Real-time infrastructure is the future, and we are creating a new category for it - ‚ÄòData in Motion‚Äô.

Your placement internship will be a remote opportunity for a full year that introduces you to Confluent's culture and enables faster learning, onboarding, and coaching.


WHAT YOU WILL DO:

 - To design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software that will touch production and have a customer-facing impact.

 - Follow best practices for software development and participate in code reviews.

 - Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.

 - Help build the next generation Kafka by continuing to push the boundaries of distributed system design.


WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

 - Pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Math, or a related technical field.

 - Self-motivated and able to drive projects with mentorship and project requirements

 - Ability to work effectively in teams and strong verbal and written communication skills

 - Good knowledge of data structures and algorithms and are proficient in at least one of these languages: Java/Scala, C, C++, GoSmart, humble, and empathetic

 - Driven and excited about the challenges of a fast-paced, innovative, and quickly growing software development environment

 - Interested in building large-scale distributed systems in the cloud and are excited to make an impact


WHAT GIVES YOU AN EDGE:

 - Exposure to tools or frameworks like Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, or Kubernetes is a plus


READY TO BUILD WHAT'S NEXT? LET‚ÄôS GET IN MOTION.





COME AS YOU ARE

Belonging isn‚Äôt a perk here. It‚Äôs the baseline. We work across time zones and backgrounds, knowing the best ideas come from different perspectives. And we make space for everyone to lead, grow, and challenge what‚Äôs possible.

We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment decisions are based on job-related criteria, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

Our platform puts information in motion, streaming in near real-time so companies can react faster, build smarter, and deliver experiences as dynamic as the world around them.

It takes a certain kind of person to join this team. Those who ask hard questions, give honest feedback, and show up for each other. No egos, no solo acts. Just smart, curious humans pushing toward something bigger, together.

One Confluent. One Team. One Data Streaming Platform.

This role is offered to active duty service members who are enrolled in the Skillbridge program or are looking for a Skillbridge internship only. This is a contract role for up to 6 months. Interns will be paid through the Skillbridge Program by the Department of Defense.


ABOUT THE ROLE:

As part of the Early Career Recruiting Team this summer, you receive a hands-on opportunity to gain exposure across recruiting, talent operations, employer branding, and early career program management and see how these functions are built, scaled, and delivered at a fast-growing tech company. Through your rotations you will gain real project ownership, and work closely with mentors who are invested in your growth.


WHAT YOU WILL DO:

 - Partner seamlessly with the recruiting team to ensure a positive and engaging experience for all interns by facilitating smooth communication, providing timely updates, and acting as a brand ambassador

 - Help maintain candidate databases and tracking systems, supporting data accuracy and reporting

 - Compile and analyze recruitment metrics and intern program data to inform future hiring strategies

 - Run in-person and virtual events for our North America internship program as the team‚Äôs on-the-ground point of contact

 - Support onboarding sessions, social events, and mentorship activities and track intern participation and engagement metrics

 - Contribute to the creation of engaging content aimed at attracting campus talent

 - Assist with intern spotlights and storytelling initiatives

 - Maintain wiki pages, onboarding resources, and intern program materials

 - Support documentation of recruiting workflows and program playbooks

 - Identify inefficiencies and propose improvements to recruiting and program processes


WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

 - Highly motivated, proactive, and comfortable taking initiative in a fast-paced environment

 - Demonstrated leadership and involvement in campus organizations or student activities

 - Able to execute a program plan with clear deliverables, timelines, and strategies

 - Strong time-management and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to multitask and stay organized

 - Detail-oriented, responsive, and quick to learn new tools and processes

 - Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 - Team-oriented mindset with a collaborative, solutions-driven approach


READY TO BUILD WHAT'S NEXT? LET‚ÄôS GET IN MOTION.





COME AS YOU ARE

Belonging isn‚Äôt a perk here. It‚Äôs the baseline. We work across time zones and backgrounds, knowing the best ideas come from different perspectives. And we make space for everyone to lead, grow, and challenge what‚Äôs possible.

We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment decisions are based on job-related criteria, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Internship People Operations
description:
ABOUT DASH0

Join Dash0 and help us define the future of observability. We are OpenTelemetry-native, building a delightful, simple, and AI-centric platform that eliminates vendor lock-in and meaningless toil. Shape a product that developers love‚Äîall with transparent pricing and cost-control built in.

Your Role at Dash0

As an Entrepreneur in Residence (EiR) Intern for People & Talent, you will be the right hand to our leadership team in building the foundational "operating system" of our company: our people. This isn't a role for someone who wants to follow a manual; it‚Äôs for someone who wants to write the manual.

You will lead high-impact founding projects across the entire employee lifecycle, from the first "hello" on LinkedIn to a seamless day-to-day employee experience. Your mission is to make our People department as efficient, AI-driven, and "delightful" as our product itself.

What You‚Äôll Do

Founding People Operations Projects

 - The Employee Journey: Map out and improve key milestones (onboarding, anniversaries, promotions).

 - Onboarding & Admin: Own the "Day 1" experience. You‚Äôll manage onboarding logistics, administrative to-dos, and contract amendments, ensuring everything is compliant but human-centric.

 - Operational Excellence: Identify bottlenecks in our current people processes and propose lean, scalable solutions.

What You Bring

 - Entrepreneurial Mindset: You are a "builder" who thrives in ambiguity. You don't wait for instructions; you find problems and solve them.

 - Process Obsession: You love creating structures where there were none. You care about the small details that make a big difference.

 - Tech-Savvy & AI-Curious: You are likely the first person among your peers to try a new AI tool and are excited about how technology can humanize (not just automate) HR.

 - High Empathy & Communication: You understand that "People Ops" is about people. You have excellent English skills and a knack for clear, transparent communication.

 - Fast Learner: You can dive into a technical environment and understand what makes a Cloud Engineer or an OpenTelemetry contributor tick.

What We Offer

 - High Ownership: You won't be making coffee; you‚Äôll be making decisions that shape our company culture.

 - Mentorship: Work directly with Dash0 leadership and experienced founders.

 - Remote-First Culture: Work from where you are most productive.

‚Ä¢A "0 to 1" Experience: The rare chance to see exactly how a high-growth startup is built from the inside.

title: Junior Business Development Manager - Rome
description:
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER (ROME) ‚Äî 12-MONTH FTC

Join us in our mission to transform the way people shop and eat, where impact, innovation, and growth drive everything we do. Our Commercial team sits at the heart of Deliveroo‚Äôs marketplace‚Äîshaping how we serve restaurants, grocers, and new verticals worldwide. From negotiating key partnerships to unlocking new revenue streams and crafting data-led growth strategies, we take on big challenges that move the business forward. If you thrive in fast-paced, commercial environments and want to influence the future of a global brand‚Äîthis is the team for you.

We‚Äôre looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team in Rome on a 12-month fixed-term contract. This is a rare opportunity to become a founding member of a growing, well-funded company, collaborating with Italy's most premium and regarded restaurants.


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING

You‚Äôll be joining the Regional Sales team, reporting to the Sales Lead. You will be the face of Deliveroo in Rome, acting as an area-level expert who knows exactly what local customers crave.

 - Strategic Prospecting: Map, prospect, pitch, and close new restaurant partners across Rome in a highly organized fashion.

 - Technology Advocacy: Communicate via physical visits, calls, emails, and social media to demonstrate the value of Deliveroo‚Äôs technology to local business owners.

 - Partner Support: Act as a consultant for restaurant owners and managers, helping them overcome barriers to entry and providing a seamless joining experience.

 - Market Immersion: Stay at the forefront of the Roman food scene by attending industry meet-ups and tracking up-and-coming culinary trends.

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO THRIVE

Our ideal candidate is a tenacious "hunter" who enjoys the challenge of building new business:

 - Sales Grit: Proven experience in sales with a focus on targeting and acquiring new business.

 - Communication Mastery: High confidence in dealing with partners face-to-face, over the phone, or via digital channels.

 - Negotiation Skills: Ability to handle objections and structure commercial deals effectively.

 - Industry Knowledge: A strong understanding of the restaurant industry is a significant plus.

 - Tenacity: A self-starter mindset with the resilience to pursue opportunities in a competitive market.


WHY JOIN US?

At Deliveroo, you‚Äôll solve complex real-time challenges in an industry that is redefining convenience. Working here you can expect:

 - üöÄ Make a Visible Impact: Your work directly shapes the culinary selection available to customers in Rome.

 - üå± Entrepreneurial Pace: Work with a high degree of autonomy and ownership in a fast-moving environment.

 - üß† Professional Growth: Gain experience with a global technology leader at the forefront of the food-tech industry.

title: Junior Account Manager (Data & Analytics focus)
description:
JUNIOR ACCOUNT MANAGER (DATA & ANALYTICS FOCUS)

title: Junior Field Sales Manager
description:
JUNIOR FIELD SALES MANAGER

Join us in our mission to transform the way people shop and eat, where impact, innovation, and growth drive everything we do. Our Commercial team sits at the heart of Deliveroo‚Äôs marketplace‚Äîshaping how we serve restaurants, grocers, and new verticals worldwide. United Kingdom & Ireland (UK&I) is our largest business and is at the forefront of strategic, commercial, and operational innovation. Regional UKI presents one of our biggest growth opportunities, and we are looking for a high-impact leader to help us fulfill our potential in the capital.

We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Field Sales Manager to join our Greater London team. Reporting to the Programme Lead, you will have direct ownership of results within your zones, leading a team of Market Activators to deliver challenging selection goals and improve our proposition across all segments.


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING

You will act as the business owner for your assigned clusters, balancing people leadership with strategic market analysis to ensure Deliveroo remains the definitive food partner in London.

 - Sales Leadership & Coaching: Manage and develop a high-performance team of up to 7 Market Activators. You will spend 3‚Äì4 days a week in the field, role-modeling excellence and providing the coaching and structure needed to hit ambitious monthly targets.

 - CVP Ownership: Be the expert on your clusters. Identify the "local gems" and high-priority partners critical to our Consumer Value Proposition (CVP). Map out cuisine gaps and competitor strengths to build precise, detailed growth plans.

 - Strategic Execution: Lead and participate in tactical initiatives, such as the Javelin project, which may include in-person marketing activations and targeted sprints on metrics like signage, menu completeness, and rejection rates.

 - Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Regional Managers and SMB leads to align on cluster priorities. You will influence Account Managers to drive operational improvements for partners within your zones.

 - Data-Driven Management: Use Salesforce to diagnose performance issues, ensure data quality, and keep senior stakeholders informed of progress within your region.


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO THRIVE

Our ideal candidate is a "bias-for-action" leader who thrives in the fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment of a growing marketplace:

 - Commercial Experience: 4+ years of experience in sales or commercial roles, with a proven track record of delivering outstanding results in a target-driven environment.

 - Inspiring Leadership: Demonstrable skills in leading direct reports or coaching and mentoring teams. You are comfortable motivating a team in a field-based setting 4 days a week.

 - Strategic Sharpness: A clear communicator capable of managing a complex stakeholder matrix (including Regional Directors and Central Strategy teams).

 - Analytical Proficiency: Ideally experienced in Salesforce, with the ability to use data to identify gaps and influence teams to follow rigorous processes.

 - Entrepreneurial Spirit: A self-starter who is well-organized and enjoys a mixture of autonomous work and deep-dive team collaboration.


WHY JOIN US?

At Deliveroo, you‚Äôll solve complex real-time challenges in an industry that is redefining convenience. Working here you can expect to:

 - üöÄ Drive Growth in a Key Market: Own the expansion and selection strategy for the most vibrant food scene in the world.

 - üå± Entrepreneurial Autonomy: Move fast and take ownership of your zones as if they were your own business.

 - üß† Lead at the Forefront: Be part of the team driving innovation in our most mature and strategic global market.


DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION
