title: Junior Graphic Designer & Marketing Assistant
description:
Join Hire Hangar and work with fast-growing global companies while building a long-term, remote career.




Job Title
Junior Graphic Designer & Marketing Assistant

Location
Remote

Time Zone
US Time Zones (EST‚ÄìPST)



ROLE OVERVIEW

We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Graphic Designer & Marketing Assistant to join a growing photography-focused startup. This is a junior, hands-on role ideal for someone early in their career who enjoys wearing multiple hats and wants to grow alongside a creative business.

Your primary focus will be graphic design, supporting visual content across marketing, social media, and client-facing materials. In addition, you‚Äôll assist with influencer outreach, light administrative tasks, and occasional support with sales or partnership-related activities. This role is perfect for a highly organized, proactive individual with a startup mindset who enjoys creative work, learning new skills, and contributing wherever needed.

This is a fun, fast-paced environment centered around photography, creativity, and building a brand - so curiosity, energy, and flexibility are key.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Create engaging graphic designs for social media, marketing campaigns, presentations, and digital assets

 - Support visual content needs for photography-related projects and promotions

 - Assist with influencer outreach, including researching creators, sending outreach messages, and tracking responses

 - Maintain basic outreach and contact lists, follow-ups, and status updates

 - Handle ad hoc virtual assistant and administrative tasks as needed (e.g., scheduling, organization, simple research)

 - Support basic sales or partnership activities, such as preparing materials or assisting with follow-ups

 - Help keep digital files, assets, and workflows organized

 - Collaborate with the founder and team to support day-to-day business needs

 - Bring creative ideas and contribute to a positive, startup-style working environment


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

 - Experience (or strong practical experience) in graphic design or visual content creation

 - Proficiency with basic design tools such as Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar

 - Strong organizational and administrative skills, with attention to detail

 - Comfortable handling multiple small tasks in a fast-moving startup environment

 - Clear written communication skills and confidence reaching out to influencers or partners

 - Prior remote work experience is required, with fluency in remote collaboration tools such as Slack, Zoom, Google Workspace, Asana, or similar; candidates must have experience working with US- or UK-based companies - applications without this experience will not be considered


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 - Interest or background in photography, creative industries, or social media

 - Exposure to influencer marketing, outreach, or basic sales support

 - Familiarity with social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, etc.)

 - Willingness to learn new tools, platforms, and processes


TOOLS & TECHNOLOGY

 - Graphic design tools (Figma, Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar)

 - Social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, etc.)

 - Outreach and communication tools (email, Slack)

 - Project or task management tools (Asana, Trello, or similar)

   It is crucial that you complete the application form in full. As part of the application process, you will be required to record a video. If your application is successful, you will receive an email confirming next steps‚Äîthe video is the first step of the interview process. If you do not record a video, we will not be able to consider you for ANY open roles.







We connect top talent with vetted employers, competitive pay, and real growth opportunities.

title: Software Engineer Intern - AI Gateway
description:
Are you ready to power the World's connections?

If you don‚Äôt think you meet all of the criteria below but are still interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box - we‚Äôre looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and have some interest and capabilities in others.

About the role:

Kong is an open-source project with a global adoption around the world. Developers and architects are adopting Kong in production among a large variety of use-cases, and actively help make Kong a better product with their feedback and contributions.

As a Software Engineer Intern in the AI Gateway Team, you will be working on core features such as proxying capabilities, load balancing, and database support with forward-thinking. You will be responsible for building foundations for other teams and customers, discovering and producing cutting edge industry trends and use-cases.

What you'll be doing:

 - Responsible for designing, building and maintaining Kong AI Gateway software and its underlying stack.

 - Design and implement new innovative features including proxying capabilities, load balancing, databases support that extend Kong‚Äôs offering.

 - Bugs troubleshooting, performance tuning and low-level optimizations.

 - Engage with the open source community and extend Kong AI Gateway to support the latest industry trends.

 - Fill the gaps between Kong and third-party deployment platforms and tooling.

 - And any additional tasks required by the manager.

What you'll bring:

 - Programming experience in server-side applications and components.

 - Experience in designing, prototyping, building and debugging applications that are highly scalable, distributed, reliable and resilient.

 - Solid hands-on low-level technical expertise in Linux systems troubleshooting, and profiling.

 - Experience in distributed systems, Linux networking stack and computer systems programming, Kong works with APIs on both L7 and L4 transports and protocols, so this expertise and knowledge are required.

 - Comfortable working with a remotely distributed team.

 - Strong sense of ownership and excellent verbal and written communication skills -- engineers at Kong write the documentation for their products

 - Familiarity with AI LLM concepts and applications development

Bonus Points:

 - Hands-on experience with NGINX/OpenResty/Kong/LuaJIT.

 - Hands-on experience with Envoy or Istio.

 - Hands on experience with Rust

#LI-WL1

About Kong:

Kong Inc., a leading developer of API and AI connectivity technologies, is building the infrastructure that powers the agentic era. trusted by the Fortune 500 and startups alike, Kong's unified API and AI platform, Kong Konnect, enables organizations to secure, manage, accelerate, govern, and monetize the flow of intelligence across APIs and AI models. For more information, visit www.konghq.com http://www.konghq.com.

title: Graduate program ‚Äì Sales
description:
At Lexroom.ai http://Lexroom.ai, we‚Äôre not just building software; we‚Äôre revolutionizing the way legal professionals work.

Our mission?

To empower lawyers, law firms and companies with a world-class AI product that saves time, boosts productivity, and redefine what‚Äôs possible in the legal world.

To become the most innovative AI company in Italy.

To build the new sales standard, the sales school for B2B sales in Italy.

We‚Äôre changing the game, and we‚Äôre doing it with a team of rockstars who are looking for their next big challenge and ambition.


WHY LEXROOM.AI http://Lexroom.ai?

 - Shape the Future: Be part of the team that‚Äôs leading the AI revolution for legal professionals.

 - Grow with Rockstars: Collaborate with industry-leading talents in an environment that values creativity, ambition, and growth.

 - Make an Impact: Your work will directly influence how lawyers around the world practice law‚Äîmore efficiently, effectively, and intelligently.

At Lexroom.ai http://Lexroom.ai, we don‚Äôt just promise career growth; we promise a journey of learning, impact, and purpose. Ready to change the world of law?


YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

To fuel our growth, we‚Äôre launching an elite Graduate Program ‚Äì Sales designed for the top 3% of young talent.

This is not a classic entry-level role. It‚Äôs a fast-track program with structured rotations and a clear goal: turn you into a high-performing Account Executive in 18 months, supported by a world-class Sales Academy.

You‚Äôll go through 4 consecutive roles, each with clear goals, coaching and KPIs:

 - 3/6 months ‚Äì SDR (Sales Development Representative)
   
   - Learn how to generate pipeline from scratch.
   
   - Master prospecting, outbound sequences, first touch and meeting setting.

 - 6 months ‚Äì BDR (Business Development Representative)
   
   - Qualify inbound leads.
   
   - Learn discovery basics, opportunity qualification and handoff to AE.

The Pivot Point

After your first 9 months, based on your performance, strengths, and the skills you‚Äôve mastered, you will transition into one of the following two tracks for the next phase:

 - 6 months ‚Äì AE Inbound (Account Executive Inbound)
   
   - Own inbound deals on our legal segment.
   
   - Run discovery calls, demos, handle objections and close your first customers.
   
   - Collaborate closely with senior AEs, Sales Coach and Sales Director on live deals and strategy.

 - 6 months ‚Äì AE Outbound (Account Executive Outbound)
   
   - Take ownership of a territory.
   
   - Drive outbound deals end-to-end with multiple stakeholders and longer cycles.
   
   - Contribute to improving scripts, sequences and playbooks as you learn what works.
     

Throughout the program, you will be trained and coached within the Lexroom Sales Academy, with structured modules on:

 - sales methodology (discovery, demo, negotiation, objection handling);

 - pipeline and territory management;

 - use of AI in sales;

 - personal performance, mindset and communication.
   

Those who perform in the top tier will be fast-tracked to mid-market, enterprise or managerial roles.


WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

 - Recent graduate (or up to 1 year experience) with a strong interest in B2B sales and tech / AI.

 - You‚Äôve consistently been in the top performers of whatever you did (university, sports, projects, work).

 - Excellent communication skills, both spoken and written, in Italian and English.

 - High drive and resilience: you like ambitious targets and don‚Äôt get scared by rejection.

 - You learn fast, ask tough questions, and actively look for feedback to get better.

 - You want responsibility early, not a ‚Äúnice‚Äù graduate badge with no real impact.


WHAT WE BRING TO THE TABLE

An Elite Team of Rockstars.

At http://lexroom.aiLexroom.ai http://Lexroom.ai, you‚Äôll collaborate with some of the brightest minds in tech and legal AI. Our small, entrepreneurial teams are driven by impact and autonomy, allowing you to contribute directly to revolutionising the legal industry. You‚Äôll work side by side with pioneers who are as passionate about innovation as they are about personal and professional growth.

Unmatched Growth Opportunities.

We believe in hiring exceptional talent and empowering them to lead. As one of the first hires at http://lexroom.aiLexroom.ai http://Lexroom.ai, you‚Äôll play a critical role in shaping the future of legal technology. Your contributions won‚Äôt just be noticed‚Äîthey‚Äôll be transformative. Here, age and title don‚Äôt define your impact; your vision, execution, and passion do. If you have the ambition and drive, you‚Äôll rapidly advance and take on leadership roles in game-changing projects.

Competitive Pay and Equity.

We recognize talent and reward it. Expect competitive compensation with rapid growth tied to your impact. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

 - Annual Salary Range: ‚Ç¨40.000 - 60.000 OTE (uncapped and accelerated)

 - Relevant stock option package: Your hard work will directly contribute to‚Äîand benefit from‚Äîour success.


PERKS THAT MAKE A DIFFERENCE

 - Hybrid Work Model: Split your time between working from home and collaborating in our dynamic Milan office, balancing flexibility and team connection.

 - Health Insurance: Comprehensive health coverage to ensure your peace of mind.

 - Meal Vouchers: Receive ticket vouchers to make your lunch breaks more enjoyable.

 - Performance Bonuses: Be rewarded for your hard work with production bonuses tied to your impact and results.

 - Team Retreats & Building Activities: Experience periodic retreats and team-building activities that strengthen collaboration and fuel creativity.

At http://lexroom.aiLexroom.ai http://Lexroom.ai, we‚Äôre driven by bold ambitions and a passion for excellence. We‚Äôre building something great, and that requires dedication, hard work, and a commitment to continuous growth. If you‚Äôre excited about the opportunity to challenge yourself, work hard and make a real impact, then we‚Äôd love to see your application.

title: Junior Finance Analyst
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


We are seeking a Junior Finance Analyst to join our growing Finance team. This role will help transition key transactional and operational finance responsibilities into the finance function. This role is collaborative, cross‚Äëfunctional, and highly interactive, working closely with Finance, Operations, and other internal stakeholders.



üåç LOCATION

Berlin, Germany
Please note: This role requires you to be located in Berlin. Your application will not be considered otherwise.




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO


Operational Finance & Payments


 - Process invoices, expense requests, reimbursements, card approval requests, and per diems through internal systems such as Moss, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timely execution.

 - Follow up with internal stakeholders for missing documentation or clarifications as needed.

 - Support routine accounting and payment‚Äërelated tasks to ensure smooth day‚Äëto‚Äëday operations.
   

Shadow & Learn Accounting Processes


 - Work closely with other team members to learn and understand internal payment policies, accounting procedures, and financial controls.

 - Build proficiency across transactional finance workflows to ensure full operational coverage.

Cross‚ÄëFunctional Communication


 - Engage regularly with internal teams across finance, operations, and other departments to address inquiries, coordinate processes, and maintain clear communication.

 - Act as a reliable point of contact for internal stakeholders regarding routine finance matters.

Process Improvement & Projects


 - Contribute to process optimisation initiatives and support the adoption of new tools or automation (including AI‚Äëassisted workflows) where appropriate.

 - Support manual crypto‚Äërelated accounting tasks as needed, under guidance.

Team Support


 - Provide general assistance across the finance function to enable strategic focus for senior team members.

 - Participate in ad‚Äëhoc projects and assist with other tasks that support the effectiveness of the finance team.
   
   
   
   


WHAT MAKES YOU A GOOD CANDIDATE


 - Analytical and detail‚Äëoriented, with an interest in finance and numbers.

 - Comfortable in a fast‚Äëpaced environment, able to manage routine tasks while learning new responsibilities.

 - Strong communication skills, able to work collaboratively with internal partners across teams.

 - Proactive and solutions‚Äëoriented, taking ownership of work and improving processes.

 - Tech‚Äësavvy and open to learning new tools; willingness to engage with process improvements and emerging technologies.

 - Previous startup experience is a plus

 - German language knowledge is a plus


COMPANY CULTURE

 - Embracing the differences
   
   - Embrace your own differences
   
   - Respect and welcome the unique qualities of others
   
   - See others‚Äô differences as an opportunity to grow

 - Own it, do it
   
   - Own tasks end-to-end
   
   - Hold yourself to a high bar for execution
   
   - Make bold decisions, and be accountable
   
   - Understand your limitations and seek for help

 - Fail forward
   
   - Try - don‚Äôt be afraid to fail
   
   - Learn - don‚Äôt make the same mistake twice
   
   - Adapt - grow with the experience

 - Have fun together
   
   - Take the time to get to know and understand each other better
   
   - Don‚Äôt take yourself too seriously and keep it light-hearted
   
   - Fun should be coming from a place of love and respect


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL GET

 - Annual team offsites (Thailand in 2023 and Vietnam in 2024 were a blast, Marrakech in March 2025 was blast-ier; let‚Äôs see what happens in 2026!)

 - 30 days of PTO

 - Flexible remote days

 - Flexible working hours

 - Equity participation from day 1

 - Entitlement to work computer (choice of equipment)

 - An annual 1,000‚Ç¨ personal development budget once you have worked 6+ months (pro-rated the first year)

 - A one-time 1,000‚Ç¨ remote budget to use on coworking, office setup, etc.

If you join us as an independent contractor, you‚Äôre only entitled to the first five benefits of this list.


APPLICATION PROCESS

Setting yourself up for success starts with the application! Click here https://www.notion.so/Setting-yourself-up-for-a-great-start-112f0ff14ac780d58c6ee346f3856bec?pvs=21 to discover valuable tips that will help you navigate our application process effectively.

LI.FI http://LI.FI is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Join us in our dedication to fostering a workplace that values and respects each team member's unique contributions.

Shortlisted candidates will undergo a comprehensive interview process, including a people operations interview, a take-home assignment, a meet-the-team & founder interview, and a reference check.

For more information, visit our page https://www.notion.so/Hiring-Process-at-LI-FI-2e3ec55d96114976abc635866ae73ea3?pvs=21 detailing our hiring process!

title: Software Engineer Intern (Summer 2026)
description:
ABOUT US:

Notion helps you build beautiful tools for your life‚Äôs work. In today's world of endless apps and tabs, Notion provides one place for teams to get everything done, seamlessly connecting docs, notes, projects, calendar, and email‚Äîwith AI built in to find answers and automate work. Millions of users, from individuals to large organizations like Toyota, Figma, and OpenAI, love Notion for its flexibility and choose it because it helps them save time and money.

In-person collaboration is essential to Notion's culture. We require all team members to work from our offices on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays, our designated Anchor Days. Certain teams or positions may require additional in-office workdays. This internship will take place from May - September (based on your summer schedule) and you will need to be able to work out of our NY or SF office during this time.


ABOUT THE ROLE:

Millions of people use Notion ‚Äî and this number is increasing every day. That means a million people trust us to deliver a fast, reliable, and secure experience, and we value this more than anything. We want to keep earning trust, while also continuing to amaze our users with the tools they can build in Notion. This is where you come in.

During your 12-week internship, you will be paired with a mentor that will help guide you as you work closely with our team to build and ship impactful projects. These projects will drive valuable impact to our customers and engineers. From product engineering, mobile, to infrastructure and security, we have opportunities available on different teams. Take a look at what our past intern cohort worked on with our Blog post here https://notion.notion.site/Notion-Intern-Spotlight-d0260c4e2317490db89f367d95cb4e68 and here https://www.notion.so/blog/saluting-notions-winter-interns and TikTok https://www.tiktok.com/@notionhq/video/7216440106356395306?lang=en post.


WHAT YOU'LL ACHIEVE:

 - Write clean, secure, tested, and documented code.

 - Design & enhance the Notion platform with new capabilities, as and when the need arises.

 - Design, develop, and own new product functionality and/or infrastructure leveraging modern frameworks and tooling.

 - Develop, fix and debug software for web services, databases, applications, tools, networks.


QUALIFICATIONS:

 - Pursuing a bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or another related field. Must graduate before July 2027.

 - Previous internship experience.

 - Working towards a proficiency of one or more programming languages such as Typescript, Node.js, Go, Python, Java, Swift, Rust, or Kotlin.

 - You find large challenges exciting and enjoy discovering problems as much as solving them.

 - You are able to problem-solve and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

 - This internship will take place from May - September (based on your summer schedule) and you will need to be able to work out of our NY or SF office during this time.


SKILLS YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO BRING:

 - Thoughtful problem-solving: For you, problem-solving starts with a clear and accurate understanding of the context. You can decompose tricky problems and work towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates. You're comfortable asking for help when you get stuck.

 - For a backend internship: You have a passion for learning how parts of a system fit together‚Äîfrom the user interface to the data model. Familiarity with relational database systems like Postgres or MySQL is a plus.

 - For a frontend internship: You have a passion for learning technologies (CSS, Javascript, & React) and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility and usability.

 - Put users first: You think critically about the implications of what you're building, and how it shapes real people's lives. You understand that reach comes with responsibility for our impact‚Äîgood and bad.

 - Not ideological about technology: To you, technologies and programming languages are about tradeoffs. You may be opinionated, but you're not ideological and can learn new technologies as you go.

 - Empathetic communication: You communicate nuanced ideas clearly, whether you're explaining technical decisions in writing or brainstorming in real time. In disagreements, you engage thoughtfully with other perspectives and compromise when needed.

 - Team player: For you, work isn't a solo endeavor. You enjoy collaborating cross-functionally to accomplish shared goals, and you care about learning, growing, and helping others to do the same.

 - You don‚Äôt need to be an AI expert, but you‚Äôre curious and willing to adopt AI tools to work smarter and deliver better results


NICE TO HAVES:

 - You have expertise with specific technologies that are part of our stack, including Typescript, React, Electron, Node.js, AWS, and Postgres.

 - You've heard of computing pioneers like Ada Lovelace, Douglas Engelbart, Alan Kay, and others‚Äîand understand why we're big fans of their work.

 - You have interests outside of technology, such as in art, history, or social sciences.

Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Notion.

Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role‚Äôs scope and complexity, and the candidate‚Äôs experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco or New York City, the estimated hourly range for this role is $57/hr for Bachelors and $61/hr for Master‚Äôs.

By clicking ‚ÄúSubmit Application‚Äù, I understand and agree that Notion and its affiliates and subsidiaries will collect and process my information in accordance with Notion‚Äôs Global Recruiting Privacy Policy https://notion.notion.site/Notion-Global-Recruiting-Privacy-Policy-fc3eb4e829354a26a2bb6fd5e289b550?pvs=74 and NYLL 144 https://notion.notion.site/Ashby-AI-Bias-Audit-2b0efdeead05803bbbfae159ec86c528.

title: Machine Learning Intern (PhD) - Summer 2026
description:
Patreon is a media and community platform where over 300,000 creators give their biggest fans access to exclusive work and experiences. We offer creators a variety of ways to engage with their fans and build a lasting business including: paid memberships, free memberships, community chats, live video, and selling to fans directly with one-time purchases.

Ultimately our goal is simple: fund the creative class. And we're leaders in that space, with:

 - $10 billion+ in revenue generated since Patreon's inception

 - 100 million+ free memberships for fans who may not be ready to pay just yet, and

 - 25 million+ paid memberships on Patreon today.

We're continuing to invest heavily in building the best creator platform with the best team in the creator economy and are looking for a Machine Learning Intern to support our mission.

This role is based in San Francisco or New York and open to those who are able to be in-office 3 days per week on a hybrid work model.

About the Role

As a Machine Learning Intern, you‚Äôll join one of our ML teams and work closely with experienced machine learning engineers, product managers, designers, and engineers. You‚Äôll gain hands-on experience across the end-to-end ML development lifecycle ‚Äî from exploratory data analysis and model prototyping to production deployment and monitoring. With mentorship and cross-functional collaboration, you‚Äôll own a well-defined ML project expected to ship to production by the end of the internship, making meaningful contributions to systems that support creators and fans worldwide.

In this role, you will:

 - Ship a real-world ML feature that directly impacts the creator economy! You‚Äôll work on a well-defined machine learning project in close partnership with a dedicated mentor, with the goal of shipping a complete, production-ready solution by the end of the internship. This includes training and iterating on ML models, writing high-quality, production-level code, and building backend components to integrate your model into Patreon's existing systems.

 - Be part of a great team. You‚Äôll be embedded into a world-class engineering team, working alongside fellow engineers, product managers, designers, and data scientists to make your feature a success.

 - Learn a lot. In the spirit of Win Together, we‚Äôll pair you with one of our experienced engineers to mentor and guide you as you ramp up and work through all the technical challenges of your internship project.

 - You‚Äôll have fun. Besides shipping a great product and partaking in Patreon's Intern Summit, you‚Äôll experience San Francisco or New York City during your summer internship alongside your intern cohort!

About You

 - You are currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science or a related technical degree (e.g. Math, Physics, Bioinformatics)

 - You possess solid technical knowledge of CS fundamentals, data structures and machine learning

 - You have experience using Python for large scale data processing

 - You demonstrate a willingness to learn and incorporate feedback

 - You are passionate about consumer products and the creator economy

About Patreon

Patreon powers creators to do what they love and get paid by the people who love what they do. Our team is passionate about making this mission and our core values come to life every day in our work. Through this work, our Patronauts:

 - Put Creators First | They‚Äôre the reason we‚Äôre here. When creators win, we win.

 - Build with Craft | We sign our name to every deliverable, just like the creators we serve.

 - Make it Happen | We don‚Äôt quit. We learn and deliver.

 - Win Together | We grow as individuals. We win as a team.

We hire talented and passionate people from different backgrounds because workplace diversity and inclusion is critical to our ability to serve creators worldwide. If you‚Äôre excited about a role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt match with every bullet point outlined above, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. If you‚Äôre a creator at heart, are energized by our mission, and share our company values, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Patreon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the interview process, please let us know via email at accomodations@patreon.

Patreon operates under a hybrid work model, where interns based in office locations are expected to come into the office three days per week, excluding sick time and leave. The goal of this policy is to be intentional about the in-person time we spend together to strengthen the feeling of community at Patreon.

Across PR, editorial, internal communications, employer brand, and events, we create moments and messages that define our brand, influence perception, and strengthen community.

About the Role

As a Communications & Events Intern, you will support how our brand shows up across live experiences, internal communications, and external PR and media. You‚Äôll work across multiple communications functions, helping teams execute their projects while understanding how each effort contributes to a cohesive brand story. This hands-on role offers behind-the-scenes exposure to how events and communications programs are planned, produced, and brought to life.

 - Creative & Experiential Support: Partner with event and creative teams to support environment design and experience details that bring our brand to life in physical spaces while creating moments designed to spark earned media and storytelling.

 - Project Coordination & Documentation: Help track timelines, maintain shared documents, and support asset organization across events and communications projects.

 - Win Together | We grow as individuals. We win as a team.

We hire talented and passionate people from different backgrounds because workplace diversity and inclusion is critical to our ability to serve creators worldwide. If you‚Äôre excited about a role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt match with every bullet point outlined above, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. If you‚Äôre a creator at heart, are energized by our mission, and share our company values, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Patreon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the interview process, please let us know via email at accomodations@patreon.

Patreon operates under a hybrid work model, where employees based in office locations are expected to come into the office two days per week. The goal of this policy is to be intentional about the in-person time we spend together to strengthen the feeling of community at Patreon.

At Patreon, we believe in fair and transparent pay. In compliance with New York pay transparency laws, we are sharing the expected salary range for this role.

The posted salary range is dependent on the location and the level. This range may encompass multiple levels within the role‚Äôs job family. The final offer will be based on candidate‚Äôs experience, skills, competencies, and geographic location, aligning with the appropriate job level within Patreon‚Äôs leveling framework.

Patreon reserves the right to modify or update compensation and benefits at any time.

title: Sales Development Representative (New Graduate)
description:
About Us

Perk (formerly TravelPerk) is the intelligent platform for travel and spend management. Built to tackle the time-consuming, manual work that gets in the way of real work, our tools automate everything from travel bookings to expenses, invoice processing, and more. By eliminating this shadow work that wastes hours, erodes morale, and saps innovation, we‚Äôre on a mission to power real work, with real impact.

We‚Äôre trusted by more than 10,000 companies worldwide, including Wise, On Running, Breitling, and Fabletics, and we‚Äôre tackling the 7 hours of lost productivity per employee each week, a $1.7 trillion problem http://www.perk.com/shadow-work-report.

Founded in 2015, Perk has grown into a global company of more than 1,800 people across 12 offices globally, with headquarters in London and Boston. We combine innovation, control, and simplicity to transform how businesses work and how people feel at work.

At Perk, we‚Äôre driven by our values, like being an owner, delivering a 7-star experience, and working as one team. We value curiosity, purpose, and mindset, not just knowledge, to unlock the power in your potential. Our talent team brings together leading minds from the travel and SaaS industries, representing over 70 countries. If you‚Äôre excited about having a real impact and shaping how millions of people experience work, we‚Äôd love you on the team.

Visit www.perk.com http://www.perk.com to learn more.


ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently looking for fresh graduates to join our Sales Development Representative (SDR) team in July 2026 to help us achieve our ambitious goals. In this role, your focus will be on feeding our sales funnel by qualifying and engaging prospective Perk customers.

This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate to join Perk, be part of a fresh but seasoned A-players Sales Team, and start a career with huge professional development opportunities. You‚Äôll learn from experienced teammates and leaders while working in a fun, collaborative culture. Help us scale by selling a disruptive product that is changing the way organizations budget, book, and manage their business travel.

If you‚Äôre energized by learning, motivated by goals, and excited to build a career in sales, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.


HOW YOU'LL SPEND YOUR TIME

 - Running outreach campaigns using a combination of phone, email, and social touches.

 - Qualifying leads over the phone (making sure they meet the requirements we look for in customers), engaging them, and scheduling next-step conversations on a Sales Executive‚Äôs calendar.

 - Learning how to understand the needs of our target prospects and articulating the value Perk provides.

 - Maintaining accurate information on prospects and interaction activities in Salesforce.

 - Building deep knowledge of Perk and our evolving product features.

 - Working closely with the Marketing team to support new ways to increase awareness of Perk and improve the lead qualification process.

 - Conducting high-level conversations with Office Managers, CFOs, and Travel Managers to explain the Perk value proposition.


WE GET EXCITED ABOUT YOU IF YOU HAVE

 - A strong interest in starting a career in sales, business development, or go-to-market roles.

 - Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).

 - Confidence speaking with new people and willingness to build credibility over the phone.

 - Strong organization skills and attention to detail.

 - Resilience, perseverance, and a goal-oriented mindset.

 - Hunger and ambition, while staying ethical and thoughtful in how you work.

 - A proactive mindset and curiosity to learn quickly.

 - The ability to work independently while also being a strong team player.

 - A customer-centric approach and genuine curiosity about understanding people‚Äôs needs.


THIS ROLE COULD BE A GREAT FIT IF YOU

 - Are a recent graduate (or graduating soon)

 - Have experience in campus leadership, internships, part-time jobs, athletics, hospitality, retail, fundraising, or other roles where you‚Äôve had to communicate, stay organized, and work toward goals

 - Enjoy fast-paced environments and are motivated by growth and development

 - Want structured coaching, feedback, and a clear path to grow your sales career


BONUS POINTS FOR‚Ä¶

 - Internship, campus org, or work experience in sales, customer-facing, or business development environments

 - Experience using tools like Salesforce, Outreach, SalesNav, or LeadIQ (not required)

 - Interest in the travel industry

 - Curiosity for tech and AI‚Äîespecially how it can be used creatively to improve workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and drive efficiency in day-to-day sales work


WHAT DO WE OFFER?

 - Competitive compensation, including equity in Perk

 - Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge

 - Comprehensive benefit plans covering medical, dental, vision, life, and disability with coverage from your start date

 - Financial benefits like 401k or Roth with company matching, and HSA or FSA plan

 - Subscription to Wellhub, the gym benefit

 - Family services that include adoption benefits and paid parental leave from 12 to 16 weeks

 - Global presence and hybrid working style

 - Unforgettable Perk events, including travel to one of our hubs

 - Learning and professional development opportunities

 - Spring Health ‚Äî a mental health support tool with access to therapists year round

 - Exponential growth opportunities

 - 16 paid hours per year to volunteer for a cause of your choice

 - ‚ÄúWork from anywhere‚Äù allowance of 20 working days per year

 - Annual travel stipend


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

Compensation for this role is a combination of salary, commissions, and stock options. The base salary is $55,000, and the total on-target earnings (base + commission) are $80,000. The commission structure is tied to the achievement of revenue and retention targets.

How We Work

At Perk, we take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in-person 3 days a week. As such, this role requires you to be based within commuting distance of our hubs. We fundamentally believe in the value of meeting in real life to improve connectivity, productivity, creativity and ultimately making us a great place to work.

For certain roles, we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply. Do not forget to submit an updated portfolio and/or resume.

Perk is a global company with a diverse customer base, and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer, which means you‚Äôre welcome at Perk regardless of how you look, where you‚Äôre from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

Protect Yourself from Recruitment Scams

All official communication from Perk will always come from email addresses ending in @perk.com http://perk.com or @externalperk.com http://externalperk.com, our verified social media channels, or recruiters listed on our official LinkedIn page. We will never ask you to pay for equipment, training, or fees, request sensitive personal information such as bank details early in the process, or communicate through unofficial apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, or Signal. If you receive a message claiming to be from Perk that seems suspicious, please do not respond. Forward it to security [at] perk .com, and we will confirm whether it is legitimate.

title: UK Internship Program
description:
Perplexity is excited to announce the Internship Program for exceptional Master‚Äôs or PhD students studying Computer Science or Engineering in the UK, enrolled in the 2025-2026 academic year. This is an intensive program in which you will work directly with our AI Inference team. This program offers a unique opportunity to gain valuable experience in a rapidly growing AI startup. Outstanding performers might be offered a full time position at the end of the program.

Our AI Inference team is responsible for running the models behind the Perplexity products. The team maintains the inference engine and deployments behind models ranging from single-node embeddings to distributed sparse Mixture-of-Experts models, maintaining large GPU clusters. With a keen focus on latency and throughput, the Inference team is responsible for the entire serving stack, from GPU kernels to networking and monitoring infrastructure.¬†

Responsibilities

 - Work with the inference team to improve serving latency and throughput

 - Bring up support for new models and state-of-the art inference optimizations or quantization schemes

 - Optimize inference across the entire stack, from GPU kernels to serving endpoints

Qualifications

 - Strong¬†engineering track record with proven knowledge of fundamentals and programming languages (multi-threaded programming, networking, compilation, systems programming, etc)

 - Pursuing a Master's or PhD in Computer Science with a focus on¬†performance-related subjects (HPC, Compilers, Distributed Systems)

 - Experience with ML frameworks (Torch, JAX)¬†

 - Experience with GPU programming (CUDA, Triton)

 - Experience with High-Performance Computing (OpenMPI)

Schedule

 - Internship program: 13 weeks, full-time or part-time, in-person in London office (hybrid schedule: 3 days from the office, 2 days WFH)

Interview Process

 - Fill out the application on Perplexity website

 - If selected, People Ops and technical interviews will be involved.

 - Offer. We‚Äôre impressed! We‚Äôd love to welcome you to our Internship program!

 - Start. We have a desk waiting for you in our London office!¬†

FAQ

Do you sponsor visas? Can I apply if I need a visa to work in the UK?

‚Üí Unfortunately we are unable to sponsor visas

What if I‚Äôm on a student visa?

‚Üí You need to seek approval from your University (to determine if you are eligible to work full time or part time only)¬†

How many internship spots are there?

 - We have spots for 2-3 interns in our 2025 class.

Is housing provided?

 - Unfortunately we cannot provide housing.¬†

Is health insurance provided?

 - Unfortunately we cannot provide health insurance for interns. Full time employees receive full health insurance and benefits.

How many full time offers are available at the end of the residency?

 - There is no limit. All outstanding performers will be given a full time offer!

At Perplexity, we've experienced tremendous growth and adoption since publicly launching the world's first fully functional conversational answer engine in 2022. We've grown from answering 2.5 million questions per day at the start of 2024 to around 20 million daily queries in December 2024. We also offer Perplexity Enterprise Pro, which counts leading companies like Nvidia, the Cleveland Cavaliers, Bridgewater, and Zoom as customers.

To support our rapid expansion, we've raised significant funding from some of the most respected technology investors. Our investor base includes IVP, NEA, Jeff Bezos, NVIDIA, Databricks, Bessemer Venture Partners, Elad Gil, Nat Friedman, Daniel Gross, Naval Ravikant, Tobi Lutke, and many other visionary individuals. In 2024, our employee base grew nearly 300%, and we're just getting started.

Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above.

title: Internship - Search Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Perplexity is looking for a Search Machine Learning Engineer Intern to help build the next generation of advanced search technologies, with a focus on retrieval and ranking. You will work closely with experienced engineers to improve search quality, experiment with new models, and ship features that directly impact how users search and discover information.

Internship program: 12 - 24 weeks, full-time, in-person in the Belgrade office.

Responsibilities:

 - Contribute to experiments that improve search quality through better models, data usage, and evaluation tools, under the guidance of senior engineers.

 - Design and implement components of the search platform and model stack, including retrieval, ranking, and classification models.

 - Train evaluating models (including LLM-based approaches) for retrieval, ranking, and classification tasks.

 - Support deployment and monitoring of search and ranking models in a scalable and performant way.

 - Help build and iterate on RAG pipelines for grounding and answer generation.

 - Collaborate with Data, AI, Infrastructure and Product teams to deliver improvements quickly and learn best practices in production ML.

Qualifications:

 - Strong foundation in machine learning and statistics, with coursework or projects related to information retrieval, ranking, or recommender systems.

 - Experience with Python and common ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX) through academic, open source, or personal projects.

 - Familiarity with evaluating model quality using offline metrics and/or A/B testing is a plus, but not required.

 - Previous experience (internships, research, or significant projects) working on search, recommendation, or NLP is a plus, but not required.

 - Self-driven and curious, with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn, and comfort working in a fast-paced environment

 - Experience with Rust will be a plus

title: Internship - Machine Learning Research Engineer
description:
Internship Program Berlin

Internship program: 12 - 24 weeks, full-time, in-person in the Berlin office.

Responsibilities

 - Relentlessly push search quality forward ‚Äî through models, data, tools, or any other leverage available.

 - Train, and optimize large-scale deep learning models using frameworks like PyTorch, leveraging distributed training (e.g., PyTorch Distributed, DeepSpeed, FSDP) and hardware acceleration, with a focus on retrieval and ranking models.

 - Conduct research in representation learning, including contrastive learning, multilingual, evaluation, and multimodal modeling for search and retrieval.

 - Build and optimize RAG pipelines for grounding and answer generation.

Qualifications

 - Understanding of search and retrieval systems, including quality evaluation principles and metrics.

 - Strong proficiency with PyTorch, including experience in distributed training techniques and performance optimization for large models.

 - Interested in representation learning, including contrastive learning, dense & sparse vector representations, representation fusion, cross-lingual representation alignment, training data optimization and robust evaluation.

 - Publication record in AI/ML conferences or workshops (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP, SIGIR).

title: Internship - Search Backend Infra Engineer
description:
Perplexity is looking for a Backend/Infrastructure Engineer Intern to support our small, high-impact team building the systems that power our search experience. You will work closely with experienced engineers to help design, build, and operate robust infrastructure and backend services that keep Perplexity fast, reliable, and scalable.

Internship program: 12 - 24 weeks, full-time, in-person in the Belgrade office.

Responsibilities:

 - Build and maintain infrastructure that supports high-performance search systems, with mentorship from senior engineers.

 - Design internal tools and automation to improve developer workflows and operational efficiency.

 - Support the design, deployment, and monitoring of cloud-native systems on AWS.

 - Contribute to improving CI/CD pipelines, testing infrastructure, and release processes.

 - Debug and optimize Linux-based services, containers, and backend systems.

 - Contribute to product codebases, primarily using Rust, Go or C++.

Qualifications:

 - Working towards a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

 - Familiarity with at least one programming language such as Go, Rust, or C/C++, through coursework or projects.

 - Basic understanding or exposure to cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS) and Linux systems is a plus, not a requirement.

 - Interest in infrastructure, distributed systems, or backend engineering, with willingness to learn about CI/CD, monitoring, and performance.

 - A proactive and curious learner who enjoys collaborating in a fast-paced, innovative environment

title: Global Talent Acquisition Intern (Summer 2026)
description:
About Plaud Inc.
Plaud is building the world's most trusted AI work companion for professionals to elevate productivity and performance through note-taking solutions, loved by over 1,000,000 users worldwide since 2023. With a mission to amplify human intelligence, Plaud is building the next-generation intelligence infrastructure and interfaces to capture, extract, and utilize what you say, hear, see, and think.




Plaud Inc. is a Delaware-incorporated, San Francisco-based company pushing the boundary of human‚ÄìAI intelligence through a hardware‚Äìsoftware combination. With SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR, ISO27001, ISO27701, and EN18031 compliance, Plaud is committed to the highest standards of data security and privacy protection.




To learn more about Plaud, please visit http://www.plaud.ai/https://www.plaud.ai and follow along on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/plaud_official/, https://twitter.com/PLAUDAI%22HYPERLINK%20%22https:/twitter.com/PLAUDAI%22%20%5C%22HYPERLINK%20%22https:/twitter.com/PLAUDAI%22%20%5CX https://twitter.com/PLAUDAI, Facebook https://www.facebook.com/plaudai, LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/plaudai/?viewAsMember=true, and YouTube https://www.youtube.com/@PLAUDAI.

Why You Should Join Us

Plaud is building the next generation intelligence infrastructure and interfaces to capture, extract, and utilize intelligence from what people say, hear, see, and think.

 - Plaud is a bootstrapped, skyrocketing, profitable company with a $250M revenue run rate achieved in just three years.

 - Define the next-gen paradigm for human-AI interaction.

 - Gain exposure to cutting-edge AI for Pro tools and play a direct role in our global expansion.

 - Work with passionate teammates who value innovation, collaboration, and customer success.

 - Grow your career in a culture that champions continuous learning and fast career development.

 - Market-competitive compensation, global exposure, and a vibrant, creativity-fueled work atmosphere.

 - 


ABOUT THE ROLE

Plaud is looking for a Talent Acquisition Intern to support junior-role hiring, candidate pipeline building, and recruitment operations. You‚Äôll learn end-to-end recruiting in a fast-paced tech environment while working closely with the TA team to deliver high-quality execution.




High-performing interns may be considered for full-time conversion based on business needs and individual performance.


WHAT YOU WILL DO

 - Build and maintain candidate pipelines for junior-level roles through proactive sourcing.

 - Manage interview scheduling, candidate communication, and ATS updates with high accuracy.

 - Coordinate assessments, hiring logistics, and prepare weekly pipeline status updates.

 - Support sourcing experiments and market mapping to broaden talent outreach.

 - Assist in employer branding and recruitment operations initiatives when needed.





WHAT WE LOOK FOR

 - Strong learning agility and adaptability ‚Äî able to pick up tools and processes quickly.

 - High attention to detail and reliability in managing coordination and data accuracy.

 - Clear, professional communication skills with candidates and hiring managers.

 - Curiosity and initiative to test new sourcing approaches and improve workflow efficiency.

 - Ability to commit full-time or at least 3 days/week for a minimum of 3 months (Jan‚ÄìMay/June).Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy, with a proactive problem-solving mindset.

 - Market-competitive compensation, global exposure, and a vibrant, creativity-fueled work atmosphere.

What you will do

Plaud is looking for a Talent Acquisition Intern to support junior-role hiring, candidate pipeline building, and recruitment operations. They will learn end-to-end recruiting in a fast-paced tech environment while working closely with the TA team to deliver high-quality execution.

High-performing interns may be considered for full-time conversion based on business needs and individual performance.

Build and maintain candidate pipelines for junior-level roles through proactive sourcing.Manage interview scheduling, candidate communication, and ATS updates with high accuracy.Coordinate assessments, hiring logistics, and prepare weekly pipeline status updates. Support sourcing experiments and market mapping to broaden talent outreach.Assist in employer branding and recruitment operations initiatives when needed.




Skills, qualifications and experience we look for

Strong learning agility and adaptability ‚Äî able to pick up tools and processes quickly.

High attention to detail and reliability in managing coordination and data accuracy.

Clear, professional communication skills with candidates and hiring managers.

Curiosity and initiative to test new sourcing approaches and improve workflow efficiency.

Ability to commit full-time or at least 3 days/week for a minimum of 3 months (Jan‚ÄìMay/June).

What we offer

 - High-Impact Environment Work in a fast-moving, product-driven environment where your ideas directly shape the future of AI productivity.

 - Cutting-Edge AI Tools for Productivity Access to best-in-class AI tools, including Cursor, GPT models, Gemini, Claude, and other frontier AI systems to maximize engineering and execution efficiency.

 - Best-in-Class Equipment Choice of top-spec laptops, high-performance workstation setups, and cutting-edge Plaud devices for all new hires.

 - Team & Culture Annual company offsites, team events, and a culture that values craftsmanship, ownership, and velocity.

title: (Junior) Product Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Are you passionate about software AND renewable energy?

Do you thrive in fast-paced, hard-working and purpose-driven environments? If you're ready to use your skills to help leveraging our product to the next level and keep processes smooth, then look no further - we want YOU!


üí° Please note that for this role a high proficiency (C2) in German OR French OR Italian OR Spanish OR Portuguese is required.

About Reonic
At Reonic, we‚Äôre on a mission to simplify renewable technology with our B2B SaaS solutions for solar, storage, and heat pumps. Backed by top-tier investors and trusted by 1,600+ business customers, we‚Äôre looking for a Product Manager with a focus on QA and Testing to work closely with our engineering team.


What You Will Do

 - üß™ Lead QA and Testing Efforts: Test new features, provide detailed feedback, and ensure quality before release. Focus on spotting issues early and maintaining smooth software functionality.

 - ü§ù Collaborate Closely with the Team: Work hand-in-hand with the tech, design, product teams to switch tasks efficiently and prioritize what matters most.

 - üß© Support Product Maintenance and Development: Contribute to dashboard concepts, ongoing software improvements, and contract-related features‚Äîhelp shape our product for the long-term.

 - üí° Be the Voice of the User: Spot usability gaps and suggest improvements ‚Äî you don‚Äôt have to be a UX designer, just a strong advocate for great experiences.

 - üì£ Communication Hub: Collect feedback, triage bug reports, and create clear tickets for the engineering team. Strong communication is key.

What Makes You a Great Fit

 - üå± Passion for Renewables: Genuine interest in renewable energy and willingness to dig into technical details.

 - üåç Excellent Communicator: C2 proficiency in at least one of the required languages (German, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese) plus strong English (C1+). You‚Äôre confident talking to multiple stakeholders.

 - üí° Product Mindset: You think beyond checklists‚Äîunderstand the customer‚Äôs perspective and anticipate issues before they arise.

 - üåø Culture Fit: Excited about clean energy, unafraid to speak up to solve problems and working in a collaborative team that values learning and ownership.

 - üè¢ Bonus: Experience in B2B SaaS, QA/Testing, or a traditional product management role. Familiarity with design principles and/or UX/UI concepts is a plus.


Why Join Us?

 - üöÄ A pivotal role in a fast-growing VC-backed startup building a product already loved by 1600+ paying B2B customers

 - üî• Be part of a fast-growing company that‚Äôs making a tangible impact in the renewable energy sector

 - üåç Nothing is set in stone - You get to shape your workplace

 - ‚ú® Perks include gym membership subsidy, coffee, regular team events, MacBook & more

 - üí∞ Receive competitive pay


Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply! Imposter syndrome shouldn't hold you back‚Äî we value talent and passion above all.


Location
Full-time, in-office role in Augsburg, Germany, with 2‚Äì4 weeks onboarding in Berlin.


Ready to shape the future of renewable energy? Apply now!

description:

title: (Junior) Customer Success Expert DACH (m/f/d)
description:
Why roadsurfer?

 - TEAM SPIRIT & TEAM EVENTS: Look forward to a collegial atmosphere with flat hierarchies, lots of fun and great team spirit, as well as regular team events such as joint sports sessions, pizza & beer evenings, etc.

 - PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT: We support your personal and professional development through an individual Growth Plan and our Inhouse Academy

 - CAMPER BUDGET: You get an annual camper budget to experience the #happyroadsurfing lifestyle for yourself

 - JOB BIKE: Stay fit with our job bike offer

 - DISCOUNTS: Use our Corporate Benefits Platform, the Travel Industry Card and Family & Friends Discounts

 - OFFICE DOGS: Dogs in the office are welcome

The Role ‚Äì Your Passion

 - We will develop you into a CAMPER expert, enabling you to independently support our customers. You will be the first point of contact and available to answer questions regarding our ‚Äúrent‚Äù and ‚Äúabo‚Äù products.

 - First-level support: You provide our customers with solutions in challenging travel situations and ensure end-to-end case resolution. Your focus will be on roadside assistance. You will be supported by modern AI tools to help you assist customers in an even more targeted way.

 - During the high season, the phone is your number one communication channel (of course browser-based and modern).

 - Handling booking adjustments: Your responsibilities include coordinating existing bookings and subscriptions, whether updates, rebookings, or cancellations.

 - When needed, you also support the handling of customer claims.

 - You work closely with other teams, including product development and our international stations, to maximize service quality.

What You Need To Surf The Wave With Us

 - You enjoy customer service and are motivated to creatively solve even challenging situations.

 - You are a strong communicator in German and English (additional languages are a plus).

 - You handle complaints confidently and keep a cool head in difficult situations.

 - A positive mindset defines your approach and is clearly felt by our customers over the phone.

 - A genuine passion for camping, travel, and road trips completes your profile.

Your Contract

START DATE: We are looking for your support starting in May 2026!

WORKING HOURS: 5 days per week / 40 hours (part-time possible by arrangement)

We are available for our customers Monday to Sunday from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Your free time is just as important to us as it is to you! That‚Äôs why we place great value on early shift planning, try to accommodate individual preferences as much as possible, and of course you‚Äôll regularly have the option to work from home.

Ready to surf?

You‚Äôre perfect for the job? Then we look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions, feel free to contact us anytime at team@roadsurfer.com, and we‚Äôll get back to you as quickly as possible.

ABOUT #ROADSURFER

We are more than Europe's largest campervan rental company. In 2021 we launched our platform roadsurfer spots in addition to our other products rent, abo and sales ‚Äì a platform where you can discover and book unique camping spots. But that‚Äôs only the beginning. We are growing fast, so hop on board and join us on our journey. The roadsurfer philosophy is simple: rent an RV, start your adventure, be happy. Come ride the wave with us!

title: Junior User Acquisition Manager
description:
ABOUT US

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/


ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a Junior User Acquisition Manager to join our growing performance marketing team and drive subscriptions through web funnels within a single product. This role is primarily focused on Snapchat and TikTok, with an emphasis on creative testing, audience experimentation, and performance optimization within these fast-moving paid social ecosystems. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with at least one of these platforms and is eager to deepen their expertise in short-form, creative-led user acquisition.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Campaign Management (Snapchat & TikTok)

 - Manage and optimize paid acquisition campaigns primarily on Snapchat Ads and TikTok Ads

 - Monitor performance daily and make data-driven optimizations across targeting, creatives, and bidding

 - Support budget pacing and allocation to maximize ROAS and conversion efficiency

 - Continuously test new campaign setups, objectives, and formats specific to each platform

Creative Testing & Collaboration

 - Work closely with the creative team to brief, review, and iterate on short-form video ads

 - Actively participate in brainstorming sessions for TikTok - and Snapchat - native creatives

 - Test multiple creative angles, hooks, messaging, and formats to identify winning concepts

 - Analyze creative performance and provide structured feedback to guide future production

 - Conduct competitor and trend analysis to stay ahead of creative best practices on both platforms

Data Analysis & Insights

 - Analyze campaign performance using platform dashboards and internal reports

 - Track key metrics such as CPA, CTR, CVR, retention, and subscription performance

 - Collaborate with the data team to extract actionable insights and optimize decision-making

 - Use learnings from tests to inform scaling and iteration strategies

Campaign Structure & Optimization

 - Build and refine efficient campaign structures tailored to TikTok and Snapchat

 - Run A/B tests across creatives, audiences, and formats to improve performance

 - Identify scaling opportunities based on performance data and creative learnings

Market & Platform Research

 - Stay up to date on Snapchat and TikTok ad products, algorithm changes, and trends

 - Monitor competitor activity, emerging ad formats, and industry benchmarks

 - Proactively surface new testing ideas and platform opportunities

Cross-functional Collaboration

 - Partner with creative producers to ensure ads align with performance goals

 - Work with data, product, and marketing teams to support cohesive acquisition efforts


QUALIFICATIONS

 - 1+ year of experience in User Acquisition, Performance Marketing, or Digital Marketing

 - Hands-on experience with Snapchat Ads and/or TikTok Ads

 - Exposure to creative testing and campaign optimization

 - Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret performance data

 - Proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets

 - Understanding of core performance marketing metrics and KPIs

 - Familiarity with analytics or attribution tools is a plus


LOCATION

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ¬± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.


BENEFITS

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:

 - Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance.

 - Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days.

 - Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge.

 - Company-provided MacBook: Experience seamless productivity with top-notch Apple MacBooks provided to all employees who need them.

 - Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tzxGX4Uu7Ts_HCLFXESKLnKaaBfVCPf1f9AYZPrkjJM/preview?tab=t.0

Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!


INTERVIEW PROCESS

After submitting your application, we conduct a thorough review which typically takes 3 to 5 days, but may occasionally take longer due to the volume of applications received. If we see a potential fit, we proceed with the following steps:

 - Recruiter Screening (40 minutes)

 - Technical Interview (60 minutes)

 - Final Interview (45 minutes)


LIFE AT RUBY LABS

At Ruby Labs, we move fast, aim high, and expect the same from our team. We‚Äôre not here to play small‚Äîwe‚Äôre here to build, grow, and win. That means we look for people who are ambitious, driven, and ready to give their best every single day.

This is a place for individuals who thrive under pressure, embrace challenges, and see opportunity in every obstacle. If you‚Äôre hungry to achieve, motivated by impact, and want to grow at the speed of your own ambition, Ruby Labs offers the platform to make it happen.

Here, effort is matched with reward. We recognize those who go all in and deliver results, and we create space for people who want more‚Äîmore responsibility, more growth, and more success.

#LI-Remote

title: Junior User Acquisition Manager (Native Advertising Focus)
description:
ABOUT US

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/


ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a Junior User Acquisition Manager to join our growing performance marketing team and drive subscriptions through web funnels within a single product. This role is primarily focused on Native Advertising channels, including Taboola, Outbrain, NewsBreak, and similar discovery platforms.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Campaign Management (Native Traffic)

 - Manage and optimize campaigns on Taboola, Outbrain, NewsBreak

 - Monitor performance and optimize bids, targeting, and placements

 - Support budget pacing to maximize CPA efficiency and ROAS

Creative Testing & Collaboration

 - Brief and review native creatives (headlines, images, advertorials)

 - Test messaging and creative angles

 - Analyze creative performance and trends

description:

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/


ABOUT THE ROLE

WinTech seeks a Junior Facebook User Acquisition Manager to support our team by handling manual campaign operations across multiple ad sources. This role is designed to free up senior UAM from 20-40% of manual workload, allowing manager to focus on strategic initiatives, data analysis, insights generation, and growth optimization.

This position offers a clear growth trajectory: starting with 3-6 months of hands-on manual work to build foundational experience and education, then progressing to independent management of specific ad sources. We expect campaign activity volume to increase significantly once manual operations are streamlined through this role.

Important: This is a demanding role in a fast-paced environment. Only candidates ready to work hard and handle a substantial manual workload will succeed. If you're not prepared for intensive, detail-oriented work, this position won't be suitable for you.

title: PhD Autonomy Engineer Intern - Planning & Controls (Reinforcement Learning)
description:
Skydio is the leading US drone company and the world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial mobility. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, operational excellence, and customer obsession to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users, from utility inspectors to first responders, soldiers in battlefield scenarios and beyond.

About the role:

Skydio builds the world‚Äôs most advanced autonomous drones used across inspection, public safety, defense, cinematography, and more. Your research won‚Äôt languish in a paper‚Äîit will fly, shaping how pilots and operators complete real missions in complex environments.¬† Develop and deploy reinforcement learning (and adjacent policy-learning methods) that make Skydio aircraft plan, navigate, and control themselves more intelligently‚Äîsafely, reliably, and efficiently‚Äîacross our ecosystem: handheld apps, ground control, cloud autonomy services, and fleet workflows.


HOW YOU'LL MAKE AN IMPACT:

 - Navigation & avoidance in the wild: Train policies that adapt online to cluttered 3D scenes (forests, bridges, urban canyons), complementing our geometric stack for robust obstacle avoidance and dynamic goal-seeking.

 - RL-augmented planning: Fuse learned cost shaping / value functions with trajectory optimization for smooth, agile flight with tight safety envelopes and mission constraints.

 - Sim ‚Üí Real at scale: Build scalable datasets and training loops with Isaac Lab, domain randomization, residual learning, and safety filters; validate on real drones weekly.

 - Human-in-the-loop shared control: Learn assistive policies that blend pilot intent, autonomy priors, and uncertainty-aware behaviors for intuitive control handoffs.

 - Fleet & multi-agent: Explore decentralized coordination for coverage, pursuit, and collaborative mapping with minimal comms.


WHAT MAKES THIS INTERNSHIP DIFFERENT:

 - Real hardware cadence: Prototype in sim, then flight test on production-ready aircraft and edge compute. Your work is meant to make a difference in the real world, not just in simulation.

 - Safety-first learning: We pair RL with formal constraints, estimation of uncertainty, and conservative action filters for dependable deployment in human environments.

 - Cross-disciplinary mentorship: Collaborate with perception, mapping, controls, and product teams to close the loop from research to field ops.


WHAT MAKES YOU A STRONG FIT:

 - PhD student in Robotics, Machine Learning, Controls, or related field.

 - Strong fundamentals in RL, control theory, and motion planning; comfort with safety/robustness concepts.

 - Proficient in Python (PyTorch/JAX/Ray RLlib) and at least one of C++ or CUDA.

 - Hands-on experience with robotics simulation (Isaac Lab/MuJoCo/PyBullet) and sim2real techniques.

 - Experience training/deploying policies for navigation, manipulation, or locomotion on real robots or autonomous vehicles.

Nice-to-Haves:

 - Publications (CoRL, ICRA, IROS, RSS, NeurIPS).

 - Experience with onboard inference optimization (TensorRT, quantization, sparsity).

 - Familiarity with modern policy learning beyond vanilla RL: diffusion policies, IL/BC, offline RL, model-based RL.

 - Experience with multi-agent RL or distributed training.

Compensation: The hourly rate for this position is ~‚Ç¨50 for PhD students*. Compensation will vary based on factors, including skill level, proficiencies, transferable knowledge, and experience.

#LI-PG1

title: Autonomy Engineer Intern - Computer Vision/Deep Learning Summer 2026
description:
Skydio is the leading US drone company and the world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial mobility. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, operational excellence, and customer obsession to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users, from utility inspectors to first responders, soldiers in battlefield scenarios and beyond.

About the role:

The core of our system is the computer vision algorithms that allow drones to understand the world around them. You will architect and implement the algorithms that run on every drone powered by Skydio as part of a world class computer vision and deep learning team with researchers who have pushed the state of the art in academia and industry.

We are looking for interns for our Summer program.¬† As a Research Intern, you will be paired up with one or more members of our core software development team, assuming direct ownership of a project that meaningfully advances the capabilities of our team and products.


If you have a strong foundation in math, theory, and software development and you are interested in directly contributing to the development of the next generation of autonomy algorithms and pushing them into real products, we would love to hear from you.

How you'll make an impact:

 - Enable rapid research and development of intelligent systems with advanced autonomous capabilities beyond anything that exists in the world today

 - Research, prototype, and generally assess the feasibility of new approaches

 - Imagine and then implement new features that unlock magic for our users

 - Characterize and quantify the performance of core components of the software and hardware stack

What makes you a strong fit:

 - High proficiency in C++ and/or Python and PyTorch

 - Demonstrated enthusiasm for one or more of the following: computer vision, deep learning, motion planning, dynamics and controls, 3D graphics, distributed systems, and tools/infrastructure

 - Solid software engineering foundation and a commitment to writing clean, well-architected code

 - Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, small team environment

Compensation Range: The annual base salary range for this position is $47/hr for Undergrad and $53/hr for Graduate students* Compensation will vary based on factors, including skill level, proficiencies, transferable knowledge, and experience. *For some positions the pay may be dependent upon the individual's regional location.

title: Electrical Engineer Intern Summer 2026
description:
Skydio is the leading US drone company and the world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial mobility. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, operational excellence, and customer obsession to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users, from utility inspectors to first responders, soldiers in battlefield scenarios and beyond.

We are seeking interns for our EE Team! We are looking for Electrical Engineering Interns who will help prototype, validate, develop, and refine the electrical systems that bring together state-of-the-art computing hardware, sensing, and power systems in the latest autonomous flying sensors. As a member of the Electrical Engineering team, you will be helping solve tough challenges alongside a team of world-class engineers.¬†

 - Take ownership of low-voltage electronic hardware development, including specification, schematic design, PCB layout, prototyping, and fabrication

 - Perform hands-on bring-up, assembly, and debugging of custom circuit boards for testing and validation

 - Collaborate cross-functionally with mechanical, firmware, reliability, software, and electrical teams to build reliable test and validation systems for new products

 - Develop and test PCBAs for subsystems such as power distribution, battery management, sensing, motor control, and computing

 - Participate in schematic, layout, and BOM reviews, providing feedback on internally and externally developed designs
