title: Junior Sales - Copenhagen
description:
ABOUT US

Tebi is creating the first Connected Restaurant Management System that makes hospitality flow. In one seamless platform, Tebi embeds sales, reservations, kitchen prep, payments, and all the data that powers it, creating smooth service and intuitive insights.


Founded by Arnout Schuijff, co-founder of Adyen, and backed by ‚Ç¨50 million in funding from Index Ventures & CapitalG, Tebi is built in service of hospitality first. Thousands of restaurants, caf√©s, bars, and coffee shops across the Netherlands, UK, and more countries soon, love running on Tebi.


ABOUT THE ROLE

We're looking for a hospitality professional to join us as Junior Sales Associate. You‚Äôll be at the heart of our growth engine - managing the end-to-end sales cycle, directly driving our business and revenue growth by bringing in new customers. But this isn‚Äôt just about closing deals. You‚Äôll also help us sell smarter by refining our tools, streamlining processes, and using data to shape how we scale.

In this role, you‚Äôll blend deep sales expertise with product knowledge to solve complex business problems for our customers. You will act as the commercial champion for the customer, working collaboratively with internal departments to ensure we are not just winning business, but building long-term value and market share. We‚Äôre seeking someone who thrives on exceeding ambitious targets and building robust, repeatable sales success.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Support the full sales cycle: Own opportunities end-to-end, from qualified lead to activation, with a focus on efficiency and impact.
   
   - Lead smart discovery: Conduct structured discovery calls to identify prospect's key organisational goals, pain points, current tech stack, and decision-making criteria.
   
   - Run engaging demos: Deliver standard and tailored product demos to qualified prospects, clearly articulating Tebi‚Äôs core product features and positioning the added business value (ROI)
   
   - Negotiate with confidence: Execute commercial negotiation steps, utilising approved pricing frameworks.

 - Keep data sharp: Uphold CRM integrity by recording all sales activities, updating deal stages and accurately entering relevant notes to ensure funnel hygiene and generate insights that guide better decisions.

 - Strengthen the funnel: Actively collaborate with the BDR team by providing feedback on quality and fit of leads quality and helping improve how we qualify and convert.

 - Set customers up for success: Execute the standardised post-sale transition process by preparing detailed customer summaries and key objective documents for the Customer Success team to ensure seamless customer onboarding.

Shape our strategy: Contribute to the overall business strategy by collaborating closely with Product, Marketing and Central Ops to present customer feature requests and market observations on competitor activities in a data driven manner.


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED

 - Hospitality experience is a big plus.

 - 1-3 years of experience in Sales, Account Management, or Customer Success, ideally in the SaaS/tech industry is a plus.

 - Bachelor's degree in business, finance, engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience) is a strong plus.

 - Willingness to roll up your sleeves and ‚ÄúLeave your ego at the door‚Äù mentality

 - Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced startup environment.

 - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with customers and internal stakeholders.

 - Entrepreneurial mindset: you thrive in fast-moving environments, love building from scratch, and bias toward action.

 - The ideal candidate will be fluent in English, Danish is a plus.

Benefits

 - Start-up Equity

 - Competitive Salary and Uncapped Commission

 - Team building events


OUR VALUES

Build Globally, Execute Locally - We are on a path to evolve an entire industry. We build products globally and we execute our world class operations locally.

Manifest the Win - Changing the world never comes easy. It takes grit. We are playing a team sport and we know winning is a conscious decision.

Launch fast and iterate - We believe speed and pragmatism wins the day. We operate with an extreme sense of urgency without compromising on quality.

Truth Seeking - We believe in first principles. We get to the heart of a problem and then develop solutions.

Dutch Directness - We operate with sophisticated Dutch directness. Open, respectful, and to the point. We create an environment where anyone can say what needs to be said.

Evolve - We are in a constant state of change and growth. As a business, as individuals. We embrace change.

Owners, not renters - We are all shareholders in Tebi and we act like it. We are drivers, not passengers.




WHAT IS RESTAURANT SOFTWARE?

Restaurants and other merchants use various software systems such as Point of Sale (POS), Reservations, Kitchen Display Systems (KDS), Payments, Inventory, Staffing, and the list goes on. These systems all need to speak to each other which they frequently don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a mess, and we are fixing it.

From buying a croissant at a cafe to having dinner with friends, it‚Äôs a ‚Ç¨4 Trillion+ global market and a critical part of everyday life in today's economy.

 - Set customers up for success: Carry the standardised post-sale transition process by preparing detailed customer summaries and key objective documents for the Customer Success team to ensure seamless customer onboarding.

 - Shape our strategy: Contribute to the overall business strategy by collaborating closely with Product, Marketing and Central Ops to present customer feature requests and market observations on competitor activities in a data driven manner.

What You‚Äôll Need

 - A minimum of 1-3 years of experience in Sales, Account Management, or Customer Success, ideally in the SaaS/tech industry.

 - Bachelor's degree in business, finance, engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience) is a strong plus.

 - Willingness to roll up your sleeves and ‚ÄúLeave your ego at the door‚Äù mentality

 - Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced startup environment.

 - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with customers and internal stakeholders.

 - Entrepreneurial mindset: you thrive in fast-moving environments, love building from scratch, and bias toward action.

 - Must be fluent in both English and German.

Benefits:

 - Start-up Equity

 - Competitive Salary

 - Lunch Provided in Office

 - Team building events

Our Values:

 - Build Globally, Execute Locally - We are on a path to evolve an entire industry. We build products globally and we execute our world class operations locally.

 - Manifest the Win - Changing the world never comes easy. It takes grit. We are playing a team sport and we know winning is a conscious decision.

 - Launch fast and iterate - We believe speed and pragmatism wins the day. We operate with an extreme sense of urgency without compromising on quality.

 - Truth Seeking - We believe in first principles. We get to the heart of a problem and then develop solutions.

 - Dutch Directness - We operate with sophisticated Dutch directness. Open, respectful, and to the point. We create an environment where anyone can say what needs to be said.

 - Evolve - We are in a constant state of change and growth. As a business, as individuals. We embrace change.

 - Owners, not renters - We are all shareholders in Tebi and we act like it. We are drivers, not passengers.

What is Restaurant Software?

Restaurants and other merchants use various software systems such as Point of Sale (POS), Reservations, Kitchen Display Systems (KDS), Payments, Inventory, Staffing, and the list goes on. These systems all need to speak to each other which they frequently don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a mess, and we are fixing it.

From buying a croissant at a cafe to having dinner with friends, it‚Äôs a ‚Ç¨4 Trillion+ global market and a critical part of everyday life in today's economy.

title: Junior Legal Executive
description:
ABOUT THE FLEX:

At The Flex, we‚Äôre reinventing the global rental experience. We believe renting a home should be as simple, fast, and borderless as buying on Amazon, and we‚Äôre building the infrastructure to make that possible.

Powered by our proprietary Property Management System (PMS), The Flex automates operations, streamlines bookings, and delivers frictionless experiences for both guests and landlords. We‚Äôre scaling rapidly and assembling a team of A-Players, ambitious, proactive, and committed to excellence. If you‚Äôre hungry to learn, comfortable with responsibility early, and want real exposure to commercial law (not just document review), you‚Äôll feel right at home here. This is not a passive paralegal role. You will sit at the centre of a fast-moving business dealing with real disputes, real negotiations, and real transactions from day one.





POSITION SUMMARY

As a Junior Legal Executive, you will operate as the internal legal engine of the business, managing day-to-day legal matters, coordinating external solicitors only where necessary, and helping the company move fast while staying protected. You‚Äôll gain hands-on exposure across litigation, property acquisitions, commercial contracts and regulatory compliance. This role suits someone driven, commercially minded and eager to build practical legal experience far faster than a traditional training route.

Areas of responsibility include:

Litigation & Disputes

‚Ä¢ Manage pre-action correspondence, evidence gathering and case preparation

‚Ä¢ Handle possession proceedings and debt recovery workflows

‚Ä¢ Draft formal responses to legal claims and solicitor correspondence

‚Ä¢ Prepare bundles and instructions for counsel and external solicitors

‚Ä¢ Track deadlines, hearings and procedural compliance

Conveyancing & Property

‚Ä¢ Support acquisitions and disposals across the property portfolio

‚Ä¢ Review title documents, searches and enquiries

‚Ä¢ Coordinate with lenders, agents and solicitors through to completion

‚Ä¢ Draft and negotiate lease agreements, deeds and side letters

Contracts & Commercial

‚Ä¢ Draft, review and negotiate employee, contractor and service agreements

‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve contract templates across the business

‚Ä¢ Support operational teams in structuring commercial arrangements

Compliance & Risk

‚Ä¢ Maintain legal registers, licences and regulatory requirements

‚Ä¢ Identify legal risks and propose practical solutions

‚Ä¢ Build internal processes to reduce recurring disputes

‚Ä¢ Liaise with external counsel only when specialist input is required


WHAT YOU WILL BRING

‚Ä¢ Law degree (LPC/SQE completed or in progress preferred)

‚Ä¢ Strong written communication and drafting ability

‚Ä¢ Highly organised with strong attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Commercial mindset, able to balance legal risk with business practicality

‚Ä¢ Comfortable managing multiple matters simultaneously

‚Ä¢ Resilient and calm when dealing with conflict or pressure

‚Ä¢ Proactive attitude, you take ownership rather than wait for instruction

We value hunger, intelligence and work ethic more than years of experience.

Experience in property, litigation, or contracts is helpful but not required.

Why Join The Flex?

 - Real Responsibility Early ‚Äì You won‚Äôt be stuck proofreading documents for years; you‚Äôll run matters yourself.

 - Accelerated Legal Career ‚Äì Gain exposure across disputes, transactions and commercial law simultaneously.

 - Business-Side Legal Experience ‚Äì Learn how companies actually make decisions, not just legal theory.

 - High-Growth Environment ‚Äì Work directly with founders and decision-makers.

 - Global Exposure ‚Äì Cross-border operations across multiple markets. Remote-First Culture ‚Äì We measure outcomes, not hours.


YOU SHOULD NOT APPLY IF :

 - You are looking for a corporate 9 to 5 job

 - You are not extremely ambitious

 - You do not aim to be one of the best in the world at what you do

title: Junior Helpdesk Engineer (Hybrid/Kyiv office)
description:
Who Are We?

We are Welltech ‚Äî a global company with Ukrainian roots and a powerful mission: to move everybody to start and stay well for life. Today 25.5 million users have trusted Welltech to help them build healthy habits ‚Äî a testament to the real value our innovative, engaging wellness solutions deliver every day. üåç

With five hubs across Cyprus, Ukraine, Poland, Spain and the UK and a diverse, remote-friendly team of 700+ professionals, we continue to scale rapidly. Our innovative apps ‚Äî Muscle Booster, Yoga-Go and WalkFit ‚Äî empower millions to transform their lifestyles and unlock their personal wellness journeys.

Welltech is where your impact becomes real. And our values clearly attest to that: we grow together, we drive results, we lead by example and we are well-makers.

If this looks like you and you thrive in a fast-paced environment, you‚Äôll fit right in at Welltech. Let‚Äôs build wellness for millions together.

What We're Looking For

We are looking for a proactive and communicative Junior Helpdesk Engineer to join our IT team. In this role, you will be the first friendly face and point of contact for employees seeking technical assistance. We are seeking an individual who is not only enthusiastic about solving technical puzzles but also possesses a keen, problem-solving mindset. You will be encouraged to identify areas for improvement within our systems and processes and feel empowered to propose changes. Your role is crucial in ensuring the smooth operation of our technology while providing excellent, interactive support to our entire team.

Key Responsibilities:

 - Provide timely and effective technical support to employees via our ticketing system, email, Slack, and walk-in requests.

 - Troubleshoot issues related to Google Workspace, Okta, MacOS, and Mobile Device Management (MDM).

 - Prepare and configure new employee devices, including hardware setup and software installation.

 - Set up and provide support for meeting room audiovisual equipment to ensure seamless presentations and conferences.

 - Develop and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including knowledge base articles for processes and policies, user manuals, and system configurations.

 - Deliver user training and guidance on Google Workspace and MacOS applications.

 - Identify and escalate complex issues to senior IT staff when necessary.

 - Collaborate with the IT team to identify and implement system improvements and upgrades.

Required Skills:

 - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a genuine desire to help your colleagues.

 - A logical approach to problem-solving and a strong sense of curiosity for troubleshooting technical issues.

 - Familiarity with MacOS and Google Workspace environments. We don‚Äôt expect you to be an expert, but you should be comfortable navigating them.

 - Some experience in an IT support or customer service role is highly desirable. We also welcome applications from candidates who can demonstrate equivalent skills through internships, personal projects, or relevant coursework.

 - The ability to work effectively both independently and as a collaborative member of a team.

Will be a Plus:

 - Experience with Jamf or similar MDM

 - Experience with Jira Service Management and Jira Assets

 - An interest in automation, demonstrated by some experience with scripting (e.g., Python, Bash).

Candidate journey: ‚≠ïÔ∏è Recruiter call ----> ‚≠ïÔ∏è Skills assessment-----> ‚≠ïÔ∏è Meet the hiring manager


‚ú® Why You‚Äôll Love Being Part of Welltech:

 - Grow Together: Join a culture that champions both personal and professional growth. Here, you‚Äôll thrive as we learn, evolve, and succeed together.

 - Lead by Example: No matter your role, your leadership matters. Every team member is empowered to inspire and make an impact.

 - Results-Driven: We‚Äôre all about achieving meaningful outcomes. It‚Äôs not just about the effort, but the difference we make every day.

 - We Are Well-Makers: Be part of a movement that‚Äôs creating a healthier, happier world. Together, we make well-being a reality!

Check out some of our products

Muscle Booster ‚Äî https://musclebooster.fitness/

Yoga-Go ‚Äî https://yoga-go.io/

WalkFit -http://walkfit.pro

title: Internship Program | 6037
description:
01. THE PROGRAM


The internship program has been designed specifically for students and is paid.


For a 6‚Äîto 9-month program, you will gain 360¬∞ knowledge of IT product modus operandi: from idea to $1 million in monthly revenue, from MVP operations set up to process automation, from simplified analytical models to 6 digits of raw data daily.

03. HOW IT WORKS


‚Üí THE SETUP


Make your choice for each of the three sections below:


‚Üí FUNCTION


We currently offer internships in the following areas:


Creative Marketing
: Developing and implementing performance creatives to engage audiences and promote products.
Product Marketing
: Executing growth strategies by identifying new niches for the product and conducting experiments (A/B testing) to increase key metrics.
Product Management
: Managing the product lifecycle from concept to launch, focusing on user needs and market demands.
Product & Data Analytics
: Analyzing data to make informed decisions about product development and process optimization.
Content Management & Copywriting
: Creating and managing content that engages and informs the target audience.
Business Analysis & Operations
: Conducting market research, evaluating business processes, and developing strategies to improve efficiency and achieve company goals.


‚Üí CAPACITY


We provide two employment modes for our interns:


Part-Time: 15+ hours/week
Full-Time: 40 hours/week


‚Üí LOCATION


We offer both on-site and remote options:


Office: Kyiv / Lviv
Remote: Within Ukraine


‚Üí APPLICATION


You can apply and onboard in just 7 days:


DAY 0
 ‚Äî Start with no IT expertise
DAY 1
 ‚Äî Send your CV and cover letter
DAY 5
 ‚Äî Prepare the test task
DAY 7
 ‚Äî Pass the interview
NEXT STEP
 ‚Äî Build your own success story!


Please send your CV and motivation letter to 
hiring@6037. tech
 with the subject line ‚ÄúInternship at 6037.‚Äù In your letter, include: 1 ‚ÄîThe function you are applying for; 2 ‚Äî Your capacity; 3 ‚Äî Your location.


ABOUT 6037
6037 is a venture partnership backing high-potential consumer products and scaling them into sustainable, globally competitive businesses. We accelerate startups through data, operational excellence, and performance-driven growth.
Our mission: to transform Ukraine from an outsourcing hub into a product-first economy. Our vision: to build a portfolio of products serving over 1 billion users worldwide.
WHAT IS A VENTURE PARTNERSHIP?
At 6037, the partnership opportunity is open to everyone. Those who deliver outstanding results grow into Principal and Partner roles, with respective profit-sharing and equity-allocation tracks.
6037 thousand km¬≤ is the territory of Ukraine ‚Äî and we are proud to build world-class products with team members coming from every region of the country.
OUR TEAM
We‚Äôre looking for resilient minds who want to get the most out of their professional careers working alongside people who live our values of optimism, ownership, and diligence.
OUR VALUES
We build products that shape global markets ‚Äî and we do it in partnership with those who share our three core values.
Optimism ‚Äî Seeing the goal beyond the challenges
We view a career as a marathon. We keep our pace, focus, and resilience ‚Äî because at the finish line stands the achievement of a great goal. Challenges are part of the journey; the destination is worth it.
Ownership ‚Äî Taking responsibility
We don‚Äôt wait for instructions. Everyone owns their domain and is fully accountable for outcomes. Our results are built on collective effort, and every personal miss affects the team.
Diligence ‚Äî Mastering every detail
Excellence is built on precision. We question, measure, and refine every decision until it‚Äôs right. Great outcomes don‚Äôt come from luck but from intent, depth, and relentless consistency.
Join the Major League. Build products that compete and win on the global stage.

Das Praktikum ist auf Lernen ausgelegt ‚Äì du bekommst strukturierte Trainings, enge Begleitung, regelm√§√üiges Feedback und Zugang zu internen & externen Lernressourcen.
Teamspirit

Einblicke in die Immobilien- & SaaS-Welt
Du lernst nicht nur Sales, sondern auch, wie digitale L√∂sungen die Bau- und Immobilienbranche transformieren.
Verg√ºtung & Benefits
Faire Verg√ºtung, flexible Arbeitszeiten, hybride Arbeitsweise und Zugang zu den gleichen Team-Benefits wie andere Kolleg:innen.


Was du mitbringst:


Du bist aktuell an einer Hochschule eingeschrieben und m√∂chtest erste Einblicke in ein modernes, digitales Unternehmen gewinnen.
Interesse an B2B Sales ‚Äì egal ob aus deinem Studium (z.B. BWL, Wirtschaft, Kommunikation) oder aus pers√∂nlicher Motivation.

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst 


¬∑       
¬£45,000
¬∑       
Fully Remote
¬∑       
12-month Fixed Term Contract 






The Company


At Amber Labs, we are a cutting-edge UK and European technology consultancy that empowers autonomy, promotes experimentation, and enables rapid learning to deliver exceptional value to our clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with our cross-functional consultants, engineers, and analysts working together to shorten delivery times, minimise risk, and drive impactful results for high-profile government and commercial programmes.


About the role


As a Business Analyst within a major public‚Äësector debt recovery transformation programme, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering services that positively impact millions of citizens. You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document requirements, ensuring that solutions align with Government Digital Service (GDS) standards and meet the needs of both the business and end users.


Key Responsibilities




Requirements Gathering &      Analysis:

Document workflows and propose       enhancements to improve efficiency and compliance.




Stakeholder Engagement:




Facilitate workshops and       meetings to ensure alignment between technical teams and business       objectives.


Communicate effectively with       both technical and non-technical audiences.




GDS Standards & Public      Sector Compliance:




Ensure all deliverables adhere       to GDS principles, accessibility standards, and government frameworks.


Support service assessments and       contribute to meeting compliance requirements.




Collaboration with Delivery      Teams:




Work alongside product owners,       architects, and developers to ensure requirements are understood and       implemented correctly.


Assist in backlog refinement       and prioritisation activities.




Continuous Improvement:




Identify and recommend       improvements to BA practices and tools.


Stay informed about emerging       trends in business analysis and public sector delivery.






Essential Skills & Experience




Proven experience as a Business      Analyst in large-scale programmes, ideally within the public sector.


Strong understanding of GDS      standards and service design principles.


Experience in requirements      elicitation, documentation, and stakeholder management.


Proficiency in process modelling      and analysis techniques.


Excellent communication and      facilitation skills.


Familiarity with Agile delivery      methodologies.




Desirable




Knowledge of data privacy      regulations (GDPR) and compliance frameworks.


Exposure to tools such as Jira,      Confluence, or similar
previous experience in government or large enterprise transformation programmes

title: Junior Software Test Automation Engineer
description:
About ARTIDIS 


Artidis¬Æ AG is a pioneering clinical stage health technology company that aims to set the gold standard in tissue analysis and therapy optimization. By combining its nanotechnology platform for rapid tissue analysis with a holistic data solution, Artidis¬Æ accelerates drug discovery, tissue engineering, and personalized treatment. Artidis¬Æ focuses its research and development efforts on solid tumors to enhance responses to chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and cell therapies, driving precision in cancer care.


Job Purpose 


As a Junior Test Automation Engineer, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring that the software which controls our medical device functions correctly and performs reliably according to the expectation of the medical professionals who will use the device. You will be tasked with the design, implantation and validation of automated tests and automation test frameworks to boost the efficiency of our testing and development process. You will also contribute in writing software requirements and establish test protocols to validate these requirements. You will be executing tests either on our complex medical device, on mock-ups and test benches, or within virtual simulation environments. You will play a crucial role in analyzing software anomalies and regression issues across the full software stack, from the low-level hardware driver to the graphical user interface. To do all of this, you will work closely with the software engineers, the hardware engineers, the product owners, the operations teams, the user experience designers, and our quality management team in a productive and motivating environment to bring this novel and unique product to the market for the benefit of patients around the world.


Duties and Responsibilities 


Evaluate, prototype and introduce new test automation technologies for hardware-in-the-loop testing and automated testing frameworks for our hardware specific control software. 
Design and implement script language based code for testing frameworks, data processing, the analysis of log files and descriptive statistics on large sets of raw data. 
Run manual software tests on our devices, carefully record the results and provide feedback to the software developers, and continuously increase the level of automation for our testing task. 
Maintain and service, and support the repair of, our test devices, test-benches and virtual simulation environments. 
 Create and review software test and validation protocols based on software requirements, software anomaly reports. 
 Support the establishment of test strategies and new software testing processes. 
Review software requirements and provide expertise from the software tester‚Äôs perspective. 
Collaborate with the device operations and development operations (DevOps) team to collect user feedback, problem reports and non-conformity reports and translate them into actionable items for the software engineering and DevOps team. 


Qualifications 


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering or equivalent technical certification. 
Strong skills in software and hardware troubleshooting, data analysis, and debugging. 
Skilled in designing and implementing scripts (in Python, JavaScript or similar) for control and automation tasks, and for the purpose of data analysis and visualization. 
Basic experience with Linux based operating systems. 
Ability to identify and analyze diverse technical issues in a complex hardware-software system in order to devise effective solutions to resolve them. 
Excellent English communication skills and ability to establish precise, comprehensive and unambiguous instructions and reports. ‚Ä¢ Experience with electro-mechanical or opto-mechanical systems, medical devices, camera systems, robots and/or embedded electronics is a strong plus. 
Experience of working in a strongly regulated industry (e.g. medical devices, pharmaceuticals, aerospace) is a strong plus. 
Experience with C++/Qt, AWS, CI/CD pipelines, deployment infrastructure, IOT device management, and/or development operations (DevOps) is a strong plus. 
Ability to work independently and dynamically to deliver accurate, complete and reliable results. 
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and to meet project deadlines. 


Working Conditions 


The environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. Our company is an excellent place for rapid advancement and offers a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. The position requires the employee to go the extra mile when needed. We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct communication. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks, the possibility to take responsibility, a highly driven team and work serving a significant purpose. The job position comes with a competitive salary and a bonus for outstanding performance. This position is primarily on-site, with the possibility of remote work/home office on a limited basis, depending on business needs and operational requirements. Flexibility may be considered in alignment with team collaboration and role responsibilities.

title: Intern Trainee - NY
description:
Position Name: Intern Trainee
Location/Type: New York, NY, Full-Time In Office
Department: Support
Pay: $23/hr.


Atlas Technica's mission is to shoulder IT management, user support, and cybersecurity for our clients, who are hedge funds and other investment firms. Founded in 2016, we have grown year over year through our uncompromising focus on service. 


We value ownership, execution, growth, intelligence, and camaraderie. We are looking for people who share our 
Core Values
, thrive, and contribute to this environment while putting the customer first. At Atlas Technica, we offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and great perks to our global Team. We strive to maintain a professional yet friendly environment while promoting professional and career development for our Team Members. Join Atlas Technica now! 


We are seeking an individual that is eager to learn and grow in the IT field for our internship trainee program. The primary purpose of our internship trainee program is to develop individuals who want a career in the IT/MSP space to the point where they have the technical knowledge and skills required to be effective system engineers. As an Atlas Technica Intern Trainee, you will be provided with training and hands-on experience in basic aspects of IT service delivery. You will work closely with experienced professionals and gain exposure to real-world IT challenges in the Alternative Investment industry.‚ÄØ Successful participants in this 90-day trainee program will graduate to become full-fledged Interns and be eligible to be evaluated again in 3-6 months for consideration to be promoted to a Junior Systems Engineer.  


The program is designed to give you a comprehensive understanding of IT service delivery and prepare you for a career in the industry.‚ÄØ Participants may be required to work on-site at client offices, including the potential for traveling interstate. The participant is also expected to work at an Atlas regional office. 




Criteria for successful completion of 90-day program:
 


Positive feedback from trainers, co-workers, and clients 
Demonstrate ability to learn new technologies and concepts quickly 
 Demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
 Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 




Responsibilities:
 


 Learn to assist in the delivery of basic IT services to clients. 
 Learn and apply industry best practices and methodologies 
 Learn to provide support to clients, both remotely and on-site, as needed 
 Learn and apply troubleshooting techniques to identify and resolve IT issues 
 Learn to use a ticketing system to manage support queries. 




Requirements:
 


 A strong desire to learn and grow in the IT/MSP space 
 Some experience with IT support (6 months to a year), or the A+ certification 
 Ability to deliver great customer service (communicating clearly, managing expectations, following up) 


 The candidate must be able to complete all physical requirements of the job, which include but are not limited to, the following; must be able to lift and/or carry up to 50 lbs; stand/sit for extended periods of time; push/pull; climb stairs; stoop, kneel or crouch; use fingers/hands to handle or feel; reach above head or below knee level; and the ability to work around machinery and material handling equipment. 




Desirable Qualities:
 


 Familiarity with Managed Service Provider operations 
 Familiarity with Windows 10, Office 365 
 Experience with basic TCP/IP networking, DNS, DHCP 
 Experience with Windows Server 2016 or higher 
 Should be able to intuitively troubleshoot. 
 Have good problem-solving skills. 


Compensation:
 


$23/hour  


Atlas Technica is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Junior Industrial Engineer (E-Commerce)
description:
Junior Industrial Engineer (E-Commerce)


Babylonstoren‚Äôs e-commerce department has grown significantly over the past few years. Our environment is fast-paced, innovative, and performance-driven, making it well suited to someone who is self-motivated, detail-oriented, solutions-focused, and confident in making decisions or escalating issues when necessary. As an E-Commerce Industrial Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our digital platforms, ensuring that systems and processes ‚Äî from the entire supply chain to the customer experience ‚Äî operate efficiently and reliably. Your primary focus will be operational process optimisation, implementation, and cost savings, with opportunities to contribute to projects across warehousing, fulfilment, logistics, and customer service.

title: Business Operations Intern - Project Management (January 2026)
description:
About BeeX


BeeX is building the world's most advanced Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (HAUVs).


BeeX specialises in providing autonomous robotics solutions to safeguard underwater infrastructure in the maritime, energy and defense sectors, reducing over 90% of carbon emissions. We are pioneering Autonomous Robotics-as-a-Service (ARaaS) on a global scale, supported by decades of operational experiences in harsh waters. With unprecedented efficiency, we strive to provide our customers with a one-point solution for asset integrity management -- protecting assets they value, making sure they stay safe.


Why Join Now

The industries we serve need new ways to overcome their current challenges, and BeeX sees the opportunity in delivering exactly that, right now. Creating anything new is very hard, and we need outstanding people.


At BeeX, everyone is dependent; united by enthusiasm for bold innovation. Our multi-disciplinary team thrives in dynamic environments, driving transformative advancements globally. Join us to make a meaningful impact on the world!


Your Role


Your Role as a 
Business Operations Intern ‚Äì Project Management
 exposes you to all the Business and Operational aspects of a deep-tech startup. This is a broad role that drives Business Growth through pre-project engagement and research, project execution and post-project support.


You will work directly in touch with the Business and Operations Teams, reporting to the Project Engineer. In this role, you will also work with the management team.

Assist      the Project Manager in project preparation, execution, and close out, to      ensure that project is delivered on time, within budget, and with high      quality.

title: Internship - Open Category
description:
We believe that candidates who have a positive learning attitude and strong work ethic can excel at tasks, regardless of their academic qualifications. To hire the best talent, BeeX has decided to create an Open Internship position, to enable candidates from any discipline to pitch to us, about how you help our team. Please pitch yourself in the Questionnaire!


This is an exciting opportunity to take your internship experience into your own hands, instead of just going through the motion.  An Open Intern will help us achieve business goals by contributing and executing impactful ideas in our team. The experience you gain through this internship will be broad, and helpful in preparing you for other fast paced work environments.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Self-directed learner, able to work independently and as part of a team
Passionate about startups and/or innovation

title: HR Specialist Intern - Compliance & Governance
description:
About BeeX


BeeX is building the world's most advanced Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (HAUVs).


BeeX specialises in providing autonomous robotics solutions to safeguard underwater infrastructure in the maritime, energy and defense sectors, reducing over 90% of carbon emissions. We are pioneering Autonomous Robotics-as-a-Service (ARaaS) on a global scale, supported by decades of operational experiences in harsh waters. With unprecedented efficiency, we strive to provide our customers with a one-point solution for asset integrity management -- protecting assets they value, making sure they stay safe.


Why Join Now
The industries we serve need new ways to overcome their current challenges, and BeeX sees the opportunity in delivering exactly that, right now. Creating anything new is very hard, and we need outstanding people.


At BeeX, everyone is dependent; united by enthusiasm for bold innovation. Our multi-disciplinary team thrives in dynamic environments, driving transformative advancements globally. Join us to make a meaningful impact on the world!


Your Role


BeeX is looking for an HR Specialist Intern to support the full spectrum of human resources functions in a fast-paced startup environment. This role provides hands-on exposure across recruitment, people operations, HR projects, and internal initiatives, while working closely with the HR and Operations teams. The intern will also support company internal events and special HR-related projects, gaining practical experience in both strategic and operational HR work.


Key Responsibilities


HR Policies, Rules & People Frameworks


Assist in drafting, reviewing, and updating company rules, HR policies, and internal guidelines
Support the development of people frameworks, such as role expectations, KPIs, and performance guidelines
Assist in creating and maintaining career pathways, job levels, and progression frameworks
Help document HR processes and standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Support clear communication and documentation of policies and guidelines across the company


Talent Acquisition & Recruitment Support






Support end-to-end recruitment activities, including job postings, resume screening, interview scheduling, and candidate coordination






Assist in maintaining recruitment pipelines and applicant tracking systems






Coordinate with hiring managers to ensure a smooth and timely hiring process






Support employer branding initiatives, including job ads and recruitment outreach






HR Operations & Administration






Assist with day-to-day HR operations, including employee records, documentation, and onboarding support






Help maintain HR databases, trackers, and personnel files






Support preparation of HR documents such as offer letters, contracts, and internal communications






Assist with offboarding and employee lifecycle processes




HR Projects and Initiatives






Support planning and execution of internal company events, team activities, and engagement initiatives






Assist in employee engagement, well-being, and culture-building activities






Help gather feedback through surveys or informal check-ins and support follow-up actions


Requirements






Currently pursuing or recently completed a Diploma or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, or a related field






Strong interest in learning across all HR functions in a startup environment






Organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks effectively






Good communication and interpersonal skills






Able to handle sensitive and confidential information professionally






Comfortable working in a fast-changing and dynamic environment






Proficient in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace (spreadsheets, documents, presentations)






Prior internship or involvement in HR, recruitment, event planning, or student leadership roles (Good to have)

title: Manufacturing Engineer Intern (January 2026)
description:
About BeeX 


BeeX is building the world's most advanced Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (HAUVs).  


BeeX specialises in providing autonomous robotics solutions to safeguard underwater infrastructure in the maritime, energy and defense sectors, reducing over 90% of carbon emissions. We are pioneering Autonomous Robotics-as-a-Service (ARaaS) on a global scale, supported by decades of operational experiences in harsh waters. With unprecedented efficiency, we strive to provide our customers with a one-point solution for asset integrity management -- protecting assets they value, making sure they stay safe. 


Why Join Now
 
The industries we serve need new ways to overcome their current challenges, and BeeX is delivering exactly that. Creating anything new is very hard. To do this, we need outstanding people.  At BeeX, everyone is dependent; united by enthusiasm for bold innovation. Our multi-disciplinary team thrives in dynamic environments, driving transformative advancements globally. 


You will be exposed to different aspects of Deeptech, from design to commercialisation. Join us to make a meaningful impact on the world! 


What our interns can get uniquely from BeeX: 


Experience the sea life, and potentially discover underwater ‚Äútreasures‚Äù  
Go to secret places that 90% of population never gets to know about 
Learn how a deep-tech startup grows in Singapore and export globally 
Potential job offer (part-time / full-time) before graduation 


Your Role
 


As the Manufacturing Engineer Intern, you will report directly to the Manufacturing Engineer Lead. Your daily schedule will include frequent interactions with a multi-disciplinary team, across teams from design to manufacturing to operations. 


Your Job Scope


Support engineering and production teams in developing and updating manufacturing plans for products





Assist in drafting and maintaining work instructions, test plans, and Bills of Materials (BOMs)






Help communicate manufacturing requirements to suppliers and support training of manufacturing personnel






Assist with providing technical support for production-related issues involving equipment, processes, quality, and systems






Support troubleshooting activities and participate in root cause analysis under guidance from senior engineers






Assist in implementing and maintaining quality control procedures on the manufacturing floor, including incoming and outgoing inspections






Help track corrective actions and follow up on quality-related issues






Maintain accurate records of inspections, tests, and audits, and assist in preparing quality performance reports






Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance product quality, manufacturing efficiency, and reduce defects






Support preparation of training materials and assist in training sessions on quality standards and procedures






Assist in supplier quality coordination to ensure materials and components meet required specifications






Support compliance with industry standards, regulations, and internal manufacturing procedures






Provide day-to-day technical and engineering support to manufacturing and operations teams under supervision






Desired Qualities and Skillsets


At least a Diploma in Mechanical or a related discipline, or currently pursuing an Undergraduate degree in a relevant field



Exposure to or experience in manufacturing or quality engineering (design experience is not required)



Working knowledge of product development and manufacturing processes



Familiarity with quality control and testing procedures such as EMI/EMC, vibration, temperature, and humidity testing is an advantage



Basic experience with Altium Designer or other comparable PCB CAD tools


Basic knowledge of communication protocols in embedded systems (CAN, Ethernet, Serial)

Exposure to 2D schematics, wire harnessing, or cable assembly design software is a plus



Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities



Able to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced environment



Good written and verbal communication skills



Comfortable working in a cross-functional team environment



Strong organisational and time-management skills

title: Internship - Data Analytics F/M
description:
Work authorization:
 You must already have the right to work in France for the duration of the program. 
Sponsorship of work permits/visas is not available for this role.
Data Analytics Intern F/M
 




WE ARE BETCLIC
 




Betclic, European leader in sports betting, is much more than just an online gaming site! Also offering Poker, Horse Racing, and Casino games across various countries and continents, it is an inspiring and forward-thinking company: every day brings new challenges in a modern and dynamic environment. As an influential player in the tech industry, with strong and sustained growth over the years, we believe in innovation through diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone to reach their full potential. With our multicultural team, we provide an optimal, safe and responsible gaming experience, powered by cutting-edge technology. 




ENTER THE GAME
 


You will join the Data Analytics team, part of a larger Data team which also includes Data Science, Data Product Management and Product Analytics teams. The Analytics team mission is to grow the business by identifying critical insights and high value opportunities. You'll integrate a fast-growing team of +40 passionate individuals tackling challenges of all sorts: from scaling marketing campaign analytics to building complex customer segmentations to predicting the outcome of the next football game 




YOUR ROLE WITHIN BETCLIC 


Your mission will be :   


Explore and manipulate large datasets to facilitate their use and analysis 


Transform raw data into visualization tools that support decision-making 


Work closely with business partners to understand their challenges and provide actionable recommendations 


Identify high value-added opportunities to support data driven decision making 




WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR? 




We‚Äôre looking for teammates who bring humor, respect, and kindness to the table‚Äîplus a bit of drive and a genuine passion for what they do! 


This internship is for you if: 




You‚Äôre in your final year of a Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent, Bac +4/5) specializing in Data Analytics or Statistics 


You have strong analytical skills, with rigor and the ability to synthesize information effectively 


You‚Äôre eager to join a fast-paced and challenging professional environment 


You have a solid foundation in SQL and want to sharpen your skills further 


You‚Äôre motivated to grow your communication and presentation abilities 


And finally, you‚Äôre fluent in English 




Bonus : 


You have already built reports using a data visualization tool 


You have basic knowledge of a programming language (R or Python) 




WHAT ARE THE RECRUITMENT
 
STEPS?
 


 


If your application is selected, you will be contacted by Joe to complete an online technical test & Assessfirst, followed by a 15-minute HR pre-qualification 


You‚Äôll then meet your future manager for a fit and technical interview  


After that, for the final round you will meet the Chief Data Officer, and you will also have a final HR interview, including a debrief on your AssessFirst test 


In order to provide an optimal applicant experience, the overall hiring process at Betclic lasts 4 to 6 weeks. 




WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT?
 




A Ticket Restaurant¬Æ card credited with ‚Ç¨11 per day (‚Ç¨6 per day funded by Betclic) 


50% reimbursement of public transport costs or an annual sustainable mobility allowance (‚Ç¨230 for commuting with sustainable transport) 


Extraordinary office spaces with a rooftop where you can enjoy sunny breaks with a view of the Cit√© du Vin 


On-site sports classes and organized tournaments (Pilates, circuit training, boxing, yoga, futsal, padel, tennis‚Ä¶) 




Internship starting as soon as January
 2026 in Bordeaux. 


Betclic Group - 117 quai de Bacalan 33300 BORDEAUX.

description:

:

Work with open sources and research tools to gather relevant information
Structure findings into clear summaries and simple insights

title: 2026 AI Graduate Talent Trainee
description:
Join us as a Graduate Talent Trainee, and explore the intriguing world of blockchain, and high-performance computing. Drive impact with us!




Job Summary:


The Graduate Talent Trainee (GTT) program at Bitdeer is dedicated to developing high-potential graduates into skilled professionals who drive innovation and organizational excellence at Bitdeer. This 18-month program combines hands-on experience in your chosen field with comprehensive training in our core values and business practices.


As a GTT, you will build technical expertise while becoming a culture carrier for Bitdeer. We are on the lookout for individuals who commit to the values of Resilience, Accountability, Customer-focused, and Entrepreneurial in everything they do.


Successful candidates should demonstrate the ability to adapt in a dynamic environment, collaborate effectively across teams, and commit to contributing to Bitdeer's mission. This program is designed for graduates ready to take ownership of their professional development, while making meaningful contributions to Bitdeer's continued growth and innovation.


Join us as we power up to build the next generation of computing excellence!




We are looking for key talents to develop in the following areas:


Machine Learning Engineer
Research Scientist
LLM Area (Large-scale language model pre-training)
Reinforcement learning for reasoning models
Advanced AI systems (Data Construction, curation, and engineering for large-scale model training)
Frontend Engineer ‚Äì AI Agent Platform
Server-sent events/WebSocket
Visualize agent reasoning/action
Backend Engineer ‚Äì AI Agent Platform
Tool adapter
Context management
Trace
Security
Sandbox
Inference engine
Full-Stack Engineer ‚Äì AI Solution
End-to-end feature delivery
Data integration
Documentation & developer enablement
Product Manager ‚Äì AI Solution
Problem framing & ROI analysis
Success metrics & evaluation design
UX for AI interaction




Our ideal candidate:


Fresh graduates (Bachelors, Masters, PhD) from all disciplines and/or candidates with up to 2 years of work experience.
Technical expertise and experience in relevant area of interest
Strong passion for new technologies: Blockchain, Cloud Computing, AI, and Data Centers.
Impressive personal achievements e.g. academics, extracurricular/internship, outstanding skills, or insights in areas of your passion.
Most importantly, you want to drive impact at the start of your career journey and you are highly motivated, have strong ownership and accountability, and unwavering commitment to pursue your passion and interest.




During the 18 months program, there will be opportunities to:


Develop a global mindset, and collaborate with our colleagues from other regions.
Develop a multitude of skill sets both business and technical skills.
Rotate within your related business functions or cross-departments (subject to availability and business needs).
Deepen your knowledge in this new and exciting industry, learn under the mentorship and guidance of our functional team leaders, to eventually become a key contributor to meaningful business projects.
Interact with senior management teams and our alumni GTT network.




What you will experience working with us:


A culture that values authenticity and diversity of thoughts and backgrounds;
An inclusive and respectable environment with open workspaces and exciting start-up spirit;
Fast-growing company with the chance to network with industrial pioneers and enthusiasts;
Ability to contribute directly and make an impact on the future of the digital asset industry;
Involvement in new projects, developing processes/systems;
Personal accountability, autonomy, fast growth, and learning opportunities;
Attractive welfare benefits and developmental opportunities such as training and mentoring.




This is a full-time and on-site position at our local office.

title: Department Assistant/Secretary (Fresh Graduate)
description:
About Bitdeer:


Bitdeer is a world-leading technology company for Bitcoin mining and AI cloud.
Bitdeer is committed to providing comprehensive Bitcoin mining solutions for its customers. Apart from designing industry-leading ASIC chips and manufacturing mining rigs, the Group handles complex processes involved in computing across the value chain. This includes equipment procurement, transport logistics, datacenter design and construction, equipment management, and network and facility operations. Bitdeer also offers advanced cloud capabilities to customers with a high demand for artificial intelligence.
Headquartered in Singapore, Bitdeer operates globally with a diversified 3 GW energy portfolio, and deploys Bitcoin mining and HPC datacenters in the United States, Bhutan, Norway, Canada, Malaysia, and Ethiopia.


What you will be responsible for:


Assist in general administrative duties, including data entry, filing, document preparation, and correspondence.
Coordinate meetings, schedule appointments, and manage office calendars.
Maintain office supplies and ensure proper organization of office equipment.
Handle incoming calls, emails, and inquiries in a professional manner.
Prepare reports, presentations, and other documentation as needed.
Assist with travel arrangements and expense reports for employees.
Ensure compliance with company policies and assist in process improvement initiatives.
Provide support to other team members and departments as required.




How you will stand out:


No experience required (we are open to provide training)
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
A proactive and positive attitude with a willingness to learn.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.




What you will experience working with us:


A culture that values authenticity and diversity of thoughts and backgrounds;
An inclusive and respectable environment with open workspaces and exciting start-up spirit;
Fast-growing company with the chance to network with industrial pioneers and enthusiasts;
Ability to contribute directly and make an impact on the future of the digital asset industry;
Involvement in new projects, developing processes/systems;
Personal accountability, autonomy, fast growth, and learning opportunities;
Attractive welfare benefits and developmental opportunities such as training and mentoring.




--------------------------------------------------------------------


Bitdeer is committed to providing equal employment opportunities in accordance with country, state, and local laws. Bitdeer does not discriminate against employees or applicants based on conditions such as race, colour, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, marital and/or parental status, religion, political opinion, nationality, ethnic background or social origin, social status, disability, age, indigenous status, and union.

title: Junior Accountant
description:
Lumerate is growing rapidly, and we‚Äôre searching for a 
Junior Accountant
 to join our team for the journey!


Who is Lumerate?


Lumerate is a Toronto-based SaaS company that has built game-changing technology to help sales teams accelerate revenue growth. We help our customers achieve the full picture of their industries. We also strive to achieve our own personal full pictures from a career fulfillment and learning perspective. We‚Äôre in the business of gathering intelligence about industries and delivering it to the right people within those industries through innovative software interfaces. Our vision is to be the world's most useful and trusted source of information for professionals seeking to understand what's happening in their industry.


Our mission: To deliver industry awareness to an ever-increasing number of people, in whatever way helps them to make the most informed decisions, take the most immediate action and be the most awesome at their unique jobs.


What the role looks like:


Reporting to our Finance Manager, you‚Äôll be deeply immersed in the world of accounting and financial reporting at Lumerate. Through a variety of assigned responsibilities, you will be exposed to the inner workings of the entire business. You will see and work within various business sub-segments like revenue generation, payment processing, cash management, expense tracking and accounts receivable. 




What you‚Äôll be responsible for:




Take the lead on managing and maintaining our Finance Billing system to ensure seamless operations.
Handle the end-to-end creation and distribution of invoices with high precision.
Act as a primary point of contact for client inquiries, resolving billing issues with a professional touch.
Drive collections and credit control while processing customer payments.
Perform rigorous reconciliations and manage the Accounts Receivable ledger to ensure everything balances perfectly.




Who will be successful in this role?‚Äç




You are comfortable navigating various accounting software and possess a genuine interest in AI and how it‚Äôs transforming the finance landscape.
You are actively pursuing a career in Accounting, ready to learn and grow.
You don't just check work, you verify it. You have a natural knack for spotting the smallest discrepancies.
You can juggle multiple deadlines without dropping the ball, thanks to your stellar time management skills.
To demonstrate your attention to detail, please tell us the name located at coordinates 43.63565745335677, -79.43972483985826 in your cover letter.




Why Join? Fancy perks etc.




Get hands-on exposure to general accounting and cutting-edge fintech software in a fast-paced, growth-first environment.
Help shape the future of a bootstrapped and profitable Canadian tech company.
Earn yourself some equity (employee options make up 20% of the value of the company at all times).
Three weeks paid vacation + paid statutory holidays.
Be a part of a tightly-knit team with a thriving hybrid culture.
If based in Toronto, enjoy a dedicated work space at our open-concept office (located in the Junction Triangle) and enjoy the benefits of in-person interactions with colleagues 3 days per week
Upgrade your home office setup with our remote or hybrid stipend.
Join us for our annual all-company retreat (past destinations include Bermuda, Iceland, Costa Rica and Spain)!
Earn additional paid vacation days with continued learning ($1000 annual stipend for courses and classes).
Take part in our Employee Giving Program (you choose the causes and the company provides the funds).
Basic and extended health and dental benefits.
Paid and topped-up maternal and parental leave.




Location: 
If the successful candidate is based in the Greater Toronto Area, she/he/they can choose to participate in our hybrid experience, by working from home 2 days/week, while enjoying the benefits of in-person interactions at our Toronto office 3 days/week. 


If our successful candidate is based elsewhere in Canada, he/she/they will work remotely 100% of the time. 




Salary: 
CAD $60,000 / year




Start Date:
 The target start date for this role is 
April 20, 2026
, but can be flexible according to the availability of the successful candidate. This posting is for an existing vacancy.


Already envisioning your first day at Lumerate as our next Junior Accountant? Apply today by submitting your cover letter and resume. While we thank all candidates for their interest. 
Please note that applications without a cover letter will not be considered.


Lumerate is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Junior Energy Broker
description:
Marex has unique access across markets with significant share globally both on and off exchange. The depth of knowledge amongst its teams and divisions provides its customers with clear advantage, and its technology-led service provides access to all major exchanges, order-flow management via screen, voice and DMA, plus award-winning data, insights and analytics [do not delete].


The Energy department has some of the most experienced teams in the world as the leader in the energy sector by Market Share. By offering clients both voice and screen options, on and off-exchange, along with an extensive range of execution and clearing services.
Role Summary
Are you an ambitious, proactive individual with a strong interest in sales and the energy industry? We are seeking a driven talent to join our team as Junior Energy Broker. In this role, you will be trained to manage a portfolio of energy products and build relationships with East Asia accounts. This is an excellent opportunity for a sales-driven individual to develop expertise in energy brokerage while making a significant impact on the marketplace.
Overall Responsibilities
Engage in trading energy commodities, focusing on products tailored for China market companies.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, including banks, hedge funds, trading houses, and corporates in the Chinese market.
Support the onboarding of new clients and ensure ongoing relationship management.
Assist in client communication, providing regular updates and ensuring satisfaction.
Develop strategies to increase profit and growth by analyzing market trends and products.
Contribute to process improvements and assist in the development of new frameworks.
Collaborate with internal teams, including Operations and Technology, to support trading functions.
Ensure compliance with regulatory standards, including those set by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS).
Uphold high standards of integrity and professionalism in line with company values and policies.
The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time
Competencies, Skills, and Experience
Key Competencies: 
‚Ä¢	Strong drive and ambition to succeed in a sales-driven role. 
‚Ä¢	Excellent communication and relationship building skills 
‚Ä¢	Proactive, resilient, and results-oriented with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
‚Ä¢	Very strong numerical and analytical skills with an interest in market dynamics. 
‚Ä¢	Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team. 
‚Ä¢	Willingness to learn and grow in the energy trading sector. 
Required Skills & Experience: 
‚Ä¢	A strong interest in sales and energy markets. 
‚Ä¢	Strong verbal and written communication skills. 
‚Ä¢	Ability to engage and influence clients effectively. 
‚Ä¢	Resilience and the ability to perform under pressure in a dynamic environment. 
‚Ä¢	A basic understanding of financial markets and regulatory requirements (training will be provided). 
‚Ä¢	
Fresh graduates or candidates with limited experience in brokerage industry are welcome to apply.
Company Values
Acting as a role model for the values of the Company:
Respect -
 Clients are at the heart of our business, with superior execution and superb client service the foundation of the firm. We respect our clients and always treat them fairly.
Integrity -
 Doing business the right way is the only way. We hold ourselves to a high ethical standard in everything we do ‚Äì our clients expect this and we demand it of ourselves.
Collaborative -
 We work in teams - open and direct communication and the willingness to work hard and collaboratively are the basis for effective teamwork. Working well with others is necessary for us to succeed at what we do.
Developing our People - 
Our people are the basis of our competitive advantage. We look to ‚Äúgrow our own‚Äù and make Marex the place ambitious, hardworking, talented people choose to build their careers.
Adaptable and Nimble -
 Our size and flexibility is an advantage. We are big enough to support our client‚Äôs various needs, and adaptable and nimble enough to respond quickly to changing conditions or requirements. A non-bureaucratic, but well controlled environment fosters initiative as well as employee satisfaction.

title: Junior Broker, Swaptions - VN2181
description:
Diversified. Resilient. Dynamic.


Marex is a global financial services platform, providing essential liquidity, market access and infrastructure services to clients in the energy, commodities and financial markets.


The Group provides comprehensive breadth and depth of coverage across four core services: Market Making, Clearing, Hedging and Investment Solutions and Agency and Execution. It has a major franchise in many major metals, energy and agricultural products, executing around 50 million trades and clearing 205 million contracts in 2022. The Group provides access to the world‚Äôs major commodity markets, covering a broad range of clients that include some of the largest commodity producers, consumers and traders, banks, hedge funds and asset managers.


With more than 35 offices around the globe, and over 2300 dedicated people enabling access to exchanges and technology-powered services.


For more information visit 
www.marex.com






Purpose of Role:


Marex is seeking a Junior Broker, Swaptions who will be an ambitious and proactive individual, in an early career level position, with the ability to work autonomously, and also as part of a team. 


This individual will provide support to senior brokers with market color, orders, and post-trade analysis.


Marex has unique access across markets with significant share globally both on and off exchange. The depth of knowledge amongst its teams and divisions provides its customers with clear advantage, and its technology-led service provides access to all major exchanges, order-flow management via screen, voice and DMA, plus award-winning data, insights, and analytics.


Responsibilities:


Analyze financial data and market microstructure for patterns.
Contribute to Swaptions product trading capability to support liquidity for clients.
Perform post-trade analysis.
Work with senior traders to acquire in-depth knowledge of financial markets, modeling, and risk management.
Assist Senior Traders with order pricings and order management.
Proactively review trade flow and middle/back-office processes to create efficiencies.
Ensure compliance with the company‚Äôs regulatory requirements under the SEC, FINRA, CFTC, NFA and other applicable exchanges.
Adhere to the operational risk framework for your role ensuring that all regulatory or company determined parameters are complied with
 Role model for demonstrating highest level standards of integrity and conduct and reflecting Company Values.
At all times complying with Marex‚Äôs Code of Conduct:
To ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to you, your role, or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility
To report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/ or your supervisor as require
 To escalate risk events immediately
To provide input to risk management processes, as required.


The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time.


Competencies, Skills and Experience
:


Competencies


A collaborative team player, who is approachable, self-sufficient and influences a positive work environment.
Demonstrates curiosity.
Excels at building relationships, networking and influencing others.
Resilient in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
Strategic collaborator with insight and agility, able to anticipate future challenges, ensuring operational effectiveness.
Excellent verbal written and communication skills.


Skills and Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, finance, economics, and/or a related field preferred.
Experience working in a regulated environment and knowledge of the risk and compliance requirements associated with this business.
Seeking between zero and three (0-3) years‚Äô experience on a trading desk, particularly in the swaps markets.
 Proactive mindset in keeping up to date with market research and incorporating into role efficiently.
Analytical skills, identifying opportunities and risks in a quick and decisive manner.
Comprehensive knowledge of the financial service markets and relevant regulatory requirement.
 Series 3 preferred or ability to study for and successfully pass within 3 months of hire.


Salary Range:  $70,000 to $90,000 per year and eligible for discretionary bonus.
Marex Benefits for 2026

The depth of knowledge amongst its teams and divisions provides its customers with clear advantage, and its technology-led service provides access to all major exchanges, order-flow management via screen, voice and DMA, plus award-winning data, insights and analytics.


The Relative Value department will have access to major liquidity provider venues. We will also access directly on to major futures exchanges including the CME, ICE and EUREX.


This role covers the execution function within the Relative Value Trading department




Role Summary


This is an exciting opportunity to join a Rates Sales desk within Marex‚Äôs fast paced and growing Capital Markets group.  As part of this newly formed team, you will be a key member of the business helping drive growth and profitability for the Multi product Sales and Execution Desk. The opportunity is unique as it gives the candidate the opportunity to learn directly on a desk without any previous rates experience. They will start as a support role to our head of Asia and develop into a Relative Value Execution broker gaining mass experience in the rates industry and exposure to the biggest global rates traders. A role designed to train the candidate intensely into becoming the key member of the desk. 




Overall Responsibilities




To complete necessary      exams within a reasonable time frame


To begin with, assisting      our Asia lead on all day-to-day activities


Being a support to the      team in outside of trading functions


Use of internal and      external systems to build client strategies


Liaising with internal      back office and middle office teams to check downstream everything settles      correctly 


Generation of historical      data for clients where needed 


Working efficiently and      supporting with making efficiencies e.g. assisting in the preparation of      any new required frameworks.
Collaboration with central operations functions which support the trading role including but not limited to Operations and Technology.
Strategizing to increase P&L, requiring analysis of markets and products.
To ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to you, your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility
To report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/ or your supervisor as required
To escalate risk events immediately
To provide input to risk management processes, as required.




Eventually (after training and exams)




Daily execution of client      trades


Trading US Treasuries as      matched principal


Trading CME, Eurex and ICE      futures as agency


Ensuring clients risk gets      sent correctly


Onboarding and setting up      new client accounts 


Engaging with clients on      Bloomberg


Developing the RV model      and build continuously to ensure we keep up with competition 


Generation of PnL


Dealing in fixed income      and futures derivatives in particular interest rate product.


Directly corresponding      with clients. Clients include Banks, Hedge Funds and Real Money Accounts.


Responsible for assisting      with the onboarding of any new client relationships and maintaining of      existing client relationships, assisting with support processes as      required by colleagues, and engaging and updating clients.


Ensuring compliance with the company‚Äôs      regulatory requirements under the FCA, NFA, AMF


Adhere to the operational      risk framework for your role ensuring that all regulatory or company      determined parameters are complied with.


Role model for      demonstrating highest level standards of integrity and conduct and      reflecting Company Values.


At all times complying      with the FCA‚Äôs/regulators Code of Conduct


Liaising with clients in      [US, UK, France, MENA]
Exchange Registration: EUREX, LIFFE, ICE, CBOT, CME
The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time




Competencies, Skills and Experience


Competencies 


Ability to study for and      complete exams (while in the role)


NFA Series 3
Eurex 
CMFAS 1B
CMFAS RES1BE1
CMFAS 2A
CMFAS 6A (If no finance background)




Ability to take a high      level of responsibility


Excels at building      relationships, networking and influencing others


Excellent verbal written      and communication skills


Superb attention to detail      


The ability to work as a      team and bounce ideas off one another


High level mathematical      skills to deal with calculations with speed and accuracy 


A collaborative team      player, that is approachable, self-efficient and influences a positive      work environment


Demonstrates curiosity


Excels at building      relationships, networking and influencing others


Resilient in a      challenging, fast-paced environment


Strategic collaborator      with insight and agility, able to anticipate future challenges, ensuring      operational effectiveness




Skills and Experience




Degree in one of: STEMS      (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math), Business, Economics or Finance


Finance or Startup      internship experience (preferred)


Good excel skills (macro      experience preferred)


Analytical skills


Mathematical skills
Some knowledge of the financial service markets and relevant regulatory requirements




Company Values


Acting as a role model for the values of the Company:


Respect 
- Clients are at the heart of our business, with superior execution and superb client service the foundation of the firm. We respect our clients and always treat them fairly.


Integrity
 - Doing business the right way is the only way. We hold ourselves to a high ethical standard in everything we do ‚Äì our clients expect this and we demand it of ourselves.


Collaborative
 - We work in teams - open and direct communication and the willingness to work hard and collaboratively are the basis for effective teamwork. Working well with others is necessary for us to succeed at what we do.


Developing our People
 - Our people are the basis of our competitive advantage. We look to ‚Äúgrow our own‚Äù and make Marex the place ambitious, hardworking, talented people choose to build their careers.


Adaptable and Nimble

- Our size and flexibility is an advantage. We are big enough to support our client‚Äôs various needs, and adaptable and nimble enough to respond quickly to changing conditions or requirements. A non-bureaucratic, but well controlled environment fosters initiative as well as employee satisfaction.




Conduct Rules


You must:


Act with integrity
Act with due skill, care and diligence
Be open and cooperative with the FCA, the PRA and other regulators
Pay due regard to the interests of customers and treat them fairly
Observe proper standard of market conduct
Act to deliver good outcomes for retail customers
