title: Junior Recruiter-Ukraine (Remote)
description:
Junior Recruiter


Location
 
: Remote (supporting Portugal time zone)
Reporting to
 
: Head of Recruitment


About UMAI


UMAI is a fast-growing F&B technology company that helps restaurants save time and increase revenue by automating manual processes, reducing last-minute cancellations, enabling smarter upselling, and delivering more personalized customer experiences.


Our founding team brings extensive experience in building and scaling internet companies across the Asia Pacific region. UMAI was founded by the former Managing Director of Foodpanda Singapore and a founding team member of Nova Founders Capital, a fintech-focused venture capital firm based in London and Hong Kong.


This is not a formal corporate role. We are looking for someone who has a ‚Äúhustle‚Äù attitude, who is results driven, comfortable with ambiguity, is a self-starter and has a sense of humor. If you are someone who is agile and loves making things happen, we'd love to hear from you!


As we scale rapidly across Europe and other global markets, we are strengthening our recruitment engine to support aggressive growth.


The Role


We are looking for a driven, organised, and proactive Junior Recruiter to support high-volume and strategic hiring across Southern Europe. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys hands-on sourcing, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and is motivated by building strong talent pipelines.


Reporting to the Head of Recruitment, you will play a key role in executing a robust hiring process from proactive talent sourcing to interviews and offer coordination. This is not a back-office role; you‚Äôll be in the market, engaging candidates, and moving fast.


If you‚Äôre results-driven, comfortable with ambiguity, and excited about startup growth we want you on the team.


What You‚Äôll Do


Proactively source and engage candidates through LinkedIn, job boards, referrals, and creative sourcing channels.
Build, nurture, and manage talent pipelines to support both immediate and future hiring needs
Own the full recruitment lifecycle, from initial sourcing and screening to interviews, offer management, and closure.
Partner with hiring managers to assess candidate fit based on role requirements, competencies, and growth potential.
Deliver a structured, data-driven, and fair recruitment process across all roles.
Ensure a seamless onboarding experience to support strong new-hire integration and early engagement.
Continuously improve hiring processes to enhance speed, quality, and consistency of hires.
Maintain accurate recruitment data, pipeline tracking, and hiring reports to support decision-making.
Provide a positive, efficient, and professional hiring experience for candidates and internal stakeholders.


Your Profile


Candidates with up to 1‚Äì2 years of experience in recruitment or talent acquisition.
Strong interest in talent sourcing and hiring.
Comfortable with proactive outreach and candidate engagement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple roles simultaneously.
Results-driven, resilient, and comfortable working under pressure.
A self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision.


What We Offer


Hands-on experience in building a scalable recruitment engine for a fast-growing tech company.
Exposure to international hiring across Europe.
Direct mentorship and guidance.
A dynamic, diverse team with 14 nationalities, flat hierarchies, and strong ownership culture.


Why Join UMAI?


UMAI is one of the fastest-growing F&B tech companies in Southeast Asia, now expanding aggressively into Europe. This role offers the opportunity to build real recruitment expertise, work closely with leadership, and directly impact the company‚Äôs growth trajectory.


If you‚Äôd like to become part of UMAI and shape the future of the hospitality industry, we urge you to apply!

title: Junior 360¬∞ Visual Media Specialist
description:
Who we are:


We are 
a software development company
 where people, passion, and technology come together to shape the future of real estate through our own innovative products. 


In 2025, we‚Äôre proudly celebrating 15 years of Yardi Romania in Cluj-Napoca!‚ÄØ 
Since opening our doors in 2010, our Cluj-Napoca office has grown into the second-largest Yardi location worldwide. As part of Yardi Systems, Inc., a global leader in real estate software, founded in 1984, we‚Äôre connected to a network of over 45 offices and 10,000+ colleagues across the globe.‚ÄØ 


Our success is driven by a diverse team of more than 1,400 professionals, including software developers, marketers, consultants, data researchers, customer service specialists, and many more. 
Think you‚Äôd be a great fit? Join #TeamYardi.
 


Your Impact:


We‚Äôre looking for a 
Junior 360¬∞ Visual Media Specialist
 who can transform real-world properties into immersive, interactive 360¬∞ virtual experiences.


This is a creative‚Äìtechnical role that blends spatial thinking, visual storytelling, and light front-end implementation. You‚Äôll apply your understanding of 3D space, composition, and user flow to build interactive environments that connect users to places in meaningful, intuitive ways.


You‚Äôll be joining Yardi‚Äôs visual media team, working on virtual tours, photography, and visual content used across the 
RentCafe
 platform.


This position is available in a hybrid regime that implies working from the office at least once a week. Therefore, please take into account that you would need to be located in or near the Cluj-Napoca area.


Please submit your application in English.


What You‚Äôll Bring Along:


Background in 
architecture, interior visualization, photography
, 
game environments, 
or
 VR/AR
A bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field is preferred but not required
Strong 
spatial awareness
 and ability to think in 
3D environments
Keen eye for 
composition, perspective, and depth
 in visual design
Working knowledge of 
HTML/CSS
 and familiarity with 
JavaScript
 for layout and interactivity
Experience with 
360¬∞ authoring platforms 
(e.g., Pano2VR, 3DVista, Matterport, Marzipano)
A logical problem-solving mindset, balancing technical precision with creative design
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining high-quality output
Proficiency in written and spoken English, with strong communication and interpersonal skills 
Self-motivation, adaptability, and eagerness to explore new creative tools, platforms, or techniques


Bonus points for:


Experience with WebGL, Three.js, or immersive 3D workflows
Familiarity with RentCafe or other property marketing platforms


What You'll Do:


Create and build interactive 360¬∞ virtual tours 
that accurately represent real-world layouts and navigation flow
Plan and map capture points
 for logical movement and clear spatial storytelling
Implement branded visual themes
 across all scenes, ensuring consistency and polish
Add interactivity
 - hotspots, info overlays, media embeds, or links - using HTML/CSS and light JavaScript
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
 (photo editors, designers, project managers) to meet design and delivery goals
Optimize tours
 for usability, visual coherence, and performance across browsers and devices


What you'll enjoy once you become part of the Yardi Romania team
:
 


A flexible hybrid work setup that blends the best of remote and office life. 
Up to two thousand USD per year reimbursed for eligible learning and professional development expenses. 
Forty RON/working day meal tickets (taxable according to current legislation). 
Up to twenty-six vacation days to recharge your energy, based on tenure. 
Comprehensive private medical insurance (including dental care, physiotherapy & psychotherapy) for you and your dependents. 
Up to twenty days of EU remote work per year, subject to current policy. 
Annual salary review to keep it in line with your performance and industry changes. 
The possibility of a yearly bonus through our profit-sharing program. 
Life insurance for you & global travel insurance for you and your family. 
Currently granting a fixed monthly Work/Life Stipend for your well-being activities.

title: Junior New Product Development Project Manager
description:
Prime Prometics
 is the fastest-growing pro-age cosmetics brand in the world, and we‚Äôre looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented 
Junior New Product Development Project Manager 
to support our product launches from early ideation through execution. 
What You'll Do:


Coordinate product launches from early ideation through execution, working closely with the NPD Project Manager.
Take ownership of select product launches over time, managing timelines, coordination, and execution independently.
Source packaging for products based on briefs provided by the NPD Project Manager, acting as the main point of contact with packaging suppliers.
Continuously expand and improve the packaging library by sourcing options from new and existing vendors, and maintaining accurate records in collaboration with the Supply Chain team.
Provide administrative and process support to the NPD Project Manager, including sample registration, labeling, organization, benchmark orders, and shipments.
Coordinate with Regulatory Compliance in regards to compliance-related requests by gathering and organizing required documentation when needed.
Assist the Customer Support team by responding to product-related inquiries for new launches, collecting customer complaints and feedback, and communicating insights to the NPD Product & Category Manager.
Update Customer Support FAQs to reflect new product launches and key product information.
Help organize and coordinate focus groups for new product testing, ensuring feedback is collected, documented, and shared with relevant stakeholders.
What Success Looks Like:


Product launches are executed smoothly, on time, and with clear coordination between Product, Supply Chain, Compliance, Marketing and Customer Support.
Packaging for products is sourced efficiently, meets project requirements, and is well-documented within an up-to-date packaging library.
Administrative tasks, sample tracking, and documentation are handled accurately, allowing the NPD Project Manager to focus on higher-level strategy and execution.
Customer feedback and complaints related to new launches are captured clearly and communicated effectively, contributing to continuous product improvement.
Focus groups are well-organized, feedback is actionable, and insights are shared in a timely manner with the Product team.
What You Bring:


1‚Äì2 years of experience in product development coordination, project management, operations, or a related role.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.
Comfort working with suppliers, packaging vendors, and cross-functional teams.
Confidence using spreadsheets, trackers, and documentation systems to manage projects and product data.
Clear written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to escalate issues and share updates proactively.
Hands-on, reliable, and eager to learn product development within a CPG or beauty environment.

title: AI Engineer (m/f/d) - Summer Internship
description:
eigenblue - We build systems that build physical systems: 
Our AI systems design and deliver custom-built, multidisciplinary systems to solve real-world R&D challenges. As today‚Äôs R&D demand can no longer be met with off-the-shelf tools, our approach crosses traditional boundaries, uniting software, electronics, mechanics, and applied physics. Our proprietary AI models generate system architectures and orchestrate fabs, human teams, and third-party tools to bring them to life. Our deployment teams integrate these systems directly into our customers‚Äô environments, turning complex ideas into working physical solutions.
 
As an AI Engineer Intern (m/f/d) in our Product Division, you will gain hands-on experience building our AI product from the ground up. You'll work alongside our product development team to develop cutting-edge AI solutions that power physical R&D automation while learning from science and industry experts to shape the future of AI-driven multidisciplinary system design.
 
 
Your Role
 
Support the development and testing of AI solutions (LLM and non-LLM) for physical R&D automation and system design in mechatronics and robotics
Assist in implementing and experimenting with AI reasoning approaches, working with our proprietary ontology and algorithms combined with public tools and data
Contribute to building MLOps pipelines and model deployment infrastructure using cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) with Docker, Kubernetes, and FastAPI
Collaborate with AI and Data Engineers to integrate AI features into our product under guidance from senior team members
Experiment with RAG systems, agent architectures, and prompt engineering techniques while learning about LLM evaluation and optimization
 
Your Profile
 
Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, AI/ML, or related discipline
Solid programming skills in Python and familiarity with LLM providers and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, and/or Azure)
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, LLMs, and modern AI tools and eagerness to learn about production ML systems, MLOps practices, and cloud-based deployment
Know-how of RAG, agents, fine-tuning, simulation, robotics, or experience with cloud platforms and containerization technologies through coursework or projects
Strong communication skills in English and enthusiasm for working in a multidisciplinary, fast-paced environment
 
 
Your Benefits
 
We enable
: The chance to use newest technologies
We create
: Huge impact on future products and insights from a broad range of industries
We explore: 
Opportunity to dive into different areas while collaborating closely with science and industry experts
We are community-driven
: Vibrant and interdisciplinary tech community
 
eigenblue is colorful
 - We embrace and value equal opportunities, inclusion, and diversity. Therefore, we welcome every application with pleasure!
Does that make you curious? 
Julia
 is your contact person for further questions and looks forward to hearing from you!

Analyse von Kundenbedarfen und Entwicklung passender Sourcing-Strategien.
Auswahl, Bewertung und Betreuung von Lieferanten.
Koordination von Produktanfragen, Angeboten und Lieferterminen.
Unterst√ºtzung bei der Implementierung von Fastenal-L√∂sungen beim Kunden.
Aufbau und Pflege langfristiger Gesch√§ftsbeziehungen.
Dokumentation und Reporting deiner Aktivit√§ten.
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams wie Vertrieb, Logistik und Produktmanagement.


Dein Einsatzgebiet:


Region Deutschland West ‚Äì NRW/Ruhrgebiet


Das bieten wir dir:


Attraktives Gehaltspaket: Fixum + leistungsbezogene Provision nach der Einarbeitung.
Dienstwagen inkl. Tankkarte f√ºr Dienstfahrten.
Moderne IT-Ausstattung f√ºr mobiles Arbeiten.
Flexible Arbeitsgestaltung ‚Äì zwischen Kundenbesuchen und B√ºro.
30 Tage Urlaub f√ºr deine Work-Life-Balance.
Regelm√§√üige Weiterbildungen und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten.
Spannende Produkte und L√∂sungen f√ºr Industrie und Logistik.
Ein internationales Netzwerk mit √ºber 23.000 Kolleg:innen weltweit.


Bereit f√ºr den n√§chsten Schritt?


Dann bewirb dich jetzt und starte deine Karriere im Sourcing bei Fastenal! Wir freuen uns auf dich!
Art der Stelle: Vollzeit


Arbeitsort: Vor Ort

title: Tirocinio (Internship) (m/f/d)
description:
Posizione: 
 Stage (m/f/d) - Categorie protette L. 68/1999


Orario di Lavoro
: Da Lunedi a Venerdi dalle  


Tipologia di contratto: T
irocinio - Full-time: 08:30 ‚Äì 17:30


Data di inizio prevista
: - 
Meta' Novembre


Sede di Lavoro: 
Via Della Scienza 19/c, Vago Di Lavagno




PANORAMICA GENERALE


Per lavorare come 
Stagista 
(
Intern
), dovrai avere un forte interesse nelle vendite e saper apprezzare il lavoro in un ambiente impegnativo e stimolante al tempo stesso. 


LE TUE MANSIONI & RESPONSABILIT√Ä 


Le mansioni e le responsabilita‚Äôdella posizione di Sales Support includono ma non si limitano a:




Assistenza nel processo di Vendite/Servizio al Cliente      (compilazione & evasione ordini, sales calls, proiezione costi,      negoziazioni, ricerca materiali, etc.)


Gestione del magazzino: Ricezione e spedizione, gestione      inventario (cycle counts), preparazione ordini, etc.


Mansioni amministrative (fatturazione, gestione entrate fiscali,      riordino merce, pagamenti in uscita, etc.)




IL TUO PROFILO


I dipendenti Fastenal di maggior successo vivono ed operano seguento questi quattro valori culturali: Ambizione ‚Äì Innovazione ‚Äì Integrit√† ‚Äì Teamwork


Inoltre, siamo alla ricerca di persone con le seguenti caratteristiche:




Maggiore et√†


Una forte attitudine alla vendita e      desiderio di vendere


Forti capacit√† informatiche e      matematiche
Capacit√† di lavorare in modo autonomo e come parte di un team
Capacit√† di camminare, sollevare pesi, trasportare      e trainare carrelli
Preferibile laurea in economia,      business, supply chain o relazioni internazionali
Obbligatorio possedere competenze      informatiche per poter utilizzare il nostro sistema ERP e i relativi      dispositivi (scanner, stampanti)
Preferibile esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di      MS Office (Excel e Word)
Fluente in italiano e inglese
Possesso di patente di guida categoria B


COSA OFFRIAMO




Un ambiente motivante e stimolante


Una carriera all‚Äôinterno di un‚Äôazienda      internazionale in rapida crescita economica


Lavorare in un contesto internazionale


Possibilit√† concreta di integrazione      all'interno del team con contratto CCNL commercio una volta finito il      periodo di Stage


Sviluppo di competenze e conoscenze      attraverso la nostra Fastenal School of Business digitale




COS‚Äô √à FASTENAL


Dal 1967 
Fastenal 
√® passata da un singolo store a piu‚Äô 3.000 punti vendita, ognuno dei quali fornisce un inventario locale ed un servizio personalizzati per i propri clienti. Nonostante la rapida crescita in tutto il mondo, abbiamo mantenuto un credo fondamentale nelle persone e nella loro capacit√† di realizzare cose straordinarie. Da questa filosofia deriva una cultura imprenditoriale che sfida ogni dipendente a gestire la propria attivit√†, creare il proprio successo e avanzare fino a diventare leader nell'azienda.


Come azienda in crescita con una solida posizione finanziaria, che generalmente raddoppia in dimensioni ogni quattro o cinque anni, ci impegnamo a formare, promuovere dall'interno e creare opportunit√† per i nostri dipendenti. Se hai uno spirito imprenditoriale e stai cercando di lasciare il segno come parte di una societ√† in crescita, non c‚Äô√® soluzione migliore di Fastenal.


La risorsa appartenente alle Categorie Protette, con disabilit√† certificata ai sensi della L. 68/1999 sar√† inserita nel team locale e riporter√† al General Manager


Se sei interessato a questa opportunita' e pensi di avere i requisiti adatti, inviaci il tuo CV


Questo annuncio √® aperto a candidati di entrambi i sessi, in conformit√† con le leggi n. 903/1977 e n. 125/91, nonch√© a persone di tutte le et√† e nazionalit√†, in conformit√† ai decreti legislativi n. 215/2003 e 2016/2003, nonch√© tutta la legislazione tempo per tempo vigente.


I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs. 215/2003, D.lgs. 216/2003, nonch√© tutta la legislazione tempo per tempo vigente, sono invitati a leggere l‚Äôinformativa sul trattamento dei dati personali consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679 ‚Äì GDPR).

title: Junior QA Engineer
description:
Junior QA Engineer 


About Finova
‚ÄØ


Finova is the UK‚Äôs largest financial services technology provider, supporting one in every five mortgages nationwide. Our agile, cloud-native solutions enable over 60 banks, building societies, specialist lenders, equity release providers and a network of 2,400+ brokers to stay ahead in a competitive market.


Built on open architecture and backed by deep industry expertise, our platform is designed to scale. Each year, we process over ¬£50 billion in loans, manage nearly ¬£50 billion in savings, and support the digital servicing of more than 650,000 UK borrower accounts.


Be part of a team that‚Äôs driving innovation, enabling growth and shaping the future of UK lending.


For Lenders
‚ÄØ


Finova offers a flexible, modular technology suite designed to help lenders move faster, scale efficiently and deliver standout digital experiences.


Financial Institutions use Finova to launch products faster, process applications up to 50% more efficiently and reduce operational costs ‚Äî all while staying fully compliant in a fast-moving market.‚ÄØ


About the Role:


Finova is hiring a QA Engineer to join our quality-focused team in Manchester. This is an opportunity to take ownership of quality across our cloud-native B2B workflow solutions, ensuring our complex mortgage and savings platforms deliver exceptional reliability for our clients. You'll work closely with Product, Development, and stakeholders to champion testing best practices and drive quality at every stage of delivery.


What will you be doing?




Design and maintain comprehensive test      scenarios, test cases, and test plans across functional, regression, and      UAT testing


Own test design and ensure appropriate      test coverage for business-critical features


Design, execute, and maintain      automated test cases using low-code automation tools such as Katalon,      TestComplete, or Mabl


Perform hands-on manual testing and      support release validation to ensure quality releases


Execute and maintain automated      regression and smoke test suites in line with agreed processes and      timelines


Lead QA-related meetings, including      test planning sessions and defect triage discussions


Participate actively in 3 Amigos      sessions with Product and Development teams to define acceptance criteria      and testing approaches


Act as the QA representative on client      calls, including triage and incident discussions, communicating quality      risks and status clearly


Champion quality practices across the      team and promote a strong testing culture within the project


Collaborate with cross-functional      teams to ensure quality is embedded throughout the development lifecycle




About You:




2‚Äì4 years' experience in a QA / Test      Engineer role, ideally within B2B or SaaS environments


Strong test design skills with      experience creating and maintaining test scenarios, test cases, and test      plans


Hands-on experience with low-code test      automation solutions such as Katalon, TestComplete, Mabl, or similar tools


Confident in both manual and automated      testing approaches, with a pragmatic mindset for balancing speed and      quality


Experience leading QA activities      including test planning, defect triage, and release readiness assessments


Comfortable acting as the QA voice in      cross-functional and client-facing discussions


Strong interpersonal and communication      skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across Product,      Development, and stakeholder groups


A proactive approach to championing      quality and embedding best practices across the team


Experience working in agile      environments and contributing to iterative, fast-paced delivery cycles


A commitment to continuous improvement      and staying current with testing tools and methodologies




What We Offer:


Hybrid working:
 At Finova, we believe the best outcomes come from working together - and having the flexibility to work in a way that suits both our people and our business. We operate a hybrid working model, with most teams spending around three days a week in the office and with our customers. This time together helps us stay connected, collaborate more effectively, and solve complex challenges as a team. We also know that flexibility matters. Our approach is designed to support a healthy balance, combining in-person collaboration with the freedom to work remotely where it makes sense.


Holiday
: 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, bank holiday trading and holiday purchase options, the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for up to 4 weeks per year.


Looking After You
: Life Assurance, Group Income Protection, Private Medical Insurance, a pension scheme via Salary Exchange, an Employee Assistance Programme, and access to a Virtual GP.


Family-Friendly Policies
: Enhanced maternity and paternity pay, as well as paid time off for fertility treatments and pregnancy loss.


Extra Perks
: Cycle to Work Scheme, discounts on shops, restaurants, and gym memberships, free fresh fruit daily, and opportunities to join colleague networks and social groups.


Giving Back
: One paid volunteering day annually and the Give-As-You-Earn scheme to support your favourite charities.


Equal Opportunity Statement


We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you‚Äôre passionate about this role but don‚Äôt meet all the criteria, please reach out‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to discuss how your skills and experiences align with our needs.

title: DAE Intern (Leading to Job)
description:
About Us?


Avanceon is a multinational corporation which specializes in automation, control systems integration, energy management solutions, and support services. With offices in Dubai, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and Pakistan, it has established a significant market presence. Over its 24-year history, Avanceon has evolved into a comprehensive provider offering automation, energy management, service, and maintenance solutions. Through its extensive experience and diverse client base, including major blue-chip companies, it has garnered strong credentials and expertise in the industry.


Job Description:


We are looking for 
hard-working, passionate, and motivated Electrical/Electronics Intern
 to join our 
Avanceon Fuelling Solutions Department
. This internship is an excellent opportunity for fresh DAE graduates to gain hands-on experience and practical exposure in a professional working environment.


Key Responsibilities:


Assist in electrical/electronic installation, testing, and maintenance activities
Support senior engineers and technicians in daily AFS department tasks
Help in troubleshooting basic electrical/electronic issues
Work with electrical panels, wiring, circuits, and electronic components
Travel to project or site locations as required
Maintain reports, records, and documentation
Follow safety standards and company procedures


Required Skills & Qualifications:


DAE in Electrical or Electronics (Fresh candidates encouraged to apply)
Candidates must be based in 
Lahore
Internship Duration: 
3 to 6 months
Willingness to travel as per job requirements
Basic understanding of electrical/electronic systems
Eager to learn, hardworking, and passionate about the field
Good communication and teamwork skills


What We Offer:


Practical, hands-on learning experience
Guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals
Professional and supportive work environment
Opportunity for future employment based on performance

title: Project Management Intern (January 2026)
description:
About BeeX


BeeX is building the world's most advanced Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (HAUVs).


BeeX specialises in providing autonomous robotics solutions to safeguard underwater infrastructure in the maritime, energy and defense sectors, reducing over 90% of carbon emissions. We are pioneering Autonomous Robotics-as-a-Service (ARaaS) on a global scale, supported by decades of operational experiences in harsh waters. With unprecedented efficiency, we strive to provide our customers with a one-point solution for asset integrity management -- protecting assets they value, making sure they stay safe.


Why Join Now

The industries we serve need new ways to overcome their current challenges, and BeeX sees the opportunity in delivering exactly that, right now. Creating anything new is very hard, and we need outstanding people.


At BeeX, everyone is dependent; united by enthusiasm for bold innovation. Our multi-disciplinary team thrives in dynamic environments, driving transformative advancements globally. Join us to make a meaningful impact on the world!


Your Role


Your Role as a 
Business Operations Intern ‚Äì Project Management
 exposes you to all the Business and Operational aspects of a deep-tech startup. This is a broad role that drives Business Growth through pre-project engagement and research, project execution and post-project support.


You will work directly in touch with the Business and Operations Teams, reporting to the Project Engineer. In this role, you will also work with the management team. 



Job Scope




Assist      the Project Manager in project preparation, execution, and close out, to      ensure that project is delivered on time, within budget, and with high      quality.


Facilitate      internal and external stakeholders‚Äô coordination, assist in tracking      project progress and status update, maintain good quality of documentation      and reporting.


Support      the Operations Team by allocating resources required for project execution      and manage external vendors.


 Opportunity to handle mini project (with      PM supervision) 


Support      and potentially lead initiatives to improve operational      excellence, from ideation to rollout


Assist      the Business Team to ensure smooth revenue generation, through pre and      post-project support to our customers




Good to have:


Background in a generic engineering discipline
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Microsoft Office, Jira, Asana, Trello, Notion, Monday.com).
Experience working on group projects, student clubs, or events in a coordinating role.
Basic understanding of project management concepts (e.g., timelines, risks, stakeholders).
Interest in Maritime Robotics


What our interns can get 
uniquely from BeeX:




Experience      the sea life, and potentially discover underwater ‚Äútreasures‚Äù


Go      to secret places that 90% of population never gets to know about


Learn      how a deep-tech startup grows in Singapore and export globally




You will enjoy this job if you:




Are      curious and always thinking of how to make something better


Want      to grow your skillsets in fast-paced start-up environment


Have      a positive learning mindset, and can quickly absorb knowledge to overcome      challenges


Enjoy      written and verbal communications


Like      to work collaboratively with team members in other sub-teams


Can      assess risk and make time-critical decisions/tradeoffs in imperfect      scenarios




Desired Qualities




Excellent      written and verbal communication skills 


Strong      organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects      simultaneously.


Self-directed      learner, able to work well in a team and independently 


Currently      enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Business -      Operations, or related field

title: Data Scientist - Internship /Apprenticeship F/M
description:
Work authorization:
 You must already have the right to work in France for the duration of the program. 
Sponsorship of work permits/visas is not available for this role.




WE ARE BETCLIC‚ÄØ
üéØ
 


Betclic, European leader in sports betting, is much more than just an online gaming site! Also offering Poker, Horse Racing, and Casino games across various countries and continents, it is an inspiring and forward-thinking company: every day brings new challenges in a modern and dynamic environment. As an influential player in the tech industry, with strong and sustained growth over the years, we believe in innovation through diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone to reach their full potential. With our multicultural team, we provide an optimal, safe and responsible gaming experience, powered by cutting-edge technology. 




WHY JOIN US?‚ÄØ
üöÄ
 


At Betclic, success comes from passionate and committed teams. Here‚Äôs why you‚Äôll love working with us: 


üí°An international and creative environment where every project is an opportunity to innovate 


üìàHypergrowth that brings new challenges and development opportunities every day 


üè°A healthy work-life balance: flexible remote work and workplace well-being are essential pillars for us. 


üåüA unique and friendly atmosphere, with 1,600 employees across 5 countries and our headquarters in Bordeaux 


Are you passionate about sports and tech? Join us and help shape the future of online gaming! 




ENTER THE GAME
 


We are looking for ambitious and creative minds to push the boundaries of Data Science at Betclic. 


Our Data team has already reached a high level of maturity: dozens of models and solutions are running live in production, powering our application and shaping decisions across every department of the company. This is your chance to join a team where Data is not a side support, but a real game changer at the heart of our product. 


You will be part of a squad of 9 passionate Data Scientists, working closely with Data Engineers, Product Owners, Data Analysts and MLOps experts. Together, we build, scale and maintain cutting-edge data products that directly impact millions of users. 




YOUR ROLE WITHIN BETCLIC
 


As a Data Science Intern at Betclic, you will have the opportunity to contribute to some of our most impactful projects. You will work on real-world challenges where advanced modeling meets business needs, with a strong focus on interpretability and clear communication of results. 


Your missions will include: 


Experimenting with 
recommendation systems
 to improve personalization in our Sport and Casino apps, while ensuring that models remain interpretable and actionable for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 


Exploring 
forecasting approaches
 to better understand and anticipate the impact of the sports calendar, helping business teams plan and optimize key decisions. 


Developing and testing models for 
customer Lifetime Value (LTV) prediction
, providing insights that support acquisition, retention and more. 


Collaborating with Data Scientists, Product Owners and business teams to align models with operational needs and ensure results drive measurable impact. 


This internship will give you the chance to explore a variety of topics in applied Machine Learning, while contributing to projects with direct business relevance. 




 


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 
We are looking for curious, passionate and collaborative people who enjoy solving problems and working in a dynamic environment. This internship is for you if you: 


You are currently enrolled in or have recently completed a Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field, and are looking for either a 
final-year internship
, a 
gap-year internship
, or an 
apprenticeship
 to further develop your skills. 


Have strong analytical skills, with rigor, autonomy, and the ability to synthesize insights. 


Are proficient in 
Python
 and have a good understanding of 
SQL
. 


Want to grow your skills in communication and presentation, making complex models easy to understand. 


Nice to 
have: 


Previous exposure to recommendation systems, forecasting, or customer analytics (e.g., LTV modeling). 


Familiarity with libraries such as XGBoost, LightGBM, or deep learning frameworks. 


An interest in sports or gaming industries is appreciated, but not required. 




WHAT ARE THE RECRUITMENT STEPS?
 


If your application is selected, Joe will contact you within a week for a short HR pre-screening (15 minutes). You will then meet your future supervisor and our Chief Data Officer (CDO), Iouri. Finally, you will have a closing HR interview to officially welcome you. To provide the best candidate experience, the Betclic recruitment process usually takes 4 to 6 weeks.

title: Junior Arhitect ‚Äì with Revit
Junior Finance Administrator
description:
Nice to meet you! I‚Äôm 
Shweta Malhotra,
 a Talent Partner at LeadDesk. Together with manager
 Samu Ruikka
, our Invoicing Team Lead we‚Äôre strengthening our Finance team in Helsinki, Finland


We‚Äôre now looking for a 
Junior Finance Administrator 
with focus on events to join LeadDesk on a 
fixed-term basis (maternity cover)


What‚Äôs in it for you‚ÄØ


You'll be working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with our strategic vision.‚ÄØ 
Opportunity to enhance your product management skills and advance your career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.‚ÄØ 
Flexible office hours and a hybrid work model: Enjoy a mix of remote and onsite work (3 days a week) at our Helsinki office.‚ÄØ 
Join a publicly listed SaaS company that develops its own technology and is committed to innovation.‚ÄØ 
Experience a truly international work environment, collaborating with talented colleagues from 27 nationalities across 8 countries in a multicultural and diverse setting.‚ÄØ


What you can expect as a Junior Finance Administrator at LeadDesk 
 


Assist with monthly invoicing processes and related documentation
Reconciling the payments
Close collaboration with the finance teams
Manage and resolve day-to-day ticketing tasks and customer requests
Assist with debt collection processes


This is where the match happens 
 


Must-haves 
 


Recent graduate or having 1 or 1+ years of experience from a similar position 
Problem solving skills 
IT Skills (MS Office)
Pays attention to details and execute tasks with a high-level of quality and accuracy
Communicate fluently in 
English and Finnish 
(written and spoken)
Ability to work effectively in a team and independently.


Nice-to-haves 
 


Understanding of the processes
Adaptability to changes or new processes


Practicalities

title: Summer Intern 2026, The Bowery Presents
description:
Summer Intern ‚Äì The Bowery Presents

For more than 20 years, AEG has played a pivotal role in transforming sports and live entertainment. Annually, we host more than 160 million guests, promote more than 10,000 shows and present more than 22,000 events around the world. We are committed to innovation, artistry, and community, and leverage the power of our 300+ venues, leading sports franchises, marquee music brands, integrated entertainment districts, premier ticketing platform and global sponsorship activations, to create memorable moments that give the world reason to cheer.

Our business is interwoven with the human mind and heart, and we strive to build a diverse and inclusive company that reflects the artists, athletes, and fans that we host; reach beyond traditional boundaries to support the communities in which we operate; and minimize our impact on the environment by adopting sustainable practices throughout our business operations.

If you want to be challenged to up your game and make a difference, then join us in giving the world reason to cheer!

The Bowery Presents, an AEG Presents company, is the leading East Coast concert promoter, whose mission is to bring the best artists to New York City, Boston, Philadelphia and beyond while providing an excellent concert experience for both fans and artists. Since its inception, The Bowery Presents has been a purveyor of true artist development and consistently strives to work with artists like LCD Soundsystem, Maggie Rogers, Gary Clark Jr., Khruangbin, Leon Bridges and Lake Street Dive to grow from performing in intimate clubs to performing in sold-out arenas. As a trusted industry tastemaker, The Bowery Presents produces dynamic entertainment experiences at dozens of venues nationally, presenting thousands of shows annually.

Job Summary:

This Intern position will rotate between various departments to gain operational knowledge of AEG Presents Sponsorship, Marketing, Ticketing, Venue Operations, and Booking for a 8-week program. This is a part-time paid opportunity for undergraduate students.

Essential Functions:

  • Interns will rotate among several departments. Participating departments may include Office Administration, Global Partnerships, Marketing, Ticketing, Venue Operations, Booking, Sponsorship and Production.
  • Interns will shadow and assist various department and perform tasks assigned by department liaisons. Assigned tasks can include, but are not limited to, socials and ad packs, show advancement, load-in and sound check.
  • Interns must complete an activity per rotation. Activities can include but are not limited to attending a show, attending load-in, shadowing in the box office, and/or attending soundcheck.
  • Interns will work on preparing an end of semester presentation to the Department Liaisons and/or Human Resources Representative on a relevant topic of their choosing.
  • Sets realistic goals and is willing to work closely with department supervisors to reach those goals utilizing the Internship Goals & Objectives form.

Required Qualifications:

  • A minimum education level of: High School Diploma or its equivalency
  • Currently enrolled in undergraduate program as a Rising Junior or Rising Senior (of Fall 2026)
  • Years of related work experience: 0-1
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly organized, detail oriented and able to manage multiple priorities and projects at once
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build and cultivate relationships
  • Team players that are enthusiastic and committed to the work.
  • Demonstrates strong interest in music industry and music business.
  • Must be fully capable and proficient in Microsoft Office/Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
  • Regular attendance and hours in conformance with the standards, which may be established by AEG from time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Due to the cyclical nature of the entertainment industry, the employee may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the company including working event nights and event weekends

Benefit:

  • Work on increasingly challenging and engaging real-world projects
  • Gain hands-on experience in event planning, marketing initiatives, and business administration
  • Collaborate with experienced sales and activation professionals
  • Work closely with experienced team members who coach and provide mentorship
  • Attend meetings, events, and other networking opportunities

Intern Perks:

  • Corporate networking
  • Resume review
  • Attend meetings, events, games, and other networking opportunities

 

Pay Scale: $19.76 

Location: New York, NY (On-site)

Bonus: This position is Not eligible for a bonus under the current bonus plan requirements.

Benefits: Part-time: This position may be eligible for benefits (ACA qualification).

AEG reserves the right to change or modify the employee‚Äôs job description whether orally or in writing, at any time during the employment relationship.  AEG may require an employee to perform duties outside their normal description.

AEG's policy is to hire the most qualified applicants, and we comply with all applicable federal, state and local employment laws in making hiring and employee decisions.  We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, marital status, disability, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, veteran status, or any other legally protected status recognized by applicable federal, state or local law.

Employer does not offer work visa sponsorship for this position.

title: Bridge Design Internship
description:
Simply Put, A Great Place to Work

Benesch is a growing, multi-disciplined planning, engineering, and professional services firm. We enhance infrastructure and communities across the country ‚Äì creating spaces and providing connections in ways that make a difference.

We pride ourselves on being nimble enough to remain responsive to client needs yet large enough to offer exceptional bench strength. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have an opportunity to draw from those resources when you need them and, likewise, contribute your expertise when you have something to share.

At Benesch, we are looking for candidates with varied backgrounds and worldviews. We are committed to offering an inclusive work environment where everyone feels valued and respected. Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for a position if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications. If this statement resonates with you, don‚Äôt be so hard on yourself‚Äîapply for the job!

Structural/Bridge Design Intern

Benesch is seeking a motivated Structural/Bridge Engineering Intern to join our Railroad team. This role will involve applying structural engineering techniques to support the design and construction of bridges, retaining walls, culverts, and other structures for highway, rail, and transit clients. As an intern, you will have the chance to collaborate on real-world railway and transit projects, gaining hands-on experience in design, development, and project execution. You will support senior engineers, contribute to design processes, and play an integral role in innovative transportation solutions. 

Location 

This position offers a hybrid work schedule with the flexibility to work from the following offices that host a Railroad-Bridge team: Portland, ME, Cincinnati, OH.  This allows you to benefit from mentorship by professionals in the office during your internship at Benesch!

Benesch‚Äôs Railroad Division is made up of highly skilled rail professionals, many of whom are former employees of operating railroads. This firsthand experience working on designing and maintaining active rail systems uniquely equips our team to develop innovative solutions to a wide variety of rail projects. 

The Impact You Will Have

  • Assist in structural analysis and design for bridges, retaining walls, and culverts.
  • Perform AASHTO and AREMA bridge design calculations.
  • Develop geometric layouts, structural details, and load rating calculations.
  • Contribute to CADD plan production and quantity development using specialized software (e.g., LARSA, MathCAD, LEAPBridge, LPile, FB MultiPier, MicroStation).
  • Support occasional bridge inspections for in-service or construction projects.
  • Collaborate with Licensed Structural and Professional Engineers on local and national projects.

What You Will Need

  • Pursuing your BS in Civil or Structural Engineering or in a related engineering curriculum required
  • Knowledge of structural analysis software and CAD design tools.
  • Interest in bridge structures is preferred.
  • Ability to perform complex analysis and design
  • Strong problem-solving, communication, and Microsoft Office skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment  #LI-ML1

Explore the Benefits of Working at Benesch! 

At Benesch, we prioritize the health and wellness of our employees, understanding that their well-being is crucial for both personal and professional success. We offer a range of benefits for eligible employees, including insurance, retirement plans, and wellness programs. Future Internship Opportunities

Benesch‚Äôs internship program is designed to give you real-world experience while helping you grow your technical and professional skills. You'll collaborate with industry experts on real projects supported by comprehensive training and resources.

At Benesch, our commitment to innovation and collaboration extends beyond our projects. We believe in nurturing talent from the ground up, making it a core part of our values. As a Landscape Architecture Design Intern, you will gain hands-on experience supporting landscape architecture projects' planning, design, and presentation. You will work closely with our Design Team, assisting with drafting, rendering, site surveys, and client presentations, while supporting workflows in AutoCAD, Photoshop, 3D modeling programs, and other design tools.

Your role will include participating in site visits and walkthroughs to ensure project requirements are met, documenting project details, and supporting project teams with planning and design tasks. You will also maintain high-quality standards for all work, participate in departmental and training meetings, and adhere to all Benesch policies, procedures, and work standards, while learning the processes that make our projects successful.

Location

This role will be located at our Omaha, NE or Bellevue, NE office.

What We Are Looking For
  • Actively pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Landscape Architecture or a related design field
  • Understanding of landscape terminology, plant materials, and installation techniques
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD; moderate proficiency in Photoshop and 3D modeling programs
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to participate in site visits and travel to project locations as needed
  • Highly motivated, detail-oriented, and able to maintain high-quality standards in all work
  • Eagerness to learn from mentorship and actively contribute to real-world landscape architecture projects
Why Choose Benesch?

Our internships and co-op programs are crafted to develop well-rounded professionals who excel in challenging environments. You will gain hands-on experience and meaningful exposure by collaborating with industry experts and clients on real projects. Supported by comprehensive training and resources, our program is the perfect launchpad for your career!

Our early career professionals at Benesch are provided with resources to navigate the industry and advance their careers. As you grow with us, you will find rewarding opportunities featuring exciting projects, excellent benefits, and a vibrant company culture. We offer technical and essential skills training, access to industry-leading technology, and different paths/opportunities for career advancement in a supportive environment.

We service clients across numerous states and localities. You can have a direct impact where you live! If you‚Äôre open to relocation, let us know in your job application. We will review your resume and contact you with next steps.

Join us at Benesch, where your journey begins with endless possibilities!

title: Structural Engineering Internship
description:
Simply Put, A Great Place to Work

Benesch is a growing, multi-disciplined planning, engineering, and professional services firm. We enhance infrastructure and communities across the country ‚Äì creating spaces and providing connections in ways that make a difference.

We pride ourselves on being nimble enough to remain responsive to client needs yet large enough to offer exceptional bench strength. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have an opportunity to draw from those resources when you need them and, likewise, contribute your expertise when you have something to share.

At Benesch, we are looking for candidates with varied backgrounds and worldviews. We are committed to offering an inclusive work environment where everyone feels valued and respected. Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for a position if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications. If this statement resonates with you, don‚Äôt be so hard on yourself‚Äîapply for the job!

Structural Engineering Internship

At Benesch, our commitment to innovation and collaboration extends beyond our projects. We believe in nurturing talent from the ground up, making it a core part of our values. Whether you‚Äôre seeking your first internship or ready for the next step in your budding career, Benesch is hiring individuals to join our dynamic teams across the country! 

Work alongside Benesch‚Äôs Bridge and Structural Engineering Professionals dedicated to delivering innovative solutions to transportation challenges. As a Bridge & Structures Intern, you will support conventional and complex bridge and structure design, load ratings, and bridge inspections. You will gain hands-on experience contributing to design, analysis, and field tasks while learning directly from experienced engineers.

Location

This internship will be based in our Lincoln, NE office, with opportunities to collaborate on active projects and receive mentorship from Project Engineers and Project Managers.

What We Are Looking For
  • Pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET-accredited university, focusing on structures
  • Master‚Äôs degree in Civil Engineering with a structural focus (or plans to obtain within 2 years) preferred
  • Strong interest in bridge and structural engineering
  • Excellent analytical, technical, and communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Familiarity with AASHTO, IDOT, and ISTHA design and construction standards preferred
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • Strong organizational and problem-solving skills

#LI-Ag1

#LI-AG1

Explore the Benefits of Working at Benesch! 

At Benesch, we prioritize the health and wellness of our employees, understanding that their well-being is crucial for both personal and professional success. We offer a range of benefits for eligible employees, including insurance, retirement plans, and wellness programs. Our Total Rewards package is designed to support a healthy lifestyle and can be customized to meet the needs of our employees and their families. Click here to learn more about some of the benefits of working at Benesch! 

Professional Development 
  • Opportunities for management and leadership development at all levels, including executive coaching and leadership development for Team Leaders, Group Managers, Division Managers, and Executive Leaders
  • Tuition reimbursement for job-related courses
  • Ongoing professional development through resources like Red Vector, LinkedIn Learning, technical team meetings, knowledge-sharing training sessions 
  • Personalized training and career development plans with your manager
  • Funding for training, committee work, professional organization memberships, and licenses/certifications
  • Support for active participation in professional organizations to foster leadership and community engagement
Retirement Benefits 
  • Access to valuable retirement planning tools, education, and individual meetings with plan advisors at no charge
  • Potential for Benesch to contribute up to 9% of your gross compensation to your retirement plan (5% profit-sharing contribution to your 401(k) plan, regardless of your own contributions & 80% match on your contributions, up to a maximum company contribution of 4%)
Work/Life Balance 
  • Flexible work schedules and hours, including work-from-home options (dependent on the role)

Employee Engagement

Join our employee resource groups and committees to enhance your work-life balance and contribute to our community-focused initiatives. title: Junior Level 3 Support Analyst
description:
At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators focused on optimizing business decision-making through our leading AI-infused scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market.

What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers‚Äô success and to our Winning Culture.

Our customers rank among the who‚Äôs who in the Fortune 50. Coca-Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies who rely on our best-in-class platform.

Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals, and we love celebrating our wins ‚Äì big and small.

Supported by operating principles of being strategy-led, values-based and disciplined in execution, you‚Äôll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and let‚Äôs build what‚Äôs next - together!

Anaplan is looking for a tenacious Support Analyst to join the Level 3 team based in Minneapolis, MN, on a full-time basis. You will be expected to be in the office at least two days per week. This is an amazing opportunity to learn about the Anaplan product from a technical standpoint and understand what needs changing whilst working with our most important customers.

Your Impact

Level 3 Support investigates and diagnoses complex problems reported by Anaplan customers. Any issues that require in-depth knowledge of the product or an investigation into the logging or back-end of the system will be dealt with by Level 3. The range of issues is diverse and can vary from front-end client or UI issues to modeling or server problems to platform or network performance.

As a Junior L3 Support Analyst, you'll gain detailed product knowledge, work with large volumes of data, and work with multiple teams, including Engineering, Product, Operations, Customer Success, and Customer Support, to ensure that the customer issue is resolved quickly and thoroughly.

Level 3 exists to resolve challenges, which means priorities change on a daily and even hourly basis. Therefore, your focus may need to be frequently shifted, and you'll need to understand what's important to the customer and internal teams.

On a day-to-day basis, you will be working on:

  • Investigating complex issues raised by users
  • Communicating the progress of issues/fixes to both technical and non-technical users
  • Using your problem-solving and creativity to derive solutions where needed for users
  • Guiding users through sophisticated solutions
  • Detailing investigations of new issues
  • Prioritising customer cases within your queue
  • Raising bugs where appropriate
  • Onboarding new features and changes to the Support Teams

Your qualifications

  • Graduate or early-career analyst working with data analytics tools / Excel
  • Degree in Mathematics, Physics, Electronic Engineering, or Computer Science (or similar degree using large and complex data sets)
  • Quick learner with a desire to understand sophisticated systems and software behavior
  • Genuine passion for problem-solving and persistence when vital
  • Analytical skills with a methodical approach
  • Ability to work under time constraints within an exciting environment
  • Ability to switch focus as priorities change
  • Good communication skills with the ability to convey technical information clearly
Base Salary Range:
$60,000—$86,000 USD

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion‚ÄØand Belonging (DEIB)

We believe attracting and retaining the best talent and fostering an inclusive culture strengthens our business. DEIB improves our workforce, enhances trust with our partners and customers, and drives business success. Build your career in a place where diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging aren‚Äôt just words on paper ‚Äì this is what drives our innovation, it‚Äôs how we connect, and it contributes to what makes us a market leader. We believe in a hiring and working environment where all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day!‚ÄØ

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.‚ÄØ 

Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer‚ÄØ 

It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondence, claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Anaplan does not:‚ÄØ 

  • Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
  • Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible and then followed up via written communication.‚ÄØ 

All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Anaplan, please send an email to people@anaplan.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

title: Junior Application Engineer
description:
About Applied Intuition

Applied Intuition, Inc. is powering the future of physical AI. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion, the Silicon Valley company is creating the digital infrastructure needed to bring intelligence to every moving machine on the planet. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining and agriculture industries in three core areas: tools and infrastructure, operating systems, and autonomy. Eighteen of the top 20 global automakers, as well as the United States military and its allies, trust the company‚Äôs solutions to deliver physical intelligence. Applied Intuition is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with offices in Washington, D.C.; San Diego; Ft. Walton Beach, Florida; Ann Arbor, Michigan; London; Stuttgart; Munich; Stockholm; Bangalore; Seoul; and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.

We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.

Meet the Application Engineers!

Our Application Engineers act as the glue between our customers and our engineering teams. They are responsible for customer success and drive impact with high-priority customer engagements ‚Äì hear from them on what life is like at Applied Intuition and what makes their roles so exciting!
 

About the role

We are looking for bright engineers interested in helping our customers solve complex technical issues related to Applied‚Äôs products. Our Application Engineers have a unique mix of software expertise, domain knowledge, and execution driven mindset. Using these skills, our engineers work closely with autonomy developers to ensure that Applied‚Äôs products are providing maximum impact to advance customers autonomy initiatives. This is an important role for the company bringing together our product and engineering expertise with our customer-centric culture.

Responsible for: Office hours, Level 1 support, Bug reports, Feature requests, TPMing customer issues

Check out what a typical day would look like as an Application Engineer here!

At Applied Intuition, you will:

  • Run office hours and first line support for customers
  • Manage requests from customer teams to ensure they are getting maximum value from Applied‚Äôs products
  • Lead workstreams to support groups of users in customer engagements

We're looking for someone who has:

  • Just finished their Master‚Äôs degree in Robotics, Autonomy or a similar program
  • Experience in interacting with end-customers as an application engineer or a developer
  • An acute attention to detail and an execution focused mindset
  • Strong communication skills and focus on solving customer problems
  • Proficiency in debugging and working with Python/C++/Linux
  • Experience in QA and wants to grow their customer facing and engineering skills
  • Strong communication skills and focus on solving customer problems

Nice to have:

  • Experience working with automotive OEMs or suppliers (through student jobs, thesis, internships)
  • Prior work in autonomous vehicle or robotics development domains
  • Prior work in software simulation or data tooling

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Software Engineer with some experience in software engineering. Whether you‚Äôd like to join a product team (web and desktop) or mobile (Android) we provide an extraordinary opportunity of growth thanks to our internal boot camps and mentorship programs.  You will work with a world-class team of engineers on building software that is here to revolutionize the way we work. We are looking for big thinkers and innovators to take on the problem space and deliver elegant solutions.

This role is based in our Warsaw office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays. Working from home on Fridays depends on the type of work you do and the teams with which you partner. If you're interviewing for this role, your recruiter will share more about the in-office requirements.

Our employees in Poland are employed under a contract of employment.

What you‚Äôll achieve

  • Produce high-quality design and code to build our features
  • Drive impactful projects from inception to completion within Asana, balancing engineering craftsmanship, execution, and stakeholder alignment
  • Utilize strong accountability, self-motivation, and collaborative skills to deliver results efficiently 
  • Promote solid engineering and operational practices through code reviews and mentorship
  • Support design reviews, communicate constraints, and assist engineers in making informed trade-offs
  • Contribute to and strategize the future of our product

About you

  • Graduate of a Technical University in Computer Science or related fields, like Mathematics, Physics etc.
  • 1+ years of experience in software engineering (either commercial or gained through internships)
  • Experience with relational and non-relational databases, familiarity with AWS
  • Excellent communication skills for collaborating with cross-functional partners (e.g. PM, design) and cross-timezone with partner teams
  • Sound autonomous judgment when balancing moving quickly with producing quality, long-term maintainable code
  • Demonstrated curiosity about AI tools and emerging technologies, with a willingness to learn and leverage them to enhance productivity, collaboration, or decision-making

At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

What we‚Äôll offer

  • Generous, transparent and fair compensation system
  • Contract of Employment (and the option of  50% tax deductible costs for author‚Äôs rights usage in respect of  applicable roles) 
  • Health insurance with dental and travel coverage (Lux Med) 
  • Meals reimbursement on the days that you work from the office
  • Career growth budget 
  • Home office setup budget 
  • Gym/Fitness reimbursement
  • Fertility healthcare and family-forming support with Carrot
  • Mental Health Support in Modern Health
  • Group life insurance
  • MacBooks with all necessary accessories

For this role, the estimated base salary range is between 19 688 PLN - 23 400 PLN gross per month (subject to all taxes and necessary deductions) . The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed range above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.

In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity and sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.

#LI-Hybrid #LI-AZ

About us

Asana is a leading platform for human + AI collaboration. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named to Fortune's Best Workplaces for 7+ years and recognized by Fast Company, Forbes, and Gartner for excellence in workplace culture and innovation. We offer an exceptional office-centric culture while adopting the best elements of hybrid models to ensure that every one of our global team members can work together effortlessly. With 13+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.

Join Asana‚Äôs Talent Network to stay up to date on job opportunities and life at Asana.

title: Want to be considered for future INTERNSHIPS ?
description:
Axogen is committed to building and maintaining a strong and gratifying company culture that fosters professional growth. Our hands-on and personal approach makes transitioning to a new job a seamless and enjoyable process. Most benefits are effective on day one!  

Axogen is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, age, sex, marital status, national origin, disability or veteran status. 

 Why you‚Äôll love working at Axogen: 

  • Friendly, open, and fun team culture that values unique perspectives 
  • Company-wide dedication to profoundly impacting patients‚Äô lives 
  • Comprehensive, high-quality benefits package effective on date of hire 
  • Educational assistance available for all employees 
  • Matching 401(k) retirement plan 
  • Paid holidays, including floating holidays, to be used at your discretion 
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan 
  • Referral incentive program 

Axogen Mission and Business Purpose

Our business purpose is to restore health and improve quality of life by making restoration of peripheral nerve function an expected standard of care. We aim to lead the markets we serve by always requiring the solutions we offer patients and caregivers provide an improved benefit-to-risk profile as compared to existing standards of care. To ensure we deliver improved benefit-to-risk solutions, we will guide and expect the market and design requirement specifications underlying our engineering, business development, and clinical research activities, objectively target advancements in standards of care.

If you do not see a suitable internship available, please upload a resume and tell us a little bit about yourself.

We will add you to our Talent Community so that when the next great internship opens up, we know where to find you!

Thanks for your interest in Axogen, we appreciate you!

 

#DNPAJE

Axogen follows healthcare system guidelines with respect to credentialing, vaccinations and other employment/compliance related requirements, as well as CDC guidance. Axogen reserves the right to amend its policies from time to time in its sole discretion.
