title: Junior SEO/GEO Consultant
description:
DEPT¬Æ is a Growth Invention company built to help the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands grow faster. Operating at the intersection of technology and marketing, our 4,000+ specialists deliver growth invention services across Brand & Media, Experience, Commerce, CRM, and Technology & Data. We‚Äôre 50|50 tech and marketing, partner-led, and first to move. Clients include Google, Lufthansa, Meta, eBay, and OpenAI. We have been certified B Corp and Climate Neutral since 2021.

JOB PURPOSE

This position sits in our Creative & Media team based in London. We combine data, technology, creative content, and paid media to crack brands‚Äô business problems & drive revenue through innovative digital marketing solutions. We plan, create and execute a variety of world class campaigns, from culture lead, social first content to award-winning integrated creative campaigns that have been built from data lead strategies and insights. Our clients include Just Eat Takeaway, Victoria's Secret, TikTok, The White Company, Meta, Pepsico, EasyJet and many more. 

Here at DEPT¬Æ, we are proud of the award winning, creative campaigns and content that we produce for a range of exciting and well known brands and we believe that our Media Team is pivotal in the success of those campaigns. Our Media Team is made up of both paid and organic media specialists and we are looking for a new Junior SEO/GEO Specialist to join the team to service an exciting new client.

Joining this team means that you will become part of our growing UK & Ireland team, and our wider EMEA SEO team which spans a number of offices across Europe. Our EMEA SEO team, which consists of 40+ specialists, empowers clients to develop and grow their online businesses through organic search in all its shapes and forms. You will go beyond simply executing SEO tasks; together with more experienced consultants, you will function as a strategic advisor to our clients by understanding their needs and proposing hands-on solutions.

This role requires a strong foundation and interest in SEO (and GEO), along with solid execution skills and a results-oriented approach. The ideal candidate effectively applies existing knowledge to support the team in solving practical, less-defined tasks and must be capable of providing clear input to both colleagues and clients. A strong focus on continuous learning and expanding expertise is essential. The candidate is expected to deliver operational work of excellent quality. Furthermore, the ability to communicate clearly and proactively is a core requirement.

As an SEO/GEO Specialist, you are a true expert when it comes to improving the organic visibility of brands online, and have an interest in optimising content for AI models (LLMs). You will work with the SEO/GEO Lead on projects from start to finish. Based on data and with the help of multiple tools, you will help create, analyse and implement long-term SEO strategies to ensure our clients are being serviced as effectively as possible.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

  • Contribute to SEO/GEO projects from planning through delivery, collaborating with clients and internal teams
  • Assist in developing long-term SEO (and GEO) strategies to support client growth
  • Conduct technical, content, and authority analyses with guidance from senior team members
  • Help set up implementation plans and workflows for clients and internal projects
  • Respond to internal and external briefs with clear, actionable input
  • Support reporting on SEO (and GEO) activity (weekly, monthly, quarterly)
  • Deliver work to a high standard and meet agreed deadlines
  • Share ideas and contribute to the team‚Äôs creative process
  • Present work and updates internally and, when needed, externally

WHAT YOU BRING

  • At least 2 years of hands-on experience with SEO, ideally from an agency or through personal web projects
  • Experience using SEO tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Moz, or Semrush
  • Strong understanding of SEO basics, with interest in broader digital marketing (including paid media)
  • Experience using AI search tools such as Profound, Peec.aI, Scrunch or similar to measure AI visibility
  • Basic understanding of social media platforms, social search (TikTok and Instagram SEO) or experience optimising social content for organic discovery.
  • Comfortable working in an international environment and are motivated to build expertise in SEO, GEO and beyond
  • Comfortable working with Excel/Google Sheets, Word/Google Docs, PowerPoint/ Google Slides, and Google Looker Studio or equivalent
  • Analytical, detail-oriented, and eager to learn, while also being proactive and communicative
  • Strong organisational skills and ability to manage time effectively
  • Confident in preparing and delivering presentations
  • Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment

WE OFFER

  • A flexible, hybrid working policy
  • The choice of medical healthcare providers (Bupa or Medicash) 
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays and your birthday off each year
  • Company pension scheme 
  • EAP scheme
  • Ride to work scheme 
  • Enhanced family friendly policies
  • Buddy Program: You will be paired with a ‚ÄòBuddy‚Äô to help you through your first weeks‚Äô at DEPT¬Æ.
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT¬Æ has been a Certified B Corp¬Æ since 2021 and named ‚ÄòAgency of the Year‚Äô at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards.
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global ‚Äî at DEPT¬Æ you‚Äôll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries. And we celebrate all of our successes together!
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training, development and certifications.
  • Global annual DEPT¬Æ Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.

WHY DEPT¬Æ?

We are a Growth Invention company built to help the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands grow faster. Operating at the intersection of technology and marketing, we create what is next by pioneering ideas, acting fast, and moving further because standing still just is not in our DNA.

We are drawn to people who stay curious, move with intent, and never stop inventing. Our culture runs on three values: better together, relentlessly curious, and get sh*t done. It is how we work, how we grow, and how we make things that matter.

At DEPT¬Æ, you will find the freedom to explore, the space to collaborate, and the trust to make a real impact for our clients, for each other, and for the world we are helping to build.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION 

At DEPT¬Æ, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

title: Cash Collection Internship
description:
Join our Movement and Champion Restaurant Culture! üíö

At TheFork we believe that the best things in life happen around the table. 
As the leading restaurant booking platform in Europe, we connect the broadest community of loyal diners with the world‚Äôs favorite restaurants. Powered by innovation and a deep passion for the restaurant industry, we create unique dining experiences across 11 countries.

We‚Äôre part of the Tripadvisor Group and proud to be building a diverse, people-first culture where ‚Äúrespect‚Äù, ‚Äúownership‚Äù, ‚Äúgrowth‚Äù and ‚Äúbetter together‚Äù values thrive.
If you‚Äôre passionate about food, technology, and making a real impact, your seat at the table is ready.

üëâ Discover life at TheFork

What you will do:

Reporting to the Associate Director of Revenue Operations, you will play a key role in a high‚Äëimpact special project in collaboration with our Legal Team. In this role, you will:

  • Manage and upload contracts from our target restaurant partners with precision and accuracy.
  • Support operational and legal processes by performing manual tasks that require exceptional attention to detail and consistency.
  • Review and analyze client account statements to accurately determine financial allocations.
  • Compile and deliver comprehensive documentation on the Italian electronic invoicing system.
  • Adapt and replicate project processes for implementation in other countries.
  • Serve as the primary liaison with our external legal counsel, providing prompt and effective assistance with their inquiries.

 
Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in Grado Medio or Superior, preferably in a field such as Administration, Business, Finance, Economics, or a related discipline.
  • Knowledge in Excel and Google Sheets.
  • Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal in English. Other European languages are a plus.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
  • Interest in cash collection, accounting, compliance, or process optimization.

What we offer you  

üòÑ An awesome team 

‚öñÔ∏è Flexible working environment  (2 days home office per week)

üí∏ Competitive salary

üçï Lunch vouchers available for each working day

üåé International teams and a multicultural environment spanning 10 offices across Europe

ü§ùHighly inclusive working environment  

üç¥ Amazing offices with dining, a coffee point on each floor, and leisure area    

üé§ Team building events

 

We believe that we are better together, and we welcome you for who you are. We endeavor to ensure  that everyone - regardless of ability, age, socio-economic & cultural background, ethnicity, faith, gender, gender expression, gender identity, ideology, national origin, race, sexual orientation, marital status, or any characteristic protected under  applicable law -has the opportunity to reach their full potential. At TheFork, we want you to bring us your unique perspectives and experiences, so we can collectively continue disrupting the restaurant industry and go from good to great.

TheFork is committed to a fair recruitment process. If you have special needs and require reasonable support during your application,  interview, or participation in the selection process due to health conditions or disability, please direct your inquiries to AccessibleRecruitment@TheFork.com. Our HR team will review the request and respond accordingly

#LI-AD2

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
The Tripadvisor Group connects people to experiences worth sharing, and aims to be the world‚Äôs most trusted source for travel and experiences. We leverage our brands, technology, and capabilities to connect our global audience with partners through rich content, travel guidance, and two-sided marketplaces for experiences, accommodations, restaurants, and other travel categories. The subsidiaries of Tripadvisor, Inc. (Nasdaq: TRIP), include a portfolio of travel brands and businesses, including Tripadvisor, Viator, and TheFork.

The Tripadvisor Experiences Engineering team is distributed across Europe and is responsible for tripadvisorexperiences.com, the Tripadvisor Experiences mobile apps and all their supporting infrastructure. We run the systems that help operators build their businesses and those which enable third parties to utilise our inventory. We provide the tools which help our customer services team provide world class service to travellers and operators internationally.

About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Software Engineer I Backend Focus to join our fast-growing team. Tripadvisor Experiences is a remote first company. This role is open to candidates based in Oxford or London in the UK. We embrace flexibility in where and how work gets done and also value meaningful in-person moments to connect and collaborate. You can expect periodic in-person gatherings for team connection, planning, or other key moments.

At Tripadvisor Experiences our Engineers are versatile and enjoy working on a variety of technical challenges. This is a backend focused full-stack position in which you will be working mostly on the backend with some front end projects from time to time. While you need to be hungry to learn, you don't need to be an expert at front end development right away - we can teach that part on the job and you won't be tested on it in interviews.

Within Viator we have a fun and friendly environment where the key objective is getting things done. Working closely alongside product managers and designers, our engineers are part of the full process from software design, to code, to test, to deployment and back again. Most of our engineers release code to production every few days and we have a daily release cycle.

 

What You'll do

Viator‚Äôs web stack includes Java, React, TypeScript, GraphQL, Kubernetes, SQL and NoSQL databases, and runs on AWS. You don‚Äôt need experience with everything listed, but you must be eager to learn. You should have experience with a statically typed, object-oriented language such as Java, C#, or C++, and hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field.

 

What We Offer 

  • Competitive compensation packages (routinely benchmarked against the latest industry data), including base salary and annual bonuses
  • ‚ÄúWork your way‚Äù with flexibility to suit your lifestyle. Tripadvisor Group takes a remote-friendly approach to collaboration across a worldwide team, with the option to join on-site as often as you‚Äôd like or as required by your team.
  • Flexible schedule. Work-life balance is ingrained in our culture by design. Trust and accountability make it work.
  • Donation matching. Give back? Give more! We match qualifying charitable donations annually.
  • Tuition assistance. Want to level up your career? We love to hear it! Receive annual support for qualified programs.
  • Lifestyle benefit. An annual benefit to spend on yourself. Use it on travel, wellness, or whatever suits you.
  • Travel perks. We believe that travel is employee development, so we provide discounts and more.
  • Employee assistance program. We‚Äôre here for you with resources and programs to help you through life‚Äôs challenges.
  • Health benefits. We offer great coverage and competitive premiums.
  • Generous referral scheme. Help us grow and be rewarded with generous awards for referring successful candidates

 

Our Cultural Pillars:

Traveler first

We exist to create value for our customer, the traveler. We enable our suppliers and partners to unlock this value. Their collective behaviors and insights are what drives us. 

Execution is our edge

We act fast, experiment, learn from failure, iterate, and improve the solutions of tomorrow across every aspect of our business. Our execution is agile, data-driven, prioritised, and built to scale. We assume no problem is someone else‚Äôs problem and finish what can be done today, knowing tomorrow will bring fresh challenges. 

We succeed together

The best outcomes are driven by empathic, humble, and diverse subject matter experts working toward shared goals. We collaborate relentlessly, challenge assumptions, give actionable feedback, and set each other up for success through empowered teams with a clear charter. We transparently take ownership of our growth, individually and as a team. We celebrate the quality of our effort, our learnings, and our collective achievements

 Application process

  • 30 minute call with a recruiter to learn more about the role
  • 1 hour technical coding interview with someone from the Tripadvisor experiences Engineering team
  • Three one-hour interviews with members of the team, covering technical topics - including some coding - and what you would bring to Tripadvisor experiences.

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please make sure to reach out to your individual recruiter or our team at AccessibleRecruiting@tripadvisor.com.

If you have any additional questions about careers at Tripadvisor you can email us at recruitment@tripadvisor.com. We have all the answers!

 

#LI-SM1

#LI-Hybrid

title: Software Engineering Internship 2026
description:
Viator, a Tripadvisor company, is the leading marketplace for travel experiences. We believe that making memories is what travel is all about. And with 300,000+ travel experiences to explore‚Äîeverything from simple tours to extreme adventures (and all the niche, interesting stuff in between)‚Äîmaking memories that will last a lifetime has never been easier. With industry-leading flexibility and last-minute availability, it's never too late to make any day extraordinary. Viator. One app, 300,000+ travel experiences you‚Äôll remember.

A Tripadvisor internship provides real world experience as part of a world-class engineering team, along with an excellent salary and other perks. Several of our former interns have gone on to become full-time members of the Engineering team.

We have a fun and friendly environment where the key objective is getting things done. Our engineers input during every stage whilst delivering technical solutions, from design, to programming, testing, and deployment.

This internship is a 12 week program from 22nd June till 18th September and will require most days spent in our Lisbon office.

Across Tripadvisor, we‚Äôve worked hard to create an atmosphere of ‚ÄúSpeed Wins‚Äù ‚Äì streamlining processes, shipping products quickly, and avoiding big company paralysis. Tripavisor prides itself on being a bottom-up organisation. Engineers are given the freedom to investigate, implement, and own the solutions they formulate within their team. 

Do you want to build features end to end? Do you want to work with a large number of technologies? Do you want to work in an environment where things move quickly, features are released daily and you‚Äôre working with other smart and talented engineers? If this sounds like you, we would love to talk to you.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Code! Most of our engineers release code to production every few days. The majority of our services are continuously released with the others following a daily release cycle.
  • Real work! From day one, Tripadvisor interns work on the same tasks as our main Engineering team.
  • Learn! You‚Äôll be assigned a dedicated mentor and work alongside skilled engineers with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences.
  • Collaborate! We have engineering groups located around the world. We‚Äôre working with teams in the US, Portugal and Australia, as well as with third parties.
  • Operate across our evolving technology stack - Currently this includes Java, React, JavaScript, TypeScript, AWS, MySQL, GraphQL and more.
  • Take responsibility for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA, and maintenance.
  • Touch code at every level ‚Äì from the UI, through backend microservices, and down to the database.
  • Collaborate closely with Product and Design teams to define feature specifications and develop high quality deliverables for our customers.

What we‚Äôre looking for

  • Students with an anticipated graduation mid-2027, working towards a degree in Computer Science or a similar discipline. 
  • Availability to commit to the entire programs duration (with some paid time off)
  • Confidence in writing code in at least one object-oriented language.
  • Willingness and ability to take on new technologies. You do not need to have experience with all the technologies listed above, but you do need the drive to learn them.
  • Ability to break down complex problems into simple solutions.
  • Strong analytical skills and desire to write clean, correct, and efficient code.
  • High quality verbal and written communication skills.
  • A sense of ownership, urgency, and pride in your work.
  • People who can commit to the entire duration of the program
  • Full working rights for the duration of the internship

Our Values

We aspire to lead; We‚Äôre relentlessly curious;... want to know more? Read up on our values: 

  • We aspire to lead. Tap into your talent, ambition, and knowledge to bring us ‚Äì and you ‚Äì to new heights.
  • We‚Äôre relentlessly curious. We push beyond the usual, the known, the ‚Äúthat‚Äôs just how it‚Äôs done.‚Äù
  • We‚Äôre better together. We learn from, accept, respect, support, and value one another‚Äì and are creating something remarkable in the process.
  • We serve our customers, always. We listen, question, respond, and strive for wow moments.  

We strive for better, not perfect. We won‚Äôt get it right the first time ‚Äì or every time. We‚Äôll provide a safe environment in which to make mistakes, iterate, improve, and grow.

Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.

 

#LI-TM1

#Viator

title: Graduate Applied Science Intern
description:
About Us:

Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We‚Äôre always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, X and on our Blog.

About the Role

Twitch builds data-driven machine learning solutions across several rich problem spaces: Natural Language Processing (NLP), Recommendations, Search, Classification/Categorization, Anomaly Detection, Forecasting, Safety, and HCI/Social Computing/Computational Social Science. As an Intern, you will work with a dedicated Mentor and Manager on a project in one of these problem areas. You will also be supported by an Advisor and participate in cohort activities such as research teach backs and leadership talks. This position is located in San Francisco, CA. 

Want to learn more? Check out the Early Careers Page for internship and student-focused content.  

You Will:

  • Solve business problems involving large-scale data 
  • Design solutions for Twitch's problem spaces
  • Explore ML and data research

You Have:

  • Current enrollment in a North American-based graduate program and past research involving Computer Science, Machine learning, Data science, and related Statistics or mathematical problems.
  • The ability to write code in at least one programming language
  • A desire to work with other scientists and engineers

Perks

  • Housing Stipend provided 
  • Relocation assistance to and from San Francisco, CA
  • Free Snacks & Beverages
  • Flexible PTO

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $75.63hr in our lowest geographic market up to $75.63/hr in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Twitch is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Twitch values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

title: Graduate Data Science Intern
description:
About Us

Twitch is the world‚Äôs biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It is where thousands of communities come together for whatever, every day.

We‚Äôre about community, inside and out. You‚Äôll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We‚Äôre on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we‚Äôre up to on LinkedIn and Twitter,  and discover the projects we‚Äôre solving on our Blog. Be sure to explore our Interviewing Guide to learn how to ace our interview process.

About the Role

The Central Analytics team drives evidence-based decision-making throughout Twitch. As researchers and thought leaders, we leverage foundational data, sophisticated ML models and cornerstone analyses  to inform product strategy, guide business decisions, and unlock new capabilities. Our interdisciplinary team brings together experts in data science, machine learning, and user research to continuously innovate and improve the world's leading live-streaming platform.

Our team is seeking an exceptional intern with demonstrated proficiency in applying machine learning and statistical methods to extract valuable insights from complex data. We value creative problem-solvers who possess a strong analytical foundation and the communication skills necessary to thrive in a collaborative environment. Our problems cover many different aspects of user behavior on Twitch, from predictive modeling of onsite viewer engagement and commerce activity, to advanced fine-grained cohort analyses of user behavior and their evolution on Twitch. The ideal candidate possesses strong quantitative reasoning skills to design and implement data science workflows, identify key patterns within large datasets, apply appropriate statistical methods, and translate those findings into clear, actionable recommendations.

You Will:

  • Drive Twitch‚Äôs understanding of users and their activity through ownership of research projects from data collection to model development, estimation, and validation
  • Identify and pursue projects with significant business impact, and make compelling cases for prioritization and resource allocation.
  • Collaborate with specialists in data science, analytics, engineering, and economics disciplines to efficiently develop reliable and reproducible analyses at scale.
  • Deliver well-documented datasets, tools, and reports to key technical and business stakeholders.

You Have:

  • MS in data science, machine learning, computer science, statistics, or highly related field OR 2+ years experience on a data, research, or applied science team OR equivalent applied research experience
  • Adherence to good coding standards and working knowledge of SoTA machine learning techniques, including forecasting, time-series modeling, natural language processing (NLP)  and unsupervised learning. Fluency in data-science tools: Python, R, SQL, and associated AI/ML libraries.
  • Maintain proficiency with version control systems to ensure collaborative development and reproducibility
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills on quantitative topics
  • Keen judgment for balancing research depth and pacing

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity with Twitch/streaming 
  • Familiarity with generative AI (GenAI) tools 

Perks

  • Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Maternity & Parental Leave
  • Flexible PTO
  • Amazon Employee Discount

 Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. 

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. 

Job ID: TW8992

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $46.88/hr in our lowest geographic market up to $88.94/hr in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. 
 

Twitch is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Twitch values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

title: Junior Account Manager
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Junior Account Manager (m/w/d) 

Are you passionate about building strong relationships and driving meaningful growth through exceptional service? Do you have a proactive attitude, analytical mindset, and a talent for strategic thinking? If so, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Join our SMB Account Management Team and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing companies, shaping how we empower local communities across South Germany.

Role Background

The Account Management team is at the core of Wolt‚Äôs mission. As a Junior Account Manager, you‚Äôll play a vital role in helping our restaurant partners succeed on our platform. You‚Äôll learn the ins and outs of operations, marketing, logistics, and product - anything to unlock sustainable growth for your partners.

You‚Äôll gain hands-on experience working with cross-functional teams, such as Marketing, Operations, and Sales, as well as Senior Leadership, making this the perfect role to launch your career in at Wolt.

You‚Äôre excited about this opportunity because you will‚Ä¶

  • Build and manage relationships with key restaurant partners: Be the go-to person for your portfolio of partners, ensuring they feel supported and engaged.
  • Drive performance and growth: Use datapoints from various sources to identify opportunities to accelerate your partners‚Äô businesses, and improve the value of our platform.
  • Deliver outstanding partner experiences: Keep restaurant partners informed, engaged and happy utilizing various communication channels and in-person visits.
  • Promote Wolt‚Äôs services: Introduce partners to new features, campaigns, and services such as Wolt+, Ads, and Promotions.
  • Research and innovate: Stay ahead of market trends and propose initiatives to enhance Wolt‚Äôs value proposition.

What we offer

  • A centrally located office in Munich, next to S-Bahn
  • Independent work in a high-trust, dynamic, and diverse team
  • A fast-growing tech company with endless learning opportunities and career growth potential
  • Competitive salary, stock options and benefits, including discounts on Wolt orders
  • Modern work equipment and office perks (snacks, fruits, coffee, drinks etc.)
  • Flexible working hours, incl. Work-from-home days, 30 days of paid vacation
  • Deutschland ticket subsidy, Urban Sports Club membership discount, Corporate Benefits Account
  • Quarterly team events and regular opportunities to visit our Berlin head office

Our humble expectations

  • Fluent in German, conversational in English
  • 1+ years of experience in Account Mgmt, CRM, Sales, Project Mgmt, Consulting, Marketing or similar
  • Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong communication skills, with an ability to build trust and adapt to different audiences
  • Proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a problem-solving mindset
  • Basic proficiency in MS Excel/Google Sheets; familiarity with analytics tools is a plus

It‚Äôs a bonus if you have‚Ä¶

  • Knowledge or experience in the Food and Beverage, Hospitality, or Restaurant industry
  • Advanced skills in Excel/Google Sheets or Google Workspace
  • Experience using data visualization tools like Looker Dashboards

Ready to make an impact? Join us and help shape the future of Wolt in South Germany!

 

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. title: Logistics Intern (all)
description:
1NCE is a pioneering company at the forefront of reshaping the IoT connectivity landscape. As a key player in the industry, we are on a mission to change the telecoms/IoT landscape. With a focus on innovation, customer satisfaction and industry leadership, 1NCE is ready to change the system.


                            


                                To support the daily logistics and warehouse operations of the U.S. office, as well as general administrative and back-office activities. The role focuses on assisting with order processing, shipping coordination, and documentation tasks while gaining hands-on experience in an international logistics environment. This position is ideal for students in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or Business Administration who want to combine their academic knowledge with practical work experience in a global tech company.
Logistics & Warehouse Operations
Perform hands-on logistics tasks such as picking, packing, and preparing shipments for customers.
Create and check shipping documents (commercial invoices, packing lists, delivery notes, labels, etc.).
Receive and unpack incoming goods, verify quantities, and organize materials in the storage area.
Track shipments and maintain proper documentation to ensure timely and accurate deliveries.
Inventory & Data Management
Support regular inventory checks and reconciliation between internal systems and warehouse reports.
Maintain logistics data and assist in creating weekly or monthly performance reports.
Organizing logistics documents
Assist with back-office tasks related to logistics and sales operations.
Customer & Sales Support
Help respond to shipment-related customer inquiries
Process & Continuous Improvement
Contribute ideas for improving logistics workflows and efficiency.
Assist in creating KPI dashboards and monitoring operational metrics.


Educational background:
¬†
Currently enrolled in a Associates Program/Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree program in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
Professional experience:
¬†
First practical experience (internship, working student job, or project) in logistics, warehousing, or office administration is a plus.
Language:¬†
Professional English proficiency required
Logistics expertise:
¬†
Knowledge of logistics and supply chain management principles, practices, and technologies.
Analytical skills:
¬†
Analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to leverage data for informed decision-making.
Technical proficiency:
¬†
Solid working knowledge of common logistics software and basic IT tools.
Carrier familiarity:
¬†
Knowledge of U.S. shipping carriers (FedEx, UPS, DHL, USPS) and their online tools.
Soft Skills:
Reliable and detail-oriented way of working.
Good communication and teamwork abilities.
Hands-on mentality with a proactive and solution-oriented mindset.
High level of integrity and responsibility.


Short decision-making paths and a lot of creative freedom - with us you can really get involved and help shape the future
A work environment defined by respect, close and informal communications among teams, departments, and management
Plenty of space for new ideas and strategies where self-started individuals are highly valued and work effort is not measured in time but in results
Working on cutting-edge technologies¬†
Flexible working models to accommodate work-life balance¬†
Global and local events to strengthen our team spirit and have fun together

title: INTERN - CLIENT ADVISORY SERVICES (CAS)
description:
As a Client Advisory Services Intern, you will be an integral member of our Client Advisory Services (CAS) team, which is dedicated to delivering a best-in-class client experience for some of the world‚Äôs leading hedge funds, asset managers, international corporations, and banks. In this role, you will collaborate closely with both the Business CAS and Technical CAS teams to support a variety of strategic and operational initiatives, gaining hands-on experience and valuable exposure to how we build and maintain trusted client relationships.
This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to impactful projects, collaborate with global client-facing teams, and help shape the way we deliver value throughout the client lifecycle.


Support the onboarding of new clients by coordinating setup activities and ensuring a smooth transition to the 360T platform
Contribute to the development and implementation of automated tools aimed at enhancing client support and operational efficiency
Acquire and apply in-depth knowledge of 360T trading applications to effectively address client trading-related inquiries
Assist in the generation of customized, on-demand client reports by compiling and analyzing relevant trading data
Participate in the optimization of post-trade client processes to improve accuracy, reduce manual intervention, and enhance overall client satisfaction


Currently pursuing or holding a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Available for a minimum internship duration of 2 months
Detail-oriented and conscientious in delivering high-quality work
Highly motivated, entrepreneurial mindset, and a strong team player
Excellent organizational skills and a proactive, self-driven work ethic
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English


1. Get hands on experience in the global financial market
We want and expect our interns to make a tangible contribution to the 360T business during their time at the company. As such, our internship program is designed to provide training and deliver real world financial markets experience.
2. Enjoy a highly exclusive program
To deliver an optimized internship experience, the 360T Americas business only accepts 2-3 candidates per year. This ensures that our interns get the focus, attention and experience that they need to be successful.
3. Find a path to permanent employment
At 360T we are highly selective of our intern intake as we view them as potential future employees. Whether you are recently graduated or still completing your university studies, the 360T Americas internship program provides a possible pathway to employment within finance.

title: JUNIOR AML TRANSACTION MONITORING ANALYST (f/m/d)
description:
Maintaining the integrity of our trading platform and preventing financial crime are essential to our business. To support this, we are looking for a Junior AML Transaction Monitoring Analyst (f/m/d) to strengthen our first line of financial crime controls.
As an¬†Junior AML Transaction Monitoring Analyst, you are responsible for reviewing and investigating trading-related activity across 360T‚Äôs FX platform. You will identify unusual or potentially suspicious client behavior and escalate findings in line with internal policies and regulatory requirements.
You work closely with internal stakeholders to support a robust, risk-based approach to financial crime prevention in a technology-driven trading environment.


Review and investigate transaction monitoring alerts related to FX trading and order activity
Perform end-to-end investigations into unusual or potentially suspicious trading behavior
Analyze trading patterns, order activity, and client behavior to identify financial economic crime risks
Escalate suspicious activity in accordance with internal procedures and regulatory requirements
Document investigations clearly and accurately in case management systems
Support the effectiveness of transaction monitoring and surveillance tools, including alert logic reviews and tuning activities
Collaborate with Compliance, Risk, Operations, and Technology teams to ensure effective financial crime controls


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent relevant professional experience
At least 2 years of experience in Transaction Monitoring, AML, or Financial Economic Crime investigations
Experience conducting end-to-end investigations using monitoring and case management tools
Understanding of AML regulations, financial crime typologies, and relevant red flags, ideally in an FX or trading context
Familiarity with transaction monitoring or trade surveillance systems
Strong written communication skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and meet deadlines in a regulated environment


Regular Performance Appraisals: Continuous feedback to help you grow and excel
Learning and Development: Access to growth opportunities, including our internal "360T Academy"
Prime Location: A modern Frankfurt office in the heart of the city
Diverse Culture: Work in a multinational, multicultural environment that values collaboration and inclusion
Team Bonding: Enjoy social gatherings and a supportive team atmosphere
We offer an outstanding opportunity for a highly motivated individual to participate in the growth of a successful technology company in the financial sector. The position is based in Frankfurt am Main and is available immediately.

title: JUNIOR ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING MANAGER (f/m/d)
description:
At 360T, we develop and operate high-performance trading systems and provide reliable, scalable technology solutions to market participants worldwide. Our work is defined by technical excellence, strong governance, and a clear commitment to regulatory compliance.
We are seeking a¬†
Junior AML Analyst
 to support our Anti-Money Laundering framework and ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulations. In this role, you will assist in identifying and monitoring potential money-laundering risks, support due-diligence and transaction-monitoring activities, and contribute to relevant reporting obligations. You will also help maintain AML policies, controls, and training materials across the organisation.
This role offers an excellent opportunity to deepen your expertise in financial-crime prevention within a dynamic and highly regulated environment.


Regulatory Compliance Support:
¬† Assist in ensuring the organization complies with applicable Anti‚ÄëMoney Laundering (AML) and Counter‚ÄëTerrorist Financing (CTF) laws, regulations, and internal policies
Suspicious Activity Reporting (SARs):
¬† Support the preparation of SARs for submission to relevant authorities (e.g., FIU, NCA) and help maintain an accurate reporting framework
Risk Assessment & Mitigation:
¬† Contribute to AML risk assessments by gathering data, identifying potential vulnerabilities, and supporting the implementation of risk‚Äëbased controls
Monitoring & Investigation:
¬† Perform initial transaction monitoring reviews, investigate basic alerts, and escalate potential suspicious activities to senior team members
Policy & Procedure Maintenance:
¬† Assist in drafting, updating, and maintaining AML/CTF policies, procedures, and internal controls
Training & Awareness:
¬† Help coordinate AML training activities and support the development of awareness materials for staff across the organization
Regulatory Liaison Support:
¬† Provide administrative and analytical support during interactions with regulators, auditors, and law enforcement agencies
Documentation:
¬† Maintain organized and comprehensive records of AML compliance activities, investigations, and reporting
Audit Support:
¬† Assist in preparing documentation and evidence for internal and external audits, including BaFin inspections
Governance & Reporting:
¬† Help compile regular reports for senior management on AML compliance status, risks, and incidents
Technology & Innovation:¬†
Support the use of monitoring tools and contribute to the enhancement of AML processes through data analysis and technology‚Äëdriven improvements


Degree in Law, Finance, Business, Economics, or a related field. Additional AML‚Äërelated courses or certifications (e.g., CAMS, ICA, CFE) are an advantage
Some prior experience or internship in AML, compliance, risk management, or a regulated financial environment is beneficial. A strong interest in developing a career in AML is essential
Basic understanding of AML/CTF regulations, EU AML‚ÄëDirectives, FATF Recommendations, and other relevant international frameworks, with a willingness to deepen expertise
Strong analytical and investigative mindset, good communication skills, and the ability to work with stakeholders across the business. High integrity, attention to detail, and sound judgment. Comfortable learning AML software and data analysis tools
Ability to liaise confidently with regulators and law enforcement
Full professional fluency in both German and English
Independent, reliable, team‚Äëoriented, and eager to learn in a fast‚Äëpaced environment


A dynamic and collaborative work environment that values teamwork and encourages innovation.
Opportunities for career growth and development.
A chance to work on cutting-edge projects that make a real impact.
An exceptional team of experts collaborating to uphold and enhance the core infrastructure of one of the world‚Äôs largest FX trading platforms
Diverse and distributed workforce

title: GTM Internship - Italy
description:
Founded in Berlin, autarc is a 40 person start-up who last year graduated from Y Combinator in San Francisco. Our team consists of people in Sales, Tech and Operations, with plans to expand into the Italian market where we are looking to hire out a new team.

                            


                                
We‚Äôre launched autarc in Italy - ¬†and we‚Äôre looking for a driven GTM Intern to help bring 
autarc
 to market. You‚Äôll work directly with our founding and GTM team, acting as the connective tissue between inbound customers, local installer partners, fairs and shows, and our global product and marketing teams.
This is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing climate tech startup as one of our first hires in Italy. You‚Äôll have a front-row seat in everything from sales to strategy and local market expansion.
Conduct virtual product demos with inbound clients and guide them through our software
Support customers via phone, email, or live chat during onboarding and setup
Connect with local heat pump and solar installers, and manage early partner relationships
Attend industry trade shows and events to build our presence in Italy
Coordinate with global marketing to create localised landing pages, brochures, and demo materials
Build structured feedback loops from Italian users and partners back into the product and engineering teams
You‚Äôll be based in our Berlin office, working closely with our international and local GTM team.


A top-tier academic background in Business, Economics or a related field
Experience in fast-paced environments like startups, VC, consulting, or investment banking
A generalist mindset: you‚Äôre curious, adaptable, and comfortable jumping into new topics
Fluent in 
Italian
 and English
Willingness to get hands dirty and push things from 0 to 1
Available for a 
4-6 month internship¬†
with a willingness to work 5 days in the 
Berlin
 office


Freedom to choose your own equipment
26 paid vacation days
An annual team retreat¬†
Mobility subsidies ¬†

title: Junior QA Engineer
description:
We are seeking a¬†
Junior QA Engineer
¬†who is eager to start a career in software testing and grow within our team. ¬†You‚Äôll help ensure the quality and reliability of our products used by thousands of users. This role is designed for someone at the beginning of their QA journey - you don‚Äôt need years of experience, just curiosity, motivation, and willingness to learn.
You‚Äôll be introduced to the fundamentals of software testing, learn how to work with web and mobile applications, and get hands-on practice with test automation and programming. Our team will provide mentorship, training, and guidance so you can build strong foundations in QA and software development.
If you‚Äôre at the end years of your studies or freshly graduated and enthusiastic about technology, want to learn how modern software is built and tested, and are excited to grow your skills step by step, we‚Äôd love to meet you.


Must have
Basic knowledge of software testing principles (ISTQB Foundation Level or equivalent knowledge - certificate not required).
Willingness to learn and develop skills in both manual and automated testing.
Basic Python skills, enabling you to write simple functions or scripts.
Curiosity, attention to detail, and motivation to grow in QA.
Ability to work in a team and communicate clearly in English (written and spoken).


First experience with test automation tools (e.g., Playwright, Selenium, or similar).
Basic knowledge of API testing (e.g., using Postman).
Familiarity with version control systems (Git).
Understanding of Agile/Scrum basics.
Interest in AI/ML and how it can support testing.


Our Tech & QA Stack
Languages/Frameworks: PHP 8+/Symfony 6+/Laravel 9+, JS/TypeScript, Go, PHPUnit, Codeception, Flutter/Dart
Databases: MySQL, MariaDB
Infrastructure: UNIX, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ
Testing: Playwright, Python, Dart, Postman
CI/CD: GitLab CI, Code Magic¬†
Containerization: Docker
AI Tools: Jetbrains AI, Cursor, Gemini for Google Workspace
Tools: Jira, Requirements & Test Management for Jira, Confluence, Slack, IDE (freedom of choice), ¬†G Suite, Sentry¬†


Agile Scrum + XP elements
OOP, TDD, DDD, SOLID, Clean Code

QA as part of cross-functional team

title: Junior Project Manager for Development Framework Contracts (m/f/d)
description:
GOPA Tech GmbH
Powering Progress ‚Äì Building Futures
¬†
Shaping Infrastructure¬†
for a Better Tomorrow
¬†
GOPA Tech is an integral part of GOPA, a trusted partner in international development for over 60 years. We harness and direct GOPA‚Äôs energy and infrastructure expertise, advancing a comprehensive approach to shaping a better tomorrow.


                            


                                You will be responsible for interpreting Terms of Reference, identifying and engaging qualified experts, and ensuring that every proposal meets the highest standards before being presented to the client. You will work closely with GOPA Tech SIA Executive Director. You will drive the process with energy, precision, and a commitment to excellence, taking ownership of each assignment and ensuring timely, high-quality results.
Role Overview
Operating at the heart of a rapidly evolving international project environment, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire process from understanding client requests and Terms of Reference (ToR), expert identification, methodology development, proposal preparation, submission, and ensuring high-quality implementation and reporting. You will serve as the key contact for partners, experts, and the Contracting Authority, ensuring that all deliverables meet the highest standards of technical and financial quality, and that processes are consistent with consortium procedures.
Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Coordination
Lead and manage the FWCs, ensuring effective coordination between project management, technical, financial, and administrative functions.
Supervise and mentor FWC Assistants, Recruiters, and support staff.
Foster a collaborative, solution-oriented, and high-performance culture within the team.
Request & Assignment Management
Oversee the management of individual Requests for Services (RfS), ensuring timely and accurate response to client needs.
Analyze and interpret ToRs, coordinate preparation of technical and financial offers, and ensure rigorous quality control prior to submission.
Liaise with consortium members and technical leads to develop tailored methodologies and innovative approaches for each assignment.
Expert Management
Identify, negotiate, and contract high-quality experts; ensure CVs are tailored to assignment requirements.
Oversee logistical arrangements, onboarding, and briefing of experts on assignment-specific procedures and GCF standards.
Ensure compliance with contractual, tax, and social security obligations for all experts.
Technical Backstopping & Quality Assurance
Organize technical briefings, peer-reviews, and regular meetings to support expert teams and ensure deliverables meet state-of-the-art standards.
Conduct multi-level quality reviews of all outputs for accuracy, consistency, completeness, and clarity.
Ensure deliverables conform to ToR, project methodologies, and internal procedures.
Financial Management
Prepare, review, and submit detailed financial proposals and budgets, ensuring compliance with GCF and consortium eligibility criteria.
Oversee project expenditure, invoicing, and financial reporting in coordination with the Financial Manager.
Ensure prompt and accurate payment processes, linked to deliverable approval.
Client & Stakeholder Engagement
Serve as the principal point of contact for the Contracting Authority and consortium partners regarding contractual, financial, and operational matters.
Maintain proactive and transparent communication with all stakeholders throughout the project cycle.
Support client relationship management, briefing/debriefing sessions, and ensure client satisfaction.
Reporting & Documentation
Prepare and submit regular progress and annual reports, synthesizing outcomes and lessons learned.
Maintain comprehensive project documentation, ensuring confidentiality and compliance with consortium agreements.
Contribute to continuous improvement of FWC processes and procedures.


University degree in project management, business administration, environmental sciences, international relations, or a related field.
Less than 3 years of relevant experience in managing international technical assistance projects, preferably within climate finance or donor-funded programmes.
Demonstrated experience in managing FWC requests, proposal development, and expert recruitment.
Strong leadership, organizational, and team management skills.
Proven ability to plan, manage, and deliver to budget, schedule, and scope, including risk and change management.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities; adaptable and resilient under pressure.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to synthesize and structure information clearly.
Fluent in English (spoken and written) and French (B2); proficiency in Serbian required
High level of customer focus, quality orientation, and commitment to continuous improvement.
Experience in the climate change, environment, or sustainable development sectors is highly desirable.


Permanent contract with a Serbia-based team, integrated into a dynamic international consortium.
Opportunity to work at the forefront of global climate action and sustainable development.
Professional growth through diverse assignments, training, and capacity building activities.
Collaborative, innovative, and supportive work environment.


                            


                                Interested candidates are invited to submit their CV and cover letter outlining their suitability for the role and relevant experience.

title: Entrepreneur in Residence / Strategic Intern - (m/f/d)
description:
While Your Peers Are Still Reading Academic Papers About AI, You Could Be Deploying It.
You've spent the last year watching generative AI evolve from interesting demos to genuinely transformative technology. You're not just reading the Anthropic release notes‚Äîyou're already using Claude, GPT-5.1, and every new model that drops to see what's actually possible.
You've automated parts of your own workflow. You've seen exactly how this technology could transform entire industries and the way work in the future. But there's a gap between what you're experimenting with in your dorm room and what's happening in real businesses at scale.
That gap is your opportunity.
Most companies are still forming "AI working groups" and debating governance frameworks.
We're different.
We're shipping AI features for millions of users monthly.
We're re-engineering business processes around AI capabilities.
We're building tools that our 100+ person team uses daily.
And we need someone who gets it‚Äîsomeone who understands this is the biggest platform shift since mobile, and wants to prepare themselves for this new world.
YOUR ROLE
You'll work directly with our Chief Innovation Officer to introduce generative AI across four critical areas:
Research & Opportunity Discovery
Business Process Re-engineering
Internal AI Tooling
Executive Support & Strategic Enablement
This isn't a¬†"shadow executives and make coffee" internship.
You'll have real autonomy, real problems to solve, and real impact on a platform serving millions of users.
This is the first rung on a new career ladder‚Äîone that still exists and leads somewhere meaningful.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
The Essentials
Top-tier academic foundation
Track emerging AI capabilities as they're released (new models, techniques, frameworks)
Translate ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs technically possible‚Äù into ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs strategically valuable for JobLeads‚Äù
Create concise opportunity briefs that get from idea to decision fast
Stay ahead of the curve on what's coming (not just what's here)
Analyze how teams currently work and identify AI transformation opportunities
Don't just automate existing processes‚Äîreimagine them entirely around AI capabilities
Work with cross-functional teams to understand pain points and bottlenecks
Build business cases showing what‚Äôs possible with AI-first workflows
Contribute to internal AI tools (prompt libraries, evaluation frameworks, internal agents)
Test new capabilities with real use cases across the company
Help non-technical teams adopt AI in their workflows
Document what works, what doesn‚Äôt, and why
Prepare decision-ready materials for leadership (decks, memos, analyses)
Coordinate cross-departmental AI projects and keep initiatives moving
Act as a force multiplier for executive bandwidth‚Äînot an assistant
Remove friction so leadership can focus on high-impact decisions
Currently studying or recently graduated from a leading university
Genuine AI enthusiasm‚Äînot hype
Strategic thinking + execution bias
Professional maturity
Nice to Have (But Seriously, These Matter)
Fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business + Tech, Economics, or related analytical disciplines
Demonstrated academic excellence
Frequent user of AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, etc.)
Personal projects with LLMs (even small ones‚Äîjust show you ship)
Follow model releases and research for fun
Understand ‚Äúcontext window‚Äù and ‚Äúcontext engineering‚Äù
Ability to see both strategic implications and implementation details
Bias toward action over meetings
Comfortable dissecting complex technical concepts (with AI help)
Comfortable with ambiguity, rapid iteration, and intense workloads
Full-time commitment (40h/week) for 6‚Äì12 months (students) or permanent (graduates)
Available to start within 1‚Äì3 months
Independent, self-directed researcher
Strong English communication
Basic coding (Python, JavaScript, or similar) is a major plus
Experience with AI dev frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.)
Understanding of context engineering, prompt engineering
Prior fast-paced tech company experience
Portfolio of AI projects (GitHub, blog, demos)
Contributions to AI communities or open-source
WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT
Blunt truth: Most "AI internships" are hedges. They'll have you do market research, maybe build a POC that never ships, then send you back to school with a nice resume line.
We're not hedging.
AI is core to our product strategy, and you‚Äôll be working directly with our CIO at the highest strategic level‚Äînot buried in hierarchy.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT ON BOARD
If You're Still Studying
6‚Äì12 month immersive experience at the forefront of applied AI
Work that forms the foundation of a killer portfolio
Direct mentorship from leadership with investment banking & top-tier consulting backgrounds
Real equity in the outcomes‚Äîyour work ships to millions
Competitive compensation
If You're a Recent Graduate
Permanent role as Entrepreneur in Residence
Help shape AI strategy for a company with millions of users
Build expertise that will be invaluable when companies finally catch up
Work directly with C-level leadership
Remote-first flexibility (or Hamburg office)
Competitive salary
Portfolio-building opportunities
AI-empowered culture: 100+ people executing on AI strategy
Super international team, zero bureaucracy
Company perks: Annual company summer getaway + team meetups across the EU
WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS FOR YOUR CAREER
The working world is changing faster than universities can adapt.
Entry-level roles are disappearing‚ÄîAI is taking over tasks juniors used to do. The bottom rungs of the career ladder are being removed.
You have two choices:
Wait and graduate into a world where "entry-level" means 2+ years of experience.
Act now and build the experience that will be impossible to get in 2‚Äì3 years.
This role gives you something rare:
The chance to work on state-of-the-art AI in a real business with real users.
Not a lab.
Not a slow enterprise.
A company shipping AI products weekly.
You'll learn:
How to evaluate emerging AI for business impact
How to redesign processes for AI, not automate old ones
How to bridge technical possibility with strategic value
How to ship AI products at scale
How to influence tech strategy at the executive level
Real hands-on experience is the hardest currency right now.
WHY THIS MATTERS BEYOND YOUR CAREER
We‚Äôre on the side of the job seeker.
Our mission: make high-quality career coaching accessible to everyone worldwide.
Unlike traditional job boards, we earn revenue from job seekers, not employers‚Äîso every AI feature we build answers one question:
‚ÄúDoes this help job seekers land better jobs faster?‚Äù
When you innovate here, you help millions:
Navigate an automated job market
Stand out in AI-filtered processes
Access coaching once reserved for executives
If you're going to invest years mastering applied AI, why not do it to help people, not optimize ads or automate layoffs?
We operate in 40+ countries, reach millions monthly, and are fully remote, diverse, and supportive.
Our AI culture:
Not experimenting‚Äîalready in production
Weekly AI feature releases
Decisions based on what works, not committees
Perfect for people frustrated by slow-moving organizations
The AI revolution has started.
If you're wondering when it's your turn‚Äîthis is it.

title: Informatica Power Center Developer - Junior
description:
About Mirai RiskTech
¬†
Mirai RiskTech is the global technology leader in Balance Sheet Management, Financial Risk and Regulation. With pioneering SaaS Solutions and consulting services, we empower banks to shorten the path to success in risk management and regulatory compliance.
Mirai RiskTech operates with fully remote operations and main employee hubs in Madrid, Mexico City, and Boston. Our team comprises 150 professionals from over 20 countries, fostering a collaborative international culture at the intersection of technology, data, consulting, and finance.
¬†
About the Role
¬†
Mirai RiskTech is seeking a Junior Informatica PowerCenter Developer with a strong foundation in ETL processes and a willingness to continue growing in the data integration field. In this role, you will support the development, maintenance, and improvement of ETL workflows within the Informatica PowerCenter ecosystem.
You will work closely with senior developers, business analysts, and other technical teams to translate functional requirements into reliable and efficient technical solutions. This position is ideal for someone with a solid technical base, strong analytical skills, and motivation to learn and contribute to Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse initiatives.
¬†
Key Responsibilities¬†
¬†
Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter, following coding best practices
Support data mapping and basic data modeling activities for Data Warehouse and Data Mart structures
Perform unit testing and participate in integration and UAT testing under the guidance of senior team members¬†
Collaborate in code migration processes across environments and help manage incremental and scheduled data loads¬†
Contribute to ETL monitoring and operational support, including issue identification and basic troubleshooting
Follow data governance guidelines, including documentation standards, data quality checks, and metadata updates¬†
Work with cross‚Äëfunctional teams (QA, DBAs, business analysts) to understand requirements and provide technical support¬†
Document processes, mappings, and ETL logic to ensure project maintainability
Execute basic data validation routines to ensure accuracy and completeness
Perform routine preventive maintenance tasks, including log reviews and monitoring activities
Participating in code review sessions as a learner to understand development standards
Support small automation tasks under guidance (e.g., simple scripts or workflow improvements)


We are looking for a proactive and self-motivated individual with strong problem-solving skills and a genuine interest in technology.¬†
The ideal candidate is someone who:
¬†
Is interested in developing advanced skills in Informatica PowerCenter, ETL process performance, and data modeling
Applies basic software development and data engineering concepts, with some hands-on experience supporting ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter.
Working knowledge of Oracle databases, SQL development, and data modeling to assist in data processing and reporting tasks
¬†
Qualifications
¬†
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field
English proficiency at B2 or higher (required)
1+ years of hands‚Äëon experience in ETL development using Informatica PowerCenter¬†
Experience participating in Business Intelligence or Data Warehouse projects
Knowledge of relational databases and proficiency in SQL¬†
Basic to intermediate experience with Control‚ÄëM or similar job schedulers
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, work proactively, and collaborate effectively in a team environment
Basic knowledge of UNIX/Linux environments
Basic understanding of Git or other version control systems
Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
Basic proficiency with documentation tools (Confluence, Jira, Notion, etc.)
¬†
Location
This position is based in 
Mexico City
 and primarily follows a remote work model, with occasional on-site meetings as needed for business purposes.
¬†


At Mirai Risk Tech, our people are our greatest asset. We offer flexibility, work-life balance, and a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your professional and personal growth.
Work From Anywhere: Remote¬†work¬†on¬†demand¬†of¬†each¬†position
Events: on-site and on-line events to foster team bonding
Flexible Hours: Enjoy shorter workdays on Fridays
Career Growth: We offer multiple fast-paced career paths with annual performance reviews
Attractive benefit package
¬†
Mirai offers equal opportunities and accepts application from all the sectors of the society, the company does not discriminate for race, religion, ethical origin, incapacity, age, nationality, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other motive protected by the current law.
Personal data will be processed by Mirai as responsible to evaluate the authenticity of the application for this position or other ones. You can see the policy in this link ¬†
https://www.mirairisktech.com/privacy-policy

title: (Junior) Technical Project Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Committed to building the next generation of 100% software-based mobile networks, combining DevOps with telecommunications expertise, ng-voice is creating innovative mobile infrastructure solutions and making them accessible for operators and enterprises that want to deploy future-proof networks.
As part of the deployment and delivery team, you‚Äôll be key in shaping how we deliver the solution to our clients and partners. Together, we develop a plan and strategy to best deploy and integrate our solution, communicate with our customers and keep the main stakeholders engaged. Prior telco experience is not required for your application.¬†
¬†
To support our exponential growth, we are looking for a (Junior) Technical Project Manager (m/f/d) to join our team!¬†
This role is based in Mexico.


What you‚Äôll do ¬†
Manage complex¬†telecommunication¬†projects end-to-end and act as the main point of contact for a customer‚Äôs¬†counterpart
¬†
Set up timelines and progress tracking including regular meetings with the¬†customer
¬†
Take ownership for regular customer interactions, incl. proper preparation of customer meetings with an agenda and slides/documents where¬†necessary
¬†
Identify and manage the project risks, provide mitigations and resolution plans¬†
¬†
Coordinate company-internal tasks and work efforts and take ownership for producing excellent customer deliverables and exceeding customer¬†expectations
¬†
Manage project execution; track project activities¬†via Jira, supervise and handle changes, conflicts, and critical¬†issues
¬†
Handle customer and partner engagement; build customer relationship, confidence, and trust, ensuring project progress is communicated and arrange meetings and customer¬†events
¬†
Develop a scalable¬†and reproducible¬†approach to project management of our deployment¬†projects
¬†


Our ideal new colleague¬†
¬†
Project Management experience with technical teams on large-scale and fast-paced projects
¬†
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate vertically and horizontally based on audience
¬†
Experience managing cross-team projects with the ability to prioritize¬†workloads
¬†
Detail-oriented, and able to work¬†efficiently
¬†
Experience with technical project management¬†
¬†
Experience owning customer engagement and being the go-to contact for customers in technical projects
¬†
Fluency in English (C1/C2 level)
¬†
Nice to have
Engineering degree in the Telecom/IT field
¬†
Experience with IMS and/or other parts of telecommunication networks
¬†
Certifications or training as Scrum Master, Agile Coach, etc.
¬†
Experience with project management automation through Jira automation or other tools
¬†
Fluency in German, Spanish or French
¬†


A little more about our culture and why you should join¬†
We are committed to building a diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills in a traditionally not very diverse industry ¬†¬†
We offer you the culture of a fast-growing start-up with the maturity of an enterprise company
We are more interested in your experience and knowledge than formal degrees¬†
Entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchies ¬†¬†
Mobility benefit, fitness benefit, language class benefit and wellness benefit (for full-time employees)
Home office budget (for full-time employees)
