title: (Junior) Aerospace Engineer - Space Safety & SSA
description:
Join us in building solutions that 
keep space safe and sustainable
. As part of our team, you‚Äôll work on 
varied projects and products
 across 
Space Flight Dynamics (FD)
, 
Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
, 
Space Traffic Management (STM)
, and 
Space Surveillance & Tracking (SST)
.


In this role, you will contribute to projects that support Europe‚Äôs future space‚Äësafety infrastructure. Your work will include developing and coding key algorithms, integrating data sources, preparing technical documentation, and coordinating project deliverables to meet agency standards.
You will work closely with institutional partners, support proposal preparation, and contribute to long‚Äëterm programmes that ensure safe and sustainable access to space. If you enjoy complex, multi‚Äëstakeholder projects and creating solutions with real impact on space operations, this role is a great fit.


We don‚Äôt expect you to meet every item below. If you are passionate about SSA, astrodynamics, and space safety, 
please apply ‚Äî even if you don‚Äôt feel ‚Äú100% ready.‚Äù
Must‚ÄëHave
BSc or MSc in Aerospace Engineering, Space Engineering, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related
Experience through 
full-time work, internships, research projects, or thesis work
 in astrodynamics, SSA/SST, or flight dynamics
Basic understanding of orbital mechanics and astrodynamics
Ability to write clean, maintainable code in Python, Java, FORTRAN, or a similar language¬†
Interest in satellite safety, conjunction assessment, or flight operations
Nice‚Äëto‚ÄëHave
Experience with SST systems, orbit catalogs, mission analysis, sensor data or tracking systems¬†
Familiarity with space operations workflows or maneuver planning
Curiosity about space policy, standards, and responsible space traffic management


With a lean hierarchy and small working groups, you define your own way of work including flexible work hours.
Work on groundbreaking space sustainability challenges with a team of top-tier engineers and scientists.
Enjoy technical freedom. Influence system architecture, research methodologies, and data integration approaches.
Grow continuously with access to training budgets, industry conferences, and networking opportunities.
Be part of a strong engineering culture, with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical deep dives, and innovation sprints.
Great team spirit, with company-wide events such as monthly all-hands lunches, and social activities like laser tag, dinners, and team-building outings.

title: (Junior) Full-Stack Developer (Next.js / Node.js) (f/m/d)
description:
Your mission is to 
develop and maintain intuitive, high-performance web applications and APIs
 that provide seamless access to OKAPI:Orbits‚Äô 
end-to-end solutions
 across 
Mission Design
, 
Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
, 
Space Traffic Management (STM)
, 
Flight Dynamics (FD)
, and 
Space Traffic Coordination (STC)
 ‚Äî supporting the¬†
entire lifecycle of satellite operators
.
You design and implement¬†
elegant user interfaces and robust service integrations
 that connect complex space-data pipelines with an accessible, reliable user experience.
You work on the systems that¬†
enable satellite operators and space agencies
 to visualize, plan, and manage their missions efficiently in an increasingly dynamic orbital environment.
Research shows that women are less likely than men to apply for a position unless they meet 100% of the listed requirements. Please know that if it‚Äôs your case ‚Äî but you are passionate about 
space technology
, 
building reliable software
, and¬†
contributing to a more sustainable space environment
 ‚Äî we strongly encourage you to apply.
OKAPI:Orbits
 already brings together a highly diverse team, and we actively continue to strengthen this diversity, as research consistently shows that 
heterogeneous teams achieve higher performance and drive innovation
.

                            


                                
Develop and maintain modern web frontends using Next.js and backend APIs using Node.js
Implement user-friendly, performant, and secure web applications for satellite operators and space agencies
Support the development and maintenance of interfaces between frontend, APIs, and backend services, including authentication and data flow
Collaborate with scientists, engineers, and senior developers to translate domain requirements into practical software solutions
Contribute to frontend architecture, performance, usability, and maintainability under guidance from experienced team members
Implement features based on technical concepts and help document implementations and workflows
Write clean, well-structured code and contribute to automated tests and quality assurance
Support CI/CD pipelines, monitoring, and automation as part of a collaborative development process
Analyze and fix issues across frontend and backend layers with support from the team
Work in small, interdisciplinary teams and actively contribute to full-stack development tasks


Must-haves
Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or completed vocational training in IT
1‚Äì3 years of practical experience in web development with React.js, Node.js, and TypeScript (or equivalent project experience)
Solid understanding of JavaScript fundamentals and asynchronous programming
Practical experience with MongoDB or comparable databases, including basic data modeling and queries
Experience building or consuming RESTful APIs
Familiarity with Git-based workflows, pull requests, and collaborative development
Willingness to learn, ask questions, and grow as a full-stack developer
Focus on readable, maintainable code and basic testing practices
Team-oriented mindset and clear communication skills
Good English, written and spoken
Nice-to-haves
First experience with Next.js (SSR, ISR, or App Router)
Basic experience with Docker or container-based development
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines or automated testing
Familiarity with monitoring or error-tracking tools (e.g. DataDog)
Interest in space, aerospace, or complex technical domains


Flat hierarchy
, 
small teams
, flexible hours
Onboarding in 
Braunschweig
, afterwards 
on-site in Brunswick
, or 
hybrid in Brunswick or Munich¬†
Early ownership, 
influence technical direction
Training budget
 for continuous development
Corporate benefits
 like BahnCard 25/50, bike leasing, 
German classes via Lingoda
Join 
space events and conferences
, advocate for sustainable space
Free office drinks, monthly company lunch, regular after-work activities

title: Space Situational Awareness Internship / Master Thesis
description:
Join us in shaping the future of safe and sustainable space operations. At OKAPI Orbits, we develop innovative technologies and data-driven solutions to protect the space environment and empower decision-makers across the space industry. Whether you're building intelligent software, analyzing orbital dynamics, or designing user-friendly tools, your work will contribute to minimizing risks, enhancing operational safety, and enabling responsible space exploration for generations to come.
Please note that the internship needs to be part of your university curriculum.


                            


                                We have a variety of topics in which you can contribute. Some of them are:
Orbit determination
Covariance realism
Atmospheric modelling
Conjunction risk assessment
Maneuver optimization
Maneuver detection and pattern extraction
Space debris environment modelling


Must haves:‚ÄØ¬†
Possibility to relocate to Brunswick from within the EEA with a valid working permit
Enrolled student (BSc or MSc) in a study program related to Space Engineering
Strong¬†knowledge of orbital mechanics
Exceptional academic track record
Independent working style¬†
English intermediate (at least B2)
¬†
Nice to have:‚ÄØ¬†
Proven analytical thinking through past research projects¬†
Programming experience in Fortran,Python and/or Java


With a lean hierarchy and small working groups, you define your own way of work including flexible work hours.
Work on groundbreaking space sustainability challenges with a team of top-tier engineers and scientists.
After your on-boarding time in Braunschweig, you can choose between staying in our office, working remote (within Germany) or a hybrid approach.
Enjoy technical freedom. Influence system architecture, research methodologies, and data integration approaches.
Grow continuously with access to training budgets, industry conferences, and networking opportunities.
Be part of a strong engineering culture,¬†with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical deep dives, and innovation sprints.
Great team spirit, with company-wide events such as monthly all-hands lunches, and social activities like laser tag, dinners, and team-building outings.

title: Capital Investment Projects Intern (f/m/d)
description:
Planet A Foods is for those who want to build something extraordinary with tangible purpose.
We‚Äôre reinventing how the world makes food ingredients, such as chocolate, replacing scarce, unsustainable raw materials with scalable, clean, and delicious alternatives.
We are united by impact, driven by innovation, and energized by the mission of building a food system that serves both people and the planet.¬†Working here means choosing meaningful challenges over easy wins. You‚Äôll join an entrepreneurial, international team of scientists, engineers, operators, and industry experts who are deeply committed to creating real planetary impact.
As a Capital Investment Projects Intern, you will work closely with our Project Manager to support the execution of a major investment project, gaining hands-on experience at the intersection of strategy, finance, and operations.

                            


                                
Support the Project Manager in coordinating and monitoring project activities
Prepare documentation, presentations, and progress reports to keep everyone aligned
Contribute to budget tracking and financial analysis of our investment project
Conduct research and benchmarking to support key project decisions
Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure smooth execution
Support in identifying risks, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement


You‚Äôre currently pursuing a degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, or similar
You combine analytical thinking with a structured, proactive way of working
You are confident using MS Office¬†
You‚Äôre a strong communicator who enjoys working both independently and collaboratively
You‚Äôre curious about project management, investment planning, and how ideas become reality
You are comfortable with travelling often to Pilsen, Czech Republic
This internship opportunity must be linked to a mandatory internship through a university and should last 6 months. We don't accept thesis projects.¬†


Early ownership and responsibility in a fast-moving environment
Accelerated learning through hands-on work, mentorship and training
2.5 vacation days per month and flexible working hours
Fresh lunches, snacks, and drinks
Vouchers for sports, wellbeing, and lifestyle perks

Chocolate. Every. Single. Day.

title: Junior QA Engineer
description:
As a
¬†
Junior QA Engineer,
¬†
you will participate in the following tasks:
Assist in developing and implementing testing strategies and processes to ensure high-quality software products.
Work closely with team members and mentors to understand business objectives and translate them into practical quality requirements.
Identify, document, and track quality issues and collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve them.
Support the creation and maintenance of test plans to ensure comprehensive test coverage.

Participate in the design, development, and maintenance of automated test scripts.

Communicate effectively within the team to align QA objectives with overall business goals.

1-2 years of experience in Manual and Automated testing of data-driven applications.

Familiarity with testing web applications (ReactJS) and mobile applications (React Native).
Some experience with testing API endpoints.
Basic knowledge of SQL databases.

title: Principal/Senior/Mid/Junior ‚Äì Data Scientist
description:
About Us
We are looking for Data Scientists that are passionate about the power of AI and who thrive at the intersection of business, analytics, and AI: someone who not only trains models but also deeply understands the business context in which they're applied.
About this role ‚Äì Domains Department
The Data Science Domains Department powers business-critical decision-making across four key areas of enterprise operations. We build and deploy AI-driven features that transform how business leaders understand and act on complex data challenges in their specific domains.
Our Four Domains:
Finance (FIN):
 We enable smarter, faster financial decision-making across the enterprise by partnering with Finance teams to improve forecasting accuracy, planning agility, and financial transparency through AI-driven solutions.
Manufacturing & Supply Chain (M&S):
 We optimize the end-to-end manufacturing and supply chain with cutting-edge AI ‚Äì from helping pharmaceutical companies avoid out-of-stocks to reducing machine breakdown in consumer goods factories.
Research & Development (R&D):
 We partner closely with pharmaceutical and biotech companies to deliver innovative AI-driven solutions that optimize clinical trial recruitment and accelerate pipeline innovation.
Cross-Functional (XF):
 We apply AI to diverse functions spanning procurement, people analytics, commercial operations, and more ‚Äì developing solutions that transform these essential but often underserved areas.


Core responsibilities and skills (by seniority)
Junior Data Scientist ‚Äì Up to 2 years
Build and maintain AI-driven features (forecasting, classification, regression, recommender systems, LLM-powered features) for business use cases
Contribute to app features with guidance from mid/senior teammates; improve models, pipelines and deliverables
Present results and findings to your team; identify gaps and learn to explain the product and the AI behind it
Deliver assigned tasks autonomously and on time with clear ownership
Mid Data Scientist ‚Äì 2+ years
Strong Python/SQL skills, basic MLOps knowledge (Airflow, MLflow, unit testing), and solid ML fundamentals
Own features of the app; constantly improve models, pipelines and monitoring to ensure robust production performance
Communicate and align with internal stakeholders; identify opportunities and explain AI behind business outcomes
Design end-to-end ML pipelines for small projects; mentor junior team members on technical topics
Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì 4+ years
Comprehensive MLOps expertise, advanced Python/SQL skills, and domain specialization; enforce code quality standards across the team
Own key features and projects; design and improve models, pipelines, and experimentation frameworks
Lead 1+ major projects as AI lead with full accountability; break down work, assign tasks, and manage multiple workstreams
Communicate and align with internal/external stakeholders; turn business requirements into AI solutions
Provide technical mentorship; set modeling standards and drive cross-functional delivery
Principal Data Scientist ‚Äì 6+ years
Deep expertise in one technical area; lead by example on technical excellence, business acumen, and strategic vision
Define and own AI domain roadmaps; transform ambiguous business challenges into structured action plans
Lead 5+ simultaneous projects across multiple workstreams; shape product strategy with PM/Eng
Demonstrate strong business acumen: estimate AI solution impact on KPIs and business outcomes
Provide leadership for the Data Science team: mentor and manage; define standards; drive impactful cross-functional delivery
Who we're looking for (all levels)
Someone who thrives at the intersection of business, analytics and AI and wants to ensure AI solves the right problems with measurable impact
A scientist and builder: you explore multiple approaches, analyze results and iterate fast, balancing cutting-edge techniques with simple, scalable solutions
A strong communicator who adapts the message to different audiences and enjoys working cross-functionally with product, engineering and business stakeholders
Someone with a startup mindset: comfortable with ambiguity, proactive and hands-on when something needs fixing or improving
Ready to Lead Boldly ‚Äì helping business leaders make decisive decisions powered by real-time AI insights


What we offer
Work at the forefront of AI-powered decision intelligence in a fast-growing B2B SaaS company
Collaborate with a global team of 300+ talented professionals across Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, Cluj and New York
Tackle real-world business challenges across Finance, Supply Chain, R&D, and Cross-Functional domains
Hybrid work policy (2 days per week in the office) for work-life balance
Permanent contract with competitive compensation
Career growth opportunities across all seniority levels ‚Äì from Junior to Principal Data Scientist
A culture driven by innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence
The chance to Lead Boldly ‚Äì turning complex data into decisions that drive real, measurable impact
Location & Details
Location: Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Contract type: Permanent
Work policy: Hybrid (2 days per week in the office)


For questions about this role, please reach out to our Recruiting team at recruiting@principal33.com.

title: Junior Business Analyst (Regulatory Reporting)
description:
As a Junior Business Analyst, you will be part of the agile development cycle for our Reg-Reporting Hub (RRH) product development center In Pune, India. This techno-functional role involves analyzing international banking regulations and translating them into software solutions and functional specifications. This entails:
Analyze regulations and business/client requirements from national and international banking authorities.
Translate regulations into functional specifications including Data Gap Analysis, Data Modelling & Mapping, and Business/Validation rules.
Perform functional implementations using SQL, e.g. on decision tables or allocation rules.
Create and validate functional scenarios & test data, conduct UAT (User Acceptance Testing), and perform regression testing.
Develop a clear understanding of product roadmaps through interaction with Product Owners and Subject Matter Experts.
Maintain detailed end-user documentation and internal technical-functional guides.
Provide support for customer projects and resolve functional tickets.
Join a dynamic team and collaborate with national and international colleagues at all levels and skills within the organization


Experience: 2-5 years in a Bank, Financial Institution, or IT firm within banking domain and willingness to learn about regulatory reporting domain.
Education: Degree in Finance, Business, Information Technology, Mathematics, Economics or Charted Accountants/ICWA preferred.
Technical Skills: Working knowledge of SQL for data analysis and reporting is highly valued.
Technical Affinity: Familiarity with XML, XBRL, JSON, and MS Excel/Access would be a plus.
Domain Knowledge: Basic understanding of Banking Products, Financial Instruments, and Financial Markets.
Accounting: Fair understanding of Balance Sheets, P&L statements, and basic accounting concepts would be a plus.
Risk Exposure: Knowledge of Market Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk, and Basel accords would be a plus.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî able to engage and influence stakeholders across business, compliance, and technical teams.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills; able to translate complex regulations into practical solutions.
Hands-on experience working within Agile (Scrum/Kanban) project environments using tools such as Jira and Confluence.

description:

title: Junior Operations Manager ‚Äì Network & Performance (m/f/d)
description:
The Junior Operations Manager ‚Äì Network & Performance is responsible mainly for managing and maintaining the operational performance of data-sourcing systems and service providers. This role ensures the smooth onboarding and performance monitoring of our Points Of Interest (Gas-/Wash stations, EV CPs), pricing and other data sources. It involves close collaboration with partners, support and our BI teams to resolve issues and therefore improve customer satisfaction.
You will be extending our ryd operations team, which operates with a collaborative mindset and also holds shared responsibility for fleet and payment performance. This structure encourages knowledge sharing and provides excellent cross-training opportunities.
The ideal candidate combines strong analytical skills, process-oriented thinking, and excellent communication abilities to support the company‚Äôs operations infrastructure and ensure reliable service for partners and customers.
Your Tasks
Monitoring & Analysis: Monitor point of interest availability and track success rates to identify operational trends and performance bottlenecks.
Partner Management: Communicate effectively with partner support teams to report and resolve performance issues.
Onboarding & Configuration: Handle the end-to-end onboarding of energy stations, ensuring accurate configuration and smooth activation.
Data Quality: Perform regular data validation and quality checks to maintain up-to-date records of station status.
Cross-Functional Support: Support the monitoring of payment transaction flows and assist with Fleet operational tasks (e.g., B2B customer onboarding) when necessary.


Several years of experience in operations, energy management, or partner management ideally in energy, mobility.
You are profound in Excel / Google Sheets, Basic knowledge of SQL is an advantage, but not required.
You have a process-oriented way of thinking, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills for working with internal teams and external partners.
Fluent English ¬†and German (as 95% of our partners are located in the Germany)¬†


#shapingryd is one of our values, as we believe that transforming from Start-up to Scaleup can only be achieved together.
We trust that #bettertogether can only be achieved by you taking ownership from day one.
We want to have our employees with us for the long haul. You get a permanent employment contract, competitive salary and a company pension scheme.¬†
As a Ryder, you work flexibly from home up to two days a week and enjoy three team days in the Munich office (S-Bahn Donnersberger Br√ºcke).¬†
Professional onboarding package and buddies: From day one, you will be part of our monthly onboarding and buddy programme. Special: In addition to a buddy from the team, you will get to know a buddy from another area of the company on your first day, which will make it easier for you to get started with us.
The professional and personal development of our Ryders matters to us. We recognise potential and enhance it. Join us and write your own success story.
Never Stop Learning! You will get a training budget per year that you can freely allocate to our professional development.
You want to work from anywhere for a change? With RydFlex you can work abroad for upto 6 weeks anywhere within the EU.


                            


                                Stefanie Straus
HR Generalist
ryd GmbH | Landsberger Str. 94 | 80339 Munich, Germany |¬†
ryd.one
¬†|

and

description:

Basic knowledge on Microsoft office or similar software
Good feeling for intercultural communication
You have the motivation to actively contribute and offer your expertise

English skills working level (C1), good German language skills is a plus

If you are interested¬†or¬†still exploring opportunities, why¬†not¬†experience it during¬†your¬†studies?¬†We¬†welcome¬†you with great enthusiasm¬†to¬†the¬†Sungrow European Research Institute (SERI).
¬†
Sungrow has sound experience on field of green energy, with a mission of ‚Äúclean power for all‚Äù. Since 2016 Sungrow starts research and development of hydrogen technology. Sungrow European Research Institute commits to accelerate the development of Sungrow hydrogen energy solutions. Our research center is composed of experienced doctors and masters. We are working on wide range of scientific researches and providing multiple possibilities.

title: Junior Claims Manager - DACH
description:

Contribute to dispute resolution processes and the identification of contractual risks within solar energy projects.


                            


                                All right, all right, that was intriguing, wasn't it? Now, in order to fit in this role, and be happy for a long time, your ideal background should look a lot like this:
Bachelor's degree in Law, Business Administration, Engineering, or a closely related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in contract management, legal support, project administration, or claims handling.
Foundational knowledge of commercial contracts, contractual obligations, and key contract law principles.
Familiarity with solar energy projects, photovoltaic (PV) systems, and related infrastructure is a significant advantage.
Fluent in German (C2) and English (C2) for both written and spoken communication.
Possesses analytical thinking, strong organizational skills, and an eagerness to learn and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

legal and contract management team
 plays a crucial role in safeguarding our mission. You will be part of a dynamic and supportive department, gaining 
hands-on experience
 in the rapidly evolving renewable energy sector.
We offer an international working environment where you can develop your expertise in claims management within the DACH region, contributing directly to our 
success in groundbreaking solar energy projects.

title: Junior Insurance Specialist - Benelux
description:
Your mission

¬†

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.
Fluency in English (at least C1); Mandarin is a plus.

Opportunities for Career advancement ¬†¬†
Bonus payment based on pre-agreed and signed KPI agreements ¬†

Possibility for technical and commercial knowledge increasement in regard to string inverters, central inverters, inverter stations including transformer and switch gear and storage solutions ¬† ¬†
Technical and commercial training in our headquarter in Germany and even visits to the big R&D facility in China!

At Surplex, you will find a work environment built on respect, sustainability, and diversity ‚Äì the foundation for innovation and success. Our company culture fosters teamwork and professionalism in everything we do.
As a team member, you will take on exciting tasks and contribute to the smooth execution of our internal processes. Your efforts will directly support Surplex‚Äôs continued success as a professional online auction platform and help create an efficient and future-oriented workplace.

Collection and Viewing¬†

description:

Junior Accountant
, you will support the Accounting team in their day-to-day operations. This role offers an excellent opportunity to build a solid foundation in finance and accounting, as well as to develop professionally through hands-on experience and close collaboration with the team. This position is

Perform reconciliations of accounts with customers and suppliers
Assist in month-end closing activities, including data validation and reporting
Collaborate closely with members of the Accounting and Finance teams to ensure smooth and compliant financial operations
Support continuous improvement initiatives, including process optimisation and the increased use of AI-driven solutions in accounting


Successfully completed studies in Economics, Finance, or Accounting
Strong interest in finance and accounting, with openness to modern, technology-driven finance environments
Advanced skills in MS Office applications (especially Excel); experience with financial systems or AI-supported tools is a plus
Well-organised, detail-oriented mindset, and the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively
Strong communication skills and a good command of English


If you are looking for a place where ambition meets creativity, where ideas turn into impact fast, and where people are trusted to grow - you have found it.
At Westwing, we‚Äôre building the Superbrand in Design with a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of beautiful home & living.
Here is what you can look forward to:

An inspiring, international environment that empowers you to think big, take ownership, and grow beyond your comfort zone
A flexible hybrid setup with 2 office days per week - because strong connections and quick collaboration make great ideas happen

20 to 28 days of paid holiday to rest, recharge, and come back ready to create

Team rituals that celebrate results and togetherness - from Summer to Winter Parties


Westwing, Europe‚Äôs #1 in Beautiful Living e-commerce, is present in 20+ European countries and achieved a GMV (Gross Merchandise Volume) of EUR 507 million in 2025. As Europe‚Äôs premium one-stop destination for Design Lovers, it offers a unique brand experience with a carefully curated assortment of the Westwing Collection and 3rd party design brands. The integrated platform combines Shop, Daily Specials, Stores, the B2B Service (Westwing Business) and the Westwing Design Service. Westwing‚Äôs team works together on its shared purpose to ‚ÄúExcite people to create homes that unlock the full beauty of life‚Äù. Founded in 2011, Westwing is headquartered in Munich and went public on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange in October 2018.
Our team is a diverse group of professionals aiming for high performance, working together at a fast pace in an inspiring, international and informal environment that enables you to grow your career while working with a brand and products our customers love. We‚Äôre made up of passionate people who are creative enough to disrupt the status quo, brave enough to fail and smart enough to win. So come, be part of the ‚Äúwow, you work at Westwing?‚Äù crowd.
Diversity is deeply rooted in our culture. Our mission doesn‚Äôt stop to inspire only your design choices, it continues to embrace an inclusive lifestyle filled with respect to everyone‚Äôs uniqueness, cultural differences and equal opportunity.

title: Junior Hospitality Manager (m/w/d)
description:
Du arbeitest gemeinsam mit dem Projektteam an der Entwicklung einzigartiger Eventkonzepten und G√§steprogramme.
Du unterst√ºtzt das Projektteam bei der Beratung von Kunden und der Evaluierung bestehender Partnerschaften, um langfristige Erfolge zu sichern.
Du arbeitest an den Projektbudgets mit und verwaltest und kontrollierst kleinere Teilbereiche.
Du f√ºhrst Recherchen durch, holst Angebote ein und agierst als wichtige Schnittstelle zu Lieferanten und Partnern.
Du koordinierst externe Dienstleister und unterst√ºtzt die Planung interner Ressourcen, um einen reibungslosen Ablauf zu gew√§hrleisten.
Du hilfst bei der Produktion, Instandhaltung und Logistik von Werbemitteln, damit diese p√ºnktlich und in bester Qualit√§t verf√ºgbar sind.
Du bist Teil des Teams bei der Onsite-Aktivierung von Sponsoring-Rechten sowie bei der Umsetzung eigens konzipierter Events und hilfst vor Ort bei allen operativen Aufgaben mit.


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium, vorzugsweise in den Bereichen Event, Marketing oder Sportmanagement.
Du bringst eine gro√üe Sportaffinit√§t mit und hast Freude daran, sportliche Events aktiv mitzugestalten.
Du kommunizierst sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch, sowohl schriftlich als auch m√ºndlich.
Du hast gute MS Office Kenntnisse und kannst diese in deiner t√§glichen Arbeit anwenden.
Du besitzt einen F√ºhrerschein der Klasse B und bist bereit, bis zu 20% deiner Arbeitszeit zu reisen, um Events vor Ort zu unterst√ºtzen.
Du sch√§tzt ein dynamisches Umfeld und freust dich auf neue Herausforderungen in einem sportlichen und performanten Team.
Du bist kommunikationsstark und serviceorientiert.
Du denkst gerne √ºber den Tellerrand hinaus, bringst Ideen ein und arbeitest selbstst√§ndig und eigenverantwortlich.
Du bringst eine Hands-on Mentalit√§t mit und bist bereit, tatkr√§ftig mit anzupacken.


Bei der WWP erwarten dich die faszinierende Welt des Sports und die erfolgreichsten Marken - sie sind seit √ºber 30 Jahren unser t√§gliches Umfeld. Wir setzen auf Leidenschaft, Individualit√§t und Erfahrung. Der standort√ºbergreifende Austausch zwischen den Teams und die pers√∂nliche Entwicklung sind uns wichtig. Daher leben wir flache Hierarchien, haben renommierte Ausbildungspartner und sind offen f√ºr neue Ideen sowie flexible Arbeitskonzepte. Denn wir sind der Meinung, nur wenn du dich wohl f√ºhlst, kannst du H√∂chstleistungen erbringen. Es erwarten dich unvergessliche Events, Sportangebote und vor allem gro√üartige Menschen.
Unsere Benefits
Wertsch√§tzung, die z√§hlt: Bei uns bekommst du ein faires, transparentes und attraktives Gehaltspaket.
Dein Wachstum: Feedbackgespr√§che und individuelle Entwicklungspl√§ne auf allen Ebenen bieten dir regelm√§√üig neue Lern- und Wachstumsm√∂glichkeiten.
Famili√§res Arbeitsumfeld: Als inhabergef√ºhrtes Unternehmen leben wir ein vertrauensvolles Miteinander. Flexible und familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen sind f√ºr uns selbstverst√§ndlich.
Teamspirit vom Feinsten: Wir f√∂rdern unseren Zusammenhalt mit einem Lunch-Bonus f√ºr gemeinsame Mittagspausen und unvergesslichen Teamevents.
Hautnah bei Sportevents: Erlebe die Faszination gro√üer Sportevents hautnah und sei mittendrin statt nur dabei.
Bleib aktiv und fit: Mit einem Beitrag zur UrbanSports-Mitgliedschaft in DE, JobRad oder der Teilnahme an Businessruns bleibst du immer in Bewegung.
Weltweit vernetzt: Genau wie unsere Kunden sind wir international aufgestellt und bieten dir moderne B√ºros in Deutschland, √ñsterreich und Liechtenstein.
Wenn dich diese Aufgabe und unsere Mission anspricht, du aber z√∂gerst, weil du nicht alle Kriterien erf√ºllst, dann lass dich davon nicht abhalten. Uns geht es nicht nur um qualifizierte Lebensl√§ufe, sondern viel mehr um den menschlichen Wert, den du mitbringst. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!
Wir sch√§tzen Vielfalt und f√∂rdern eine inklusive Arbeitsumgebung, in der jede Person unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, ethnischer Zugeh√∂rigkeit, Alter, sexueller Orientierung, Behinderung oder religi√∂ser √úberzeugung respektiert und unterst√ºtzt wird. Alle Bewerbungen werden auf Grundlage von Qualifikationen und Eignung f√ºr die jeweilige Position bewertet.

title: Au√üendienst im Handel / Junior Gebietsverkaufsleiter Ost√∂sterreich (m/w/d)
description:
Lust, Ern√§hrung neu zu denken?¬†
Bei yfood machen wir seit 2017 gutes Essen alltagstauglich ‚Äì ausgewogen, praktisch und richtig lecker. Mit unseren Produkten haben wir eine eigene Kategorie geformt: Smart Food. In ganz Europa unterwegs, rasant wachsend und immer auf der Suche nach neuen Ideen. Wenn du Teil eines dynamischen Teams sein m√∂chtest, das die Lebensmittelbranche revolutioniert, dann bist du bei yfood genau richtig.
Du f√ºhrst und betreust selbst√§ndig und eigenverantwortlich wichtige Kunden im Gebiet 
Ost√∂sterreich¬†
(Teile Wien, N√ñ, Teile O√ñ, wobei Wien dein Kerngebiet definiert) im Bereich Lebensmittelhandel & OOH (Impulsgastronomie). Au√üerdem hast Du Lust in einem international stark wachsenden und dynamischen Food-Tech Startup voll durchzustarten und t√§glich an den spannenden Heraus¬≠for¬≠derungen zu wachsen? Dann haben wir gute Nachrichten f√ºr Dich: Wir suchen Dich!
Du f√ºhrst und betreust selbst√§ndig und eigen¬≠ver¬≠antwortlich in Abstimmung mit dem regionalen KAM /Gebietsverkaufsleiter wichtige Kunden in Ost√∂sterreich im Bereich Lebensmittel und Lebensmittelein¬≠zel¬≠handel samt Out of Home Kunden
Hierbei besuchst Du Filialgesch√§fte mit dem Ziel, das Umsatzpotential unserer Produkte bei Deinen Kunden voll auszusch√∂pfen und diese optimal zu pr√§sentieren
Dabei arbeitest Du eng mit Marktleitern, Abtei¬≠lungs¬≠leitern oder Gesch√§ftsinhabern zusammen und garantierst die optimale Platzierung und Dis¬≠tribution unserer Produkte in den von Dir betreu¬≠ten Filialen, Kantinen und Gesch√§ftspartnern
Du bist das Vorbild und Visitenkarte des Unternehmens und stimmst Dich mit Deinen erfahrenen Kollegen und Kolleginnen bez√ºglich Schwerpunkte ab
Du akquirierst m√∂gliche Neukunden, f√§hrst Durcharbeiten und erstellst mit Unterst√ºtzung Deines Vorgesetzten die Tourenplanung anhand unserer Verkaufsschwerpunkte
Du verwendest innovative und moderne Ver¬≠triebs¬≠¬≠konzepte und hast die Chance, schnell Kun¬≠denverantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und direkt am Unternehmenserfolg von YFood mitzuwirken


Du bist voll motiviert etwas Neues mit uns aufzubauen
Du hast Deine kaufm√§nnische Ausbildung, Gastro Ausbildung oder Dein Studium mit Schwerpunkt Sales / Vertrieb erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Du konntest idealerweise erste oder sogar mehr¬≠j√§hrige Berufserfahrung im FMCG oder Gastro Vertrieb sammeln; Bewerbungen von Quereinsteigern (z.B. Handel, Gastrono¬≠mie) schauen wir uns jedoch auch sehr gerne an
Du verf√ºgst √ºber die F√§higkeit, mit qualifizierten, betriebswirtschaftlichen Argumenten auf Handels¬≠kunden zuzugehen und diese zu √ºberzeugen
Zu Deinen St√§rken z√§hlen Deine gewinnende und dynamische Pers√∂nlichkeit, Dein sicheres Auf¬≠tre¬≠ten, Durchsetzungsverm√∂gen sowie Problem¬≠l√∂sungs¬≠¬≠kompetenz
Deine engagierte Arbeitsweise, Eigeninitiative und Dein Wille, Dinge anzupacken und um¬≠zu¬≠setzen machen Dich von Tag 1 zu einem unver¬≠zichtbaren Teammitglied
Zus√§tzlich bringst Du ein hohes Ma√ü an Flexi¬≠bi¬≠lit√§t und Mobilit√§t mit und bist bereit in Deinem Gebiet auch zu N√§chtigungen


Wir sind ein bisschen anders ‚Äì und genau das macht uns aus:
Leidenschaft
 ‚Äì Wir brennen f√ºr das, was wir tun. Voller Energie, voller Optimismus, immer hungrig nach Neuem.
Verantwortung
 ‚Äì Hei√üt f√ºr uns: F√ºreinander einstehen, Verantwortung √ºbernehmen und alles geben, wenn‚Äôs drauf ankommt.
Professionalit√§t¬†
‚Äì Wir nehmen unsere Arbeit ernst ‚Äì uns selbst aber nicht zu sehr. Wir sind offen, direkt und immer auf Augenh√∂he. Kein Bullshit, kein Ego. Nur Team.
Innovation¬†
‚Äì Wir denken lieber ‚ÄûWarum eigentlich nicht?‚Äú statt ‚ÄûDas war schon immer so.‚Äú Wir lieben neue Ideen, unkonventionelle Wege ‚Äì und bleiben nie stehen.


¬†Was wir dir bieten
Wir f√∂rdern Chancengleichheit und sch√§tzen Vielfalt.
 Wir verpflichten uns, ein integratives Umfeld f√ºr alle Mitarbeitende zu schaffen.
yfood w√§chst international:
 Obwohl Deutschland unsers ‚ÄûHome Base‚Äú ist, haben wir mit unseren internationalen M√§rkten ein dynamisches und buntes Umfeld geschaffen, in dem viele spannende Themen auf Dich warten.
Urlaub ist wichtig.
 Daher erh√§ltst du bei uns 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr.
yfood h√§lt dich fit
. Mit einer subventionierten Mitgliedschaft bei EGYM-Wellpass kannst du dir f√ºr nur 29‚Ç¨ im Monat Gutes tun. Dazu bieten wir im Rahmen unseres Gesundheitsmanagements & Healthy@yfood ¬†Workshops und Aktionen (z.B. Yoga, Breathwork, Soccer, Pickleball) an.
Weg vom Fleck
.¬†Wir stellen dir einen Firmenwagen auch zur privaten Nutzung zur Verf√ºgung und bieten dir √ºber JobRad die M√∂glichkeit, verg√ºnstigt ein Fahrrad zu leasen.
Trainiere deine Geschmacksnerven
.¬†Es gibt so viel yfood wie du tragen kannst, nat√ºrlich auch f√ºr dich gratis. Probiere also neue Produkte, Sorten oder Geschm√§cker.
Come as you are.
 Ob im Anzug oder Einhorn-Onesie. Einen Dresscode kennen wir nicht.


                            


                                Katharina Bauer
Talent Acquisition Manager
jobs@yfood.eu

yfood steht f√ºr die Chancengleichheit aller ein. Wir begr√º√üen und feiern Vielfalt und setzen uns daf√ºr ein, ein inklusives Arbeitsumfeld f√ºr alle Mitarbeiter:innen zu schaffen. title: Project Finance & Infrastructure - Intern Summer 2026
description:
Looking to gain hands-on experience in financial modelling, M&A, and infrastructure deals that shape the future? You‚Äôve come to the right place.
We‚Äôre looking for a sharp, curious intern to join our 
Project Finance & Infrastructure
 team in Hamburg. As part of our collaborative and international team, you‚Äôll work on real transactions in the 
infrastructure, energy, and renewables
 sectors ‚Äì not just as a spectator, but as a valued contributor.
Eight Advisory was founded in 2009 in France by 8 former partners of Arthur Andersen / Big4 companies as a firm specialized in Transaction Services, Restructuring, and Transformation. Today, Eight Advisory has grown to 950+ employees (including 113 partners) in France, the UK, Belgium, Netherlands, USA (New York), Spain, Germany and Switzerland. Together with the Eight International Network, counting over 650 employees in more than 20 countries, we respond to a growing demand for financial advice from private equity firms, medium- and large-sized corporates, and investment banks.
What you‚Äôll do:
Support financial and transaction advisory projects for 
national and international clients
: project developers, private equity firms, and infrastructure funds.
Learn the nuts and bolts of 
financial modelling, financial engineering, M&A
 and 
debt structuring
 through our learning-by-doing approach.
Work closely with experienced team members and get access to a 
dedicated mentor
 for personal and professional guidance.
Contribute to deals that support the transition to sustainable infrastructure.
Get a head start: 
Outstanding interns may receive an offer to join us permanently
 after graduation.

title: M&A Transaction Services - Intern Summer 2026
description:
Eight Advisory was founded in 2009 in France by 8 former partners of Arthur Andersen / Big4 companies as a firm specialized in Transaction Services, Restructuring, and Transformation. Today, Eight Advisory has grown to 950+ employees (including 113 partners) in France, the UK, Belgium, Netherlands, USA (New York), Spain, Germany and Switzerland. Together with the Eight International Network, counting over 650 employees in more than 20 countries, we respond to a growing demand for financial advice from private equity firms, medium- and large-sized corporates, and investment banks.
We are currently looking for an ambitious and diligent individual to join our Transaction Services team in Zurich as an Intern (4-6 months). The Transaction Services team in Zurich mainly provides buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence services to support its private equity and corporate clients in M&A processes.
You will work as a fully integrated team member on buy- and sell-side Financial Due Diligence projects
From the start, you will be given responsibility on our Financial Due Diligence projects and you will receive an in-depth on-the-job training to deepen your understanding of the mechanisms of buy- and sell-side M&A processes.
You will be coached by a mentor who is available at any time to support you with professional or personal advice. Graduates may have the opportunity to be offered a permanent position after a successful internship.

title: Transaction Services - Intern (from September 2026)
description:
Eight Advisory was founded in 2009 in France by 8 former partners of Arthur Andersen / Big4 companies as a firm specialized in Transaction Services, Restructuring, and Transformation. Today, Eight Advisory has grown to 950+ employees (including 115 partners) in France, the UK, Belgium, Netherlands, USA (New York), Spain, Germany and Switzerland. Together with the Eight International Network, counting over 650 employees in more than 20 countries, we respond to a growing demand for financial advice from private equity firms, medium- and large-sized corporates, and investment banks.
We are currently looking for an ambitious and diligent individual to join our Transaction Services team in Munich or Frankfurt as an Intern (3-6 months). The Transaction Services team in Munich or Frankfurt mainly provides buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence services to support its private equity and corporate clients in M&A processes.
You will support us as fully integrated team member on planning, executing and delivering Transaction Services (primarily Financial Due Diligence in buy- and sell-side transactions) for international and national private equity and corporate clients.
With a full involvement from the beginning to the end you will get an intensive training on the job on our Financial Due Diligence projects to understand the mechanisms of buy- and sell-side M&A processes.
You will be coached by a mentor who is available at any time to support you with professional or personal advice. Graduates may have the opportunity to be offered a permanent position after a successful internship.

We leverage the tools of digital transformation to guide traditional companies into the future and help young businesses establish themselves in the market.

Since our founding in 2017, we have grown to over 110 employees across eight locations ‚Äì Berlin, Munich, Vienna, Cologne, Stuttgart, Hamburg, Bucharest, and most recently Warsaw. title: Junior Data Engineer (Databricks)
description:
Addepto is a leading AI consulting (
https://addepto.com/ai-consulting/
) and data engineering (
https://addepto.com/data-engineering-services/
) company that builds scalable, ROI-focused AI solutions for some of the world's largest enterprises and pioneering startups, including Rolls Royce, Continental, Porsche, ABB, and WGU. With an exclusive focus on Artificial Intelligence and Big Data, Addepto helps organizations unlock the full potential of their data through systems designed for measurable business impact and long-term growth.
The company's work extends beyond client engagements. Drawing from real-world challenges and insights, Addepto has developed its own 
product - ContextClue
 - and actively contributes open-source solutions to the AI community. This commitment to transforming practical experience into scalable innovation has earned Addepto recognition by 
Forbes as one of the top 10 AI consulting companies worldwide
.
As part of 
KMS Technology
, a US-based global technology group, Addepto combines deep AI specialization with enterprise-scale delivery capabilities‚Äîenabling the partnership to move clients from AI experimentation to production impact, securely and at scale.
As a 
Junior Data Engineer
, you will have the exciting opportunity to work with a team of technology experts on challenging projects across various industries, leveraging cutting-edge technologies. Here are some of the projects we are seeking talented individuals to join:
Design and development of a universal data platform for global aerospace companies. 
This Azure and Databricks powered initiative combines diverse enterprise and public data sources. The data platform is at the early stages of the development, covering design of architecture and processes as well as giving freedom for technology selection.
Data Platform Transformation for energy management association body. 
This project addressed critical data management challenges, boosting user adoption, performance, and data integrity. The team is implementing a comprehensive data catalog, leveraging Databricks and Apache Spark/PySpark, for simplified data access and governance. Secure integration solutions and enhanced data quality monitoring, utilizing Delta Live Table tests, established trust in the platform. The intermediate result is a user-friendly, secure, and data-driven platform, serving as a basis for further development of ML components.
Design of the data transformation and following data ops pipelines for global car manufacturer.
 This project aims to build a data processing system for both real-time streaming and batch data. We‚Äôll handle data for business uses like process monitoring, analysis, and reporting, while also exploring LLMs for chatbots and data analysis. Key tasks include data cleaning, normalization, and optimizing the data model for performance and accuracy.
üöÄ Your main responsibilities:
Design scalable data processing pipelines for streaming and batch processing using Big Data technologies like Databricks, Airflow and/or Dagster.
Contribute to the development of CI/CD and MLOps processes.
Develop applications to aggregate, process, and analyze data from diverse sources.
Collaborate with the Data Science team on Machine Learning projects, including text/image analysis and predictive model building.
Develop and organize data transformations using Databricks/DBT and Apache Airflow.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions and ensure optimal performance and quality.

Naast OV Web beheert het ontwikkelteam nog een aantal andere applicaties waarvoor front- en backend ontwikkelingen plaatsvinden.

title: Junior Legal Counsel (m/f) - Lisbon
description:
We are currently looking for a 
Junior Legal Counsel 
with experience on data protection compliance.
In this role, you will report to the Iberia Legal Counsel. You will play a key part in providing legal and compliance support for Affidea Iberia and act as the contact point for all issues relating data protection in Affidea Portugal, working closely with the DPO.

Draft, review, negotiate and advise on a wide variety of agreements for the provision and procurement of services, confidentiality agreements, information systems agreements, business development agreements.

Support integration projects and M&A.
Draft and review policies.
Providing trainings for in-house business teams on legal and compliance topics and processes.
Provide support in¬†other areas of civil and commercial law.

title: Intern M&A
description:
This internship offers rare end-to-end exposure to European B2B SaaS M&A transactions, working directly with the Head of M&A. During this internship, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the world of software investing covering the entire deal process from¬†deal sourcing, evaluating investment opportunities, supporting the investment decision making process, guiding due diligence workstreams and identify value creation plans.
Anchr is a house of software companies backed by Strada Partners. We are building a collection of leading B2B SaaS business across Europe, organised around six domains. Those domains are Government, Commerce, Legal & GRC, Finance, Construction and Oracle. Today our group employs over 350 people and serves over 2,000 customers. Our ambition is to become a European leader in each of these virtual networks through an active buy and build strategy. Within Anchr, we offer companies solid foundations and strategic support to help reach its full potential.
What can you expect?
Gaining hands-on experience in the full range of software M&A transactions:
Pro-active sourcing of potential investment opportunities through desktop research
Evaluating inbound deal flow
Supporting the investment decision making process through due diligence support, reference calls, market research, preparation of materials, etc.
Active participation throughout a transaction lifecycle, from origination calls, through management meeting and price negotiations until investment decisions.
Getting exposure to a fast-paced learning environment including financial analysis, building and reviewing SaaS operating models and valuation analyses (LBO) in Excel, investment memo drafting in Word etc.
Working directly with and reporting to the head of M&A, while working closely with Anchr portfolio CEOs and Strada Partners‚Äô investment team.
Working from a fun environment in Mechelen, but investing across Europe
What do we offer you?
Location
: Mechelen / Antwerp. Some occasional travel might be required A few days (2 max) of homeworking is possible.
Duration
: 6 months minimum
Start date
: As from March 2026, with later starting dates on a rolling basis
Compensation
: competitive internship compensation
The process consists of four rounds:
CV screening
Initial interview with HR
Online tests
Business case combined with a fit interview

title: Consulting Internship (Stockholm) - Fall 2026
description:
NOTE: The deadline for applying is February 22nd 2026
Internship Overview:
Applied Value offers world-class management consulting services designed to enhance the value of clients' enterprises, providing¬†a comprehensive range of strategy and operations management consulting.¬†In our management consulting work, we focus on projects where we can deliver the greatest impact and achieve tangible, measurable results. With offices in the US, Europe, and Asia, we combine the in-depth expertise of a global adviser with the focus, attention, and flexibility of a boutique consulting firm.
Over the 8-12 weeks period,¬†you will spend most of your time in the Management Consulting business. Our interns are considered an integral part of our case team and gain significant exposure & experience in all aspects of management consulting.¬†When not traveling for casework, you will be working from our Stockholm office. The internship will be either first or second period of fall.¬†¬†
The Ideal Candidate
Applied Value is looking for people who share our ambitions and who can deliver results in our driven, dynamic environment. We want people who can form their own conclusions, yet can learn from others. We want people who can get things done on time. We are looking for people who bring a commercial perspective and the ability to make an immediate impact.
Candidates must be decisive, results-oriented, highly motivated, and able to work in an unstructured environment. Demonstrated leadership, business acumen, and financial skills, plus a willingness to travel are essential. Previous start-up, general management, engineering, sales, or marketing experience is a plus. Flexibility and drive are requirements.
Applied Value offers a career path where you are expected to take a large responsibility from day one for your own work tasks or parts of the project. You are also, in an early stage of your career, exposed to the sales process, which includes identifying potential clients and projects, producing sales materials, and participating in sales meetings.
About Applied Value Group
Work on high-profile projects with Fortune 500 companies while surrounded by the most dynamic and driven consultants in the industry.¬†
Applied Value offers world-class management consulting services designed to enhance the value of clients' enterprises with professionals in offices around the world (Stockholm,¬†New York, Miami, Shanghai).¬† Applied Value bridges the gap between the hands-on, personalized engagement of a smaller consultancy and the global perspective of larger international firms.¬†
We offer management consulting services in four key practice areas: go-to-market strategy, gross margin improvement, OPEX efficiency, and capital efficiency. ‚ÄúTangible results‚Äù are a core value proposition of the firm, and we only pursue projects where they can produce quantifiable outcomes. 
Anything else you should know about Applied Value?
Named ‚ÄúBest Boutique Firms to Work for‚Äù by Forbes,¬† Vault, and Ivy Exec
Top-tier clients across all industries
Excellent compensation/benefits package
Opportunity to make an immediate impact/uncapped growth

title: AI Engineer / Consultant - Internship
description:

AI brings huge potential, but many companies are still struggling to release the desired impact. We are a pragmatic and dynamic team to help ‚Äúempower our business clients with AI‚Äù. You, as a talent, are needed to grow our business which started up from three founders with proven track-records in AI consulting and scaled AI implementations.¬†
¬†

What you can expect

As an intern at Artifact, you will contribute to client projects and play and active role in development tasks. You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to work on internal projects and initiatives, enhancing both your technical expertise and leadership skills
Be involved in shaping our internal asset and strategy - your ideas and technical skills will help move Artifact forward
Enjoy a flexible work environment where you can grow, learn, and be part of a team that is passionate about AI
About Artifact
Artifact is dedicated to empowering people with AI for the better. As a professional service provider, we 
do
 AI and Data Science. Together, we are leveraging the best ideas to find pragmatic and sophisticated solutions with the best suited technology. We help our business clients from any sectors and any size, to accelerate their journey with AI and deliver real impact.

 een dynamische rol waarin jij het verschil maakt voor honderden collega‚Äôs, elke dag opnieuw.

title: Junior Fleetmanager
Junior Accountmanager
description:
In deze rol ben je h√©t aanspreekpunt voor de klanten van BAS Rent. Je zorgt ervoor dat alle aanvragen voor de huur van transportmaterieel zo goed mogelijk worden opgevolgd. Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in de dagelijkse operatie: van het opvolgen van aanvragen tot het opstellen van offertes en het beantwoorden van klantvragen. Je geeft uitleg over de verhuuropties met betrekking tot onze trekkers en bakwagens en kunt op termijn zelfstandig het gehele verhuurproces van aanvraag tot afronding beheren.
We verhuren een grote diversiteit aan voertuigen aan zakelijke klanten, waarbij jij jezelf eerst focust op ons standaard aanbod van trekkers en bakwagens. Deze leveren wij voornamelijk aan transport- en logistieke bedrijven in Nederland. Door onze groeiambities en toenemende vraag zoeken we versterking. Ben jij communicatief sterk, commercieel ingesteld en wil je graag leren binnen een dynamische omgeving? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!
Wat ga je doen?
Als 
Junior Accountmanager
 ben je voornamelijk bezig met het opvolgen van binnenkomende aanvragen en het beheren van onze standaard verhuurvoertuigen en offertes. Jij zorgt ervoor dat klanten snel en professioneel geholpen worden, of het nu gaat om een korte of langere huurperiode.
Jouw belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden:
Behandelen van inkomende tickets en klantaanvragen
Opstellen, versturen en opvolgen van offertes
Beheren van het standaard verhuuraanbod
Verzorgen en opvolgen van wekelijkse mailings naar klanten en prospects
Zorgen voor een actueel en compleet aanbod van huurvoertuigen op de website
Meedenken over commerci√´le kansen en verbeteringen in onze werkwijze
Wij bieden jou
Een uitdagende en afwisselende functie binnen een dynamische en groeiende organisatie.
Een marktconform salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;
25 vakantiedagen + de mogelijkheid om extra bij te kopen;
Doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden met een op maat gemaakt ontwikkelplan;
Deelname aan het BAS Fit Sportprogramma, sportevenementen en fitnessen tegen een gereduceerd tarief;
Leuke teamuitjes, borrels en niet te vergeten ons BAS-Jaarfeest.

title: Junior Onboarding Analyst - (El Salvador, Remote)
description:
The Original Bitcoin Exchange
Inspired by Bitcoin's vision of financial freedom, we are committed to empowering individuals to transact and connect seamlessly across the globe. From the early days of the Bitcoin revolution, our mission has been to champion freedom through innovative, reliable, and accessible technology‚Äîensuring that everyone, everywhere, has the tools to participate in a truly open and borderless world. 
We are driven by a relentless pursuit of innovation and financial empowerment. By prioritizing education and delivering a cutting-edge platform, we enable users to seamlessly buy, hold, and trade digital assets with confidence. As the digital asset landscape rapidly evolves, we stay ahead‚Äîoffering state-of-the-art trading services that empower both individuals and global liquidity providers. Our forward-thinking, agile approach ensures that financial freedom is not just a vision, but a reality for all.
Our team, composed of visionary individuals with practical expertise, focuses on crafting solutions to the market's toughest challenges. Despite our global presence and impact, we maintain a small, technology-focused core, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. 
We value integrity and autonomy, empowering our team to contribute from concept to launch. Driven by a passion for lifelong learning and a commitment to advancing freedom, we prioritize high-caliber products and services, with a proven track record of innovation that draws on the dexterity of our teams.
Why Join Us?
Innovation
 
At Bitfinex, we merge technology and skill to create an environment where your involvement isn‚Äôt just appreciated‚Äîit‚Äôs pioneering the future and pushing boundaries in finance. Our culture values bold creativity, a passion for technology, and a deep belief in Financial Freedom. 
Flexibility & Global Reach
 
We believe in trust, autonomy, and results‚Äîour team operates remotely, ensuring you work from anywhere while collaborating with some of the best talents across the world. We thrive on innovation, autonomy, and breaking new ground. 
Fast-Paced & Impactful
 
Much like the crypto industry itself, our projects move fast, break new ground, and make an impact. Your contributions reach our global audience, shaping the narrative of a decentralized future. 
A Team that Thrives on Collaboration
 
We blend seasoned experts with fresh creative minds, ensuring constant innovation, mentorship, and a dynamic work environment that keeps you at the forefront of achieving your goals. We see integrity and standing up for what is right as the most important qualities. 
Grow with the Best 
At Bitfinex, we‚Äôre committed to continuous learning‚Äîwhether through technological advancements, creative workshops, or mentorship from leading professionals in the industry.
If you‚Äôre excited about partaking in shaping the narrative of decentralized finance, you‚Äôll feel right at home
The Role:
The primary purpose of this position is to support the end-to-end onboarding and monitoring of clients in line with company policy, regulatory requirements, profile risk, and the Terms of Service. The incumbent is a member of the Onboarding and EDD Team, reporting directly to the Manager, Onboarding and EDD and their deputies or designates.
Responsibilities include collecting and verifying corporate KYC documentation, reviewing client structures and UBOs, their initial risk drivers, and conducting due diligence and enhanced due diligence (EDD) for higher-risk clients. The incumbent will also perform ongoing screening to identify potential sanctions, PEP, adverse media matches or updated/adjusted profile risks, as well as review fiat wire transfers in consultation with guidance from the Transaction Monitoring Team and alerts related but not limited to prohibited jurisdictions or Terms of Service violations.
The incumbent will liaise with internal teams and external clients to resolve discrepancies, escalate high-risk cases, and assist in responding to inquiries from banking and payment partners. In performing this role, the incumbent is expected to develop their analytical and risk assessment skills, remain current with evolving compliance standards, and contribute to the refinement of AML/KYC processes.
The incumbent reports to the Manager, Onboarding and EDD. They also work closely with Compliance, Fraud, Technology, Legal, and other relevant teams.
Your Day-to-Day:
Manage the end-to-end onboarding process for new clients, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements
Collect and verify KYC documentation, including identity verification, corporate structures, and ultimate beneficial owners (UBOs) and review their initial risk profile¬†
Assist with tasks assigned by the Profile Risk team.
Liaise with business development teams and clients to resolve discrepancies or obtain missing information
Communicate directly with users regarding onboarding requirements, EDD clarifications, World-Check matches, ToS violations, and prohibited jurisdictions
Conduct due diligence using external databases such as public records, World-Check, and open-source media
Perform ongoing screening and periodic reviews to identify sanctions, PEP, or adverse media matches
Conduct enhanced due diligence (EDD) for high-risk clients, including PEPs and clients from high-risk jurisdictions
Analyze client financial information, including source of wealth and source of funds, to ensure legitimacy
Assess complex corporate structures to identify and verify all UBOs
Conduct ongoing monitoring of existing high-risk clients to detect changes in their profiles
Review fiat wire transfer requests in consultation with the Transaction Monitoring Team, evaluating associated risks and escalating issues when necessary.
Investigate IP address alerts to identify potential ToS violations related to prohibited jurisdictions
Assist with inquiries from banking and payment partners
Contribute to the enhancement of AML/KYC policies and procedures
Follow and implement KYC/AML/CTF and Sanctions-related policies, laws, and regulations
Participate in compliance training and support the team in complex cases
What You Bring to the Table:
In addition to the skill set preferred requirements listed below the incumbent must be able to work independently with minimum supervision, (seeking guidance as required) and confident in making decisions as delegated by the Head of Onboarding.
Knowledge:
University education (preferred);
Native Spanish speaker;
Fluent in English;
Experience in the compliance field;
Fair understanding or ability to understand AML/KYC/CTF related policies, laws and regulations, including enhanced due diligence, (CDD/EDD) and Sanctions;
Basic knowledge of blockchain technology, (enhanced in the role);
CAMS/CBP designation (preferred)
Skills:
Strong written and verbal communication
Ability to interpret documentation in multiple languages and formats
Attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency
Self-motivated and proactive
Basic critical-thinking and decision-making
Proficiency in IT tools (Google Suite, Word, Excel, open search)
Willingness to learn and develop within the compliance and risk function
What We Offer:
Flexible Work & Remote-Friendly Culture
Mentorship & Growth
Competitive Pay
Career Development Opportunities
Supportive Team Environment
Learning & Knowledge Sharing
Team-Building Activities
Social activities (online & in-person)
A collaborative environment where your creativity will have a direct impact on the brand‚Äôs narrative
Ready to join us in bringing Financial Freedom to all?
If you‚Äôre a visionary who thrives at the intersection of technology, knowledge and innovation, we want to hear from you!
Recruitment Data & Security Disclaimer
As part of the hiring process at Bitfinex, we collect personal data such as your name, contact details, location, job preferences, education and employment history, and other information you voluntarily provide. This data is used solely for recruitment purposes, processed in accordance with applicable global data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), and retained only for as long as necessary to fulfil its purpose. 
All assessments and recruitment-related communications are conducted exclusively through official Bitfinex email addresses (e.g., 
firstname.lastname@bitfinex.com
). Bitfinex does not use unofficial channels (such as WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS) for recruitment communication and does not distribute assessments or sensitive links via those means.
As part of our secure and compliant recruitment process, we may use approved third-party platforms to facilitate candidate assessments. For more information, please refer to our 
 
Candidate Privacy Notice and Interview Recording Consent
. All candidates have the right to access, correct, or delete their personal data and to withdraw consent at any time, where applicable.
Bitfinex will never request payments, financial information, or personal banking details at any stage of the recruitment process.
If you receive a suspicious request, wish to exercise your data privacy rights, or have further inquiries regarding the legal aspects of the process, contact 
privacy@bitfinex.com
. 
Please note this inbox is intended for privacy concerns and reports only; any other communications will not be processed
.
Equal Opportunity Statement
At Bitfinex, we're committed to equitable opportunities. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. This commitment applies across all stages of recruitment and contractual relationships.
