title: Junior Project Manager
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Expected duties and responsibilities to be performed under the supervision of a Senior Project Manager
Engages with key stakeholders, product managers and team members to define version scope, work priorities, timelines, and product specific requirements.
Collaborates with team members and product managers to dissect if stakeholders' requirements are made logical, feasible and risk-free (as much as meaningfully possible).
Solicits, analyses, discuses and negotiates feature specifications with team members, product managers and key stakeholders to help define what, how and by when a functionality needs to be implemented and delivered.
Formalizes team protocols and complies related necessary documentation.
Liaises, streamlines and facilitates direct, honest, transparent and timely communication between all the parties involved in the development process to relay crucial updates, maintain absolute alignment & focus, and help resolve conflicts and solve problems.
Monitors and addresses product's Intra- and Inter-dependencies, as well as Risks. Assists with tracking, communicating, escalating, alarming and executing corresponding prevention, deflection, and/or mitigation strategies.
Regularly manages and updates Agile Artifacts and other project management tools (such as: Issue Board, Product Backlog, Release Scope, Weekly Reports, Knowledge Base, etc.).
Organizes and conducts Agile Ceremonies (such as: Daily Standups, Defect Triages, Feature Planning, Weekly Synchronizations, etc.).
Assists in establishing optimal work distribution, making sure all team members have adequate tasks prepared, arranged (per relative urgency and importance), and assigned to each of them.
Fosters collaboration, improves team health & dynamics, and motivates team members to successfully develop valuable solutions. Helps the team achieve business-wide awareness, self-organization, maturity, reliability, and other key characteristics of a high performing team.
Employs critical, system and design thinking to address everyday issues, resolve misunderstandings & misalignments, eliminate hinderances & obstacles, protect the team from unproductive disturbances, and mediate conflicts.
Reacts aptly to shifts in the planned project scope or timeline, identifies related issues and their root causes, and helps the team to properly adjust & adapt to any and all project changes.
Tracks down team‚Äôs progress on a daily basis, compiles relevant reports and utilizes analytics & statistics to ensure crucial decisions are both well-informed and data-driven.
Closely monitors results of the product testing effort, and actively assists the team in amending critical defects.
Adheres to and promotes operations and patterns prescribed by the Agile Methodology, and coaches on adopting and nurturing tried-and-true Agile practices.
Constantly and proactively strives to improve and optimize working procedures and processes.
Performs other tasks upon request of the Employer.

description:
Position Summary:
This is an opportunity for someone who would like to become a proficient video editor and that is interested in learning all about the video production process. You will be part of a unique Creative Team within TransPerfect that offers creative solutions to clients and other internal departments from concept to delivery. The intern will support the team with creative brainstorming sessions, carrying out administrative tasks, media management and video editing.
Position responsibilities:
Support the Creative Content Producer by scheduling calls/meetings, taking notes, creating follow-up emails, collaborate to create client proposals and creative strategies.
Support the film crew as required during film shoots.
Assist our Video Editor creating and preparing Premier projects, string outs and first drafts.
Edit video content and address feedback requested by team leads.
Media management, proxies creation and organizing the server following the established structure.
Research footage, music and other assets needed in the production.
Take care of all production documents such as location and personal releases, location permits, licenses, contact lists, call sheets, production schedules, etc.

title: Internship in Vendor Management
description:
Summary:
The intern will form part of our Vendor Management department and will support and assist our Production teams with their vendor capacity needs. This department is responsible for all vendor management, engagement and certification processes. They manage TransPerfect¬¥s freelance community comprised of thousands of specialists (translators, proofreaders, DTP specialists, copywriters, subject matter experts and more) providing services to our company to assist with the successful delivery of our projects.
The intern will be able to learn and develop different skills through a valuable experience in a multicultural and dynamic environment and have the opportunity to see how a translation company works. They will be involved principally in the recruitment and onboarding of new specialists, rate negotiation and maintaining lasting relationships with our vendors.
Position responsibilities:
Search for new vendors (translators, proofreaders, medical writers, regulatory consultants, etc.): run searches in specific platforms, post jobs, contact candidates, analyze candidates‚Äô CVs, etc.
Negotiate rates with vendors according to services provided.
Set up new vendors in the Vendor Management systems: screen candidates‚Äô applications, organize paperwork and document signature collection, add vendors to our company‚Äôs systems and platforms, update systems and platforms, store vendors‚Äô documentation and test files.
Assist candidates with the certification process: offer certification tests to candidates, schedule certification tests with candidates, create certification tests in our company‚Äôs platform, schedule certification tests review, work with Vendor Managers within the team in tests review results analysis and records, keep track of vendors training records, create and maintain dashboards.
Ensure vendor information is up to date at all times on our Vendor platform.

title: Junior Customer Care Specialist (replacement contract)
Junior Accountant
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Accountant for our Finance department who will help us with day to day accounting.
About Finance Team¬†
The Finance Team supports the organization by performing financial processes like collecting cash from customers, making payments to suppliers, and processing the related accounting documents. We make sure Tylko follows the tax rules and provides financial information and reports both internally and externally.
We support other departments in planning and decision-making by providing financial insight, maintaining relations with banks and trade currencies.
Once you join our Team you will be responsible for:
Sales/Revenue
: Verifying, issuing, and posting sales invoices; managing sales returns and corrections; supporting sales settlements (with Customer Support).
Cost/AP (Accounts Payable)
: Processing and booking purchase invoices; handling cost accruals and related documentation.
Compliance
: Verifying EU VIES numbers; preparing GUS and Intrastat reports; entering selected accounting documents.
General Accounting Support
: Assisting with bank statement posting and payment preparation (backup); performing account reconciliation and register analysis; supporting month-end closing.
Why Tylko?
Being a part of the Tylko team goes beyond clocking in every day and keeping your head down. We celebrate inclusivity and work together to build a culture of happy, healthy employees who are truly heard, and provide the following great benefits for every single member:
One Extra Day Off every month (in addition to your standard days off)
Comprehensive healthcare
Multisport
A discount on all Tylko products
And of course, a dog-friendly office!

title: Influencer Marketing Specialist (Junior/Mid)
description:
Join our furniture brand as an 
Influencer Marketing Specialist
, where you will spearhead our influencer partnerships to elevate our brand presence in the furniture and home decor space. In this role, you will focus on fostering and managing collaborations with influencers, driving engagement, and ultimately increasing sales. You will be an integral part of our dynamic brand marketing team, contributing your expertise in influencer relationship management to achieve our business objectives.
Once you join our Team you will be responsible for:
Influencer Identification
: Identify and research relevant influencers across various platforms who resonate with our target audience and align with our brand values.
Partnership Management
: Establish and maintain relationships with influencers, negotiating terms, contracts, and deliverables to ensure mutually beneficial partnerships.
Content Collaboration
: Collaborate with influencers to develop compelling content that resonates with their audience while showcasing our products or services authentically.
Performance Tracking
: Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for optimization and improvement.
Budget Management
: Manage influencer marketing budget effectively, allocating resources to maximize ROI and achieve campaign objectives.
Stay Updated
: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging platforms, and best practices in influencer marketing to continuously innovate and improve strategies.
Why Tylko?
Being a part of the Tylko team goes beyond clocking in every day and keeping your head down. We celebrate inclusivity and work together to build a culture of happy, healthy employees who are truly heard, and provide the following great benefits for every single member:
One extra day off every month (in addition to your standard days off)
Comprehensive healthcare
Multisport
A discount on all Tylko products
And of course, a dog-friendly office!

title: Junior Market & Customer Insights Researcher (Home & Furniture)
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Market & Customer Insights Researcher to join our Product Team. In this role, you‚Äôll support our efforts to better understand the furniture market across Europe and help maintain our research repository.
This is an excellent opportunity for someone at the early or developing stage of their research career‚Äîsomeone who‚Äôs passionate about furniture and interior design and looking to grow in a creative, collaborative environment.
About the Team
You‚Äôll work closely with our Research Manager and Product Managers across the Tylko Product Department. As part of the early stages of the furniture development process, you‚Äôll be responsible for collecting insights on market trends, product features and competitors.
You‚Äôll engage with Tylko users across Europe and see how customer feedback is translated into concrete features and solutions. You'll collaborate with a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about what they do.
Once you join our team, you will be responsible for:
Supporting the Research Manager
Assisting with daily tasks such as meeting notes, fieldwork summaries and tracking project timelines. You‚Äôll help keep research activities organised and running smoothly.
Conducting market research
Carrying out competitor analysis, exploring customer preferences and trends and turning this information into insights and recommendations for the Product Team.
Managing the research repository
Ensuring all research data is properly stored, organised and tagged so it‚Äôs easy to access and use.
Coordinating research operations
Managing participant databases, consent forms, scheduling and supporting recruitment for research projects.
Participating in qualitative user research
Conducting in-depth interviews with Tylko customers across Europe to understand their needs and experiences (for applicants with a proven track record).
Why Tylko?
Being a part of the Tylko team goes beyond clocking in every day and keeping your head down. We celebrate inclusivity and work together to build a culture of happy, healthy employees who are truly heard, and provide the following great benefits for every single member:
One bonus day off every month
Comprehensive healthcare
Multisport
A discount on all Tylko products
And of course, a dog-friendly office!
Here‚Äôs what you can expect from our recruitment process:
Short video interview (English)
Task to be solved at home (English)
Meetings with the managers and team (Polish / English)

title: Volunteer Internship
description:
UN WATCH VOLUNTEER INTERNSHIPS


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 




What is UN Watch?¬†


UN Watch is a non-governmental organization (NGO) in Geneva, Switzerland whose mission is to monitor the performance of the United Nations according to the yardstick of its Charter and to protect human rights for all.¬†UN Watch believes in strengthening the role of democracies within the UN and in the Charter‚Äôs guarantee of equal treatment for all nations large and small.¬†UN Watch is at the forefront in the struggle against anti-Semitism and anti-Israel bias at the UN.¬†For more information, please visit 
www.unwatch.org
.


¬†


Does UN Watch offer paid internships?¬†


No, unfortunately, UN Watch cannot offer a salary to¬†interns due to¬†visa complications. The only internships we offer are on a volunteer basis. Interns must find their own funding for travel, health insurance, daily living, lodging and all other costs. Geneva is an expensive city.




Are scholarships available for UN Watch¬†interns?
Yes, a limited number of scholarships are available to top internship applicants. More information will be provided to eligible applicants during the interview process.


When are UN Watch internships available, and for how long do they last?¬†


UN Watch offers three main internship opportunities throughout the year, each of which encompasses one Human Rights Council Session:


1. Spring (February, March, April),
¬†
Application Deadline: November 30th


2. Summer (May, June, July), 
Application Deadline: December 31st


3. Fall (September, October, November), 
Application Deadline: April 30th


Interviews of qualified candidates are typically conducted in the month following the application deadline.


Interns are expected to commit to a minimum of two months and up to three months.¬†




Is it possible to intern remotely?


Yes, but only if you are within one timezone of¬†UN¬†Watch's office in Geneva (CET). This means that we unfortunately cannot take remote interns from the US or Canada. UN Watch¬†accepts remote interns dependent either on the preference of the applicant or the availability of spaces in the Geneva office. Remote interns perform nearly all of the same tasks as those physically in Geneva given that many of the UN's activities can be followed online.




What are an intern‚Äôs activities and responsibilities?¬†


The activities and responsibilities of an intern typically include a broad range of substantive and administrative research functions, and may depend on the skill set and background of the applicant. Substantive responsibilities can include research and writing of reports, drafting correspondence, monitoring and reporting on meetings at the UN, attending and reporting on meetings with diplomats and UN officials, fact-checking and taking notes. Interns also participate in all administrative responsibilities, which regularly include website maintenance, answering telephones, making photocopies and filing, events support and other office tasks.


¬†


Does UN Watch have offices outside Geneva?¬†


The only office in which internships are offered is in Geneva, opposite the European headquarters of the United Nations.

capabilities, excellent English communication skills, and a structured, analytical mindset.
¬†
Key Responsibilities
Collect, analyze, and document business requirements in collaboration with stakeholders
Support business process mapping, workflow documentation, and optimization initiatives
Perform data analysis to identify trends, performance gaps, risks, and improvement opportunities
Build and maintain advanced Excel reports, dashboards, and tracking tools (using formulas, pivot tables, and data validation)
Prepare professional reports, presentations, and management summaries
Participate in project meetings, workshops, and alignment sessions with business and technical teams
Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities and validate process or system changes
Maintain accurate project documentation and monitoring files
Provide analytical and operational support to senior business analysts
¬†
Required Skills & Qualifications
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis, reporting automation)
Very good command of English (minimum B2 level) ‚Äî both written and spoken
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills
Basic understanding of business analysis methodologies and process documentation
Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint and Word for reporting and presentations
Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Strong communication skills and stakeholder interaction abilities
¬†
Nice to Have
Experience with reporting tools or BI platforms (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Basic knowledge of SQL or data management concepts
Previous experience in a business analysis, reporting, or operational role

title: Junior Legal Counsel - Corporate & Commercial
description:
Virya Energy, founded in 2019 through the strategic partnership of Colruyt Group and its majority shareholder Korys, is a Belgian pioneer in sustainable energy solutions. Our activities span the complete energy value chain, from renewable energy development in Europe and Asia to energy distribution through DATS 24. Our portfolio encompasses our consolidated wind activities (formerly Eoly in Belgium and Eurowatt in France), solar energy projects, sustainable hydrogen development, and strategic investments in specialized energy industry services providers.
Building on over two decades of wind energy expertise and pioneering work in sustainable hydrogen, we continue to expand our capabilities. At our headquarters, a growing team of professionals drives our development across all renewable energy sectors, delivering tailored energy solutions that accelerate the energy transition.
Your role
As Legal Counsel, you will be part of the Group Legal team, supporting Virya Energy and its subsidiaries in Belgium and internationally. You will provide broad legal support on corporate, commercial and general business law matters, working closely with internal and external stakeholders across the group.
This role offers a high level of variety and exposure, combining day-to-day legal support with involvement in strategic projects across different business lines and operating units.
¬†
Your responsibilities
Providing pragmatic, business-oriented legal advice to the group‚Äôs business lines and operating units, supporting both day-to-day activities and strategic initiatives across Virya Energy and its subsidiaries.
Drafting, reviewing and negotiating a wide range of commercial agreements, including services agreements, development agreements, cooperation agreements, supply and offtake agreements, framework agreements and NDAs.
Assisting in M&A, investment and (project) financing transactions, including legal due diligence and drafting and reviewing transaction documentation such as share purchase agreements, asset transfer agreements, shareholders‚Äô agreements and financing agreements, as well as supporting post-closing implementation.
Supporting corporate housekeeping and governance matters across the group, including board and shareholder documentation, resolutions, mandates and internal governance processes.
Advising internal stakeholders on contractual risk, liability allocation and compliance, translating legal analysis into clear, workable solutions that align with business objectives.
Coordinating with external law firms and notaries, including managing mandates and following up on notarial documentation and related formalities.
Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of group-wide legal policies, guidelines and standard documentation, helping ensure consistency, efficiency and legal robustness across the group.
Preparing internal legal notes, memos and presentations for senior management and/or the board of directors.
Monitoring relevant developments in corporate and commercial law and proactively assessing their impact on the group‚Äôs activities.

title: Junior Electrical Engineer
description:
About Vitestro
Founded in 2017 in Utrecht, Vitestro is pioneering the future of blood collection with the 
Aletta¬Æ Autonomous Robotic Phlebotomy Device‚Ñ¢ (ARPD‚Ñ¢)
. This groundbreaking medical device combines advanced multi-modal imaging (near-infrared, ultrasound, and Doppler ultrasound) with robotics and AI to perform the entire diagnostic blood draw procedure autonomously.
By addressing critical healthcare staffing shortages and improving patient experience, Vitestro is transforming one of the most common and essential medical procedures. With more than 90 team members and growing rapidly, we are scaling our impact. As we placed our first devices with customers, we are now expanding our team to ensure successful implementation and long-term reliability.
At Vitestro, we are committed to continuous innovation and improvement.
Join us as our new Electrical Engineer!
About the role
We are looking for a junior electrical engineer to join us on this journey and help us build the electronics backbone of our device. You will work closely with our electrical systems engineer and freelance electrical engineers and collaborate cross-functionally with mechanical and software engineers.
We provide you with plenty of on-the-job learning experiences.¬†
What you are going to do
Build broad expertise across the device‚Äôs electronic systems, growing into an all-round electrical engineer.
Contribute to the design, development, and validation of PCB test systems.
Support production and customer-facing teams with electrical troubleshooting and improvements.
Own cable harness documentation, including updates and ongoing development.
Execute electronics changes, upgrades, and optimizations in line with project needs.

title: Junior Category Manager UK
description:
Why we are here¬†
¬† ¬†
Tony‚Äôs Chocolonely is committed to ending exploitation in cocoa. We are an impact company that makes chocolate, not a chocolate company that makes impact. With incredibly tasty chocolate, we lead by example, demonstrating that ethical practices and success can go hand in hand. Through Tony's Open Chain (TOC), mission allies like Ben & Jerry's, Waitrose, Aldi and Pip & Nut have embraced a fairer, more transparent supply chain for their chocolate too.¬†
¬†
What you will do¬†
¬†¬†¬†
We are looking for a Junior Category Manager to join our team in Richmond, London. The #1 goal of this role is to turn a range of category data into killer insights and recommendations that support the growth of both the Tony's brand and the entire chocolate category. Because for us, more growth means more impact!¬†
You will support in upskilling the entire business in category data and insight. You will take ownership of the regular reporting suite and support in managing of our data sources and contracts, so that we can make the right decisions, whilst managing our budgets effectively. You will help drive the commercial agenda by presenting relevant insights and recommendations internally and externally, ensuring that we stay ahead of the curve. You will also be given an opportunity to manage your own external retail relationships.¬†
If you are data-driven, keen to develop your career in category and are passionate about making serious impact in the world of cocoa, we are looking for you!¬†
¬†
All wrapped up, you will
¬†
Turn data into impactful insights to identify category growth opportunities. 
Your data analysis provides insight and recommendations that will help grow the Tony's brand; spotting gaps, distribution opportunities and any potential risks.¬†
Manage the internal reporting process from start to finish. 
You will source, format and deliver category data in regular comprehensive reports, enabling all in the business to stay on top of UK Category performance.¬†
Monitor and communicate business performance. 
You support in communicating category and Tony‚Äôs performance clearly, both internally and externally ensuring we‚Äôre always spotting opportunities and/or risks early on.¬†
Build impactful relationships both internally and externally. 
You foster solid connections with your fellow Tony's team members and build your own retailer relationships ensuring that Tony‚Äôs has a seat at the table.

title: Junior IT Specialist for Physical Security & Network
location_raw: Near Brussels Midi Station, Brussels Hoofdstedelijk Gewest, Belgi√´
description:
Ypto is looking for Young Graduates who want to act as the link between IT and Business. You will manage applications and environments in one of the following domains: Physical Security and Network, and you will serve as the main point of contact and Application Owner for our developers, implementation partners, and colleagues within the team.
You will be part of the Operations department and the Physical Security & Network Team, where numerous digital transformation projects are developed in close collaboration with our customer, NMBS. The technologies managed within the team include CCTV, Access Control, Intrusion Detection, Parking Systems, and Network.
Ypto offers you, as a recent graduate, an excellent growth path within IT, tailored to your ambitions and interests. Through on‚Äëthe‚Äëjob training and both internal and external courses, we introduce you to the IT solutions within your domain and gradually involve you in our complex, challenging, and innovative projects.
Typical responsibilities of an Application Owner:
Keeping domain‚Äërelated servers operational (OS, databases, certificates, ‚Ä¶)
Communicating with the Back Office regarding desired application functionalities
Creating and following up on Service Requests and Change Requests in collaboration with the Solution Architect
Following up on ServiceNow Problems
Participating in project meetings and contacting the necessary teams (Networking, DBAs, KPI, ‚Ä¶)
Actively contributing to NIS2 cybersecurity requirements for servers and applications
Providing support for incoming incidents (INC‚Äôs)
Communicating with Technical PMs regarding field device issues
Applying ServiceNow methodology: Vulnerability Management, KA‚Äôs, IT Remediations
On‚Äë and offboarding servers for monitoring in ScienceLogic/Ignio
Communicating with Business, SOC, Control Rooms, and related teams for major upgrades, testing, and validation of new clients
Validating application updates between provider and back office
Validating application readiness (compatibility)
Following up on application distribution (Software Centers)
Evaluating application solution risks and interfacing with the DPO for validation
Ensuring a separate DB cluster/application and continuous duplication of the Milestone database

title: Strong Junior UX/UI Designer
description:
Zelh is a fast-growing, passionate outsourcing company.
Our mission is to be the most reliable company by offering and maintaining consistently high-quality services.
We achieve the mission by fostering long-term relationships with customers, employees, and vendors. Personal attention, timely communication, and respect for all people are the basis of our business philosophy!
Now we are looking for 
Strong Junior UX/UI Designer
 
At Zelh Tech Department, where we design and build digital products across HR, AI, logistics, architecture, and more. This role is for a growth-oriented designer eager to learn, conceptualize, and actively contribute ideas. You‚Äôll work closely with senior designers, product managers and developers.
Responsibilities:

English classes

title: Talented Junior Developer - Frontend + Backend | Remote
description:
About Us
360dialog is the leading Whatsapp platform for Independent Software Providers. We are hosting the Whatsapp channels for more than 800 software solutions and 45000+ B2B clients. As a bootstrapped and profitable company with no investors in the cap table, we are free to do what makes sense from the business as well as from the tech perspective. Our mission is to enable businesses to not only adapt messaging channels but also use them for performance use cases and drive revenue through them. We love to use state of the art engineering methods all over the place, in software development, tech operations but you will find them also in non-tech areas through the whole organization.
We are looking for like-minded people to join our organization and contribute with their ideas, skills and expertise in exchange for a good payment.
What we offer:
Here‚Äôs an opportunity to shape a whole new industry in Business Messaging. You‚Äôll be joining a team of experienced entrepreneurs who run a bootstrapped and profitable global company.
Join a dynamic, innovative team where you'll collaborate with some of the brightest minds in tech.
Enjoy daily opportunities to learn, grow, and push the boundaries of what's possible.
Work from anywhere in the world with full remote flexibility.
Receive a competitive salary package that reflects your skills, experience and achievements.
NB: This is a contract-based position. We are a fully remote company and welcome applicants from anywhere in the world‚Äîplease disregard the listed countries, which are included only due to system requirements.
Requirements
Please tell us if you are interested in Frontend or Backend development. 
No professional experience is required but a bright mind and commitment to work hard and learn.
Ability to learn constantly and improve a little bit every day
You can be a fresh beginner who is very smart and eager to learn
First knowledge about any programming language with basic understanding how to develop code
Open mind to listen and learn (from Seniors and other sources)
Robust confidence level but far away from being arrogant (or thinking I know it better than others)
Learn-it-all mindset instead of I-Know-it-all
Taking responsibility for every task you do¬†
Working every day to reach the skill-level of a senior ASAP
Budget
The budget range for this role is 
‚Ç¨40k/Year ‚Äì ‚Ç¨60k/Year
, depending on the candidate‚Äôs level of experience and fit with the position requirements.
Background Check Notice
By submitting your application, you acknowledge and agree that 360Dialog may conduct a background check as part of the recruitment and selection process. This may include, verification of your professional experience, educational background, and other relevant information necessary to assess your suitability for the role.

title: ADIA UAE National Internship and Employment Opportunities
description:
Thank you for your interest in internship or employment opportunities at ADIA.¬†
Kindly note that this application is open for UAE Nationals only.
Once you have submitted your application, our team will review your profile for potential Internships and/or Employment opportunities.
For internships:
 It is important to note that ADIA offers two internship intakes, and candidates are encouraged to apply at least 2 months prior to the intake:¬†
 
March Internship Intake: 
Designated for Summer and Fall internship applications. The 
deadline to complete your application is on the 1st of January.
 
October Internship Intake:
 Designated for Winter and Spring internship applications. The 
deadline to complete your application is on the 1st of July.
 
For recruitment:
 It is important to note that ADIA offers two recruitment intakes, and candidates are encouraged to apply at least 2 months prior to the intakes:¬†
 
February Recruitment Intake: 
Designated for Fall semester graduates. The 
deadline to complete your application is on the 1st of January.¬†
 
 
September Recruitment Intake:
 Designated for Spring semester graduates. The 
deadline to complete your application is on the 1st of July.
 
¬†
Be sure to 
review your e-mail inbox regularly
 for invitations to assessments or interviews sent by 
talent.sourcing@adia.ae
 or the National Recruitment team.
Requirements
 
 
CV: 
Include your graduation or expected graduation date (Month, Year). Be sure to include your local and abroad phone number (if applicable).
 
 
Photo:
 as per UAE National ID requirements. 
 
 
Passport copy, Emirates ID, Family Book: 
coloured copies of your personal documents (these can easily downloaded from 
ICA
).
 
 
University Transcripts: 
copies of official academic transcripts preferred. 
 
 
Certificate of Equivalence: 
If you have completed your studies abroad and have graduated already, include your Ministry of Education certificate of equivalence if available. 
 
 
High School Transcripts: 
include your 10th,11th & 12th grade transcripts.
 
 
IELTS: 
attach a copy of your certificate.
 
Document Quality & Size: Ensure that all text is legible, and images are clear. Each document file size should not exceed 5MB.
Please make sure to fill out all the required fields to ensure that your profile can be viewed by our team.

Sarai il motore dell'attivit√†, lavorando a stretto contatto con i Partner e il team di appartenenza. Il tuo ruolo sar√† ibrido e strategico:
Market Intelligence (Hunting 2.0)
: contribuirai all'identificazione e l'ingaggio  di C-Level e Director nel settore verticale di competenza, usando strumenti digitali, network e pensiero laterale. Non cerchiamo chi fa "copia-incolla", ma chi sa scovare il talento dove altri non guardano.
Business Content & Storytelling:
 I nostri Partner hanno le idee e le relazioni, tu hai la capacit√† di renderle visibili. Ti occuperai di creare presentazioni d'impatto, pitch deck e materiali per eventi esclusivi. Dovrai saper "impacchettare" un concetto e renderlo accattivante per un pubblico executive.
Candidate Experience
: Gestirai il primo contatto e le interviste di pre-qualifica. Devi saper affascinare l'interlocutore, spesso figure senior, con professionalit√† ed empatia.
Requirements
Il tuo DNA (Requisiti)
Mindset
: Sei veloce, odi la burocrazia inutile e cerchi sempre il modo pi√π smart per arrivare all'obiettivo.
Business Acumen
: Capisci come funziona un'azienda e sai parlare la lingua di settore.
Hard Skills: 
Ottima padronanza del pacchetto Office (soprattutto PowerPoint/Canva per le presentazioni) e familiarit√† con LinkedIn Recruiter e tool di AI sourcing.
Lingue: 
Inglese fluente
 (scritto e parlato). Lavoriamo su mandati internazionali.
Background: Laurea (Economia, Giurisprudenza, Umanistica o affini). L'esperienza pregressa nell'head hunting √® un plus, ma non un vincolo: valutiamo potenziale e attitudine sopra ogni cosa.
Benefits
Cosa ti offriamo
Impatto
: Non sarai un numero. Il tuo lavoro influenzer√† direttamente il successo della practice.
Mentorship Reale
: Imparerai da esperti del settore, in un ambiente meritocratico dove le buone idee vincono sulla gerarchia.
Solidit√† & Benefit:
 La sicurezza di un grande gruppo uniti a un ambiente di lavoro fresco e collaborativo. Applichiamo la settima corta di 4 gg.
Sede
: Prestigiosi uffici in centro a Milano (C.so Monforte).
Nota sull'iter di selezione:
Per i candidati che avanzeranno nell'iter, sar√† richiesta la presentazione di referenze professionali.
Se sei pronto/a a sfidare lo status quo dell'Executive Search, inviaci il tuo CV!

title: Junior Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
The Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist is responsible for managing incoming payments, ensuring accuracy in financial records, and maintaining positive relationships with customers. This role involves issuing invoices, following up on outstanding payments, reconciling accounts, and supporting the broader finance team in month-end and year-end closing processes.
Key Responsibilities:
 
 Generate and send accurate customer invoices in a timely manner 
 
 Monitor customer accounts for delayed or missed payments 
 
 Contact customers via phone, email, or mail to follow up on outstanding balances 
 
 Apply incoming payments to customer accounts and ensure proper account reconciliation 
 
 Investigate and resolve payment discrepancies or disputes 
 
 Maintain detailed and organized records of all AR transactions 
 
 Collaborate with Sales and Customer Service teams to resolve billing issues 
 
 Support audits by providing documentation and explanations as needed 
 
 Assist with month-end closing and reporting activities 
 
 Ensure compliance with internal policies and relevant accounting regulations 
 
Requirements
 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (preferred) 
 
 2+ years of experience in Accounts Receivable or general accounting 
 
 Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, QuickBooks) and MS Excel 
 
 Strong attention to detail and organizational skills 
 
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
 
 Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines 
 
 Knowledge of GAAP and internal control principles is a plus

title: Marketing Intern (Resellers)
description:
The Marketing Intern for the Customer Service‚ÄìResellers Team supports Ascension‚Äôs marketing initiatives and helps enhance communication strategies for both domestic and international resellers. This role requires the ability to work independently, apply analytical thinking, demonstrate creativity, and feel comfortable using a variety of technology platforms to support B2B marketing efforts.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support the planning and execution of marketing initiatives for domestic and international resellers, gaining hands-on experience in B2B marketing.
Assist in creating, updating, and maintaining reseller communications, including emails, informational materials, and digital resources.
Organize marketing content, track reseller engagement, and maintain accurate client directory data to support ongoing outreach efforts.
Analyze reseller engagement data and contribute to reports that inform marketing decisions and identify opportunities for growth.
Conduct data-driven research using surveys and other tools to gather insights and support targeted marketing strategies for reseller customers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams within Ascension, including Marketing, Product Teams, and Customer Service, to support B2B initiatives.
Use a variety of technology platforms and tools to support communication, reporting, and marketing workflows while developing technical and analytical skills.
Demonstrate a willingness to present research findings, insights, and recommendations in a company meeting.
WHO SHOULD APPLY?
We welcome students who:
Are currently pursuing an Associate‚Äôs, Bachelor‚Äôs, or Master‚Äôs degree.
Have a strong desire to learn, grow, and make meaningful contributions.
Bring excellent communication, problem-solving, and teamwork skills.
Demonstrate a proactive, positive, and motivated attitude.
Exemplify and live our core values of humility, passion, and integrity.
WHAT WILL YOU GAIN?
Hands-on experience contributing to meaningful projects.
Opportunities to develop skills that strengthen your resume.
Experience in a supportive and collaborative company culture.
Real-world experience to prepare you for your future career.
Benefits
Remote
Paid Internship

title: Texas Division Internship
description:
The Ewing Internship Experience Video
Develop the skills and experience you need to succeed in the workplace while making the world a little greener at Ewing, the largest family-owned supplier of landscape and irrigation products in the U.S.
During an internship at Ewing, you can expect to grow your skills, knowledge, and experience in wholesale distribution by working in several different job functions in our 
rotational program
.
You will gain operations experience working alongside our 
Branch Service Professionals 
learning counter sales, shipping, and receiving. Shadowing and performing the duties of a 
Branch Manager 
exposes interns to strategic planning and operations of running a branch.
Interns will gain sales experience working alongside some of our 
Account Managers 
performing sales calls and activities to grow the business.
Lastly, interns are exposed to high-level leadership through the mentoring from 
Regional and Divisional Managers 
allowing exposure to the strategic development of the business and our employees.
All interns will be given the opportunity to work on a 
Capstone Project
, where interns use their knowledge, skills, and interests to develop process improvement strategies for Ewing! Examples of projects include but not limited to‚Ä¶
 
Customer churn outreach
 
Conducting employee ‚Äústay‚Äù interviews
 
Social media outreach
 
Customer satisfaction exploration
 
Learning & Development activity effectiveness
 
And more!
 
At the completion of the project, you will get the opportunity to present your findings and show off your hard work to a group of company executives. A great experience throughout! 
Requirements
 
Must be candidates for a Bachelor's or Master's degree 
 
Candidates for a Bachelor's degree must have at least 75 hours at the end of the fall semester prior to the internship.
 
Benefits
All Interns could qualify for the following benefits:
 
Company-issued laptop (if needed)
 
Relocation Assistance (if needed)
 
Ewing attire (shirts, hats, etc...)
 
Paid time off for holidays etc...
 
Full time employment at the completion of your internship could be available for those interested and qualified!

title: Store Design Junior Project Manager, UK & ANZ
description:
About Charlotte Tilbury Beauty
Founded by British makeup artist and beauty entrepreneur Charlotte Tilbury MBE in 2013, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty has revolutionised the face of the global beauty industry by de-coding makeup applications for everyone, everywhere, with an easy-to-use, easy-to-choose, easy-to-gift range. Today, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty continues to break records across countries, channels, and categories and to scale at pace.
Over the last 10 years, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty has experienced exceptional growth and is one of the most talked about brands in the beauty industry and beyond. It has become a global sensation across 50 markets (and growing), with over 2,300 employees globally who are part of the Dream Team making the magic happen.
Today, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty is a truly global business, delivering market-leading growth, innovative retail and product launches fuelled by industry-leading tech ‚Äî all with an internal culture of embracing challenges, disruptive thinking, winning together, and sharing the magic. The energy behind the bran¬≠d is infectious, and as we grow, we are always looking for extraordinary talent who want to be part of this our success and help drive our limitless ambitions.
About the role
We are looking for a motivated and proactive Store Design Junior Project Manager to support the delivery of high-quality retail store projects across the UK & ANZ! This role focuses on managing projects from briefing to installation within retailers, ensuring that the Charlotte Tilbury brand is executed consistently, efficiently and in line with our operational, budget and quality requirements.
We are looking for someone who can contribute to the team culture, manage and support the delivery of projects, communicate clearly and stay highly organised. A Junior Project Manager should be a team thinker, collaborator, doer and someone who adds value through strong detail management and proactive problem solving! 
Please note, we are 2-3 days in the office (Central London) and the rest of the time you can WFH.
As a Store Design Junior Project Manager, you will
Manage and support the delivery of concession store projects including approvals, retailer coordination and supplier liaison.
Maintain our design standards across all architectural details and ensuring they are reflected accurately in retailer environments.
Preparing, owning and updating project CPAs and presenting progress back to the business.
Manage design pack submissions for internal approval and retailer sign off, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
Coordinate with suppliers, consultants, internal teams and retailers, keeping all stakeholders informed and aligned.
Support the review of manufacture drawings with the design team to ensure design integrity and compliance with safety standards. Assist in development and updates to design standards guidelines.
Manage all admin elements of projects including documentation, filing, tracking, purchase orders and project budgets.
Attending installations, resolving issues on site and ensuring snagging is completed to brand standard.
Support the broader team with meeting coordination, preparing decks, updating presentations and capturing meeting notes. Ensuring all project information is organised, accurate and accessible.
Who you will work with
You will report directly to our wonderful Senior Store Design Project Manager ‚Äì UK & ANZ, working alongside some highly creative and talented individuals within our wider VM & Store Design UK team.
You will also work cross functionally, with teams such as Commercial, Retail, VM, PR & Global, as well as external suppliers and partners.
About you
You have demonstrable experience in a similar role within Project Management in Store Design, alongside experience in managing the approval process for retail stores in all types of environments (Retailer Stores, Free Standing Stores).
Extensive knowledge of best practice within the construction industry including accessibility and building codes is a must.
You have an exceptional eye for detail and great vision on how to use spaces and commercial opportunities. You are skilled in the visual, written and verbal communication of design issues. 
An excellent communicator: confident and comfortable presenting, able to influence and effectively articulate your point of view. You have exceptional organisational skills and can manage multiple stakeholders with ease!
You thrive working to pace, you are able to ruthlessly prioritise and can manage multiple deadlines at anyone time with ease.
Decisive problem-solving skills with regards to construction materials and methods a must, with an awareness of design trends and materials. You have a strong understanding of basic mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and structural concepts. 
You are a self-starter, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to collaborate and drive team success!
You have excellent project planning and time management skills, with an exceptional eye for detail and great vision on how to use spaces and commercial opportunities. 
Ability to balance design with operational needs and budget objectives, to create exceptional store environments and customer experience. 
You are super confident using the MS Suite, with m
onday.com knowledge advantageous. You have good working knowledge of Vectorworks, AutoCAD and basic Photoshop, InDesign. 
Knowledge of best practice within the construction industry, including accessibility requirements is advantageous. 
 
Charlotte Tilbury is a fast-paced and dynamic environment where nimble mindsets, striving to deliver the best and wanting to be part of a global #dreaamteam are key. Even though we have requirements, our experience and background are just a guide, we still love to welcome applicants with more or less experience stated, provided necessary skills can be demonstrated.
Why join us?
Be a part of this values driven, high growth, magical journey with an ultimate vision to empower everyone, everywhere to be the best version of themselves
We‚Äôre a hybrid model with flexibility, allowing you to work how best suits you
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) with an additional day to celebrate your birthday
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey
Financial security and planning with our pension and life assurance for all
Wellness and social benefits including Medicash, Employee Assist Programs and regular social connects with colleagues
Bring your fury friend to work with you on our allocated dog friendly days and spaces
And not to forget our generous product discount and gifting!
At Charlotte Tilbury Beauty, our mission is to empower everybody in the world to be the most beautiful version of themselves. We celebrate and support this by encouraging and hiring people with diverse backgrounds, cultures, voices, beliefs, and perspectives into our growing global workforce. By doing so, we better serve our communities, customers, employees - and the candidates that take part in our recruitment process.
If you want to learn more about life at Charlotte Tilbury Beauty please follow our 
LinkedIn page!

title: Junior B2B Sales Executive
description:
City Wide Facility Solutions - Toronto
 
is seeking a tenacious closer to join our Sales Team! 
If you aggressively prospect for business, sell with confidence and integrity, and have a deep understanding of your clients' needs, our team and compensation structure is waiting for you!
Please note, this is a pure sales role primarily focused on prospecting and closing the deal. As a Jr. Sales Executive, you will be responsible for new business development through cold-calling and supervised field walk-ins with very little post-sale account management. You can expect a highly structured, productive, sales-driven, start-up environment. Working closely with Business Account Managers and your leadership team, you will position City Wide's well defined UVP to establish and nurture mutually profitable business relationships with clients. Successful Jr. Sales Executives will easily bring home over 
$100,000
 in your first year and have very rapid career advancement opportunities. Priority will be given to those applicants that demonstrate a history of success in this kind of environment. 
The territory for this position will be GTA including Toronto, Etobicoke, Vaughn, Woodbridge, etc. The ideal candidate will have easy access to these locations and our office at 427 and Burnamthorpe.  Please do not apply if you are not geographically well positioned.
In this position you will:
Identify and qualify potential clients.
Initiate the sales process by scheduling appointments, understand account requirements, and make initial presentations.
Closes sales by building rapport with potential accounts, explaining our service capabilities, overcoming objections, and preparing contracts.
Conduct a minimum of 25 hours prospecting each week.
Utilize and manage your customer relationship management system (CRM) to maintain all customer information.
Maintain and manage your Hot 25 list in CRM.
Maintain an elevated rapport, communicating and behaving professionally so that you stand out to clients, co-workers, and supervisors. 
Undergo rigorous strategic sales training.
Other duties as assigned by management.
Requirements
1+ years inside or outside B2B sales experience, prefer most recent job experience in outside sales
Demonstrated track record of success demonstrating promotability and 1-2 full calendar years, IE 105% of sales goal via scorecard or sales dashboard.
Strong skill set for prospecting and developing a territory
Proficiency in CRM systems to include strong data entry and organization of sales data
Prior sales training certificate, e.g., Sandler, President‚Äôs Club, Dale Carnegie, etc., preferred, but you will go through rigorous sales training here.
Experience closing short-cycle B2B sales
Outgoing, dynamic personality
Can-do attitude that loves to be challenged
Organized within a defined sales process with an ability to move clients from prospect to close
An excellent communicator with the ability to facilitate a presentation or a one-to-one meeting
Demonstrated ability to coordinate team activities and work effectively with operations and marketing teams
Strong MS Office
City Wide Facility Solutions is a Professional Sales and Management leader in the building maintenance industry serving the more than 100 locations across the US and Canada. We are the Professionals in a non-Professional industry. Our mission includes a dedication to serving others with excellence in all we do. Here you will find a high-energy work environment that balances high expectations with a strong commitment to work-life balance, sales and career coaching, group support, and fun. Applicants to this job posting will be considered for the geographic territory requested in the online application.
Benefits
City Wide offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including car allowance.

title: Growth & Marketing Intern (X)
description:
This is a hands-on role focused on building our presence and driving growth on X (Twitter). You'll create content, engage with the tech/AI community, and experiment with strategies to grow our audience and brand awareness.
You will:
Own and manage Convergent's X account day-to-day.
Create and schedule engaging content: posts, threads, memes, commentary.
Engage with the AI, startup, and tech community‚Äîbuild relationships and visibility.
Monitor trends and conversations to find opportunities for timely content.
Experiment with growth tactics and track what works (impressions, engagement, followers).
Collaborate with product and leadership to amplify launches, features, and company news.
Analyze performance and share learnings to refine our content strategy.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
Active on X with a good feel for what works on the platform.
Strong writing skills‚Äîclear, punchy, and engaging.
Interest in AI, startups, and tech culture.
Self-starter who can create and ship content independently.
Comfortable with fast iteration and experimentation.
Nice to have:
Personal account with some traction or examples of content you've created.
Understanding of B2B marketing or SaaS.
Benefits
Compensation varies based on profile and experience, but a general cash range for the 3-month internship (fixed comp + performance variable) is $5,000-$10,000, plus a competitive equity package in case you are confirmed.

title: Junior Full Stack Developer
description:
We are seeking a Junior Full Stack Developer with 1-3 years of experience to join our growing team. The ideal candidate is passionate about building scalable web applications, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and enjoys working collaboratively with cross-functional teams. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a willingness to learn new technologies.
Key Responsibilities
 
Develop, test, and maintain scalable web applications.
 
Work with Node.js and TypeScript to build backend services.
 
Design and optimize databases using PostgreSQL and write efficient SQL queries.
 
Integrate third-party APIs (RESTful APIs, GraphQL, Webhooks).
 
Build and maintain frontend components using React.js or similar frameworks.
 
Utilize version control systems like Git for code management.
 
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other developers to deliver high-quality software.
 
Troubleshoot and debug issues to improve application performance.
 
Requirements
 
¬†1-3 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.
 
Proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript.
 
¬†Experience with PostgreSQL and writing efficient SQL queries.
 
¬†Familiarity with frontend frameworks like React.js (or similar).
 
¬†Knowledge of third-party API integrations (RESTful APIs, GraphQL, Webhooks).
 
¬†Understanding of Git for version control.
 
¬†Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 
¬†Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Fly.io).
 
 
¬†Basic knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and Docker.

, or an equivalent processor. 
 
 A minimum of

.

 A

 A

 A

 for communication and verification purposes.

Join Our Dynamic Team:¬†
Experience our fun, inclusive, innovative culture that values your unique contributions and supports your professional growth.

Limitless Career Growth:
¬†Unlock a world of possibilities and resources to propel your career forward.
 
 
Fast-Paced Thrills:
¬†Thrive in a high-energy, engaging atmosphere. Embrace challenges and reap stimulating rewards.
 
 
Flexibility, Your Way:

Work-Life Balance at Its Best:
¬†Say goodbye to stressful commutes and hello to quality time with loved ones. Achieve a healthy work-life integration to perform at your best.

title: Junior QA Tester (Part-Time)
description:
Description
As a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer, you will be responsible for safeguarding the quality and functionality of our platforms. You will design and execute thorough testing processes, document results with precision, and collaborate with developers to ensure issues are resolved before deployment. Your work directly impacts the smooth daily operations of our business and the experience of every user.
Job Responsibilities
Platform Testing & Quality Control
Perform thorough manual testing of related systems
Conduct regression, smoke, and sanity tests to validate system performance and stability
Identify, document, and track bugs or issues through resolution
Documentation & Reporting
Create clear, detailed, and organized test case documentation
Maintain accurate records of test results, bug reports, and fixes
Collaboration & Communication
Work closely with developers, product managers, and stakeholders to clarify requirements and confirm that fixes meet expectations
Participate in review sessions to ensure all features meet quality standards before release
Process Familiarization & Continuous Learning
Study and utilize the User Manual and other Confluence resources to stay updated on features, processes, and best practices
Understand platform workflows and the business processes they support
Technical Skills Development
Learn to perform and interpret HTTP calls to support testing needs
Requirements
Minimum of 1-2 years of professional experience in software quality assurance or a closely related field, with a proven track record of identifying, documenting, and resolving issues
Extensive experience in manual testing of web-based platforms and applications, with the ability to design, execute, and maintain comprehensive test cases
Strong expertise in test automation, including designing, developing, and maintaining automated test scripts to improve the efficiency and scalability of testing processes
Proficient in regression testing, with the capability to set up automated regression suites to reduce manual testing for existing products, allowing manual QA to focus on new features and product releases
Technical proficiency with QA tools and frameworks, including:
Selenium WebDriver for web app UI automation, or Playwright / Cypress for modern web automation
Can understand and write code primarily using the JavaScript programming language.
Postman for manual API testing
JUnit / TestNG / NUnit / PyTest for unit and integration testing
JMeter for performance testing
SQL for querying and validating database records
Git (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket) for reviewing and managing automation code and test scripts
Browser Developer Tools for debugging and inspection
Jenkins for CI/CD test execution pipelines
Azure DevOps for work tracking, testing, and collaboration
Maven / Gradle / npm for building and managing test frameworks
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with proficiency in tools such as Slack and Google Docs for team communication and documentation
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to document processes and issues with accuracy and clarity
Familiarity with regression, smoke, and sanity testing concepts
Strong communication and collaboration skills for working with cross-functional teams
Basic understanding of HTTP calls and web application functionality is a plus
Experience with Confluence or similar documentation tools is a plus

Internet Connection:

15 Mbps
.

10 Mbps
.

Desktop or laptop equipped with at least:
Intel Core i5 (8th generation or newer)
,¬†
Intel Core i3 (10th generation or newer)
,¬†

, or an equivalent processor.

Join Our Dynamic Team:
 Experience our fun, inclusive, innovative culture that values your unique contributions and supports your professional growth.
Embrace the Opportunities:

title: Junior Payroll Specialist
description:
Critical Manufacturing is dedicated to empowering high-performance operations to make Industry 4.0 a reality with the most innovative, comprehensive, and modular MES software. We have a global presence, but our headquarters, and the main technical center, are in Porto (Maia), Portugal, where we develop a state-of-the-art solution for Semiconductor, Electronics, Medical Devices, and other Discrete industries.
Recognized for the third consecutive year as a Leader by Gartner, we are part of ASMPT, the world's largest supplier of best-in-class equipment, and technological process partner for the electronics and semiconductor industries.
The role:
The main responsibility of this position is to oversee salary processing for our employees in Portugal, along with maintaining and managing all associated documentation. Join our team and apply today as a Junior Payroll Specialist!
What you‚Äôll do:
Conduct salary processing for more than 500 employees

Manage all necessary documents for salary processing

Register and track changes in employees' tax status
Suggest and implement improvement ideas to enhance this process
Support the implementation of the new ERP version of Microsoft Dynamics
Invoices confirmation
Expenses and invoices booking in the ERP
Requirements

Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economy, Management or similar
 
More than 2 years of experience in similar roles
 
Experience with ERP¬¥s (e.g: primavera, sap, phc‚Ä¶)
 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Portuguese and English
 
Great sense of responsibility
 
People-oriented
 
Adaptability
 
Dynamic approach
 
Ability to meet deadlines
 
 
What we consider a plus (not mandatory):
Knowledge of the ERP Microsoft Dynamics

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Critical Manufacturing is dedicated to empowering high-performance operations to make Industry 4.0 a reality with the most innovative, comprehensive, and modular MES software. We have a global presence, but our headquarters, and the main technical center, are in Porto (Maia), Portugal, where we develop a state-of-the-art solution for Semiconductor, Electronics, Medical Devices, and Industrial Equipment.
Recognized as a Leader by Gartner, we are part of ASMPT, the world's largest supplier of best-in-class equipment, and technological process partner for the electronics and semiconductor industries.¬†
The Role
As a¬†Junior Software Engineer, you will work full-stack with an emphasis on backend development in C#. You will contribute to the continuous improvement of our MES platform through developing scalable, high-quality software supporting real-time control, data collection, and automation in complex manufacturing environments.
What You Will Do
Create, develop and maintain backend services and their frontend counterparts
Collaborate with team members and learn to deliver robust, tested solutions
Support debugging, testing, and documentation efforts to ensure system reliability
Participate actively in an agile delivery process, contributing ideas and learning best practices
What Success Looks Like
Within your first year, you will have:
Delivered multiple backend and frontend features with strong test coverage and code quality
Gained solid understanding of MES architecture and Industry 4.0 applications
Actively contributed to team code reviews and process improvements
Why Join Us
Be part of a company shaping the future of manufacturing software
Enjoy the freedom to experiment, innovate, and create systems that will last
Join a team where storytelling, strategy, and technology meet to make Industry 4.0 real
Requirements
What You Will Bring
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or relevant field (or equivalent experience)
Good knowledge of object-oriented programming (preferably C#/.Net and Node.js)
Good knowledge of frontend technologies (preferably TypeScript or Angular)
Strong willingness to learn, good communication skills, and teamwork orientation
Excellent English skills ‚Äì spoken and written
What We Consider A Plus (not mandatory)
Knowledge of PostgreSQL or ClickHouse
Knowledge of Manufacturing Execution Systems, or Manufacturing processes
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are a source of commitment and innovation
At Critical Manufacturing, we welcome and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of disabilities, diverse abilities, identities, or experiences. Our commitment is to create an inclusive environment where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed and thrive.¬†
If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know - we're happy to support you.

title: (CG) Junior Credit Analyst / Mortgage Credit Support - 044
description:

Junior Credit Analyst / Mortgage Credit Support

e: up to Php 60,000/month

 Mondays to Fridays, 7:00am to 4:00pm Philippine Time

: Australian Public Holidays

Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail

title: Junior Pre-Sales Consultant (Technical Bid and Solution Specialist, German)
description:
D-ploy is an 
IT
 and Engineering Solutions company with operations throughout the EMEA region including Switzerland, Germany, Czech Republic, Austria, UK, as well as the USA.
We pride ourselves on delivering innovative and superior services and solutions to numerous industry-leading clients. By building relationships and trusted partnerships within the 
IT
 community, we optimize our customer‚Äòs 
IT
 productivity and contribute to the organization‚Äôs success and value.
We are interested in talking to engaging, flexible, and solution-oriented individuals who are looking to become a part of a dynamically growing and international organization. We are focused on creating value where 
IT
 counts, join us! 
We are seeking a dynamic Technical Bid and Solution Specialist to support our bid management and solution development processes. This key role bridges technical service delivery and business development by coordinating with internal teams and contributing to the development of technical responses for customer bids. You will leverage your IT expertise to create solutions that address clients' specific needs and clearly articulate how our services deliver value.
The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of IT infrastructure, IT Technologies, service delivery, and will play a vital part in winning new contracts by ensuring our bid responses are comprehensive, technically sound, and aligned with client requirements
Tasks and Responsibilities
 
Bid Management & Coordination: Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams including service delivery, technical experts, and project managers to gather necessary information and ensure alignment of the bid response with customer requirements.
 
Technical Solution Design: Develop innovative technical solutions for client bids, utilizing your deep understanding of IT infrastructure, service management (ITIL framework), and other IT technologies.
 
Proposal Development: Write, edit, and proofread technical sections of proposals and bids, ensuring content is accurate, persuasive, and compliant with customer requirements.
 
Solution Presentation: Create and deliver compelling presentations that effectively communicate the value of our technical solutions and service delivery approach, using tools like PowerPoint.
 
Client-Centric Focus: Conduct research into client needs, competitive landscapes, and potential risks, tailoring solutions and bid responses to address specific client challenges and opportunities.
 
Compliance & Quality Assurance: Ensure that all bid submissions meet customer requirements, industry standards, and formatting guidelines. Review and improve proposal templates and boilerplate content for future use.
 
Process Improvement: Continuously update and refine proposal templates, best practices, and knowledge repositories to support a more efficient bid response process.
 
Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with sales, technical experts, and business development teams to ensure alignment on proposal strategies, client goals, and solution delivery.
 
Risk Assessment & Mitigation: Identify potential risks in service delivery for bid responses and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes.
 
Requirements
 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience is a plus
 
Experience working in a pre-sales, solutions architect, or service delivery role within a bid or sales environment and hands on experience. 
 
Prior experience in responding to large-scale IT service delivery bids across industries such as government, healthcare, or enterprise IT.
 
 
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in bid management, technical writing, or IT service delivery, preferably within the IT services or technology industry.
 
Strong technical knowledge of IT.
 
Proven experience in coordinating and writing complex technical proposals and bids.
 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to simplify and articulate complex technical concepts clearly.
 
Proficiency in creating compelling presentations and bid documentation using tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
 
Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams to meet tight deadlines.
 
Strong organizational and time management skills, with attention to detail and a commitment to high-quality work.
 
Familiarity with procurement processes and government contracting standards is a plus.
 
Fluency in English and German, spoken and written.
 
Candidates have to provide a Criminal record extract not older than three months.
 
Benefits
 
Broad range of activities, tasks, and projects
 
Flexible working conditions 
 
Minimum 5 weeks of vacation
 
Paid sick days
 
Meal vouchers
 
Vouchers (B-day voucher, wedding, and new born surprise)
 
Contributions to wellness programs (multisport card)
 
Fishing for Friends program ‚Äì our referral program
 
Refreshments in the D-ploy office
 
Further development and professional advancement 
 
Friendly and international working environment  
 
Company-sponsored events
 
Competitive salary and various benefits
 
Is 
IT
 in your DNA?

title: Intern - Europe Flagship Investments
description:
Who We Are
Energy Impact Partners (EIP) is a global investment platform leading the transition to a sustainable energy future. EIP brings together bold entrepreneurs and some of the world‚Äôs most forward-looking energy and industrial companies to advance clean energy innovation. EIP has over $4 billion in assets under management and invests globally across venture, growth, and credit.
We‚Äôre seeking an Intern to join our European investing team, which covers venture, growth and private equity investments across the broader climate and energy landscape. The intern will be integrally involved across the investment process, including sourcing and evaluating potential investments; performing due diligence, structuring transactions; monitoring performance at portfolio companies; and more.
Interns at EIP will work on real-time projects and participate in day-to day activities on our teams to enable the clean energy transition. EIP Interns will be empowered to bring creativity and initiative to their work to discover their passion in finance, clean energy, and more. Our team of innovators and collaborators is looking for growth-oriented interns to provide support to teams and bring new ideas to the EIP ecosystem.
Requirements
Intern roles include but are not limited to, those described below:
Screening prospective investment opportunities
Researching and synthesizing market trends and data
Conducting due diligence on potential investments
Developing internal investment committee presentation materials
Providing ongoing portfolio support, monitoring, and administration
The Ideal Candidate Will Have:
A bachelor's or master's degree in relevant field with a strong academic track record
Excellent analytical skills and capability to assess complex business cases
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple responsibilities and/or projects at a time
A positive attitude, be open-minded, and be ready to work as a team player
Intellectually curiosity, be a highly motivated self-starter, and detail oriented
Demonstrated passion around climate technology and/or sustainability is a plus
Benefits
Compensation with this role is commensurate with experience. Candidates earning graduate degrees are eligible for a rate of ¬£30 per hour, with an expectation of working twenty hours per week. This role is based out of our London office and is a three-month commitment with the potential to extend, for an immediate or early January start.

title: Internship - Finance Intern EMEA (F/M/D)
description:
Flowdesk's mission is to build a global financial institution for digital assets, one designed from the ground up for market integrity and efficiency.
To achieve this in a rapidly evolving market, we apply a disciplined, first-principles approach to everything we do. This approach is embedded in our core services, from institutional liquidity provision, trading solutions, OTC execution to our comprehensive treasury management offerings. This is how we cut through the noise and build robust and scalable systems across all our business lines.
We seek individuals who are driven by this systematic approach. Joining Flowdesk means you will be a key contributor in building and scaling a more transparent and efficient financial markets infrastructure.
Given our rapid growth, we've also launched our Early Talent Program, designed to attract and develop high-potential students through internship experiences. This program aims to build a strong pipeline of future full-time employees who are already aligned with our culture and expectations.
At this position you will primarily manage day-to-day financial controls and operations. Your core mission is accuracy, timeliness, and audit-ready records, ensuring invoices are correctly coded and approved, payments run on schedule, receivables are billed/collected, accounts reconcile, and data remains consistent across NetSuite, Abacum, HR, and internal trackers. You will maintain documentation, strengthen controls, and drive process/automation improvements in these routines. Occasionally, you will support FP&A tasks such as tying out actuals to budget, updating simple reports, and assisting with variance explanations.
Role 
Finance Control
1. Accounts Payable
Record supplier invoices in the accounting system (e.g. NetSuite).
Verify invoice accuracy and compliance (supplier details, VAT, cost center, approval flow).
Follow up with employees for missing receipts and ensure proper documentation.
Support payment runs, review due dates, validate invoices, and assist with payment processing.
Organize and archive supporting documents (digitally or physically).
2. Accounts Receivable
Assist in client billing, collect necessary data, issue invoices, and ensure timely delivery.
Track incoming payments and help reconcile them with accounting records.
Support account reconciliation and monitor outstanding receivables.
3. Month-End Closing Support
Prepare account reconciliations (suppliers, customers, accrued expenses, deferred revenues).
Assist in reconciling accounting data with FP&A reports.
Ensure proper analytical and accounting allocations for all transactions.
FP&A
1. Reporting & Analysis
Support monthly variance analysis by updating and reconciling actuals vs. budget files.
Help prepare departmental and product-level reports for management.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify cost drivers, trends, or process improvements.
2. Forecasting & Planning
Assist in forecasting and budgeting cycles, including headcount, travel, and OPEX tracking.
3. Data Management & Systems
Maintain and update FP&A dashboards and data models in Google Sheets and Excel.
Ensure data integrity across Finance systems and sources (NetSuite, Abacum, HR, and other trackers).
Requirements
Background and experience
Bachelor‚Äôs in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related.
Experience with Google Sheets and Excel
Experience or interest in Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable, reconciliations, month-end;
ERP familiarity (e.g., NetSuite) a plus.
Strong written and verbal communication in English, French is a plus.
Skills and personality
Highly detail-oriented and analytical.
Focused, patient and proactive.
Eager to learn¬†and develop your Finance Control skills in a fast-pace environment.
Start Date, starting from January 2026
What would be the Internship duration ? 6 months¬†(5 days in a week, full time on-site)
Who is eligible ? Bachelor's student who are able to provide an internship convention. 
Benefits
International environment (English is the main language)
50% of transportation costs & a sustainable mobility agreement
Swile lunch voucher (‚Ç¨9.25 per day, 60% covered)
Team events and offsites
Recruitment Process
Are you interested in this job but feel you haven't ticked all the boxes? Don't hesitate to apply and tell us in the cover letter section why we should meet!
Here's what you can expect if you apply
Technical Test 
HR Interview 
Technical Interview with the team 
Wrap-up Interview with the CFO
On the agenda, discussions rather than trick questions! These moments of exchange will allow you to understand how Flowdesk works and its values. But they are also (and above all) an opportunity for you to present your career path and your expectations for your next job! 
We are committed to an inclusive and accessible recruitment process. If you require any reasonable adjustments or have specific needs to enable you to participate fully in the interview or assessment process (e.g., a sign language interpreter, extra time for a test, or an accessible location), please contact us to discuss how we can support you.

title: Junior QA Engineer EMEA (F/M/D)
description:
Flowdesk's mission is to build a global financial institution for digital assets, one designed from the ground up for market integrity and efficiency.
To achieve this in a rapidly evolving market, we apply a disciplined, first-principles approach to everything we do. This approach is embedded in our core services, from institutional liquidity provision, trading solutions, OTC execution to our comprehensive treasury management offerings. , you will work closely with our product and engineering teams to ensure the high quality and reliability of our client-facing platform. This is a hands-on position where you will help define, execute, and automate test plans for new features and existing functionalities. English is mandatory
