title: 3D Animation Internship (Gurgaon)
description:
Lakshya, a Keywords Studios company,¬†in India is headquartered in Gurgaon and has a team of over 700 employees spread across studio facilities in Gurgaon, Pune and Seattle, and sales offices in San Diego and Tokyo. Setup in 2004, Lakshya has, over the last 20 years, created a reputation in the game development industry for being a highly talented and dependable game art studio. During this time, Lakshya has created art for over a hundred game titles, including hugely successful global hits such as Bloodborne, Dark Souls II, Just Cause 3, WWE 2K16, Uncharted 2, Farmville and Cityville. Lakshya‚Äôs senior team, which comprises of top-notch International and Indian talent, has a huge amount of experience of creating art for different game platforms and genres. Lakshya blends artistic creativity with strong process orientation in order to deliver best in class services. Lakshya works closely with NASSCOM to help in the growth of the game development eco-system in India.
For more info, please refer to 
https://lakshyadigital.com/
¬†
Job Information
Lakshya is seeking passionate and talented 3D Animation Interns to join our team. This internship offers the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in Game animation, working on exciting projects alongside experienced professionals. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in animation, excellent communication skills, and a willingness to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.
Requirements
 
Degree in Animation, Film, Digital Media, or related field.
 
Strong passion for animation and storytelling.
 
Proficiency in animation software such as Maya, 3ds Max, Motion Builder etc.
 
Basic understanding of animation principles and techniques.
 
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
 
Ability to take direction and work collaboratively in a team environment.
 
Positive attitude and willingness to learn and adapt.
 
Learnings from 6 months Internship Program
 
Gain experience and earn simultaneously with our "Earn While You Learn" program!
 
Get training by Industry Experts
 
Advance training on Keyframe & Motion Capture across Different Platforms (Max, Maya, motion Builder, Blender, Unreal)
 
Exposure towards Gaming Industry Pipeline.

title: Junior CAD Technician - #34819
description:
Exciting opportunity to join the client, where you can be part of a trusted company recognized for delivering high-quality survey solutions in a dynamic real estate market. This role offers exposure to innovative projects, professional growth, and the chance to work alongside industry experts while contributing to the rapid development and modernization of the region‚Äôs property sector.
Company Profile
Our client is in the Real Estate industry and for 15 years has been the industry benchmark throughout the GCC, providing survey, subdivision, and measurement services across the full spectrum of the property and construction sector.
From the most complex and prestigious developments in the world to one-off boutique communities, they provide their partners with the tools and insight to navigate today‚Äôs cutting-edge construction advancements and help futureproof their developments for tomorrow.
Job Description
Assist in preparing detailed CAD drawings¬† 
Use CAD software for technical drawings¬† 
Maintain organized drawing files and file directories as per company policy¬† 
Collaborate with surveyors to integrate data¬† 
Perform quality control checks¬† 
Engage in continuous learning¬† 
Drawing work will be primarily focused on creating new drawings rather than updating or maintaining existing files, applying specific company processes to existing architectural plans¬† 
Handle projects involving subdivision of buildings, working with existing architectural plans to create boundary lines and extract areas for authority submissions during both pre-construction and post-completion phases¬† 
Requirements
At least 0‚Äì2 years of experience in CAD drafting (open to candidates with no experience as long as they are proficient in AutoCAD)¬† 
Diploma or Certificate in Drafting, Architecture, Surveying, or related field¬† 
Experience working in the Construction or Surveying industry¬† 
Technical proficiency in CAD software¬† 
Strong attention to detail and accuracy¬† 
Ability to interpret survey data¬† 
Strong organizational skills¬† 
Good verbal and written communication skills¬† 
Arabic and other languages are advantageous but not required¬† 
Proficiency in AutoCAD¬† 
Knowledge of Revit or Civil 3D is advantageous but not required¬† 
Knowledge of GIS systems, Adobe Photoshop, or Illustrator is a bonus but not mandatory¬† 
Ability to work under supervision¬† 
Strong teamwork skills.
Job Type: Permanent¬† 
Employment Type: Full-time¬† 
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM UAE time (12:30 PM to 9:30 PM Manila time). The candidate may be required to start earlier or work overtime depending on workload.
Location: Work From Home¬† 
Industry: CAD

title: Junior Full-Stack Developer - Go/React/TypeScript (Work-from-home)
description:
Company Profile:
Our client is a premium sports apparel brand providing on-trend, technically superior, and value-rich apparel to licensed sports markets. Their core strengths include innovation, decoration, and quick response.
¬†
The Toronto-based company employs over 200 full-time skilled staff at its Richmond Hill office and manufacturing facility, with products distributed globally. Their apparel is sold in most of the Top 100 Golf Courses across North America. They use only well-tested and functional fabrics and components, combined with exceptional craftsmanship. Over the years, they have built strong partnerships and developed an extensive global supply chain that includes China, India, Hong Kong, Bangladesh, and Cambodia.
Overall purpose and responsibilities of the role:
As a Junior‚ÄìMid Level Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing the company‚Äôs web applications. You will also design and implement backend services to support application functionality. and REST APIs and work with the team.
Duties and Responsibilities:
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Develop, maintain, and optimize full-stack web applications.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Build responsive, high-quality UI components using React, TypeScript, and Next.js.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Develop backend services and REST APIs using Go.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Work with SQL databases (primarily MSSQL) and GraphQL endpoints.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Collaborate via Git/GitHub and follow best practices for version control.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Troubleshoot, debug, and enhance application performance.
Requirements
Must-have Skills/Qualification:
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† 2+ years of experience being a full stack developer
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Strong proficiency in: React, TypeScript, Next.js,¬† SQL,GraphQL, Git/GitHub
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Experience with relational databases, especially MSSQL
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Solid understanding of full software development lifecycle and modern web architecture
¬†
Nice to Have
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Experience in Go
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Familiarity with Linux environments
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Experience with PHP
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Knowledge of UI frameworks such as Material UI or Tailwind CSS
¬†
Note: Preferred candidate with own laptop/equipment

title: Junior to Intermediate Level - Database Administrator - #34849
description:
As a Database Administrator‚Äôs role is to design, install, monitor, maintain, and performance tune the corporate database environment. Additionally, this role includes maintaining high levels of data availability plus creating, implementing and
operating a database recovery strategy. This individual is also responsible for developing,
implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures that ensure the security and integrity of the corporate database environment. DBA is responsible for maintaining and adding to the existing different data replication tools in use.
DBA is also responsible for monitoring for notifications and fixing failed SQL Server jobs, replication, permissions, database configuration, etc.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Monitor database system details within thedatabase, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements.
Respond to and resolve database access and performance issues.
Monitor, optimize and allocate physical data storage for database systems.
Plan and coordinate data migrations between systems.
Design and implement redundant systems, backup and restore tools, and dynamic options for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of corporate data assets.
Work with application development staff to develop database architecture, coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures.
Work with Walton BI team on managing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and any data analysis technologies
Assess and develop long-term strategic goals for production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers.
Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications to databases.
Conduct research and make recommendations on database technologies, services, protocols, and standards in support of application development efforts.
Establish appropriate end-user database access control levels and perform when required database transaction and security audits.
Document all policies, procedures, and methodologies relating to the administration of the corporate database environment. 
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the team where applicable
Requirements
Must-have Skills/Qualification:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology, Computer Science, Information
Systems, or a related field, and 3 years equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Experienced in supporting SQL Server IaaS and PaaS, Azure SQL Server
Experienced in setting up SQL Replication and Mirroring
Knowledge of reporting and query tools and practices
Analysis Services, Integration Services, and Reporting Services
Good understanding of the organization‚Äôs goals and objectives
Good interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong technical documentation skills.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Work Conditions
After hour support during planned system outages.
Emergency availability for unplanned system outages.
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse,power tools, and to handle other computer components.
Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.
Advantageous Experience/Skills:
SSAS experience
Server Log Shipping,

Your Next Opportunity Starts Here

title: Junior Software Sales Associate
description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and ambitious Junior Software Sales Associate to join our team. This 
entry-level position
 is ideal for 
recent graduates
 who are eager to begin a career in technology sales and business development.
Role Overview
As a 
Junior Software Sales Associate
, you will receive comprehensive training and guidance from experienced professionals. You will be exposed to all aspects of the sales process, supporting the team in identifying client needs, presenting tailored solutions, and maintaining client relationships.
Key Responsibilities
 
Assist in identifying new business opportunities and potential clients
 
Support the preparation of presentations, proposals, and sales materials
 
Participate in client meetings and gain exposure to sales discussions
 
Conduct research on industry trends and customer needs
 
Help manage client data and prepare reports on sales activity
 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support sales initiatives
 
Requirements
 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
 
A strong interest in technology and business development
 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 
Self-motivated with a willingness to learn and take initiative
 
Fluent in written and spoken English
 
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
 
Analytical mindset with attention to detail
 
Benefits
 
 Continuous learning opportunities
 
Mentorship and support from experienced team members
 
A dynamic, international, and professional work environment
 
Exposure to enterprise-level clients and cutting-edge technologies
 
Career development opportunities within the organization
 
If you are a recent graduate eager to launch your career in a forward-thinking technology company, we invite you to apply and join our team.

title: Junior Software Solutions Sales Representative
description:
Mellon Technologies
, the parent company of Mellon Group of Companies, was founded in 1994 in Athens. Our offering consists of specialized technology solutions, contact centre and business process outsourcing services, to serve the increasing needs of financial institutions and organizations with strong consumer transactions business, such as Retail Banks, Public Utilities, Telecommunications Providers and large Private Companies.
Mellon Technologies seeks to hire
 a Junior Software Solutions Sales Representative
The ideal candidate:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for the business development related to company‚Äôs software and technology solutions mainly in the Banking Sector. The salesperson will have a strong understanding of the business along with the sales process, excelling at generating sales leads and building customer relationships.
Job Description 
Maintain and broaden the company‚Äôs client portfolio while cultivating trusted, long-term relationships with existing and potential clients
Schedule meetings with potential clients to assess and anticipate their business needs and objectives, and recommend appropriate solutions
Identify business opportunities and the resources required to accelerate business growth
Provide comprehensive consulting services regarding the implementation of Mellon banking technology solutions and recommend tailored solutions, including responding to RFPs
Organize sales meetings with clients to review product features, pricing, and delivery schedules
Maintain follow-up communication after meetings with the client to verify customer satisfaction
Collaborate in a team-selling environment, promoting a range of solutions across business units to collaboratively meet customer needs
Prepare sales performance reports, including¬† forecasts and detailed account records
Stay abreast of market trends and develop competitive sales strategies
Requirements
 
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science/Networks or related discipline 
 
Master‚Äôs degree will be considered as an asset
 
At least 3-5 years of experience preferably within a Tech sector company
 
Previous sales experience in dealing with the Banking sector and related areas will be considered as an asset
 
Analytical skills 
 
Drive for results
 
Excellent communication skills
 
Strong presentation and persuasion skills
 
Fluent in both written and spoken English 
 
Strategic thinker with a sales mentality, as well as analytical ability and a shown ability to execute strategy
 
Proven record of success with the entire sales process, from planning to closing
 
Proactive person, able to make decisions independently
 
Benefits
Opportunities to evolve into an international hyper-technological working environment
Multicultural and excellent working environment
Leading-edge technology
Continuous training

title: Software Development Intern (IT Domestic)
description:
Mellon Group of Companies is a leading multinational group, employing more than 9.000 people in 11 countries, with our corporate headquarters located in Athens, Greece. Our offering consists of specialized technology solutions, contact centre and business process outsourcing services, to serve the increasing needs of financial institutions and organizations with strong consumer transactions business, such as Retail Banks, Public Utilities, Telecommunications Providers and large Private Companies.
Mellon Technologies, the parent company of the Group has built expert know-how and support services to provide its customers with a range of technologically advanced solutions, addressing all the delivery channels of institutions with strong consumer business. You may find more information for Mellon Group here: 
https://mellongroup.com/
We are currently looking for an enthusiastic software developer interns, who will be eager to enter Fintech and Banktech areas and start their internship journey within our team!
You will be part of a team designing, installing, testing and maintaining our internal software systems with the following: 
Responsibilities
 
Leveraging your knowledge, you will play a key role in development and implementation in close collaboration with the architects and backend/frontend team
 
Understanding and clarifying product specifications, implementation of the code and regression testing
 
Working with SQL Server, Oracle, Power BI, ReactJS, and Azure, gaining hands-on experience with these technologies.
 
Requirements
 
Undergraduate student in IT, Computer Engineering or any relevant studies, being at the semester of their internship is mandatory
 
Knowledge any of the following languages: Java/Android, C, C#/.NET/.NET core, Python
 
Knowledge of GIT version control
 
Good understanding of the software development lifecycle, and the relevance of different tools at different stages of the development lifecycle
 
Team player as well as good interpersonal skills
 
Enthusiastic in the pursuit of duties
 
Benefits
 
Opportunities to evolve into an international hyper-technological working environment
 
Multicultural and excellent working environment
 
Leading-edge technology
 
Trainings
 
Company laptop

title: Junior Data Scientist for an E-commerce Company (US-Based/Remote)
description:
Paired is a global staffing and recruiting agency that pairs remote work with top-tier talent. We help individuals from around the world connect with great companies that are looking for their specific skill set. Our mission is to provide great jobs to talented people, no matter where they are located.
Our client is¬†an e-commerce consultancy firm specializing in data analysis to enhance seller efficiency, helping online sellers boost profitability, streamline operations, recover lost revenue, and maximize advertising performance.
About the Role
We are looking for a¬†
Junior Data Scientist
¬†who enjoys figuring things out. You will help the team investigate problems in client accounts, dig into Amazon data, and surface insights that help drive financial recovery. This is an ideal role for someone early in their career who is organized, curious, and comfortable working in spreadsheets. You don‚Äôt need to know everything up front, but you should be eager to learn and able to work independently once trained.
Responsibilities
 
Investigate issues in Amazon accounts, such as incorrect fees or missing payments
 
Analyze reports, transactions, and data to identify errors or discrepancies
 
Summarize findings in clear documents and spreadsheets
 
Assist the team in resolving client account issues
 
Learn how Amazon‚Äôs financial systems work and build a deep understanding over time
 
Propose potential causes or solutions when something doesn‚Äôt look right
 
Requirements
 
1 to 2 years of relevant experience in financial analysis and data science, operations, or data-related roles
 
Experience working with Excel or Google Sheets, including basic formulas and formatting
 
A track record of being organized, thorough, and reliable
 
Willingness to learn Amazon systems and ask thoughtful follow-up questions
 
Bonus Experience
 
Experience with Amazon Vendor Central or Seller Central
 
Exposure to audits, reconciliations, or account troubleshooting
 
Previous work with eCommerce or consumer brands
 
Benefits
 
Remote Working for a US Company
 
Exposure to new technology & trend
 
Competitive Salary

title: Junior Audio Programmer
description:
We want you to 
#JOINTHEREBELLION!
 
For 30 years we‚Äôve been independently developing and publishing incredible video games at our multiple studios founded by Jason & Chris Kingsley, but Rebellion is more than just games. We have our own film studio, we create board games, publish books, and through 2000AD, publish comics and graphic novels such as the amazing Judge Dredd.
We are looking for a talented Junior Audio Programmer to join our passionate and experienced Tech Team and be part of one of our exciting new large-scale projects, crafted by a seasoned team renowned for creating exceptional shooters.
Working closely with our in-house tech team, you will help work on our in-house game engine, Asura. The successful candidate will design, implement, and test new audio features while also maintaining and updating the existing codebase. 
Additionally, you will develop and maintain tools that enable designers to create content, collaborating closely with them to introduce new features and identify any issues. You will also work with other teams to support their game development needs.
Responsibilities
:
Designing, implementing and testing new audio features in the engine and maintaining and updating the existing code base
Developing and maintaining tools for designers to author content
Working closely with designers to develop new features and identify issues
Collaborating with other teams to meet their game development needs
Research and evaluate new game audio technology
Be a champion for audio in the company
This role is based at our riverside headquarters in Oxford, offering a creative and relaxed atmosphere where teamwork drives our success. We can provide a relocation package, including moving assistance, temporary accommodation, and full support to ensure a smooth transition to your new environment.
Requirements
Proficient in C++ programming
Passionate about audio
Quick to embrace new processes and workflows
Familiarity with the video game development lifecycle is a plus
Having professional experience in commercial programming or audio is a valuable addition
Benefits
We offer an extensive benefits package to our team including: 
22 days holidays + Christmas closure (typically 4 days) & Bank holidays (increasing with service at 5 years ‚Äì one day each year until you reach 31 days)
Private Medical Insurance, healthcare cash plan, including dental and Vision
Life Assurance, Income Protection & Critical Illness Cover
Enhanced Family Leave 
Interest Free, Tax-Free loans
Enhanced Pension Scheme
EAP a range of Mental Health and Wellbeing Support 
Plus loads more‚Ä¶ including a wide range of discounts, freebies, and social events! 
Right to Work Statement
This role is only open to applicants who have the permanent right to work in the UK. We are unable to provide or take over visa sponsorship, either now or in the future. Applicants must therefore be able to demonstrate their ongoing eligibility to work in the UK without the need for employer sponsorship.
Life at Our Oxford HQ
Our riverside headquarters in Oxford places you a short walk away from the city centre. Renowned for its rich historical backdrop and esteemed educational institutions, Oxford offers a unique blend of tradition and modernity, with its beautiful architecture and green spaces.
Oxford also boasts excellent transport links, making it easy to navigate both the city and the wider country. The city‚Äôs train station, just a short walk from our studio, offers frequent services to London, as well as direct routes to major cities like Birmingham, Manchester, and Reading and we also offer free parking at the studio.
Our open-plan office promotes teamwork and innovation, with regular interaction with senior management and other departments, alongside access to free hot drinks, a handy tuck shop onsite and a range of local pubs, cafes and dining options nearby helping make every workday enjoyable!
Inside Rebellion
Whichever team you join at Rebellion we are proud of our open, friendly, and creative atmosphere. We love what we do, and we have fun doing it! As a big indie developer, we have complete creative freedom over our titles which allows us to work on a massive variety of projects across all the major platforms.
Find out more about us 
here
Our size, stability, and the variety of in-house expertise across multiple industries, makes Rebellion completely unique! We work in our own way, and we celebrate that as the key to our success. We foster an inclusive culture where you are encouraged to be yourself, to express your creativity and your talent. We are people focused and will support you in every way to can be the best at what you do. We recognise the importance of enjoying what you do and having a healthy work-life balance. We offer a friendly, creative, and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and a wide variety of benefits and development opportunities for all our teams to ensure you are fully supported with your physical and Mental Well-being.
We are actively recruiting for a diverse team and continue to add to our culture of growth and inclusion. Rebellion encourages innovation in all areas, and we look forward to hearing how you can help us to be better. We encourage all demographics of culture, gender, ethnicity, neurodiversity and beyond, because a representative team makes better products.
If you are interested in working at Rebellion, but this role doesn‚Äôt sound quite like you, we‚Äôre recruiting for a range of positions across the studio and we‚Äôre always happy to receive speculative applications via our website. Visit our Careers website to view all our live vacancies: 
Rebellion: Careers
#LI-Onsite

title: Junior HR Operations Generalist
description:
About Recurly:
Recurly, Inc., a SaaS company, provides a versatile subscription management platform to manage the entire subscription lifecycle for market-leading brands worldwide. Subscription businesses such as Sling TV, FabFitFun, Cinemark and¬†
Fubo.tv
¬†depend on Recurly to harness the power of the subscription model and drive recurring revenue growth. Since its launch in 2009, Recurly has deployed subscription billing for thousands of companies across 55 countries. Our platform empowers billions of credit card transactions and has enabled customers to recover nearly $1.3 billion in revenue in 2024.
Recurly is backed by Accel-KKR, a leading technology-focused private equity firm with over $10 billion in capital commitments. The partnership offers Recurly access to significant capital and resources to make continued investments in technology and platform innovation and expand our go-to-market initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Maintain accurate employee records in the HRIS (new hires, changes, audits)
Prepare employment contracts, amendments, and HR letters using templates
Support onboarding and offboarding processes (documentation, system access, checklists)
Manage HR inbox or ticket queue and route queries appropriately
Maintain HR trackers, files, and documentation
Follow documented HR processes and SOPs
Support policy distribution and acknowledgements
Support data accuracy checks and accounting & compliance audits
Follow documented HR processes¬†
Build and maintain HR Decks
Key Competencies
Process-driven and detail-oriented
Strong follow-through and time management
Customer-service mindset
Comfortable working with routine and repetitive tasks
Willingness to learn HR systems, policies, and employment basics
Requirements
0‚Äì2 years of experience in HR, operations, or administrative roles
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intermediate Excel / Google Sheets skills
English proficiency (written and spoken) ‚Äì intermediate to advanced
Good to Have
Experience supporting HR processes in a global or remote company
Familiarity with BambooHR or other HRIS systems
Basic understanding of payroll or benefits processes
Willingness to learn HR systems, policies, and employment basics
Benefits
As a full-time employee, we offer competitive benefits programs and perks designed to fit your needs and the needs of your family.
Recurly is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, age, race, religion, or any other classification which is protected by applicable law. Recurly is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at¬†
talent@recurly.com

title: Junior Marketing Executive & Assistant
description:
Junior Marketing Executive & Assistant
Job Overview
We‚Äôre seeking a motivated 
Junior Marketing Executive & Assistant
 to support a dynamic UK-based marketing team. This dual-role opportunity is perfect for a proactive, detail-oriented individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You'll assist with day-to-day marketing tasks while gaining valuable hands-on experience across various marketing channels ‚Äì from campaign coordination to content creation and data reporting.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a forward-thinking UK business that values innovation, creativity, and growth. You'll be part of a collaborative remote team and have the chance to grow your skills in a supportive and professional setting.
Responsibilities
Support the marketing team with the execution of digital and traditional marketing campaigns
Assist in the creation, proofreading, and scheduling of content for social media, email, and website platforms
Help manage and update the company‚Äôs CRM and marketing databases
Conduct market research and competitor analysis
Coordinate administrative tasks such as meeting scheduling, campaign reporting, and file management
Monitor and report on marketing performance metrics
Collaborate with external suppliers and stakeholders when required
Maintain brand consistency across all marketing materials
Qualifications and Experience
1‚Äì2 years of experience in a marketing, administrative, or communications role
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with social media platforms (LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, etc.)
Basic understanding of marketing principles and tools (e.g., Canva, Mailchimp, Google Workspace, or similar)
Strong attention to detail and organisational skills
Ability to multitask and meet deadlines
Proficient in Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace
Must have access to a laptop and reliable, high-speed internet connection

title: Junior / Level 1 (IT) Helpdesk Technician
description:
üìå Job Summary
RemoteVA PH is hiring a Junior / Level 1 Helpdesk Technician to provide the first line of IT support to our clients. You will be the initial point of contact for incoming helpdesk requests and will ensure client issues are quickly addressed or escalated with clear, friendly communication. If you enjoy problem-solving, have a passion for client service, and thrive in a remote IT support environment ‚Äî we want to hear from you!
üõ† Responsibilities
Customer Service & Support
-Serve as the first point of contact for client support via phone, email, or ticketing system
-Troubleshoot basic IT issues remotely and deliver a helpful, client-friendly experience
-Communicate consistently with clients regarding the status of their requests
Ticket Management
-Create, manage, and update service tickets using our internal system
-Document work completed and ensure ticket details are up to date
-Split multi-issue tickets and prevent ticket stagnation
Monitoring Tools
-Review RMM dashboards and perform remedial actions per processes
-Conduct regular system checks as scheduled
Project Support
-Occasionally assist the Projects Team with remote implementations and rollouts
Communication & Reporting
-Escalate complex tickets to senior technicians
-Report risks, updates, or client outages promptly
-Submit required timesheets and reports
Team Collaboration
-Follow SOPs and scheduled tasks
-Ensure security protocols are followed vigilantly
-Actively contribute to team improvements and innovations
Requirements
üîß Skills & Qualifications
Required:
-Strong communication and listening skills
-Solid understanding of operating systems, networks, and common business applications
-Problem-solving mindset with a client-first attitude
-Fast and accurate typing while on calls
-Strong IT literacy at an advanced user level
Preferred:
-Familiarity with ticketing systems and RMM tools (Autotask, DattoRMM a plus)
-Experience supporting Microsoft 365 and Google Workspace
-IT certifications (MCP, MCSA, ITIL, etc.)
-Prior Helpdesk or MSP experience
Benefits
Schedule: 9:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM EST | 9:00 PM ‚Äì 5:00 AM PH Time
Salary: USD 700‚Äì1000/month
Location: Work from Home
üì© To Apply:
Send your CV and portfolio to mondilla.jay03@gmail.com with the subject: Junior Helpdesk Technician Application.

-Experience with Photoshop (a plus)

Benefits

title: Customer Service Internship - Subang Jaya
description:
Rentokil Initial is one of the largest business services company with more than 57,700 colleagues worldwide and operates in over 90 countries. The company relies on the commitment, ability and teamwork amongst colleagues to deliver the services and delight customers. We are the market leader in both pest control and hygiene solution industries for more than 50 years in Malaysia. As our presence in 11 major cities nationwide expands, we invite suitably qualified and highly dynamic colleagues to passionately grow with us
.
We are looking for a motivated, dynamic Intern to support our Customer Relations Executive to join our team.
To help to achieve this, we will provide you with a competitive allowance & bright career opportunities. You will also be given full product training, with hands on assistance from Customer Care Team.
In this role you will be responsible for:
 
Uncover customer needs and interact with our products and services through various initiatives including CVC, CSAT, or CES surveys via Outbound Calls, Email & Texting across customer touchpoint
 
Deep understanding on customer insights by identify the pain points and opportunities through the surveys
 
Handling customer contact activities includes sales, customer feedback with Customer Relationship Management System
 
Demonstrate effective verbal communication skills when interacting at all level, be it among peers & managers or with customers
 
Working in a team to achieve the required Key Performance Index (KPI) & SLA (Service Level Agreement)
 
Duration: Depending on your university's requirement
Requirements
The ideal candidate will possess:
 
Currently pursuing tertiary education/Final semester (Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Business Administration, Management, Marketing, Customer Service Management, Office Management course)
 
Has own transport to travel to work on daily basis
 
Benefits
 
Monthly allowance
 
Opportunity to be absorbed as permanent employee (based on your work performance)
 
Location of this branch:
Rentokil Initial (M) Sdn Bhd, 
Unit 8-1, Level 8, Tower 8, UOA Business Park, No. 1, Jalan Pengaturcara U1/51A, Seksyen U1, 40150 Shah Alam, Selangor Darul Ehsan.

title: Field Product Sales Executive - Nashik | Min Exp 3yrs I Any Graduate
description:
About Rentokil PCI
Rentokil PCI is the leading pest control service provider in India. A Rentokil Initial brand, Rentokil PCI was formed in 2017 through a joint venture (JV) between Pest Control India, the number one pest control company in India, and Rentokil, the world‚Äôs leading pest control brand. Rentokil PCI aims to set new standards for customer service having operations across 300 locations in India.
For more details: 
https://www.rentokil-pestcontrolindia.com
About the Role:
‚óè The incumbent will report to the Territory Manager. The incumbent will have to work as part of a multi-functional team and this involves collaboration with the internal team and external stakeholders.
Job Responsibilities:
Sales & collection
‚óè Achieving sales targets & collection targets.
‚óè Keep a close watch on outstanding and implement strict credit policy within 30 days time.
Market relations
‚óè Building up good distribution network and ensure team work
‚óè Providing market infrastructure and being in regular touch with the market/customer.
‚óè Distributor appointment and their staff training
‚óè SWOT analysis of Market and distributor.
‚óè Updating product knowledge and constant learning.
‚óè Motivating the distributor/sales men for better market coverage.
‚óè Regular reviews with distributor/sales men for achieving the desired goals.
‚óè Building up a good distribution network.
‚óè Good communication with retailers/customers.
‚óè Complete the daily call report immediately after market work on the same day.
‚óè Merchandising and a close watch on redistribution.
‚óè Be presentable and always wear a uniform and carry an ID card.
‚óè Carry samples of products and required brochures.
Sales promotion
‚óè Utilization of sufficient POP material, brochures, posters etc. and display of the same in the market.
‚óè Helping the distributor in liquidation of stocks and implementation of company Trade schemes, participation in exhibitions / product promotions / customer awareness programmes.
‚óè Plan for budgets and schemes for sales promotion and ensure maximum returns.
‚óè Inventory management of the distributor & settlement of distributor claims.
‚óè Visit of farmer and his fields for exploring and promotion of Bio-products.
‚óè Regular visits to hospitals, industries, panchayats/municipal corp. for promotion of Industrial products.
‚óè Collect the order from Dealer/ Distributor / Institution on their letterhead/ Order format with clear payment terms.
Key role
‚óè Close monitoring of his distributor indents and execution.
‚óè Identify & explore new market segments and development of new areas.
‚óè Constant touch with key and institutional customers.
‚óè Maintain Good relations with Govt. departments
‚óè Attend the customer complaints and help them in solving their problem.
‚óè Constantly on the lookout for newer business opportunities
‚óè Ensure all trade schemes are all operated properly by Distributor.
Focus areas
‚óè Ensure profitability on each case to case
‚óèReduce damaged stocks and market returns.
‚óè Analysis of competitor activities /Market information and send the report to the company.
‚óè Minimise the outstanding and fast recovery of amounts from markets
‚óè Positive attitude/honest/punctual and well disciplined.
Admin related responsibilities
‚óè Comply all govt. Licenses/Sales permissions/other Govt. rules.
‚óè Ensure proper documentation and updating of records related to sales & collections. Monthly analysis of the sales data for better results.
‚óè Cost control and self financial discipline.
Key Result Areas:
‚óè Achieve the sales & collections targets.
‚óè Credit control.
‚óè Distributor/Retailer expansion as per plan
‚óè Ensure market secondaries
‚óè Reduce market returns and damages.
‚óè Implement tasks defined by branch head, including daily activity reporting
Competencies (Skills essential to the role):
‚óè Distributor/Dealer management skills
‚óè Excellent communication skills
‚óè Sales pitching of all existing and new products
‚óè Ability to deliver sales & collections under pressure situations
‚óè Team player & ensuring good working relation with team & reporting manager
Educational Qualification / Other Requirement:
‚óè Graduate / PG in any field
‚óè if under graduate, candidate needs to have proven track record in sales field
What can you expect from RPCI?
‚ûî Our values lie at the core of our mission and vision. We believe that it‚Äôs our people who make our company what it is. We believe in:
‚óè Safety
‚óè Integrity
‚óè Innovation
‚óè Learning & Development
‚óè Open & Transparent
‚óè Performance Orientation

title: Field Sales Executive | Sriperumbadur | Any Graduate
description:
About Rentokil PCI
Rentokil PCI is the leading pest control service provider in India. A Rentokil Initial brand, Rentokil PCI was formed in 2017 through a joint venture (JV) between Pest Control India, the number one pest control company in India, and Rentokil, the world‚Äôs leading pest control brand. Rentokil PCI aims to set new standards for customer service having operations across 300 locations in India.¬†
For more details: 
https://www.rentokil-pestcontrolindia.com
About the Role:
The role is responsible to identify, source and secure both long term and short-term pest control & prevention business opportunities. The incumbent shall be primarily responsible for the New Sales Productivity, Renewal and Collection as per the assigned targets.
The person will report to the Branch Manager. The incumbent will have to work as part of a multi-functional team and this involves collaboration with the internal team and external stakeholders.	
Job Responsibilities:
Business Development (Sales)	
 
Get business as per the approved business plan of the branch	
 
Responsible for sales promotion activities in the assigned territory	
 
Ensure all Sales KPIs are achieved month on month	
 
Identify and follow-up with prospective customers and respond to enquiry calls within specific time period	
 
Maximise conversion of enquiries into orders	
 
Ensure renewals in line with Company Expectations	
 
Keep a close eye on the developments & business opportunities in the assigned territory
 
Prepare MPG and ensure it‚Äôs updated regularly
 
 
Customer Service	
 
Ensure the quality of service delivery	
 
Maintain good liaison with the customers	
 
Prepare reports & submit the same on time to the customers	
 
Attend to complaints & participate in logically concluding them along with Operations and Back office whenever required

Sell the visits as per iCABS frequencies so that the Annual Template Calendars can be set for timely service delivery by the service planners	
 
Share & explain the cost sheet to operations along with details of material to be used. Also share customer expectation with operations before service delivery 	
 
Ensure all the sales are delivered after being visible in iCABS for planning & execution via Service Companion. Timely punching of new sales in SRA so that sufficient lead time should be give to planners to execute the services.Service Scheduling is done in consultation with Service Planners. No commitment to customer on service scheduling.	
 
Administration & Accounts	
 
 
Ensure timely submission of invoices & getting the necessary acknowledgements wherever necessary	
 
Follow-up for the timely and correct invoicing by the back office	
 
Share the costings and customer expectation with operations before service delivery 	
 
Ensure all the collections gets deposited to back office within 24 hours	
 
Review daily collection & billing with back office department	
 
 
 
Maintaining Systems and MIS	
 
 
Ensure the required systems related to sales are updated on timely basis.	
 
Prepare Daily and Monthly Sales Report	
 
Maintain Database of customers
 
 
Requirements
Key Result Areas:
 
Business Development (Sales)	
 
Develop new business opportunities & Upselling Opportunities	
 
Renewals (if assigned)
 
Calls/ Survey / Quotations/ PDSA¬† as per Regional plan
 
Collection & DSO	
 
Customer Service	
 
Timely Invoice Submission

Good Interpersonal & Networking Skills	
 
Ability to communicate effectively	
 
Ability to negotiate with the clients	
 
Ability to achieve targets	
 
Computer Skills	
 
Educational Qualification / Other Requirement:
 
Any Graduate (Any stream)	
 
Sales experience of a minimum of 2 years in Direct Sales (Facilities Management) for Commercial business profile	
 
Preferable experience of minimum 2 years in Home product / Home service business, residential cleaning services for Residential business profile¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†

Field Sales - Individual Contributor Role	
 
External team- Customers and Customer representative	
 
Internal team- ABM/BM, Operations & Sales Colleagues, Planners

title: Field Sales Executive | Sriperumbudur | Any Graduate
description:
Company Profile:
Rentokil PCI is the leading pest control service provider in India. A Rentokil Initial brand, Rentokil PCI was formed in 2017 through a joint venture (JV) between Pest Control India, the number one pest control company in India, and Rentokil, the world‚Äôs leading pest control brand. Rentokil PCI aims to set new standards for customer service with operations across 250 locations in India. The JV brand also focuses on developing industry-leading service operations through the sharing of best practices, new innovations and the use of digital technologies.
Your day to day responsibilities will include:
‚Ä¢ To identify, source and secure both long term and short-term pest control & prevention business opportunities.
‚Ä¢ To develop new business opportunities within current and new customer bases in accordance with the sales strategy.
‚Ä¢ To look after client retention by ensuring customers‚Äô ongoing expectations is met.
‚Ä¢ To manage day to day sales activities, including proposal, service agreement, and prospecting and market development.
‚Ä¢ To support the service team by providing customer feedback.
‚Ä¢ To develop good client relationships.
‚Ä¢ To provide reports as per the requirement.
‚Ä¢ To assist with debt collection
Do you have what it takes? If you want to be considered for this role you will need:
‚Ä¢ Good Interpersonal & Networking Skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively

title: Junior Credit Controller
description:
The Junior Credit Controller is responsible for collecting debts from company debtors, evaluating new credit requests, ensuring timely payments of company debts, processing invoices, maintaining the sales ledger, and providing administrative support where needed. He/ She maximizes company profits by efficiently managing its debts.
Rentokil Boecker¬Æ Junior Credit Controller is held accountable for the below job responsibilities:
Submitting all invoices with proper documentation (service reports, breakdowns) via email to customers at the beginning of each month
Negotiating payment plans with customers and setting payment terms and condition accordingly
Maintaining debt records, conducting regular analysis of the credit-control system and implementing changes as needed to reduce bad debts.
Analyzing and monitoring all assigned aged debtors in order to reduce outstanding debt and ensuring prompt action is taken for non-payment or continued late payment
Overseeing and initiating collection calls with concerned parties and account holders in order to resolve all outstanding customers debts / billing issues on these complex accounts
Performing customer accounts reconciliation on a monthly basis and sharing outstanding balance with customers where required
Recording all debtors‚Äô communications, payment plans, disputes on OnGuard and ensuring dashboards and tracker sheets are updated on daily basis
Following up on overdue invoices and payments and implementing company collections procedures as necessary
Reporting outstanding debt accounts and payment issues to management on a weekly basis
Reviewing credit notes or additional billings and negotiating payment plans with debtors where required.
Managing the service suspension process for the recovery of debt, actively chasing aged debt and taking the lead in reviewing debtor key accounts
Preparing proposals for delinquency accounts where legal action may be required, and reporting account disputes for Finance management to advise on appropriate actions.
Providing continuous coaching and support to the credit control teams to achieve departmental goals and collection targets
Supporting the team by training new joiners on collection systems (OnGuard), processes and procedures.
Requirements
BA degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or any relevant field
Experience of minimum 4 years in a similar role
Proficiency in English and Arabic with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledgeable in reporting and monitoring with remarkable attention to details.
Benefits
Competitive Salary
1 yearly ticket to home country
Medical Insurance Class B

title: Talent Sourcer - (Junior - Remote)
description:
Talent Sourcer (ScaleSource)
Job Title: 
Remote Talent Sourcer (Jr)
Location:
 Fully Remote
Working Schedule: 
M-F / 9:00 AM ‚Äì 6:00 PM (EST)
Salary:
 USD $750 to 1000/month
About ScaleSource
ScaleSource helps U.S.-based companies scale efficiently by providing high-quality remote talent across LATAM, Africa, and other global markets. We partner with fast-growing companies to build reliable, cost-effective teams through strong sourcing, structured processes, and operational excellence.
At ScaleSource, we believe that great recruiting starts with great sourcing. Our Sourcers play a critical role in building and maintaining high-quality talent pipelines that allow Recruiters to move fast and focus on closing the right candidates.
Role Overview
We are seeking a Talent Sourcer (Jr) focused on active candidate hunting, pre-screening, and pipeline management. This role is responsible for generating a steady flow of qualified candidates across multiple roles and geographies, ensuring clean ATS data and strong sourcing coverage.
This is not a full-cycle recruiter role. The Talent Sourcer does not manage clients, negotiate offers, or conduct final interviews. Instead, you will support Recruiters by delivering well-qualified, pre-vetted profiles and maintaining an organized, up-to-date pipeline. The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, process-driven, and comfortable working in a high-volume sourcing environment.
Key Responsibilities
‚óè Actively source and hunt candidate profiles using LinkedIn, job boards, databases, referrals, and alternative sourcing channels.
 ‚óè Conduct resume reviews and initial pre-screening to validate experience, English level, availability, time zone alignment, and basic role fit.
 ‚óè Filter inbound applicants and maintain clean, organized pipelines inside the ATS.
 ‚óè Build and refresh talent pools for recurring and high-volume roles.
 ‚óè Publish job openings across approved platforms following a quarterly publishing calendar with defined activity and content goals.
 ‚óè Perform accurate data entry, tagging, and documentation of candidate profiles, notes, and sourcing sources in the ATS.
 ‚óè Identify duplicates, outdated profiles, and unqualified candidates to maintain data hygiene.
 ‚óè Collaborate closely with Recruiters to understand role priorities and sourcing needs.
 ‚óè Share sourcing insights such as candidate availability, market challenges, and talent trends when relevant.
 ‚óè Support ad-hoc sourcing projects during hiring spikes or urgent requests.
Qualifications
‚óè 1+ year of experience in sourcing, recruiting coordination, or talent research.
‚óè Strong LinkedIn sourcing skills and basic Boolean search knowledge.
‚óè Solid English communication skills (written and verbal).
‚óè Experience working remotely with minimal supervision.
‚óè High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
‚óè Comfortable working inside an ATS and following structured processes.
‚óè Ability to manage multiple open roles and pipelines simultaneously.
Nice to Have
‚óè Experience sourcing talent globally (LATAM, Africa, Asia) is a plus.
‚óè Prior experience working with staffing or recruiting agencies is a plus.
‚óè Familiarity with Workable or similar ATS platforms.
Requirements
‚óè Professional remote work setup with reliable internet connection.
‚óè Strong written communication and responsiveness.
‚óè Ability to follow sourcing guidelines, documentation standards, and internal processes.
‚óè Willingness to submit a short introduction video as part of the recruitment process.

title: Junior User Researcher
description:
Spotlight Sports Group is a global media and technology company specialising in content and data within sports betting, horse racing and fantasy sports. With over 400 employees, the group operates multiple award-winning brands, including Racing Post, the world‚Äôs largest horse racing affiliate, Pickswise, myracing and Free Super Tips. We partner with leading operators across the betting industry to produce and build multilingual, best-in-class digital products and content to engage and educate customers. ICS-digital, an international marketing agency including ICS-translate, also operates under the group.
Come and join an established User Research team at Spotlight Sports Group (SSG) a global media and technology company specialising in fan engagement, content and data within horse racing, sports and sports betting. With over 300 employees, SSG is the parent group for multiple award-winning brands, including Racing Post, the world‚Äôs leading horse racing media brand alongside a portfolio of other specialist sports and betting brands. We partner with leading operators across the betting industry to produce and build multilingual, best-in-class digital products and content to engage and educate customers. This means that SSG is both customer and business focused.¬†
This is a permanent opportunity offered as a hybrid role, working out of our London Southbank office 3 days per week with 2 from home. You will be part of the Product Design and User Research Team (PD&R) that works on products across the UK and International projects. The role will be a mixed methods research role with a primary focus on qualitative work including field visits.
Responsibilities
:
Work closely with the Lead Researcher and User Researcher to ensure that the research activities are run efficiently
Work effectively with UX & UI designers and product managers to translate research findings into actionable insights
Assist to collect and analyse research findings for a variety of projects, ranging from discovery to validation
Assist in planning and conducting user research activities (e.g. usability testing, interviews, surveys)
To build up to taking lead responsibility for qualitative interviews in research projects
Responsible for user research operations and participant data management
Responsible for the development and the maintenance of the user research repository, including research findings, reports and documentation
Contribute to research projects, conduct research sessions, and effectively document and analyse findings
Start presenting user research findings within the Product and PD&R and occasionally other related departments
 
Requirements
Recent graduate or seeking to transition into the field of user research
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in related fields, e.g. Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Sociology
Basic knowledge and appreciation for qualitative and quantitative research methods
Prior research experience (academic or professional) in user research or usability testing is desirable
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong ability to synthesise qualitative and quantitative data into actionable insights
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to clearly present research findings to diverse audiences
Detail-oriented and highly organised, with the ability to manage multiple projects and facilitate research operations (e.g. recruiting research participants, documenting results and participant details)
Ability to work collaboratively to support larger projects
Willingness to learn and develop as a User Researcher
A strong passion for understanding user behaviour and delivering exceptional user experiences
Desire to take a major role in qualitative research in projects which will include evening interviews and some field visits in the UK
Skills:
methods: familiarity with a range of qualitative and quantitative research methods. Some experience with interview practice is a plus
Communication: excellent written and verbal communication skills; confidence in presenting research findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong storytelling and data visualisation skills are highly desirable
Attention to detail: a meticulous approach to detail in research planning, execution and documentation
Organisational skills: ability to multitask and prioritise
Critical thinking: strong analytical and problem-solving skills to evaluate complex user behaviours and translate them into actionable insights
Continuous learning: a growth mindset and a passion for continuous learning in the field of user research
Domain knowledge: prior knowledge of horse racing or bloodstock is not required, but curiosity and an eager willingness to learn are essential¬†
Empathy: the ability to have a deep understanding of user needs, behaviours, and motivations
AI: ability to demonstrate effective use of AI tools to enhance work, improve efficiency whilst maintaining core research processes
Benefits
We offer a range of well-being initiatives, including private medical insurance, excellent parental leave, a working globally policy, mental health support, assistance programs, and social gatherings. We also provide a pension scheme and various other benefit schemes. Plus, we all get our birthdays off work and enjoy 25 days of holiday per year.
We‚Äôve also got you covered with life assurance and exclusive perks like the Star card and our Step Further Awards (our employee recognition program) to recognise your dedication. For those working via the hybrid model (in the office and at home) we‚Äôve made commuting easier with our Season Ticket Loan and Cycle to Work Scheme.
You can also take advantage of complimentary access to our Racing Post Members Club, complete with an Ultimate Membership. We believe in making a positive impact beyond the workplace, and you'll have the chance to volunteer two days per year with our charity partner or local charity.

title: Junior Accountant
description:
Job Purpose Accountant is responsible for performing and coordinating accounting activities within a designated group of companies under one of the finance towers. The role involves maintaining accurate financial records, assisting in financial reporting, and ensuring compliance with company accounting policies and procedures. This position serves as a key support role to the Finance Manager and Controlling Supervisor in maintaining strong financial control and accurate reporting across multiple business units.
 Key Accountability Activities General Accounting: 
 ‚Äí Maintain and update accounting records, ledgers, and supporting documentation for all assigned companies.
 ‚Äí Prepare and post routine journal entries including accruals, prepayments, and adjustments. 
‚Äí Perform monthly account reconciliations (bank, receivables, payables, and intercompany) and resolve discrepancies.
 ‚Äí Ensure that all financial transactions are properly recorded and classified according to the company‚Äôs chart of accounts.
 ‚Äí Assist in month-end and year-end closing activities, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of submissions. Financial Reporting 
‚Äí Support in preparing monthly and quarterly financial reports and analysis for assigned entities. 
‚Äí Compile and organize financial data for management reviews and consolidation purposes. 
‚Äí Assist in the preparation of project cost summaries and basic variance analysis. 
‚Äí Maintain documentation and schedules to support reported figures. Payables, Receivables & Cash Transactions
 ‚Äí Review and process supplier invoices, ensuring accuracy, approval, and timely posting. 
‚Äí Prepare payment requests, monitor due dates, and support vendor reconciliations. 
‚Äí Prepare and issue customer invoices and follow up on outstanding receivables when required.
 ‚Äí Support day-to-day banking activities, including deposits, transfers, and reconciliations.
 ‚Äí Maintain proper filing of financial and payment documents for audit readiness. Compliance & Audit Support 
‚Äí Ensure adherence to internal accounting policies and procedures
.‚Äí Prepare necessary documentation and assist during internal or external audit reviews. 
‚Äí Support the implementation of recommendations from auditors and finance management. 
‚Äí Maintain confide
Requirements
Qualifications/Requirements Education & Certification: 
‚àí Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field Experience:
 ‚àí Minimum of 1-3years of accounting experience, 
‚àí Strong knowledge of IFRS, financial reporting, and project accounting. 
‚àí Experience in managing budgets, cost control, and financial analysis. 
‚àí Proficiency in ERP/accounting systems and advanced Microsoft Excel skills. 
‚àí Strong problem-solving ability and attention to detail with a commitment to accuracy. 
‚àí Excellent communication, organizational, and leadership skills. 
‚àí Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities, and meet strict deadlines.

Respond to tender documents, proposals, reports, and supporting literature, manage workload to organize and prioritize daily and weekly goals
Requirements
 
Bachelor's degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field.
 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and build relationships.
 
Familiarity with CRM software and sales tracking tools.
 
1‚Äì3 years‚Äô experience in software sales or technical consulting.
 
Strong understanding of IT systems, software specs, and documentation.

title: Junior Operations Analyst
description:
We are looking for a motivated Junior Operations Analyst to support the assessment and improvement of our clients‚Äô operational processes. This role involves supporting senior team members in analyzing customer operations, identifying areas for efficiency and quality enhancement, and contributing to the delivery of data-driven recommendations. You will work closely with senior consultants and client teams to gather information, perform structured analyses, and prepare clear presentations and reports.
 Key Responsibilities:
¬†‚Ä¢ Assist in conducting operational assessments across customer service, back-office workflows, and support processes.
¬†‚Ä¢ Collect, validate, and analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., performance metrics, process documentation, interviews). ‚Ä¢ Support the preparation of reports, dashboards, and presentations for internal stakeholders and clients.
 ‚Ä¢ Participate in meetings, workshops, and interviews with customer operation teams.
¬†‚Ä¢ Help track ongoing performance metrics and follow up on implemented actions. 
‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with project managers and senior analysts to ensure timely delivery of project tasks.
Requirements
Qualifications & Skills :
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Data Analytics, or a related field (preferred). ‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
¬†‚Ä¢ Ability to work with data (Excel/Google Sheets required; familiarity with Power BI/Tableau is a plus).
¬†‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and Arabic. 
‚Ä¢ Previous internship or 1‚Äì2 years‚Äô experience in operations, consulting, customer service analysis, or process improvement is a plus (but fresh graduates with strong analytical aptitude will be considered).
Duration: 4 weeks total (1/2 weeks remote, 3/2 weeks onsite in Cairo)
 Junior Operations Analyst (qualitative research / process analysis background)
 Nationality: 
Native Egyptian
 Languages:
 Native Egyptian Speaker + second languages French & English is a must.

title: QC Engineer (Junior/Mid Level)
description:
Role Overview
The QC Engineer will support software testing activities to ensure the quality, functionality, and performance of digital applications. The role focuses on preparing and executing test cases, identifying and documenting issues, and assisting in test automation under the guidance of senior engineers.
This position is ideal for professionals at junior or mid-level who are eager to develop their technical and analytical skills in a collaborative Agile environment.
Key Responsibilities
¬†
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Quality Control and Testing Execution
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Prepare and execute test plans, test cases, and test scenarios covering functional, regression, and integration testing.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Perform manual and automated testing to validate requirements and system behavior.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Identify, document, and track software defects to closure, ensuring accurate test reporting.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Re-test and verify fixes during subsequent releases or updates.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Support the creation and maintenance of automation test scripts using tools such as Selenium or similar frameworks.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Automation and Technical Support
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Assist in developing and maintaining automated test scripts and frameworks.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Execute automated tests within defined pipelines under the supervision of senior engineers.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Use APIs, databases, and SQL queries to perform data validation.
Follow established coding, documentation, and quality standards in all testing activities. 
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Agile & Collaboration
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Participate in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and reviews to support testing coverage.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Working closely with developers, product owners, and QA leads to understanding business requirements.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Provide clear and timely feedback on functionality, usability, and overall product quality.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Document testing progress and share regular updates with project teams. 
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Process Improvement & Governance
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Follow defined QA/QC processes, templates, and testing methodologies.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Contribute suggestions to improve efficiency and quality in testing practices.
o¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Stay updated with new testing tools, automation techniques, and best practices
Requirements
Qualifications & Experience
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† 1‚Äì4 years of experience in software testing or quality assurance (manual or automation).
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Understanding Selenium, JUnit/TestNG, or other test-automation frameworks.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Familiarity with Software Development Life Cycle and QA methodologies.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Experience using issue-tracking tools such as JIRA or Azure DevOps.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ISTQB or equivalent certification is an advantage.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Good analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Fluency in English and Arabic (written and spoken).
Expectations
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Demonstrate willingness to learn and adapt to new tools and testing techniques.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Collaborate with team members to ensure timely and quality delivery.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Maintain organized, accurate, and auditable QC documentation.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Exhibit professionalism, accountability, and a positive team attitude.
¬†
¬†
If you are a motivated Quality Engineer looking to build your skills in testing, automation, and Agile delivery, we‚Äôd like to hear from you.
¬†
¬†
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ‚Ä¢¬† Benefits offered: 
Individual medical insurance, social insurance, and transportation from designated pickup points (for Sokhna)
¬†¬† ‚Ä¢¬† Travel requirements: 
Currently based in Maadi, but you must be open to relocating or traveling to Sokhna once required
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ‚Ä¢¬† Work location and model: Onsite (primarily Maadi, with possible work from Sokhna)
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ‚Ä¢¬† Residential location preference: Preferably Cairo
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Fluency in English is a must as they will be dealing with suppliers all over the world.

title: Junior Product Designer - Engine by Starling
description:
At Engine by Starling, we are on a mission to find and work with leading banks all around the world who have the ambition to build rapid growth businesses, on our technology.¬†
Engine is Starling's software-as-a-service (SaaS) business, the technology that was built to power Starling Bank, and a year ago we split out as a separate business.¬†
Starling Bank has seen exceptional growth and success, and a large part of that is down to the fact that we have built our own modern technology from the ground up. This SaaS technology platform is now available to banks and financial institutions all around the world, enabling them to benefit from the innovative digital features, and efficient back-office processes that has helped achieve Starling's success.
We draw upon our experience as FinTech experts, and best-in-class technologists, to become the chosen option for these banks, and preferred partners for leading consultancies.
As a company, everyone is expected to roll up their sleeves to help deliver great outcomes for our clients. We are an engineering led company and we‚Äôre looking for someone who will be excited by the potential for Engine‚Äôs technology to transform banking in different markets around the world.
Hybrid Working
We have a Hybrid approach to working here at Engine - our preference is that you're located within a commutable distance of one of our offices so that we're able to interact and collaborate in person.¬†
About the Role
At Engine by Starling we‚Äôre at an exciting point of our journey, building out a series of mobile SDKs and web portals to delight our clients as we help them bring best-in-class digital banking to customers around the world. We like to spend our time building products that we‚Äôre really proud of. We focus on the experience, often delivering things with real polish but sometimes making a fast strategic move. We‚Äôre always working closely and collaboratively with our product teams and clients to solve problems, build new products and improve existing ones.¬†
You‚Äôll be able to own the design of products and features, working closely with the rest of the Engine team to design the product, and then staying closely involved as our engineering team builds, helping make sure the outcome is as good as possible. The Engine team works with clients around the world. Some of the interesting challenges will be balancing the needs of both clients and their customers, creating journeys that work in multiple regions.¬†
Responsibilities:
 
Work across multiple product areas, solving complex, ambiguous problems with product owners and tech leads
 
Contribute to the entire product development lifecycle, from discovery through to delivery
 
Design the visual and functional experience of our mobile SDKs and web portals for your product domains. Such as cards, lending, saving, onboarding, open banking and payments to name a few.
 
Maintain and develop our multi-brand design system to ensure a consistent user experience across all our platforms
 
Ensure our products are designed and documented to a standard that enables rapid adoption and meaningful configuration by our clients
 
Champion design, both internally and externally, demonstrating how best-in-class design can transform banking
 
Requirements
2 years experience as a UX / Product Designer
Lots of examples of designing thoughtful, accessible experiences for customers
Ability to communicate design decisions, strategies, and concepts to diverse audiences
Accomplished visual design quality - able to guide and evolve our design language to the next level
Experience planning and running various research methods to test and evaluate our ideas.
Proficiency working with Figma and prototyping tools¬†
Able to work confidently with a design system
Examples of partnering with cross-functional stakeholders and product owners
An inclination to seek feedback, share your work and be open. The Engine team is collaborative and friendly, we encourage everyone to share their opinions and contribute where they‚Äôre interested.
Nice to have
Experience in a Product Design role for a FinTech or Software Startup / Scaleup - ¬†ideally with mobile design experience
We're particularly interested if you have experience with B2B / B2B2C products or environments where we balance both customer and client needs
Practical experience maintaining and contributing to a design system (incl design tokens) - extending beyond Figma and UI components
Illustration skills and strong craft for creating custom iconography and visual assets
Bachelors degree in Design, HCI, or related field (or equivalent professional experience)
Interview process
Interviewing is a two way process and we want you to have the time and opportunity to get to know us, as much as we are getting to know you! Our interviews are conversational and we want to get the best from you, so come with questions and be curious.¬†
In general you can expect the below, following a chat with one of our Talent Team:
First 45 min interview with someone from our Design team
In depth 60 min interview with the Design team and an Engineer: We‚Äôll look to see a case study of a project from start to finish to show your thinking, how you worked with the team and to highlight your design craft.¬†
Final interview with some more senior members of the Engine team
Benefits
33 days holiday (including public holidays, which you can take when it works best for you)
 
An extra day‚Äôs holiday for your birthday
 
Annual leave is increased with length of service, and you can choose to buy or sell up to five extra days off
 
16 hours paid volunteering time a year
 
Salary sacrifice, company enhanced pension scheme
 
Life insurance at 4x your salary & group income protection
 
Private Medical Insurance with VitalityHealth including mental health support and cancer care. Partner benefits include discounts with Waitrose, Mr&Mrs Smith and Peloton
 
Generous family-friendly policies
 
Incentives refer a friend scheme
 
Perkbox membership giving access to retail discounts, a wellness platform for physical and mental health, and weekly free and boosted perks
 
Access to initiatives like Cycle to Work, Salary Sacrificed Gym partnerships and Electric Vehicle (EV) leasing
 
About us
You may be put off applying for a role because you don't tick every box. Forget that! While we can‚Äôt accommodate every flexible working request, we're always open to discussion. So, if you're excited about working with us, but aren‚Äôt sure if you're 100% there yet, get in touch anyway. We‚Äôre on a mission to radically reshape banking ‚Äì and that starts with our brilliant team. Whatever came before, we‚Äôre proud to bring together people of all backgrounds and experiences who love working together to solve problems.
Engine by Starling is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Engine by Starling are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.¬†
When you provide us with this information, you are doing so at your own consent, with full knowledge that we will process this personal data in accordance with our Privacy Notice. By submitting your application, you agree that Engine by Starling and Starling Bank will collect your personal data for recruiting and related purposes. Our Privacy Notice explains what personal information we will process, where we will process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over our use of your personal information.

title: Junior Executive, Network Engineer (Software)
description:
Responsibilities:
 
Assist in network design, implementation, and maintenance.
 
Support the installation and configuration of network equipment and systems.
 
Monitor network performance and troubleshoot network issues.
 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the smooth operation of the network infrastructure.
 
Assist in the planning and execution of network upgrades and enhancements.
 
Perform network assessments and audits to identify and address security vulnerabilities.
 
Create and maintain network documentation, including diagrams and configuration files.
 
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments in network technology.
 
Provide technical support to end users for network-related problems.
 
Requirements
 
Diploma or degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
 
Prior experience or internship in network engineering or related roles is a plus.
 
Knowledge of networking concepts and protocols.
 
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
 
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
 
Relevant certifications (e.g., CCNA) are a plus.

title: Internship at Teltonika IoT academy
description:
About Us
¬†
The first IoT Academy in Lithuania offers you a unique opportunity to not only learn more about Internet of Things (IoT) devices but also to challenge yourself in developing cutting-edge technological products. The knowledge you gain during this hands-on experience will be the first step in your career.
An internship at the IoT Academy is your initial step into the professional world. Here, you will not only acquire practical knowledge but also have the chance to continue your journey within the Teltonika team alongside other Academy graduates.
¬†
Offered Positions
¬†
By joining the IoT Academy, you will have the chance to explore various specializations. We offer a wide range of options that will help you unlock your potential in the area that excites you the most.
Available positions:
Embedded Programming (LINUX)
Electronics Engineering
IoT Device Testing
CAD Design Engineering
Web Programming
Networking & IoT Engineering
¬†
Learn more about these positions¬†
here
.
